He wants there to be flowers for future generations as well, because he's a nice dude like that.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>足<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>foot</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Foot</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The radical for <font color=""#0af""><b>foot</b></font> and the kanji for <font color=""#f0a""><b>foot</b></font> are exactly the same.<br>That being said, there's also another meaning you should keep in mind, which is <font color=""#f0a""><b>sufficient</b></font>. If you think about it, one foot should be <font color=""#f0a""><b>sufficient</b></font> enough to walk around with if you jump.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Same kanjis and radicals make Jack a happy boy. You should also learn the other meaning as well, though, if you can.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>世<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>generation</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Generation</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The <font color=""#0af""><b>generation</b></font> radical and the <font color=""#f0a""><b>generation</b></font> kanji are the same.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: The same can't be said for different generations of people... they are not the same. Count your lucky stars that radicals and kanji can be, though.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>打<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>hit</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Nail, Nailbat</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You have a <font color=""#0af""><b>nailbat</b></font> but you want to add an extra <font color=""#0af""><b>nail</b></font> to it. How do you do it? You set the nail upright, and <font color=""#f0a""><b>hit</b></font> the nailbat into the nail as hard as you can.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: The nail flies out and <font color=""#f0a""><b>hit</b></font>s you in the eye. You have a nail in your eye now, and you're freaking out. What do you do? How does it feel? Can you feel the metal on eyeball feeling?</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>百<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>hundred</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Sun, Leaf</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">There is a <b><font color=""#0af"">leaf</font></b> growing out of the <b><font color=""#0af"">sun</font></b>! You fly out into space to check it out and when you get closer you see that it isn't just one leaf, it's a <b><font color=""#f0a"">hundred</font></b>! That makes sense, you wouldn't be able to see just one leaf on the sun from where you were on earth.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine flying toward the sun to see a hundred leaves growing together in the shape of one big leaf. You want to go closer!</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>氷<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>ice</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Drop, Water</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You have <font color=""#0af""><b>water</b></font> already... and it's pretty cold. All it takes is one cold <font color=""#0af""><b>drop</b></font> of liquid nitrogen added to it to turn it into one big block of ice, just like that.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Go ahead and touch it... wow, it's really cold - and only from one drop, too. Feel the burn on your finger from where you touched the <font color=""#f0a""><b>ice</b></font>.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>虫<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>insect</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Insect</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The <font color=""#0af""><b>insect</b></font> radical and <font color=""#f0a""><b>insect</b></font> are the same in looks as well as and meaning.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: It's times like these when you gotta hope you're studying your radicals!</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>字<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>letter</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Child, Helmet</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You walk up to a <font color=""#0af""><b>child</b></font> wearing a <font color=""#0af""><b>helmet</b></font> on his head. As you come closer, you see what he's working on. He has hundreds of <font color=""#f0a""><b>letters</b></font> (of the alphabet) in front of him, and he's rearranging them into different equations. Absolutely crazy, this one is. He's wearing a helmet because he doesn't want the aliens to know his thoughts, and know the secret codes and equations he's creating with the letters. <br>A <font color=""#f0a""><b>character</b></font> also works, though this is like a 'letter character' not a character in a movie, even if it is Steve Buscemi.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Build up the tension as you walk up to the helmeted kid. You're walking towards him from behind, so you can't see what he has in front of him. You just see the helmet on his head, which is made of tin foil and obviously for a crazy person. Then, as you get closer, hear the clack of wooden block letters being moved around, frantically.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>男<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>man</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Power, Rice Paddy</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You have <font color=""#0af""><b>rice paddy</b></font> <font color=""#0af""><b>power</b></font> (or you need power for your rice field). If you want precision in your rice paddy, go ask a woman. If you want power in your rice field, you need a <font color=""#f0a""><b>man</b></font>.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: P.S. Sorry for being totally sexist there – use your possible upsetedness to remember the meaning of this kanji, though, and it will be all worthwhile</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>主<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>master</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Master</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The radical <font color=""#0af""><b>master</b></font> and the kanji <font color=""#f0a""><b>master</b></font> have the same meanings! How lucky for you.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: </i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>名<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>name, famous</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Mouth, Evening</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">What is the <font color=""#0af""><b>evening</b></font> <font color=""#0af""><b>mouth</b></font>? Imagine a mouth that’s up in the night sky. It’s just there, talking, and only comes out at night. It only appears in one area of the world (what area would you choose? Imagine yourself going to that place to see the “night mouth.”), and appears only one month out of the year (more on this in a second). The “evening mouth” is the most famous thing in the _____ area (this is the area you choose). He’s so <font color=""#f0a""><b>famous</b></font> that everybody knows his <font color=""#f0a""><b>name</b></font> (“Evening Mouth.”).</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine yourself going to the area you chose, and watching “Evening Mouth” speak. There are thousands of others there, wanting to see the giant floating mouth in the night sky. “Evening Mouth” then says “Everyone, what’s my <font color=""#f0a""><b>name</b></font>!?” and everyone shouts back “Evening Mouth!” in unison. “Evening Mouth” has certainly gotten really <font color=""#f0a""><b>famous</b></font>.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>不<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>not</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Not</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The <font color=""#0af""><b>not</b></font> and the kanji <font color=""#f0a""><b>not</b></font> are the same thing! That makes it easy... Not!</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Actually, it does make it easy - the radicals make kanji wayyy easier, no?</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>号<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>number</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Enclosure, Ground, Mouth</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">There's a <font color=""#0af""><b>mouth</b></font> in the <font color=""#0af""><b>ground</b></font> (in our case, it's a hatch), and inside is some kind of <font color=""#0af""><b>enclosure</b></font> you can't quite get to. If you've ever seen Lost, this will sound familiar... on the hatch, there's actually a series of <font color=""#f0a""><b>number</b></font>s that you don't understand.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: What are these numbers? What do they mean? Think over it for a while, get frustrated, and try to figure it out. You can't, though, so you probably won't ever get inside.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>他<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>other</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Alligator, Leader</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The <font color=""#0af""><b>leader</b></font> of <font color=""#0af""><b>alligators</b></font>... he's no ordinary leader, that's for sure. He's not a politician.. he's not a king... He's one of the <font color=""#f0a""><b>Other</b></font> Ones, a group of strange, eccentric people who become leaders of animals.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine different groups of leaders - they're all dressed nice and normal. Then, off to the side are the leaders who are leaders of bears, cats, alligators, and narwhals... they're the <font color=""#f0a""><b>other</b></font> ones, no matter how you look at it. They are in their own group, and they are considered 'others' because society won't accept them :(</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>去<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>past</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Grave, Pile</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">A <font color=""#0af""><b>pile</b></font> of <font color=""#0af""><b>grave</b></font>s has a whole lot of <font color=""#f0a""><b>past</b></font> associated with it, and not much future.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Look at all the years and tombstones... all of it is from so long ago. All of it is from the past.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>皿<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>plate</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Plate</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The <font color=""#f0a""><b>plate</b></font> kanji and the <font color=""#0af""><b>plate</b></font> are exactly the same, like two matching pieces of china.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: If you know your radicals, you know your kanji too.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>先<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>previous</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Slide, Grave, Legs</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You’re about to go down a <font color=""#0af""><b>grave</b></font> <font color=""#0af""><b>slide</b></font>. This time you won’t make the same mistake you made with the <font color=""#f0a""><b>previous</b></font> grave slide you tried. In the previous slide, you went down so fast your <font color=""#0af""><b>legs</b></font> got stuck in the grave. You could feel the bones and rotting flesh touching your shoe-less feet. That previous grave-slide was faulty.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Emphasize thinking back to the <font color=""#f0a""><b>previous</b></font> slide (not the one you’re on, unless you’re thinking about how much better this one will be compared to the previous one). Imagine the previous slide, and all its nastiness (when it comes to sliding down so hard your feet are stuck in someone’s grave, you’ll have plenty of nastiness to go around).</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>赤<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>red</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Red</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The radical for <font color=""#0af""><b>red</b></font> and the kanji for <font color=""#f0a""><b>red</b></font> are the same thing!</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: What a lucky ducky - as long as you know your radicals, you'll know this kanji's meaning as well!</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>休<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>rest</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Tree, Leader</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The <font color=""#0af""><b>leader</b></font> is next to the <font color=""#0af""><b>tree</b></font>. What is he doing? He's leaning against it, <font color=""#f0a""><b>rest</b></font>ing.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: One of the best things you can do under a tree is rest. Just lean your head against it and close your eyes. The leader of your outfit has been working hard, and he really, really needed that <font color=""#f0a""><b>rest</b></font>.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>申<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>say humbly</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Cross, Mouth</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">There’s a <font color=""#0af""><b>cross</b></font> in your <font color=""#0af""><b>mouth</b></font>, so the things you say are very pious. Everything you say you <font color=""#f0a""><b>say humbly</b></font>.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine yourself with a cross in your mouth, saying all kinds of humble things. 'Oh no, I'm not that good.' 'Oh no, my mustache doesn't look that great.'</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>見<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>see</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">See</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The radical <font color=""#0af""><b>see</b></font> and the kanji <font color=""#f0a""><b>see</b></font> are exactly the same!</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Make sure you're studying your radicals. If you do, you'll know a lot of kanji as well, almost magically!</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>貝<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>shellfish, clam</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Clam</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The radical, <font color=""#0af""><b>clam</b></font>, is a type of <font color=""#f0a""><b>shellfish</b></font>. Also, we'll allow <font color=""#f0a""><b>clam</b></font> here too, because sometimes clams are referred to as 貝 and it's the same as the radical. I'd focus on learning the 'shellfish' version of the vocab if you can, though.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Be sure to try and differentiate 'clam' and 'shellfish' before moving on to the reading.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>皮<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>skin</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Slide, Frog</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">A <font color=""#0af""><b>frog</b></font> decides to jump down a <font color=""#0af""><b>slide</b></font>... the problem is that it's not a water slide (which is another radical). This is a regular slide he jumps down, and as a frog, his skin gets dry easily. As he slides down, his <font color=""#f0a""><b>skin</b></font> gets torn off him, and so he's a naked, skinless frog when he reaches the bottom.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Pick up the <font color=""#f0a""><b>skin</b></font> and feel it... Does it feel odd? Weird? Rubbery? Really touch it in your mind and remember how it felt. Make sure it's just the skin, too.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>代<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>substitute, age, period</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Ceremony, Leader</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The <b><font color=""#0af"">leader</font></b> for the <b><font color=""#0af"">ceremony</font></b> wasn't available, so they had to find a <b><font color=""#f0a"">substitute</font></b>.  It also has another meaning. A leader only missed the ceremony if he forgot what <b><font color=""#f0a"">period</font></b> of time it was. If he thinks he's in the wrong <b><font color=""#f0a"">age</font></b>, he won't come because he's trying to lead some monkeys in the ceremony instead.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: First, come up with a really weird ceremony. Then, be someone who's coordinating this weird ceremony. Much to your surprise, the leader of the ceremony itself didn't show up. You have to figure something out... you have to find (and imagine yourself doing this) the <font color=""#f0a""><b>substitute</b></font> leader. Also, the sub does terribly - what a disaster, and it's all your fault, because you're coordinating.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>礼<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>thanks</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Pelican, Umbrella</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The <font color=""#0af""><b>pelican</b></font> with an <font color=""#0af""><b>umbrella</b></font> is standing there in the rain, staying dry. You on the other hand, are not. But, this pelican is super nice. She sees you looking all pathetic and holds the umbrella over your head to keep you dry. What do you say when this happens? You say '<font color=""#f0a""><b>thanks</b></font>.'</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Feel really <font color=""#f0a""><b>thank</b></font>ful about this. You're all wet (feel the cold wetness) and you're getting wetter. Then, this pelican comes out of the blue to keep you dry. You probably feel really really thankful about it, right?</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>糸<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>thread</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Thread</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The <font color=""#0af""><b>thread</b></font> radical and <font color=""#f0a""><b>thread</b></font> are the same in looks as well as and meaning.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: This is why it's good to make sure you know your radicals.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>町<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>town</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Nail, Rice Paddy</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The <font color=""#0af""><b>rice paddy</b></font> is full of <font color=""#0af""><b>nails</b></font>. That sucks. Why is the rice field full of nails? It’s part of a <font color=""#f0a""><b>town</b></font> that’s known for making nails, and they dump their nails in the rice field (because rice is worth nothing to this town).</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Try to feel some anger towards the town as a whole. Rice is awesome. They can’t be throwing nails in there. Jerks.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>村<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>village</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Tree, Measurement</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Someone’s taking <font color=""#0af""><b>measurements</b></font> of the <font color=""#0af""><b>trees</b></font>… Why is someone taking measurements of trees? These people are planning to take the trees and cut them down to make their <font color=""#f0a""><b>village</b></font>.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: There is a whole group of people out there who are measuring these trees. Imagine them asking each other “do you think this will be a good tree for our village center?” and other people nodding in agreement or disagreement as they measure.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>年<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>year</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Cow, Gun</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The <font color=""#0af""><b>cow</b></font> part of this kanji is slightly altered, but I think you can see where it is. The <font color=""#0af""><b>gun</b></font> looks just fine, though. Think back to a fake memory you have living on the farm. You have your gun, and you gotta use it on a cow (ruh roh). Once a <font color=""#f0a""><b>year</b></font> on New Year's, you have to go out and shoot one of the cows. It's only a yearly shooting, though, so at least there's that respite.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: You'll have to imagine yourself doing this to remember the meaning of the kanji. Focus on the thought that 'okay... it's only once a year... I only have to do this once a <font color=""#f0a""><b>year</b></font>...'</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>角<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>angle</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Enclosure, Elephant</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You have an <font color=""#0af""><b>enclosure</b></font> trying to enclose the <font color=""#0af""><b>elephant</b></font>. But, as you can see already, the elephant is way too big for it. No matter what <font color=""#f0a""><b>angle</b></font> you turn the elephant, you're unable to get it inside the enclosure.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine yourself turning the elephant in all different directions. You turn it at a 90 degree angle. A 60 degree angle. A 20 degree angle... nothing works - no matter what angle you turn it at, the elephant won't fit in.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>青<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>blue</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Blue</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The <font color=""#0af""><b>blue</b></font> radical and the <font color=""#f0a""><b>blue</b></font> kanji are exactly the same.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Don't feel blue, you should know this kanji automagically!</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>体<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>body</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Real, Leader</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The <font color=""#0af""><b>real</b></font> <font color=""#0af""><b>leader</b></font>'s <font color=""#f0a""><b>body</b></font> is here... so who's the other leader? Is he a fake?&nbsp;</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Just imagine finding your leader's body somewhere, even though you saw him just a moment before in the other room. That means the other one is a fake, and this body is the real leader.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>色<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>color</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Color</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The <font color=""#0af""><b>color</b></font> radical and <font color=""#f0a""><b>color</b></font> are the same in looks as well as and meaning.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Color me pink! This kanji's super easy if you know your radicals.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>来<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>come, next</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Ground, Rice</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">There's <b><font color=""#0af"">rice</font></b> spread out all over the <b><font color=""#0af"">ground</font></b>. This will cause the Predator to <b><font color=""#f0a"">come</font></b> because he loves kome (rice). Then once he's gone, the <b><font color=""#f0a"">next</font></b> Predator will come to eat.<br><br>Also imagine everyone else coming to the rice next. When rice spills, people come from all around to line up and grab a handful of it to take home. Who's next? Come forward!</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: </i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>社<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>company</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Grave, Pelican</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">There's this mass <font color=""#0af""><b>pelican</b></font> <font color=""#0af""><b>grave</b></font>. Who on earth would kill all the pelicans? You look around, and see a giant building. It's a local pelican hunting <font color=""#f0a""><b>company</b></font>. They're obviously responsible for all these pelican graves.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: What a terrible <font color=""#f0a""><b>company</b></font>, though. Just think about all the companies you don't like, and add them to your metaphorical list.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>図<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>diagram</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Mouth, Treasure, Ice</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The <font color=""#0af""><b>treasure</b></font>s are in the <font color=""#0af""><b>mouth</b></font> where there’s <font color=""#0af""><b>ice</b></font>. How cryptic! You want to find the treasure, that’s for sure (treasure is great!). It is somewhere where there is ice, so maybe the arctic? What you are looking at is a <font color=""#f0a""><b>diagram</b></font> which will guide you there.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine looking at a diagram or map – and it has pictures of treasure in an area where ice is. This is where you will find the mystical treasure. This diagram will show the way. You're so excited that you found this map!</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>毎<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>every</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Window, Gun</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You see some <font color=""#0af""><b>windows</b></font>... you have a <font color=""#0af""><b>gun</b></font>. What do you think you're going to do with this gun? Of course, you're going to shoot the windows... <font color=""#f0a""><b>every</b></font> single one of them.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Make a point to make sure you get <font color=""#f0a""><b>every</b></font> one, and don't miss any of them. Actually search around in your imagination for any more windows, because you want to stress it's important you hit <font color=""#f0a""><b>every</b></font> one.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>羽<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>feather, wing</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Feathers</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The <font color=""#0af""><b>feather</b></font> radical and <font color=""#f0a""><b>feather</b></font> are the same in looks as well as in meaning.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Have you been studying your radicals? If so, this'll be easy!</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>林<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>forest</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Tree</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You have a <font color=""#0af""><b>tree</b></font> and another <font color=""#0af""><b>tree</b></font>. You basically have yourself a <font color=""#f0a""><b>forest</b></font>!</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Follow the logic of this one and you should be okay.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>行<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>go</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Go</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The <font color=""#0af""><b>go</b></font> radical and <font color=""#f0a""><b>go</b></font> kanji are the same in looks as well as and meaning.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Go study your radicals if you didn't know the 'Go' radical, okay?</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>金<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>gold</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Gold</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The radical <font color=""#0af""><b>gold</b></font> and the kanji <font color=""#f0a""><b>gold</b></font> are the same, making this an easy kanji to learn.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Just know your radicals and you'll be golden, so to speak.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>草<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>grass</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Cross, Sun, Flowers</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Instead of a 'cross' let's say that 十 is 'ten' for this time.<br>You expose your <font color=""#0af""><b>flowers</b></font> to <font color=""#0af""><b>ten</b></font> <font color=""#0af""><b>sun</b></font>s. They are instantly burned up, and all that remains is <font color=""#f0a""><b>grass</b></font>.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Think of how disappointed you are. You thought ten suns would make the flowers grow better, but instead it just burned up all the sensitive flowers, leaving only the grass behind :(</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>里<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>home village</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Sunflower</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Turns out, your <font color=""#f0a""><b>home village</b></font> is known for all its beautiful <font color=""#0af""><b>sunflower</b></font>s.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: You might have to make up this part of your past, but the village you were born in is just beautiful during the summer. Sunflowers everywhere. You always like going back to visit your parents at your home village just to see them. They're so nice.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>作<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>make</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Leader, Key</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The <font color=""#0af""><b>leader</b></font>'s <font color=""#0af""><b>key</b></font> is the key that <font color=""#f0a""><b>make</b></font>s all the other keys. It's sort of like the one ring to rule them all, the one ring to bind them... except with keys.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine the leader taking his key to open up a safe that has a button to make other keys for the underlings. No key is as great as this key, though.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>多<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>many</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Evening</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">How many <font color=""#0af""><b>evenings</b></font> are there? There are <font color=""#f0a""><b>many</b></font>.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: If you accidentally think 'a lot' or something similar, that's okay too. It's the basic meaning that counts, and all these things are pretty close, though eventually you want to get to the point where you know that this kanji does in fact mean <font color=""#f0a""><b>many</b></font>.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>肉<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>meat</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Meat</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The <font color=""#0af""><b>meat</b></font> radical and <font color=""#f0a""><b>meat</b></font> are the same in looks as well as and meaning.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Study those radicals, and perhaps we'll eat some meat tonight.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>会<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>meet</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Meet</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The radical <font color=""#0af""><b>meet</b></font> and the kanji <font color=""#f0a""><b>meet</b></font> are exactly the same!</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: </i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>交<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>mix</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Lid, Father</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Your <font color=""#0af""><b>father</b></font> is in a kettle with a <font color=""#0af""><b>lid</b></font> on top. This is a horrible situation. To make things worse, someone is forcing you to <font color=""#f0a""><b>mix</b></font> him with a big spoon. As you mix him, he tells you to mix harder, so that at least your life can be saved. '<font color=""#f0a""><b>Mix</b></font> me, child! <font color=""#f0a""><b>Mix</b></font> me!!'</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine yourself having to mix your father in a kettle, then put the lid on. This is a terrible thing... but also a terrible thing you'll probably remember, helping you to remember the kanji's meaning as well.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>近<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>near</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Axe, Water Slide</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The <font color=""#0af""><b>water slide</b></font> with <font color=""#0af""><b>axe</b></font>s flowing down it instead of water is <font color=""#f0a""><b>near</b></font> your house!</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine it right next to your house. People are lining up to use it, but to you it's just an eyesore because you have to look at the dumb thing everyday. It's so near, too! Literally the next lot over.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>池<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>pond</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Alligator, Tsunami</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The poor <font color=""#0af""><b>alligator</b></font> was taken far inland by a <font color=""#0af""><b>tsunami</b></font>. His only source of water is a tiny <font color=""#f0a""><b>pond</b></font> that barely fits his body, and doesn't even provide much food.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine the alligator riding the tsunami in. When he hits the ground, and the water recedes, he's all alone in a field. He doesn't like it... it's not his environment. So, he looks around and finally finds a little <font color=""#f0a""><b>pond</b></font>, but it doesn't provide much for him. Imagine him looking for food in the little, shallow pond. Imagine him trying to stay wet... it's just not a great situation to be in, unfortunately.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>雨<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>rain</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Rain</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The radical for <font color=""#0af""><b>rain</b></font> and the kanji for <font color=""#f0a""><b>rain</b></font> are the same thing.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Make sure you know your radicals!</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>米<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>rice</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Rice</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The <font color=""#0af""><b>rice</b></font> radical and <font color=""#f0a""><b>rice</b></font> are the same in looks as well as and meaning. This also refers to 'America,' maybe because America is covered in rice or fields or something?</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Aren't radicals nice? They make things so much easier... if you've been studying them.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>当<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>right, success</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Wolverine, Triceratops</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The 'right' for this kanji is like 'correct' or something along those lines. It's like when you get a question correct. 'You're Right!' You could also say it's a <font color=""#f0a""><b>success</b></font>.<br>There's a <font color=""#0af""><b>triceratops</b></font> and a <font color=""#0af""><b>wolverine</b></font>. What are they doing together? You'd think they'd fight, but they took their battle to another venue... they're competing in Jeopardy! One of them answers a question, and the host says 'You're <font color=""#f0a""><b>right</b></font>!'</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Feel free to think through several questions and answers, but make sure they're all right, because that's what we're focusing on. Also make sure to focus on the triceratops and the wolverine themselves. You want to make sure that when you see these two radicals you automatically know they're playing Jeopardy, not doing anything else, like fighting or racing or playing or something.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>走<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>run</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Run</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The radical <font color=""#0af""><b>run</b></font> and the kanji <font color=""#f0a""><b>run</b></font> are exactly the same!</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Make sure you know those radicals!</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>同<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>same</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Ground, Mustache</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">There's a <font color=""#0af""><b>mustache</b></font> on the <font color=""#0af""><b>ground</b></font>. Upon closer inspection, you see that the mustache on the ground is exactly the <font color=""#f0a""><b>same</b></font> as yours!</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Pick up the mustache, hold it up next to your face in front of a mirror. It's unbelievable, but it's the same in every way, down to the last hair.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>言<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>say</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Say</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The radical <font color=""#0af""><b>say</b></font> is the same as the kanji <font color=""#f0a""><b>say</b></font>!</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: If, say, you learn your radicals, you'll know a lot of your kanji as well!</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>自<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>self</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Self</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The <font color=""#0af""><b>self</b></font> radical and <font color=""#f0a""><b>self</b></font> are the same in looks as well as and meaning.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Radicals have self. Kanji has self. Kanji and radicals can sometimes be the same thing... so do they really have 'self'? Only way to find out is to study both of them hard!</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>売<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>sell</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Legs, Forehead, Samurai</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">There’s a <font color=""#0af""><b>samurai</b></font> with (just) his <font color=""#0af""><b>forehead</b></font> and <font color=""#0af""><b>legs</b></font>. Everything in between is missing. What happened to everything in between? He was low on money, so he had to <font color=""#f0a""><b>sell</b></font> it all, leaving him only the top and the bottom.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine this terrifying samurai. You have legs… okay, that’s normal. But, then you have just a giant forehead on the top of everything else, walking around. That’s pretty scary that someone would sell such important parts of their body.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>形<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>shape</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Hair, Lantern</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You discover something strange about a <font color=""#0af""><b>lantern</b></font>. It's totally covered in <font color=""#0af""><b>hair</b></font> which is arranged in a very strange <font color=""#f0a""><b>shape</b></font>.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: I want you to come up with a really strange shape this hair lantern should be in. Something startling, something surprising...</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>空<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>sky</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Construction, Legs, Helmet</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You're doing some <font color=""#0af""><b>construction</b></font> under your <font color=""#0af""><b>legs</b></font>, and you're even wearing a <font color=""#0af""><b>helmet</b></font> on top of that. Why do you need to build something under you and put something on top of you? You want to be able to reach the <font color=""#f0a""><b>sky</b></font>.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: So that explains why you're doing so many things to make yourself taller... too bad the sky is really high. Imagine what you'd need to construct / wear to get up that high.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>音<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>sound</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Sun, Stand</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">For some reason, you are <font color=""#0af""><b>stand</b></font>ing on the <font color=""#0af""><b>sun</b></font>. It's obviously very hot, but the thing you notice most is the <font color=""#f0a""><b>sound</b></font> of you burning up. It sizzles so much.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine a super loud sizzling sound, drowning everything else out. It's ridiculously loud, and hurts your ears more than the sun's heat hurts your skin.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>学<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>study</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Child, Viking</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You have a wild <font color=""#0af""><b>viking</b></font> <font color=""#0af""><b>child</b></font> you have to take care of. He won't do anything but <font color=""#f0a""><b>study</b></font>, surprisingly. You can't get him to eat, use the bathroom, or anything else. He just wants to study.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Of course, this isn't what you'd expect of a little viking child. It's the opposite. That's why it's so surprising! He loves to study!</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>光<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>sunlight, light</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Triceratops, Pi</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You see a <font color=""#0af""><b>triceratops</b></font> in the distance... but notice something odd about it. It's perfectly <font color=""#0af""><b>pi</b></font> shaped (circular) It's the pitriceratops! But the shape isn't the strange thing about the pitriceratops. The weird part is that these creatures are made 100% out of <font color=""#f0a""><b>sunlight</b></font>. <br>This kanji can also simply just mean <font color=""#f0a""><b>light</b></font> as well, if you like.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine it absorbing sunlight to become stronger. Then, it turns and sees you, nearly blinding you. Feel the pain in your eyes from all the sunlight emanating off the pitriceratops.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>考<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>think</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Beggar, Coffin</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">We have a <font color=""#0af""><b>coffin</b></font> and a <font color=""#0af""><b>beggar</b></font>. How do these things go together? The person begging is in the coffin. He's begging for his life, of course, but that's not going to do him any good. So, after he realizes that, he just begins to <font color=""#f0a""><b>think</b></font>. What could I have done better in my life? Why am I in this situation? How will I get out? Think, damnit, think!!</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine him going down the slide <font color=""#f0a""><b>think</b></font>ing really, really hard. Maybe his head begins visibly throbbing from all of it. His hands are on his chin, allowing him to contemplate harder. Important thing is to focus in on the beggar’s thinking and perhaps a bit about what he’s thinking of.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>回<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>times, revolve</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Mouth</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">There's a <font color=""#0af""><b>mouth</b></font> inside a mouth. But, if you look even closer (not actually, but we're pretending) you can see another mouth inside that mouth... and another one inside of that one! It keeps going and going. Can you count the number of <font color=""#f0a""><b>times</b></font> there's a mouth inside a mouth? This kanji also means <font color=""#f0a""><b>revolve</b></font>, too. Think of each 'time' a thing happens, it loops back around and comes back to the beginning, revolving around again for another time.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine yourself counting and counting smaller and smaller mouths inside of each other, recording the number of times you can find a mouth inside another mouth. Dig deeper and deeper until it feels ridiculous how small the mouths are getting. Be sure to focus on the counting and the number of times you find one. Now, how many mouths is this <font color=""#f0a""><b>times</b></font> two, because your mouth is like this too.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>谷<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>valley</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Fins, Mouth, Hat</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">There's a <font color=""#0af""><b>hat</b></font> decorated with <font color=""#0af""><b>fins</b></font> and (presumably fish) <font color=""#0af""><b>mouth</b></font>s on it. Who wears strange hats like this? Turns out, the <font color=""#f0a""><b>valley</b></font> people are the ones who wear these. I'm talking about the 'Valley Girls' of California, Hollywood / LA. They're into the crazy fashion, and they'll wear anything if it's deemed 'cool' or something like that.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine a bunch of Valley Girls walking around with these strange hats. Fins and fish mouths... what a strange new fad.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>声<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>voice</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Flag, Samurai, Stick</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You have a <font color=""#0af""><b>samurai</b></font> with a <font color=""#0af""><b>flag</b></font> on a <font color=""#0af""><b>stick</b></font>. On his flag is this symbol, the kanji for <font color=""#f0a""><b>voice</b></font>. Why does he have that there? He feels like his Shogun isn't giving him and his fellow Samurai a voice, so he's brought a flag with the word 'voice' written on it to protest.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine him and other samurai with their flags on sticks waving them around shouting things like 'we want a voice in politics!' etc., etc.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>西<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>west</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">West</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The <font color=""#0af""><b>west</b></font> radical and <font color=""#f0a""><b>west</b></font> are the same in looks as well as and meaning.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Make sure you know all those radicals, will make your life more pleasant.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>何<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>what</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Leader, Lip Ring</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Our <font color=""#0af""><b>leader</b></font> has a <font color=""#0af""><b>lip ring</b></font>. Wait, our leader has a lip ring? <font color=""#f0a""><b>WHAT</b></font>??</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Think of our president (or your prime minister, or dictator, or whatever) and imagine this person appearing on television one morning with a big ol' lip ring. Feel surprised by it. Just say 'What??' over and over again. You want to have the feeling of 'what' in you when you imagine this - that'll help you to remember this kanji's meaning.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>麦<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>wheat</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Life, Winter</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The <font color=""#0af""><b>life</b></font> radical is without the slide (as it sometimes is), but when you combine that with the <font color=""#0af""><b>winter</b></font> you have life during winter. What gives you life during the winter? It's the <font><b>wheat</b></font> you store away.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine you're starving. It's cold and you've run out of food. You don't know what you're going to do. If you don't find something, you'll lose your life. Then, you break open a barrel, and wheat pours out. It's beautiful. You just found some life in the middle of winter.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>弟<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>younger brother</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Slide, Spring, Stick, Horns</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You have someone with <font color=""#0af""><b>horns</b></font>, <font color=""#0af""><b>springs</b></font> (on his feet), a <font color=""#0af""><b>stick</b></font>, and is going down a <font color=""#0af""><b>slide</b></font>. What type of person do you imagine? I'd say someone who's an immature boy. That would be your <font color=""#f0a""><b>younger brother</b></font>.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Just pretend you have a younger brother for now, if you don't. Also be sure to imagine this person really vividly. They look ridiculous. He is a stereotypical little kid (horns because horns are awesome, springs on his feet, and a stick - plus he's going down a slide). Everything about someone like this screams 'little brother.'</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>全<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>all</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">King, Hat</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text""><font color=""#0af""><b>Kings</b></font> with <font color=""#0af""><b>hats</b></font>. Did you know that <font color=""#f0a""><b>all</b></font> kings wear hats?</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Think of as many kings as you can think of. Guess what, every single one of them (aka <font color=""#f0a""><b>all</b></font> of them) wear hats! Think of strange hats, funny hats, and normal hats. Just make sure you're amazed by the fact they all are wearing them.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>後<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>behind, after</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Poop, Winter, Loiter</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">In the <font color=""#0af""><b>winter</b></font>, <font color=""#0af""><b>poop</b></font> <font color=""#0af""><b>loiter</b></font>s <font color=""#f0a""><b>behind</b></font> you (aka on your butt) because it freezes so fast. It lasts a long time <font color=""#f0a""><b>after</b></font> it's been dropped. Really it's anything that's behind you... which includes <font color=""#f0a""><b>rear</b></font> and <font color=""#f0a""><b>back</b></font> as well.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Well, this is already really gross, but it can't be helped. It's so cold that your poop freezes to your butt cheeks and loiters there for a long time. Imagine the feeling of it frozen and stuck to you, and you know that if you try to rip it off, it'll take your skin with it. So, you're stuck with it behind you until you can get home.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>血<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>blood</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Blood</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The <font color=""#0af""><b>blood</b></font> radical and <font color=""#f0a""><b>blood</b></font> are the same in looks as well as and meaning.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: There'll be some bad blood between us if you're not studying your radicals, especially when they're the same like this kanji!</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>両<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>both</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Ground, Mountain, Head</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Under the <b><font color=""#0af"">ground</font></b>, which you dug into, you found two great finds. You found&nbsp;<b style=""color: rgb(226, 0, 150);"">both</b>&nbsp;a <b><font color=""#0af"">mountain</font></b> and a <b><font color=""#0af"">head</font></b>, two strange things to find underground.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: You'll want to focus on the part where you find <font color=""#f0a""><b>both</b></font>, not so much the things themselves. Think about how you can't believe you did so good finding both things at once. Usually you only find one or the other when you're searching.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>明<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>bright</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Sun, Moon</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The <font color=""#0af""><b>sun</b></font> AND the <font color=""#0af""><b>moon</b></font> are out? With both their light-powers combined, it's incredibly <font color=""#f0a""><b>bright</b></font> outside.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Look up at both of them, hanging out in the sky together. Make them super bright, so bright you have to shield your eyes.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>京<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>capital</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Lid, Mouth, Small</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Someone is trying to put a <font color=""#0af""><b>lid</b></font> on the <font color=""#0af""><b>small</b></font> <font color=""#0af""><b>mouths</b></font>. This is oppression. The small people are trying to speak out their opinions on the government but they cannot. Where would it be most important to squelch this sort of uprising? In the <font color=""#f0a""><b>capital</b></font>.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Just imagine all these people yelling for change out of their mouths. They are the little people, the peasants, the regular Joes. Imagine them at the capital (imagine your capital building, whatever it is, in your country). P.S. This kanji looks very similar to the radical 束 but it's a little different. The line doesn't cross through the middle all the way. Be careful of this.</span></i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>化<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>change</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Spoon, Leader</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">A <font color=""#0af""><b>leader</b></font> with a <font color=""#0af""><b>spoon</b></font> is a powerful thing. Even something like a spoon when given to the right man or woman can make great <font color=""#f0a""><b>change</b></font> in the world.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine your leader-hero holding a spoon out, then doing something awesome with it to totally <font color=""#f0a""><b>change</b></font> everything for the better. It's amazing the change this person can do with such a blunt, small, device!</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>国<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>country</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Drop, Mouth, King</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The <font color=""#0af""><b>mouth</b></font> of the <font color=""#0af""><b>king</b></font> extends all the way around him (like in this kanji). Where his mouth reaches, that is his <font color=""#f0a""><b>country</b></font>, give or take a few <font color=""#0af""><b>drop</b></font>s.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine his talking taking physical form. As he talks, waves extend out from him, and stop right at the border of his country before getting to the next one.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>死<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>death</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Spoon, Bad</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You'll have to stretch the top of <font color=""#0af""><b>bad</b></font> out a bit, but it's there. You have a <font color=""#0af""><b>bad</b></font> <font color=""#0af""><b>spoon</b></font>, though you don't know that. When you use it to take a bite of something, your throat seizes up. You can't breathe. There was poison on that bad spoon, and now you're about to experience <font color=""#f0a""><b>death</b></font>.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine <font color=""#f0a""><b>Death</b></font> coming up behind you with his black cloak and scythe. He says 'aw, you had a bad spoon, sorry. I'm here to take you now.' You try to plead with death, saying his name over and over ('Death, but... Death, no, please!') to no avail. He takes you to his death kingdom.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>亡<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>deceased</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Death</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The meaning of the radical <font color=""#0af""><b>death</b></font> and the kanji <font color=""#f0a""><b>deceased</b></font> are pretty similar which should make it easier to remember the meaning of this kanji.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: It's not just <font color=""#0af""><b>death</b></font> though, it's a more polite version of the word death. You know how you say 'he's deceased' instead of 'he's dead' because it sounds nicer? It's kind of like that.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>画<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>drawing</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Rice Paddy, Box, Leaf</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">There's a nice little <font color=""#0af""><b>leaf</b></font> coming out of a <font color=""#0af""><b>rice paddy</b></font> in a little <font color=""#0af""><b>box</b></font>. So, everything is really tiny. Why? Because actually this is a <font color=""#f0a""><b>drawing</b></font>. Most likely some kind of modern art.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: What does this drawing mean? You're looking at it in the museum, examining it closely. Imagine this scene as a drawing to hit home the point that this kanji means drawing as well.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>地<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>earth</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Grave, Alligator</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You're digging a <font color=""#0af""><b>grave</b></font> and you find an <font color=""#0af""><b>alligator</b></font>'s skull. You're excited about this find. So, you keep digging and digging, hoping to find more. Soon you find yourself surrounded by the <font color=""#f0a""><b>earth</b></font> itself! <br>You can also think of this word as <font color=""#f0a""><b>ground</b></font> too, because that's kind of what the earth is made out of, at least the hard part.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: To make things even more memorable, you can imagine the alligator skull being hundreds of feet wide / tall. Imagine yourself digging the whole thing out, by hand, for years and years. Think of all the <font color=""#f0a""><b>earth</b></font> that would get in your fingernails. Think of the huge mounds of earth you'd create. Epic!</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>東<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>east</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Cross, Fins, Rice Paddy</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">There are some holy <font color=""#0af""><b>cross</b></font> <font color=""#0af""><b>rice paddy</b></font>s with religiously important fish <font color=""#0af""><b>fins</b></font> in them for some reason. You want to collect these fins, but you don't know where to go. You survey around. All you know is that these cross-shaped fin-filled rice paddys are to the <font color=""#f0a""><b>east</b></font>.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: So, turn to the east and make your way over there. Did you find all the fins you were looking for? Actually figure out in your imagination which direction east is though. If you struggle a bit at figuring it out (maybe you check moss on trees or check the wind or check the sun...) you'll likely remember this kanji's meaning better.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>食<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>eat, meal</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Eat</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The radical for <font color=""#0af""><b>eat</b></font> and the kanji for <font color=""#f0a""><b>eat</b></font> are the same! Lucky you.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: If you know the radical, you basically know the meaning(s) of this kanji. There is a second meaning added to it, though, and that is <font color=""#f0a""><b>meal</b></font>. Just think about the things you eat? What are they? In the simplest form, they are just meals. So, if you know 'eat' you should be able to remember 'meal' as well.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>直<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>fix, direct</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Cross, Eye, Lion</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You accidentally stab your <font color=""#0af""><b>cross</b></font> into the <font color=""#0af""><b>eye</b></font> of a <font color=""#0af""><b>lion</b></font>. Of course, this is a terrible thing you've done, because it's Mike Tyson's Lion. You have to <font color=""#f0a""><b>fix</b></font> your mistake. Mike Tyson is very <font color=""#f0a""><b>direct</b></font> when he tells you that you gotta fix your mistake.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: How will you fix this mistake, though? Maybe if you build a time machine you can go back and stop yourself from throwing your cross around so carelessly. Whatever you do, focus on how important it is to <font color=""#f0a""><b>fix</b></font> the mistake, more than anything. This kanji also means direct, so just imagine Mike Tyson being very direct when he speaks to you.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>前<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>front, before</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Ground, Moon, Horns, Ribs</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You find some <font color=""#0af""><b>horns</b></font>, some <font color=""#0af""><b>ribs</b></font>, and some <font color=""#0af""><b>moon</b></font> rock on the <font color=""#0af""><b>ground</b></font> in <font color=""#f0a""><b>front</b></font> of you. When you try to move, they always rotate around with you, staying right in front. You can't escape these objects, for some reason. <br>This kanji also means <font color=""#f0a""><b>before</b></font>, too. Something that's in front of you is before you, after all.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Perhaps it's some kind of magic, but you don't care. Why are these strange objects always in front of me? Why won't they stay put? This will get pretty freaky after a while. Try to run. Try to hide. Spin around. Do whatever you need to do. No matter what, these objects are always in front.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>有<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>have</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Moon, Narwhal</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">A <font color=""#0af""><b>narwhal</b></font> and a <font color=""#0af""><b>moon</b></font>. Two great, majestic things. You really want to <font color=""#f0a""><b>have</b></font> both of them, more than anything.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine yourself holding both, one in each arm, so happy because you <font color=""#f0a""><b>have</b></font> what you want. What a lucky kid you are, getting everything!</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>知<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>know</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Mouth, Arrow</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Just before saying something important, you take an <font color=""#0af""><b>arrow</b></font> to the <font color=""#0af""><b>mouth</b></font> which seals your lips together, making it so you can't talk. Someone doesn't want you to share what you <font color=""#f0a""><b>know</b></font> with something else.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine being so surprised by this arrow. Then, think of all the things you know that need to be said and told to everyone. Maybe you have information about nuke codes. Maybe you have information that will save the President. Whatever it is, make sure you know important things that need to be said (but also things that people want to prevent you from saying, even if it means shooting you in the mouth with an arrow).</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>活<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>lively</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Mouth, Thousand, Tsunami</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">A <font color=""#0af""><b>tsunami</b></font> of a <font color=""#0af""><b>thousand</b></font> <font color=""#0af""><b>mouths</b></font> sweeps over your city, enveloping everything in its path. As you're being swallowed up, the one thing you notice is how <font color=""#f0a""><b>lively</b></font> the mouths are. They're talking, they're having a good time, and they're laughing. So lively.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine the mouths doing all kinds of things that you'd personally associate with being 'lively.' This is more of a personal thing, so fit the mnemonic to your own tastes!</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>長<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>long, leader</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Long</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The radical for <font color=""#0af""><b>long</b></font> and the kanji for <font color=""#0af""><b>long</b></font> are the same! <br>There is also another meaning to learn, though, which is <font color=""#f0a""><b>leader</b></font>. You can remember this by thinking about how the leader has a long staff, showing he's the leader.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Make sure you know your radicals!</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>曲<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>music, bend</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Mouth, Twenty</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text""><font color=""#0af""><b>Twenty</b></font> <font color=""#0af""><b>mouths</b></font> are together. That's a lot of mouths. What do they do? They sing beautiful <font color=""#f0a""><b>music</b></font> together.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Listen to the twenty mouths. They sound great. Have them sing your favorite music. Also note that this kanji also means 'bend.' Imagine the music coming out at you <font color=""#f0a""><b>bend</b></font>ing all around in strange shapes through the air.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>首<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>neck</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Neck</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The radical <font color=""#0af""><b>neck</b></font> and the kanji <font color=""#f0a""><b>neck</b></font> are exactly the same!</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: </i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>次<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>next</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Ice, Lack</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You <font color=""#0af""><b>lack</b></font> <font color=""#0af""><b>ice</b></font>. So you go to the store and see if they have any. Nope, no ice. So, now you go to the <font color=""#f0a""><b>next</b></font> store. Is there ice here? Nope. Next!</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Feel a little frustrated you can't find ice. Have the words '<font color=""#f0a""><b>next</b></font> next next' echoing through your head as you go from store to store, irritated.</i></span><p> "
