"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>夜<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>night</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Drop, Lid, Winter, Leader</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">A <font color=""#0af""><b>leader</b></font> is wearing a <font color=""#0af""><b>lid</b></font> and is standing outside in <font color=""#0af""><b>winter</b></font>. Plus it's raining and he's covered in <font color=""#0af""><b>drop</b></font>s of water. On top of all this, it's <font color=""#f0a""><b>night</b></font>.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: If it helps, you can come up with a reason why he's outside in the winter at night. Also, why is he wearing a lid on his head? Probably because he's protecting his people from something that comes at night.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>姉<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>older sister</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Lid, Woman, Two Face</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">There's a <font color=""#0af""><b>woman</b></font> standing with <font color=""#0af""><b>two face</b></font> who has a <font color=""#0af""><b>lid</b></font> on his head. You look carefully at the woman. Who would be with Two Face not to mention crazy version of him (with a lid on his head!)? To your surprise, this woman is your <font color=""#f0a""><b>older sister</b></font>!</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: You're very protective of your older sister so be sure to feel the shock and disgust that she's with crazy Two Face. You go up to him and yell at him about trying to be with your older sister.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>点<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>point, decimal</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Fortune, Fish Tail</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The fortune teller is telling your <font color=""#0af""><b>fortune</b></font> and takes a look at a <font color=""#0af""><b>fish tail</b></font> for a moment, then writes down a number based off that. It's the number 100. 'This is how many more years you'll live, so the fish tail says.' You look. That's not too bad. 'Wait,' she says. 'I made a mistake.' She grabs her pen and adds a <font color=""#f0a""><b>point</b></font> to the number. The point is a <font color=""#f0a""><b>decimal</b></font> right after the 1. 'Sorry, bad math. One more year to live.'</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: You can't believe it. Just one decimal point takes your life from 100 extra years to only 1 more year. Of course, you'll feel really frustrated at the fortune teller for forgetting her decimals. You were so happy one minute, and now you're really upset. All because of one measly decimal...</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>安<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>relax, cheap</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Woman, Helmet</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You walk up to a <font color=""#0af""><b>woman</b></font> with a <font color=""#0af""><b>helmet</b></font> on her head. 'Why are you wearing a helmet on your head?' you ask. 'Because it helps me to stay <font color=""#f0a""><b>relax</b></font>ed,' she replies. 'Oh, and it was super <font color=""#f0a""><b>cheap</b></font>, too.' You can see the price tag. It was only $1. That is cheap.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: You can imagine her super relaxed right now. But, if you take off the helmet she flips out and starts attacking you, screaming. Put the helmet back on, and she falls over limp, super-duper relaxed.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>室<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>room</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Grave, Pile, Helmet, Ground</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You find a <b><font color=""#0af"">pile</font></b> of <b><font color=""#0af"">helmet</font></b>s on the <b><font color=""#0af"">ground</font></b>. You move them aside to reveal a <b><font color=""#0af"">grave</font></b>. When you open up the grave and go inside, you find yourself in your <b><font color=""#f0a"">room</font></b>.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: It's your <b><font color=""#f0a"">room</font></b>, exactly. Imagine yourself in your room, but it's underground hidden beneath a grave that was below a pile of helmets. Obviously, you should feel unnerved.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>科<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>science</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Chopsticks, Pine</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Using some <font color=""#0af""><b>chopsticks</b></font>, you carefully pick away at a <font color=""#0af""><b>pine</b></font> tree, taking some important specimens for it. Why are you doing this? For <font color=""#f0a""><b>science</b></font>, obviously.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Take the specimens back to your lab and study them. What are they? Make them something very strange, and focus on the fact that you have a laboratory, a lab coat, and all sorts of science-related things to make you remember the word 'science.'</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>海<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>sea</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Window, Tsunami, Gun</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You can see the <font color=""#0af""><b>tsunami</b></font> coming from your <font color=""#0af""><b>window</b></font>, so you point your <font color=""#0af""><b>gun</b></font> at it. 'You better turn away, <font color=""#f0a""><b>sea</b></font>, or I'll shoot!' The sea decides it doesn't want to die today, so it turns its tsunami around and goes the other way.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: You'll have to think of the 'sea' as its own entity, controlling the tsunami, otherwise you might confuse and combine the two. So, when you point your gun out the window, aim it at the 'sea,' not the 'tsunami,' if that makes any sense.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>羊<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>sheep</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Sheep</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The <font color=""#0af""><b>sheep</b></font> radical and <font color=""#f0a""><b>sheep</b></font> are the same in looks as well as and meaning.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: You are no sheep - you study your radicals, unlike most Japanese learners. You'll learn sooo much faster!</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>店<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>shop</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Mullet, Fortune</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You go get your <font color=""#0af""><b>fortune</b></font> told by a dude with a <font color=""#0af""><b>mullet</b></font>. He says that you will go to a <font color=""#f0a""><b>shop</b></font> full of mullets, and buy him a new mullet.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: You're suspicious at first, but then you look up. You're right in front of a mullet <font color=""#f0a""><b>shop</b></font>. You feel the allure of mullets, and so you go in ready to buy.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>南<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>south</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Cross, Head, Sheep</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Where are you, right this very moment? Once you've got that, imagine people with <font color=""#0af""><b>sheep</b></font> <font color=""#0af""><b>head</b></font>s carrying <font color=""#0af""><b>cross</b></font>es living to the <font color=""#f0a""><b>south</b></font> of you.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: So, where is that place? Is it France? Is it Brazil? Is it some city, maybe? Wherever it is, imagine the people of that place to have sheep heads with crosses. Imagine yourself driving down there and seeing all of them, walking around like it's normal. What's up with these southern people?</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>星<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>star</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Sun, Life</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The <font color=""#0af""><b>sun</b></font> that gives <font color=""#0af""><b>life</b></font> is our very own <font color=""#f0a""><b>star</b></font> (which we happen to call the sun). Of course, all the other stars are probably giving life to other planets as well.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine all sorts of stars all around the universe giving life to planets as suns. These are all the stars you see in the sky, and there are billions of them. I hope you feel overwhelmed by how minuscule we really are when you look up at all of them.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>州<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>state</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Drop, River</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Think about Japan. Japan is a country made up of islands. Those islands are kind of like <font color=""#f0a""><b>state</b></font>s in a way. These three <font color=""#0af""><b>drop</b></font>s in the huge <font color=""#0af""><b>river</b></font> that makes up the Pacific Ocean are just Japanese states in the water.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Also, another way to think of this is that the river radical is actually just three rivers, separating drops, which are capitals of various states. Rivers are usually great ways to divide up a country, and states are one way to do it!</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>茶<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>tea</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Angel, Flowers, Hat</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You come across an <font color=""#0af""><b>angel</b></font> wearing a <font color=""#0af""><b>hat</b></font> that's covered in <font color=""#0af""><b>flowers</b></font>. So, you do the only natural thing. You take this angel, chop him up into tiny pieces, and dry him out. Then, you make <font color=""#f0a""><b>tea</b></font> out of all the dried up angel bits. You wear the hat, though.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: How does this angel-flower tea taste? Be sure to imagine it. Probably heavenly *rimshot.*</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>思<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>think</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Rice Paddy, Heart</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">In the <font color=""#0af""><b>rice paddy</b></font>, you come across a beating <font color=""#0af""><b>heart</b></font>. Of course, you do the most logical thing you can think of and pick it up and start eating it. After you're done eating it, you realize what you've done. It's Einstein's heart, and by eating it, it gives you the power to <font color=""#f0a""><b>think</b></font> like him.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Now, sit in the middle of the rice paddy and <font color=""#f0a""><b>think</b></font> like the master of thinkers. Think about the universe. Think about space time. Think about the speed of light. What have you figured out? Of course, in this mnemonic, think about thinking. It's where you should arrive and where you should narrow into.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>歩<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>walk</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Slide, Small, Stop</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You <font color=""#0af""><b>stop</b></font> at a <font color=""#0af""><b>small</b></font> <font color=""#0af""><b>slide</b></font>. What were you doing before you stopped here? You were <font color=""#f0a""><b>walk</b></font>ing.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Question is, what made you stop? Imagine yourself walking at a nice casual pace... then imagine something that would make you stop that's incredibly interesting and strange. Maybe an alien is going down the slide? He would say 'keep walking, friend.'</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>向<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>yonder, facing</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Cyclops</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The <b><font color=""#0af"">cyclops</font></b> only has one eye, so it really likes to look off into the distance with it. He's like the tower of Sauron, he thinks, with his one big eye. He's <b><font color=""#f0a"">facing yonder</font></b>, his large eye seeing all.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Maybe the cyclops hears something behind him, so he swings around, and looks <font color=""#f0a""><b>yonder</b></font> again.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>妹<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>younger sister</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Woman, Jet</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">A <font color=""#0af""><b>woman</b></font> who is as speedy as a <font color=""#0af""><b>jet</b></font> is definitely your <font color=""#f0a""><b>younger sister</b></font>. She's got seemingly unlimited energy&nbsp;and all she seems to do is run around. You, the older sister, on the other hand, are slow.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine a little girl (your younger sister) running around with her arms out, pretending to be a jet, too. Prwoooooo!</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>辺<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>area</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Sword, Water Slide</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Think of the coolest <font color=""#0af""><b>water slide</b></font> in the world (so amazing!). Now, think of your disappointment when you hear about the <font color=""#0af""><b>swords</b></font> that have been sliding down the slides and getting stuck, making it uber-dangerous for you to use this slide. In fact, it’s so dangerous, they’ve had to block off the entire <font color=""#f0a""><b>area</b></font>. You can’t even come close, that’s how bad the whole sword-water slide situation is.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: You'll want to imagine swords everywhere... on the slide, around the slide, everywhere. Then, as you walk up to go in (because you love water slides!) a police officer comes up and stops you, saying 'sorry, this <font color=""#f0a""><b>area</b></font> is blocked off.' Feel the disappointment, you really wanted to go in there!</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>付<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>attach</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Leader, Measurement</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You have the measurement of a leader. Imagine yourself measuring said leader (his/her height) and then coming up short. This is not good, you think. Leaders need to be at least six feet tall. So, to make the leader tall enough, you <font color=""#f0a""><b>attach</b></font> another head to the top of his/her head.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Make sure you really feel like the person can’t be a leader because they’re too short when you measure them (I know this isn’t true, but we’re remembering kanji here, anything goes!). As long as you feel disconcerted that the leader isn’t tall enough, you should be able to remember that you need to attach something to the leader to make him/her tall enough. The fact that you’re attaching another head to the top of his/her head is pretty weird too, and should help you to remember the meaning.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>札<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>bill</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Tree</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The <font color=""#0af""><b>tree</b></font> has an <font color=""#0af""><b>umbrella</b></font>, and it's holding it over his head, which is strange, because trees normally like water... turns out, it's not water falling on him, but dollar <font color=""#f0a""><b>bills</b></font> floating down.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: The sick part of this is that those dollar <font color=""#f0a""><b>bills</b></font> were once this tree's friends. The tree is sobbing uncontrollably as pieces of his friends fall on him and all around him - which is why he's using the umbrella to protect himself.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>鳥<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>bird</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Bird</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The radical <font color=""#0af""><b>bird</b></font> and the kanji <font color=""#f0a""><b>bird</b></font> are exactly the same!</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: </i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>黒<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>black</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Black</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The radical <font color=""#0af""><b>black</b></font> and the kanji <font color=""#f0a""><b>black</b></font> are exactly the same.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: </i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>船<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>boat</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Fins, Mouth, Sail</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">If you have something with <font color=""#0af""><b>fins</b></font> and a <font color=""#0af""><b>mouth</b></font>, you can probably assume it's a fish. If you add a <font color=""#0af""><b>sail</b></font> to this fish, you have yourself a nice little <font color=""#f0a""><b>boat</b></font>.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Or a giant boat, perhaps? Imagine yourself riding a giant fish with a sail stuck in it. What an awesome boat you have. It can swallow up smaller ships whole for you, if you like.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>以<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>by means of</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Drop, Person, Lion</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text""><font color=""#0af""><b>Lion</b></font>-<font color=""#0af""><b>person</b></font>-<font color=""#0af""><b>drop</b></font>. Think of the 'drop' as 'dropping something' instead of the usual drop of water. Now, imagine the kind of air drop the army might do. Except this one is a lion on a rope, holding onto a person, and then dropping the person at the right place. So, how did you get to the drop zone? You got there <font color=""#f0a""><b>by means of</b></font> lion-person-drop technology.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: I know, this one is a long one. But, if you see these three radicals together, how can you not think of this strange transportation method? Once you're able to do that, just focus in on needing to remember 'By Means Of' and you should be all set. If it doesn't come to you the first time, I bet it will come to you the second or third time, so don't fret!</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>必<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>certain</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Slide, Heart</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The <font color=""#0af""><b>slide</b></font> coming out of the patient's <font color=""#0af""><b>heart</b></font> is there because a mad scientist is testing to see if it's a good way to drain the body of blood. The patient is alive now... but they are definitely slated for <font color=""#f0a""><b>certain</b></font> death.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: As you imagine the mad scientist drawing blood out of the patient's heart with a small slide, also imagine a little meter hooked up to him as well. On one end is 'SURVIVE!' on the other end is 'CERTAIN DEATH.' Right now the finger is pointing close to <font color=""#f0a""><b>certain</b></font> death, though :(</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>末<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>end</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Jet</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">This kanji uses a modified <font color=""#0af""><b>jet</b></font> radical. The front area wing is wider than the middle area of the wing. This may seem counterintuitive, but by doing this they can fit so much more jet fuel. The jet zooms off and keeps going for a long, long time, until it reaches the <font color=""#f0a""><b>end</b></font> of the earth.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine the end of the earth being like how they imagined it pre-Columbus era. Just a big drop going off into space, giant waterfalls plummeting down. Your crazy jet has made it to the very end! Congratulations!</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>氏<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>family name</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Duck</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The only radical that makes up this kanji is <font color=""#0af""><b>duck</b></font>. Even though it looks the same, the radical has a different name from the kanji (because the meaning of the kanji is such a bad mnemonic word). So what is 'Duck?' You have that piece from the radical. The word 'Duck' is your <font color=""#f0a""><b>family name</b></font>.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Just imagine your last name being 'Duck.' Say your first name plus 'Duck' out loud. Think about your family and parents, and how their last names are 'Duck' as well. Say as many of your family's name plus Duck as you can to help solidify the meaning of this kanji. 'Duck' is a 'Family Name.'</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>失<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>fault</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Slide, Husband</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Your <font color=""#0af""><b>husband</b></font> is going down a <font color=""#0af""><b>slide</b></font>. That's nice. As he's going down, though, he snaps the slide in two, and it collapses on top of your family dog :'( Was it your husband's <font color=""#f0a""><b>fault</b></font> that the dog died?</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Think of this conversation, following the 'accident.' You yell at your husband: 'This is your fault,' you scream. 'My fault!?' he replies. 'The slide obviously wasn't built right!' This goes on and on, and as it goes on, make sure to focus in on the <font color=""#f0a""><b>fault</b></font> part, with both people blaming each other over and over.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>魚<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>fish</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Fish</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The radical <font color=""#0af""><b>fish</b></font> and the kanji <font color=""#f0a""><b>fish</b></font> are exactly the same!</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Nothing fishy about that, right?</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>組<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>group</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Thread, Top Hat</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Sew <b><font color=""#0af"">thread</font></b> through your <b><font color=""#0af"">top hat</font></b> and to the top hats of other people you know and you'll turn into a <b><font color=""#f0a"">group</font></b> of top hat wearing people. You're all connected by the thread now, so everyone will assume you're a group, even if that's all you guys have going for yourselves.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Picture a group of people threaded together by their top hats. Don't you want to be part of a cool group like that? Your own top hat team.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>家<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>house</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Helmet, Pig</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You have a <font color=""#0af""><b>pig</b></font> with a <font color=""#0af""><b>helmet</b></font>. Now why in the world would you need something like this? He exists to protect your <font color=""#f0a""><b>house</b></font>.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine the pig with a helmet on his head protecting your own home. He stands outside the door attacking anyone who comes near (except for you, of course, this is your house after all!). The helmet makes him stronger, which is why he wears it to protect your <font color=""#f0a""><b>house</b></font>. That'll do pig, that'll do.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>欠<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>lack</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Lack</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">This kanji is the same as the radical it comes from. <font color=""#0af""><b>Lack</b></font> becomes <font color=""#f0a""><b>Lack</b></font>!</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: If you know the radical you know this.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>未<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>not yet</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Jet</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You're flying in a Jet. Even though it's one of the fastest things on earth, your child is sitting in the back asking, 'Are we there yet? Are we there yet?' You have to keep responding. '<font color=""#f0a""><b>Not yet</b></font>! Not yet! NOT YET!'</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Feel the irritation of this. How irritating is this kid going to be the whole flight over? The jet is going as fast as it can!</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>紙<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>paper</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Thread, Duck</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">There's this <font color=""#0af""><b>duck</b></font> pooping out <font color=""#0af""><b>thread</b></font>. It's really strange that it would do this, because it's being fed <font color=""#f0a""><b>paper</b></font>.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine a duck being fed paper and instantly pooping out thread. You need thread, so this is good, but it's really strange that paper becomes thread like this when you feed it to a duck, you know?</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>通<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>pass through</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Elephant, Mama, Water Slide</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Your <font color=""#0af""><b>mama</b></font> was going down a <font color=""#0af""><b>water slide</b></font> but she came to an <font color=""#0af""><b>elephant</b></font> blocking her path. But, since the elephant is so big, she went right in the mouth and then out the *cough* other end. She was able to <font color=""#f0a""><b>pass through</b></font> with no problem at all.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine the fear you'd feel for your mama as she's going down the slide at high speeds. Then, imagine the relief and surprise as she just passes right through the elephant, barely slowing down. It's nothing short of a really disgusting miracle.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>民<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>peoples</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Mouth, Duck</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Everyone around you in this village has a <font color=""#0af""><b>duck</b></font> <font color=""#0af""><b>mouth</b></font>. They are all one 'Duck <font color=""#f0a""><b>People</b></font>.'</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine visiting a nation. The first thing you see is how they all have duck mouths. Imagine how strange this would feel. It's a genetic thing, so you know it's a group of people that are like this. Duck People. An entire nation of Duck People.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>理<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>reason</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">King, Sunflower</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The <font color=""#0af""><b>sunflower</b></font> was the <font color=""#f0a""><b>reason</b></font> the <font color=""#0af""><b>king</b></font> was king. He was able to pluck the magic sunflower from the ground to claim his throne!</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine the king pulling on a sunflower with everyone gathered round. They want to see if he'll be able to become king or not. Turns out, he will be able to become king, because he just pulled the sunflower out. Focus in on the reason he's king (because he pulled a sunflower out of the ground) and think about how absurd that reason is.<br>Note that there's another 'reason' kanji in this level. It is 由, and also means reason.</span></i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>由<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>reason</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Cross, Mouth</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">There are ten <font color=""#0af""><b>crosses</b></font> with <font color=""#0af""><b>mouths</b></font>, telling you the <font color=""#f0a""><b>reason</b></font> you are here.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine these crosses with mouths surrounding you in a dark room. You can just see their outlines and the large mouths talking to you. You know why you're here. Have them give you some kind of reason as to why you're here. It's important, whatever it is. Are you on some epic quest? Are you receiving a punishment? Are they judging you? It's up to you, just be sure to focus on the 'reason' part, though. <br>Note that there's another 'reason' kanji in this level. It is 理, and also means reason.</span></i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>校<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>school</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Lid, Tree, Father</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You find your <font color=""#0af""><b>father</b></font> with a <font color=""#0af""><b>lid</b></font> on his head, up in a <font color=""#0af""><b>tree</b></font>. He yells down at you. 'Hey! Welcome to your first day of <font color=""#f0a""><b>school</b></font>!'</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: You are not happy about this, but you have to do what your father says. So, you climb the tree and sit in the school bench to listen to your father talk crazy talk about all sorts of weird things. This is the worst school in the world, you think.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>雪<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>snow</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Rain, Wolverine</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The <font color=""#0af""><b>rain</b></font> is being mixed up and slashed at by a sky <font color=""#0af""><b>wolverine</b></font>. This is causing the rain to get very cold and turn into <font color=""#f0a""><b>snow</b></font>.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine the wolverine running around the clouds frantically, trying to cool the air down with his claws to make this snow. For some reason, it's very important to him - perhaps you could help him out in that imagination of yours?</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>強<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>strong</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Pile, Spring, Insect</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">There's a <font color=""#0af""><b>pile</b></font> of <font color=""#0af""><b>insect</b></font>s on top of a <font color=""#0af""><b>spring</b></font>. Because the pile is so big, you need to be extremely <font color=""#f0a""><b>strong</b></font> to push it down enough to launch the huge pile of insects.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Look at this pile of insects on the giant spring. Try to pull the spring down. You absolutely can't. Now imagine a bodybuilder coming along and pulling it down, launching the insects into the air. He's a bodybuilder, so he's strong enough.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>夏<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>summer</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Eye, Winter, Leaf</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The <font color=""#0af""><b>eye</b></font> <font color=""#0af""><b>leaf</b></font> grows only in the <font color=""#0af""><b>winter</b></font>. Every other leaf, however, will do the opposite, which is to grow in the <font color=""#f0a""><b>summer</b></font>.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Just think of the eye leaf as weird (it is weird, after all). It grows in the winter. Now, think of any normal leaves. They do the exact opposite, which is to grow in the summer.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>高<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>tall, expensive</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Lid, Mouth, Mustache</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Someone who has a <font color=""#0af""><b>lid</b></font> on their head, an extra <font color=""#0af""><b>mouth</b></font> above their <font color=""#0af""><b>mustache</b></font> (which also contains a mouth) has got to be really, really <font color=""#f0a""><b>tall</b></font>.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Also, dental care must be quite <font color=""#f0a""><b>expensive</b></font> as well, because of the two mouths there.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>教<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>teach</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Child, Winter</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">A <b><font color=""#0af"">teacher</font></b> in <b><font color=""#0af"">winter</font></b> is happiest because they get to <b><font color=""#f0a"">teach</font></b>! The kids can't go out and play because it's too cold. They all have to come in and stay warm as the teacher teaches!</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Picture a teacher excitedly teaching, bundled up in the cold. Snow falling outside. Grumpy children being taught, inside.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>時<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>time</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Sun, Grave, Measurement</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The <font color=""#0af""><b>sun</b></font> and <font color=""#0af""><b>graves</b></font>. They are both good ways to make a <font color=""#0af""><b>measurement</b></font> of <font color=""#f0a""><b>time</b></font>. <br>This also can mean <font color=""#f0a""><b>o' clock</b></font>, as in 'five o'clock' It's used when measuring what time it is in Japanese.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Think about the sun going around the earth over and over again. That measures days going by. Think about graves. They have dates on them, and show generations of people. Both of these things have to do with one thing, and that is <font color=""#f0a""><b>time</b></font> and its passing.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>弱<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>weak</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Spring, Ice</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The <font color=""#0af""><b>spring</b></font>s are covered in <font color=""#0af""><b>ice</b></font>. This has made them very <font color=""#f0a""><b>weak</b></font>.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: What else would ice do to springs? I'm pretty sure getting ice in springs is a bad idea for any machine. Those springs need to move, and moving frozen things breaks said frozen things. These springs are so <font color=""#f0a""><b>weak</b></font>.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>週<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>week</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Ghost, Water Slide</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">A <font color=""#0af""><b>ghost</b></font> is going down the <font color=""#0af""><b>water slide</b></font>. The ghost goes down the water slide only one day of the <font color=""#f0a""><b>week</b></font>.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: You have to imagine the ghost thinking... 'Oh, what day of the week is it?' then realizing it's that special day of the week. At this point, he drags himself to the water slide where he has to go down it again. He's been alive forever, so now he's getting a bit tired of this weekly ritual.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>風<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>wind, style</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Slide, Head, Insect</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">There is an <b><font color=""#0af"">insect</font></b> <b><font color=""#0af"">slid</font></b>ing around under your <b><font color=""#0af"">table</font></b> from the <b><font color=""#f0a"">wind</font></b>. You try to grab the insect but it keeps sliding past your hand because the wind is so strong. It’s going to start blowing you around under the table too!</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Picture an insect, on it’s back, being blown around under a table. Feel the wind pushing you as you try to save the poor thing.  This kanji also means <b><font color=""#f0a"">style</font></b> too. You can think of the wind blowing one style in fashion one moment and then another the next. It blows your clothes off and blows new style clothes onto you, over and over again. Imagine this happening. Are you embarrassed when all the clothes are off? Pleased when you get new style clothes on?</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>記<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>write down, record</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Say, Cobra</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You <font color=""#0af""><b>say</b></font> to the <font color=""#0af""><b>cobra</b></font> (because now you're talking to cobras): 'Hey cobra, I want you to <font color=""#f0a""><b>write down</b></font> what I'm about to say. The cobra pulls out a pen and paper to get ready to write down and <font color=""#f0a""><b>record</b></font> your important message.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine what it is you say to the cobra. Make sure to remind the cobra to write down what you're saying (because sometimes cobras can be slackers). 'Hey, you writing that down cobra? I want you to record my words accurately, now.'</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>黄<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>yellow</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Yellow</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The radical <font color=""#0af""><b>yellow</b></font> and the kanji <font color=""#f0a""><b>yellow</b></font> are exactly the same!</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: </i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>答<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>answer</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Bamboo, Suit</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">""Does the <b><font color=""#0af"">bamboo</font></b> shirt <font color=""#0af""><b>suit</b></font> me?"" you ask... but nobody will <font color=""#f0a""><b>answer</b></font>.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Shout 'PLEASE ANSWER ME!' a few times to get the idea of 'answer' in your head. What you really want is an answer, whether it's bad or good, but nobody's willing to say anything because you look so terrible.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>反<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>anti</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Stool, Cliff</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The <font color=""#0af""><b>stool</b></font> is in the <font color=""#0af""><b>cliff</b></font>. If someone has a stool deep inside a cliff, they are most likely pretty <font color=""#f0a""><b>anti</b></font> society, hiding away like that.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine someone who looks super antisocial (and a little feral). Ask them why they're sitting on this stool inside a cliff... they reply because they hate people. They are anti people!</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>君<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>buddy</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Mouth, Slide, Wolverine</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">A <font color=""#0af""><b>wolverine</b></font> is going down a <font color=""#0af""><b>slide</b></font> into your <font color=""#0af""><b>mouth</b></font>. Why is he going into your mouth, though? You're opening it really wide, because you're screaming '<font color=""#f0a""><b>BUDDY</b></font>!!! You're so excited to see your wolverine buddy-pal again. You thought he was dead.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Make sure you feel super happy. Even yell 'Buddy' out loud while imagining this wolverine coming at you, if you're not in a quiet-zone.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>局<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>bureau</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Mouth, Flag, Cloak</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">There’s your nation's <font color=""#0af""><b>flag</b></font> on top of the <font color=""#0af""><b>cloak</b></font>ed <font color=""#0af""><b>mouth</b></font>. Why would there be a flag on this cloaked mouth? Because it's the symbol for the '<font color=""#f0a""><b>Bureau</b></font> of Secret Things.'</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: The cloaked mouth represents how this bureau never talks about their secrets. The flag represents your country. Think about all the cool secret things the Bureau of Secret Things must have. Aliens, maybe?</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>買<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>buy</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Clam, Sauron</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text""><font color=""#0af""><b>Sauron</b></font> is looking at some <font color=""#0af""><b>clam</b></font>s to <font color=""#f0a""><b>buy</b></font>.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Have him go through various questions. 'How much are these?' 'Can you go lower on your prices? I have a lot of orcs to feed.' 'Are these ones on sale?' etc. Always make it focused on the buying, though.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>雲<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>cloud</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Rain, Boobs</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">What are <font color=""#0af""><b>rain</b></font> <font color=""#0af""><b>boobs</b></font>? They're things that create, produce, and emit rain. I would say those things are the big fluffy things in the sky, also known as <font color=""#f0a""><b>cloud</b></font>s.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Makes sense, if you think about it. Boobs produce milk, clouds produce rain! Kind of a weird comparison, admittedly, but it'll probably help you to remember this kanji pretty well!</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>楽<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>comfort, ease, pleasure</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Tree, White, Ice</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The <font color=""#0af""><b>white</b></font> <font color=""#0af""><b>ice</b></font> <font color=""#0af""><b>tree</b></font> is a magical tree. When you eat its ice flowers it gives you incredible amounts of <font color=""#f0a""><b>comfort</b></font>, <font color=""#f0a""><b>ease</b></font>, and <font color=""#f0a""><b>pleasure</b></font>.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine yourself picking the white ice flowers off the tree. Then, put it in your mouth. Make it taste comforting... It puts you at ease. Then, swallow it. Feel your head go nuts with comfort. This is the greatest drug in the world when it comes to comfort. So much pleasure!</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>数<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>count</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Woman, Winter, Rice</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">In the <font color=""#0af""><b>winter</b></font>, the <font color=""#0af""><b>woman</b></font> has to go through all the <font color=""#0af""><b>rice</b></font> and <font color=""#f0a""><b>count</b></font> each individual grain. When you've counted all of them, you'll have an <font color=""#f0a""><b>amount</b></font> / <font color=""#f0a""><b>number</b></font> so that you can split them up accordingly.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: She has to count each grain out in order to divvy up the supply to last through the winter. Imagine yourself getting just a few grains today for food. It's not a good time for you guys :(</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>決<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>decide</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Person, Hook, Tsunami</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You have at your disposal a <font color=""#0af""><b>tsunami</b></font> and a <font color=""#0af""><b>hook</b></font> to assassinate this <font color=""#0af""><b>person</b></font>. Which weapon will you choose. <font color=""#f0a""><b>Decide</b></font> now!</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Have trouble with the decision. Which one? Tsunami will be big and cool, but a hook will be more discreet. How can you decide? Can you think of a neat way to decide this, like Two-Face on Batman?</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>絵<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>drawing</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Thread, Meet</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Using just <font color=""#0af""><b>thread</b></font> <font color=""#0af""><b>meeting</b></font> the paper (with a little ink on the end) you create a masterpiece of a <font color=""#f0a""><b>drawing</b></font> (or a <font color=""#f0a""><b>painting</b></font>).</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: It's unbelievable the kind of drawing you're able to draw with just the tip of a thread. So much detail. So artistic. If it helps, imagine that you drew the Mona Lisa, better than the original, only using this floppy thread tool.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>住<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>dwelling</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Leader, Master</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The <font color=""#0af""><b>leader</b></font>, of course, is a <font color=""#0af""><b>master</b></font> at something. He's the best of the best, but because he's so good, nobody can find him. Everyone wants to know where he lives. Because of that, you're searching for his <font color=""#f0a""><b>dwelling</b></font>.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Think about what this leader is a master in. Come up with something crazy but also something that interests you. Also make yourself believe that you want to know where his dwelling is (aka where he lives) more than anything else in the world. Where is his dwelling?</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>電<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>electricity</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Rice Paddy, Rain</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You're standing in the middle of a <font color=""#0af""><b>rice paddy</b></font> in the <font color=""#0af""><b>rain</b></font> with an <font color=""#0af""><b>umbrella</b></font>. You're standing here because there's nothing else that's very tall around you. You want to get hit by <font color=""#f0a""><b>electricity</b></font> (aka lightning) to show that it exists.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Get hit by the electricity. How does it feel?</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>森<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>forest</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Tree</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">This kanji is just the <font color=""#0af""><b>tree</b></font> radical three times. Just based off this, you should be able to figure it out. This kanji means '<font color=""#f0a""><b>forest</b></font>.'</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Makes sense, because a bunch of individual trees is what makes up a forest!</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>助<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>help</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Power, Top Hat</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">If you wear a <b><font color=""#0af"">top hat</font></b> with <b><font color=""#0af"">power</font></b> it will give YOU the power to <b><font color=""#f0a"">help</font></b> people. You put it on your head and the power it has surges through you, making you a bit of a super hero. And all super heroes help people!</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine a top hat giving you the power to help your family, your next door neighbor, the world!</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>馬<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>horse</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Horse</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The <font color=""#0af""><b>horse</b></font> radical and the <font color=""#f0a""><b>horse</b></font> kanji are exactly the same! Huzzah!</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: </i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>間<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>interval</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Sun, Gate</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Think of a <font color=""#0af""><b>gate</b></font> that the <font color=""#0af""><b>sun</b></font> has to go through every time it revolves around in the sky (I know, the sun doesn't move, but let's pretend it's ancient China, okay?). Someone at the gate checks the time, and makes sure the <font color=""#f0a""><b>interval</b></font> is correct, then waves it through the gate for another circling, where it creates its next interval of time.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Interval is a weird word to remember, but just think of the sun going around the earth and through the gate just like clockwork. Every 24 hours it passes through the gate, and each interval is exactly the same.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>場<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>location</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Grave, Gravity</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">There is a great <font color=""#0af""><b>gravity</b></font> at this <font color=""#0af""><b>grave</b></font>. It pulls us in towards it... It obviously wants us to go to a specific <font color=""#f0a""><b>location</b></font> (aka the location where it is).</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: This is a really, really general kanji meaning which makes it harder to remember via a mnemonic. Spend a few extra seconds trying to sort this one out in your head before moving on.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>医<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>medicine</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Arrow, Cage</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You're in a <font color=""#0af""><b>cage</b></font> and you've been shot by an <font color=""#0af""><b>arrow</b></font>. Obviously things are looking pretty bad. You need some <font color=""#f0a""><b>medicine</b></font> if you hope to live.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: More specifically, antibiotics. Your wound is festering pretty badly.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>朝<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>morning</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Cross, Sun, Moon</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">There's a <font color=""#0af""><b>cross</b></font> on both sides of the <font color=""#0af""><b>sun</b></font>, with the <font color=""#0af""><b>moon</b></font> off to one side. That's because the religious folk are all about the <font color=""#f0a""><b>morning</b></font> (all those early church sessions!), and everyone else is all about the night (the moon).</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Just think about religious people waking up super early to do their rituals. That's why the crosses are on the sun. That's why they're associated with the morning.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>番<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>number in a series</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Rice Paddy, Sickle</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You have to <font color=""#0af""><b>sickle</b></font> the <font color=""#0af""><b>rice paddy</b></font> today because it's your <font color=""#f0a""><b>turn</b></font>. This kanji also means <font color=""#f0a""><b>number in a series</b></font>, which is a lot like a turn. For example, you're number 3, so your turn will be number 3.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Go through in your mind the system your farm / village uses for deciding who has to sickle on any given day. It rotates, and it's a turn-based system. So, do you all stand in a line? Is there a calendar? Come up with something interesting, focusing on your turn in the process you come up with. <br> It will be helpful to remember both the 'number in a series' and 'turn' meanings for the vocab coming up in the future.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>所<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>place</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Door, Axe</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You're taking an <font color=""#0af""><b>axe</b></font> to a <font color=""#0af""><b>door</b></font>. You're absolutely crazy. 'I HATE THIS <font color=""#f0a""><b>PLACE</b></font>!!' you keep yelling as you smash in the door.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Why do you hate this place, in particular? Come up with a great reason why to help you to remember this very broad kanji meaning.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>究<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>research</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Nine, Hole</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You've already dug <font color=""#0af""><b>nine</b></font> <font color=""#0af""><b>hole</b></font>s. You're doing this for your <font color=""#f0a""><b>research</b></font> which requires you to unbury bodies and take them back to your laboratory.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: What kind of <font color=""#f0a""><b>research</b></font> is this? Come up with something disgusting or ridiculous to help you to remember the meaning of this kanji.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>道<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>road</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Neck, Water Slide</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">At the <font color=""#0af""><b>neck</b></font> end of the <font color=""#0af""><b>water slide</b></font>, it becomes a full on <font color=""#f0a""><b>road</b></font>.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine yourself going down a water slide, getting to the neck of it (that's the end). It shoots you out onto pavement where you keep on sliding, except now you're surrounded by terrifying trucks and vehicles. You slide around, avoiding getting hit. It's so strange that you're even on a road in the first place, actually.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>役<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>service</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Loiter, Ikea</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You're <font color=""#0af""><b>loitering</b></font> around in <font color=""#0af""><b>Ikea</b></font>, just waiting for someone to help you. What's up with this terrible <font color=""#f0a""><b>service</b></font>? It's their <font color=""#f0a""><b>duty</b></font> to serve and they're failing terribly.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: While you're at it, imagine yourself writing a review about this Ikea on Yelp (or some other review site). Make the focus of this imaginary review be about the terrible service. Go ahead and make up your own story about how bad the service was, too.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>研<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>sharpen</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Stone, Lantern</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You've found yourself a <font color=""#0af""><b>stone</b></font> <font color=""#0af""><b>lantern</b></font>. You need a quick way to <font color=""#f0a""><b>sharpen</b></font> your blade so you use it, then catch your sword on fire. Time to go fight again!</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Try to feel the rush of the situation. People are chasing you to cut you down, but your blade is too dull. So, you sharpen it quickly on something normal, like a stone lantern, then rush back into the fight.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>身<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>somebody</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Slide, Self</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The self radical is a bit modified, with things sticking out, but that’s because it’s falling down a slide.<br>Sure, it’s your<font color=""#0af""><b>self</b></font> who’s tumbling down the <font color=""#0af""><b>slide</b></font>… at least that’s how it feels to you. Who are you? What are you? All you know is you’re <font color=""#f0a""><b>somebody</b></font>, but you don’t know who that somebody is.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Apparently, you’re having some kind of internal crisis. Come up with a rough one and you’ll remember this kanji better.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>者<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>someone</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Sun, Coffin</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">A <font color=""#0af""><b>coffin</b></font> has been left out in the <font color=""#0af""><b>sun</b></font> for too long. When dead bodies are out in the sun like this, they really begin to decompose. You are wondering who this person is, though. You can't tell because it's fallen apart too much. You look on the coffin. There's a label, but it only says '<font color=""#f0a""><b>someone</b></font>.'</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Smell the stench of the decomposing body. Also, feel really curious as to who this person is. It came from somewhere that gives you a reason to believe it's someone you know. Then, feel the disappointment as you read the label that says 'someone' instead of an actual name. 'Someone,' you repeat. 'Someone.'</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>合<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>suit</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Suit</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The radical <font color=""#0af""><b>suit</b></font> and the kanji <font color=""#f0a""><b>suit</b></font> are exactly the same! This kanji can also mean <font color=""#f0a""><b>join</b></font> which makes sense. When something suits you well, like a hat or something, it joins together with you quite well too. Join me, my hat! You suit my head well.&nbsp;It just <b><font color=""#f0a"">fit</font></b>s, you know?</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Just remember that this 'suit' means 'to suit you' - not the thing you wear, okay!</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>支<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>support</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Frog</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The hard part about learning this kanji is that the radical looks the same but doesn't have the same meaning. So, let's make a story. The <font color=""#0af""><b>frog</b></font> was all alone (just like in this kanji). Nobody else was there to help him. He had to <font color=""#f0a""><b>support</b></font> the weight of the building to make sure it didn't fall on the elementary school.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: When you think 'frog' you have to automatically think about this story. Embellish and add to it if you want. Make it more ridiculous. Make it more vivid. Whatever you need to do to remember that Frog = <font color=""#f0a""><b>support</b></font>.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>話<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>talk</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Say, Tongue</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">When you <font color=""#0af""><b>say</b></font> something with your <font color=""#0af""><b>tongue</b></font>  you're obviously <font color=""#f0a""><b>talk</b></font>ing.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: The logic of this one is almost too good, so don't let that fool you!</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>投<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>throw</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Ikea, Nailbat</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You're hitting <font color=""#0af""><b>Ikea</b></font> furniture with your <font color=""#0af""><b>nailbat</b></font>, busting it apart. But, this isn't fun enough, so you ask your friend to start <font color=""#f0a""><b>throw</b></font>ing it at you so you can hit it in the air.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Feel the heaviness of the things you're hitting. It probably hurts your hands and arms just because of the mass of the items being thrown at you. Also wonder how your friend got so strong. He's able to throw this furniture as if it were nothing!</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>対<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>versus</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Doll, Measurement</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You have this <font color=""#0af""><b>doll</b></font> and you need to get a <font color=""#0af""><b>measurement</b></font> of it. But, you have to get a measurement faster than your opponent. It's you <font color=""#f0a""><b>versus</b></font> that crazy lady over there.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine something like an advertisement for a cage match showing. The part that stands out big time is the word 'Vs.' in the center, between your faces. Also note how ridiculous this battle is. You're measuring dolls...</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>受<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>accept, receive</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Stool, Forehead, Cleat</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You’re sitting on a <font color=""#0af""><b>stool</b></font> and someone <font color=""#0af""><b>cleat</b></font>s you in the <font color=""#0af""><b>forehead</b></font> as part of an <font color=""#f0a""><b>accept</b></font>ance ritual. It’s for the most prestigious Spanish soccer club in the world. You got knocked off the stool, and the cleats really hurt your forehead, but you’re just glad to have been accepted. <br>This kanji also means <font color=""#f0a""><b>receive</b></font>, which is quite similar in idea to <font color=""#f0a""><b>accept</b></font>. Shouldn't be too hard to remember because of the similarities.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: You’re dealing with a lot of mixed emotions right now. You feel the pain from being cleated in the forehead and knocked clean off your stool, but you’re also glad to have finally been accepted into the soccer club. Suppress your pain. Accept this honor like a man.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>事<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>action, matter, thing</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Cross, Mouth, Brush</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You're <font color=""#0af""><b>brush</b></font>ing your <font color=""#0af""><b>mouth</b></font> with a <font color=""#0af""><b>cross</b></font> shaped thing. You're doing the <font color=""#f0a""><b>action</b></font> of this brushing over and over hoping to summon Jesus, who will help to solve the <font color=""#f0a""><b>matter</b></font> of your cavities.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine having this strange thing poking you in your gums, tongue, and cheeks. It’s not pleasant. That thing is spiky! What is this thing? How will this action summon Jesus to perform a miracle on your teeth?</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>美<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>beauty</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Big, King, Horns</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">A beast <font color=""#0af""><b>king</b></font> with <font color=""#0af""><b>big</b></font> <font color=""#0af""><b>horns</b></font> marries a true <font color=""#f0a""><b>beauty</b></font>. The big horned king may look like a beast, but the beauty loves him for what’s inside. That is where true beauty lies.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: I’m sure you know of The Beauty and the Beast. Remember that movie? Think of the king and his big horns. And remember the beauty that loved him.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>予<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>beforehand</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Nail, Mama</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">This kanji uses the radicals <font color=""#0af""><b>mama</b></font> (which you for sure know) and <font color=""#0af""><b>nail</b></font> (though this nail radical is modified). Instead of being a regular nail, it's a nail made up of two barbs (that's twice as dangerous!).<br>Your mama has this double-dangerous nail. She made sure to remove it from your play area <font color=""#f0a""><b>beforehand</b></font>, to prevent you from sticking it in your dirty little mouth.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Basically, what you have to remember here is that mom was taking away nails in advance of something. You know, beforehand.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>始<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>begin, start</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Woman, Machine</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">If you give a <b><font color=""#0af"">woman</font></b> a <b><font color=""#0af"">machine</font></b> she'll <b><font color=""#f0a"">begin</font></b> learning how to use it right away. She'll also get it to <b><font color=""#f0a"">start</font></b> before you or I could. Women are really good at starting up new machines!</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Picture a woman seeing a new machine and beginning work on it right away to see how she can start it up. It's so exciting!</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>服<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>clothes</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Moon, Stool, Stamp</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The <font color=""#0af""><b>Moon</b></font> <font color=""#0af""><b>Stamp</b></font> is laying on your <font color=""#0af""><b>stool</b></font>. The giant moon reminds you of something... it reminds you that you have to take off all your <font color=""#f0a""><b>clothes</b></font> to moon the world, so you do it.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Fake an epiphany in your imagination about this moon stamp sitting there. Compare the moon stamp to your butt, then realize in order to do this you have to take off your clothes.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>度<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>degrees, occurence</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Stool, Hick</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You see a <b><font color=""#0af"">hick</font></b> sitting on a <b><font color=""#0af"">stool</font></b> and go over to say hi. They don't respond. They're just propped up on the stool. You touch their forehead and realize they're like 105 <b><font color=""#f0a"">degrees</font></b> Fahrenheit! That'll kill a hick!  This is a very strange <b><font color=""#f0a"">occurrence</font></b>, you think. Which is convenient since that's the second meaning for this kanji!</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Sitting on a stool is not what you should be doing when you have a fever of over 100 degrees! Even a hick should know that!</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>発<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>departure</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Tent, Lantern</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Once you remove the <font color=""#0af""><b>lantern</b></font> from the <font color=""#0af""><b>tent</b></font>, we will be ready for <font color=""#f0a""><b>departure</b></font>. We can’t leave the lantern inside of the tent, that’s a fire hazard. We’d best take it with us before the departure. Don’t you agree?</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Feel the heat from the lantern. It’s not quite as comforting as being inside a tent, but it’s better than nothing. The lantern will light your way on your departure.</i></span><p> "
