"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>定<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>determine</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Helmet, Coat Rack</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">If you see a <b><font color=""#0af"">helmet</font></b> on a <b><font color=""#0af"">coat rack</font></b> you have to <b><font color=""#f0a"">determine</font></b> who put it there. No one in your house looks like a soldier. So whose is it. You will determine whose it is by following the clues, of course!</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine staring at a helmet on your coat rack and trying to determine how it got there and whose it is.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>談<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>discuss</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Fire, Say</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">If you <font color=""#0af""><b>say</b></font> there’s a <font color=""#0af""><b>fire</b></font>, but there really isn’t one, you’re going to have to <font color=""#f0a""><b>discuss</b></font> why you did such a thing once the fire department gets there. The chief fireman is not going to be happy with you.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Why would you say there was a fire when there really wasn’t one? How shameful. You should feel ashamed about this. Feel bad for what you have done.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>表<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>express</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Life, Kick</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">A swift <font color=""#0af""><b>kick</b></font> in the pants will damage your <font color=""#0af""><b>life</b></font> and cause you to <font color=""#f0a""><b>express</b></font> much agony. Being kicked down there hurts, and one of the worst things in life. You can hardly express the pain you feel.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: It hurts to get kicked in the pants. Use that pain to remember this kanji. Really remember a time this happened to you. Imagine how you would express that terrible feeling to someone else.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>客<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>guest</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Mouth, Winter, Helmet</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Holding a <font color=""#0af""><b>winter</b></font> <font color=""#0af""><b>helmet</b></font> in your <font color=""#0af""><b>mouth</b></font> signifies that you are a <font color=""#f0a""><b>guest</b></font> in my house. Yes, it’s a silly custom, but it is the way of my people. All guests must hold a winter helmet in their mouths. You are a guest. You must do it.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Taste the leather strap of the winter helmet in your mouth. It tastes like… old cows. It would be a lot more useful if it were on your head, but no, it is in your mouth. Silly guest ritual.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>重<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>heavy</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Heavy</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The <font color=""#0af""><b>heavy</b></font> radical and the <font color=""#f0a""><b>heavy</b></font> kanji are exactly the same! Thast's some heavy stuff.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: </i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>持<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>hold</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Grave, Measurement, Nailbat</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">If you use a <font color=""#0af""><b>nailbat</b></font> to try and <font color=""#0af""><b>measure</b></font> a <font color=""#0af""><b>grave</b></font>, you’re going to want to <font color=""#f0a""><b>hold</b></font> the end without nails sticking out of it. I’m not going to ask why you’re trying to measure a grave with a nailbat, so the least you can do is not hold it on the murder end.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine how painful it would be to grab and hold the business end of a nailbat. Nails are sharp and you don’t want them going into your fleshy palms. That’d be painful. And then you’d need a tetanus shot. Those aren’t fun either.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>負<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>lose</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Enclosure, Clam</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You are trapped in the <font color=""#0af""><b>enclosure</b></font> of a <font color=""#0af""><b>clam</b></font>. Because of this, you can't move, and you will surely <font color=""#f0a""><b>lose</b></font> the race you're in.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine feeling upset about being stuck in the clam. Imagine being upset you won't win the race. You will lose. For sure.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>相<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>mutual</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Tree, Eye</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Looking a <font color=""#0af""><b>tree</b></font> in the <font color=""#0af""><b>eye</b></font>, you gain its <font color=""#f0a""><b>mutual</b></font> respect. You have always thought trees were pretty grand with their big branches and knowing eyes. But now the tree also respects you. The feeling’s mutual.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine you are a tree. You have gained the mutual respect of all of nature. You are knowing and wise. Your eyes have seen many things. Feel the knowledge and wisdom rustling through your leaves.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>要<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>need</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Woman, Helicopter</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">A <b><font color=""#0af"">woman</font></b> who pilots a <b><font color=""#0af"">helicopter</font></b> will have the insatiable <b><font color=""#f0a"">need</font></b> for something. She doesn't know what it is. But she needs it. And that's why she's flying around looking for it!</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Picture the woman in the helicopter needing something. She's looking around. Searching. But she doesn't know what it is!</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>新<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>new</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Tree, Stand, Axe</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">There's a <font color=""#0af""><b>stand</b></font>ing <font color=""#0af""><b>tree</b></font> that you're taking an <font color=""#0af""><b>axe</b></font> to. You're going to cut down this tree to create a <font color=""#f0a""><b>new</b></font> chair.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: As you imagine yourself cutting down the standing tree, think about why you need a new chair. Come up with a weird (irritating) reason on why you need a new one so that you can use your emotions a bit to help yourself remember the meaning of this kanji.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>部<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>part</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Butcher, Clown</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Someone has <font color=""#0af""><b>butcher</b></font>ed the <font color=""#0af""><b>clown</b></font>. It is horrific. The clown is in several <font color=""#f0a""><b>part</b></font>s, strewn across the table.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Of course, feel terrified by this. Clown blood everywhere. Kind of funny, but not. Stop that.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>和<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>peace, japanese style</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Mouth, Pine</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You’ve chomped down a <font color=""#0af""><b>pine</b></font> tree with nothing but your <font color=""#0af""><b>mouth</b></font> to bring <font color=""#f0a""><b>peace</b></font> to the Japanese nation. Why does felling a pine with nothing but your mouth bring peace? It is <font color=""#f0a""><b>Japanese style</b></font>.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Taste the pine sap in your mouth, the splinters in your teeth. It was all worth it, for peace was made! Well done.  Imagine the Japanese people chewing down pines as well, in celebration.<br>This kanji means <font color=""#f0a""><b>Japanese style</b></font>, too. The explanation is pretty long, however. <a href=""http://www.tofugu.com/2012/01/06/names-of-japan-history/"">Want to read about it</a>&nbsp;then come on back here? Basically, this kanji is used to represent the Japanese, so any 'Japanese something-or-other' uses this kanji. They are the 'Wa' people!</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>県<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>prefecture</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Eye, Lion, Small</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The <font color=""#0af""><b>eye</b></font> of a <font color=""#0af""><b>small</b></font> <font color=""#0af""><b>lion</b></font> gazes upon the <font color=""#f0a""><b>prefecture</b></font> that will one day become his. He’s a small lion prince, but once he grows up, the whole prefecture will be his to command!</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Remember Lion King? Of course you do. This is pretty much the same thing.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>返<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>return</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Devil, Water Slide</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The <font color=""#0af""><b>devil</b></font> has a little <font color=""#0af""><b>water slide</b></font> under his arm. He's taking it back to Target to <font color=""#f0a""><b>return</b></font> it. He says it has too much water in it, and he's not a fan of water.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Think of the absurdity of the situation. He also waits in line, despite being all that is evil. When he gets to the counter, he's very polite about it, but gets mad when they say no returns, just store credit.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>乗<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>ride</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Mouth, Pine</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">If you stick a <font color=""#0af""><b>pine</b></font> in your <font color=""#0af""><b>mouth</b></font>, you can expect a <font color=""#f0a""><b>ride</b></font> to the hospital. Sticking pines in your mouth can be very dangerous. They are a choking hazard. Remember, mouth plus pine equals ride to hospital.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine how painful getting a pine stuck in your throat would be. Those things are pretty abrasive. Best advice is to just keep those pines away from your mouth. Rides to the hospital should always be avoided whenever possible.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>屋<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>roof, shop</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Ground, Flag, Grave, Pile</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Making a <font color=""#0af""><b>pile</b></font> on the <font color=""#0af""><b>ground</b></font> above a <font color=""#0af""><b>grave</b></font>, you stick a <font color=""#0af""><b>flag</b></font> into it, making a <font color=""#f0a""><b>roof</b></font> for your dear friend Babe Ruth. He always liked piles of dirt on the ground with flags stuck in them. Too bad he’s in a grave now, but at least he has a roof of a flag over his head.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: This kanji often signifies a type of <font color=""#f0a""><b>shop</b></font>, too. So, if you run into a 'meat roof' you're probably at a butcher shop, for example. If you're at a 'book roof' you're probably at a 'book shop.' Technically, they all have roofs, so it's kind of like saying a 'building that sells ____.' Just be sure to remember this as it'll help with some of the vocabulary going forward.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>送<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>send</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Heaven, Horns, Water Slide</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">If you have <font color=""#0af""><b>horns</b></font>, you won’t get into <font color=""#0af""><b>heaven</b></font>, but there will be a <font color=""#0af""><b>water slide</b></font> that will <font color=""#f0a""><b>send</b></font> you down into the underworld. No one with horns is allowed into heaven. Too bad. At least you get to ride a waterslide. Waterslides are fun.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Feel the water on the slide rushing around you, the wind in your face blowing your hair across the horns on your head. You feel bad about not getting into heaven, but at least you have this cool waterslide to send you on your way.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>苦<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>suffering</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Old, Flowers</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text""><font color=""#0af""><b>Old</b></font> <font color=""#0af""><b>flowers</b></font>, all they feel is <font color=""#f0a""><b>suffering</b></font> because they are so old.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: You're an old flower. Petals are falling from you, and you're shriveling up. Every nerve in your old flower body is shooting off like crazy. Nobody wants to pick you to end your suffering because you look so bad.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>泳<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>swim</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Drop, Water, Tsunami</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Many <font color=""#0af""><b>drop</b></font>s of <font color=""#0af""><b>water</b></font> gather together to turn into a giant <font color=""#0af""><b>tsunami</b></font>, forcing you to <font color=""#f0a""><b>swim</b></font> for your life! Hard to believe how tiny little drops of water could create such a large tsunami, but you don’t have time to ponder it over. Swim! Swim away!</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Think back to when you were a child, swimming in the sea. Remember how big the waves seemed back then? Probably seemed like a tsunami to you. Remember those family vacations and how you had to swim away from these massive tsunamis.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>仮<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>temporary</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Leader, Devil</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You’re a servant to a <font color=""#0af""><b>devil</b></font> <font color=""#0af""><b>leader</b></font>, but this is only <font color=""#f0a""><b>temporary</b></font>. Soon you will rally the other servants and overtake this devilish leader and claim your rightful place on the throne! Your time is nigh!</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine how frustrating it must be under this devilish leader's rule. Your only consolation is remembering that his reign is only temporary.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>物<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>thing</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Cow, Wing</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">A <font color=""#0af""><b>wing</b></font>ed <font color=""#0af""><b>cow</b></font> is flying in the air – what a strange <font color=""#f0a""><b>thing</b></font>! You’ve heard of flying pigs before, but cows? This is a new and strange thing indeed! Cows with wings! What a silly thing to imagine.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine if cows could fly. Wouldn’t you be jealous of them? I mean, if a cow can fly, you should be able to, right? Just sprout some wings and fly like the cows. It’s not a hard thing to do.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>具<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>tool</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Fins, Ground, Eye</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">An <font color=""#0af""><b>eye</b></font> and <font color=""#0af""><b>fins</b></font> litter the <font color=""#0af""><b>ground</b></font>. What happened? You killed a fish. You must hide the murder <font color=""#f0a""><b>tool</b></font> before someone finds out it was you.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: You feel the panic upon realizing what you've just done. This is murder in the first degree. You used a terrible tool to do it, and now you must hide it.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>実<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>truth</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Helmet, Train</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Gregory the <font color=""#0af""><b>Train</b></font> always wears a <font color=""#0af""><b>helmet</b></font> (<font color=""#f0a""><b>truth</b></font> is, he’s deathly afraid of injuring his head). He once ran into a cow, and from that day on, Gregory the Train has always worn a helmet when on the move. Trust me, it’s the truth.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine how ridiculous a train would look wearing a helmet! What a hilarious sight. Visualize a train with a helmet crashing into something. Truth be told, it’s much safer than crashing into something without a helmet, don’t you agree?</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>使<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>use</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Ground, Leader, History</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">A good <font color=""#0af""><b>leader</b></font> can put the <font color=""#0af""><b>history</b></font> of the <font color=""#0af""><b>ground</b></font> to great <font color=""#f0a""><b>use</b></font>. You are a good leader. You have studied the ground and dirt of the earth your entire life. You know the history of the ground and you know how to use it to lead your people to victory. How? By throwing it in your enemy's faces!</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Smell the ground. Waft the earthy smell of history into your leader-like nostrils. What does it smell like? It smells useful. And also like ground.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>待<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>wait</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Grave, Loiter, Measurement</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text""><font color=""#0af""><b>Loiter</b></font>ing in a <font color=""#0af""><b>grave</b></font>yard at night is a good way to <font color=""#0af""><b>measure</b></font> how long you’re willing to <font color=""#f0a""><b>wait</b></font> in creepy places. Graveyards and graves are creepy enough as is, but loitering around them at night time? Scary.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Picture how creepy it is at graveyards at night. Feel the cold air on your skin and the hair raising on the back of your neck. You’re getting goose bumps. You don’t want to wait here for very long, do you?</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>勝<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>win</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Power, Moon, Horns, Train</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">A <font color=""#0af""><b>train</b></font> with <font color=""#0af""><b>horns</b></font> gathers <font color=""#0af""><b>power</b></font> from the <font color=""#0af""><b>moon</b></font> to <font color=""#f0a""><b>win</b></font> a race with a sports car. The train with horns is a demon of the night, so light from the moon gives it power. The horned train got his win a bit unfairly, but he is a demon after all.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine the sound of the train engine, the horn blowing, the car engine revving. Feel the wind on your face as they speed past you. You’re rooting for the horned train to win. You know he has an unfair advantage, but you want him to win anyway.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>界<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>world</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Rice Paddy, Hut</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">A little <font color=""#0af""><b>hut</b></font> and a <font color=""#0af""><b>rice paddy</b></font> is all you really need in this <font color=""#f0a""><b>world</b></font>. It’s a simple life, but you get shelter from the hut, and food from the rice paddy. You don’t get to travel or see much of the world, but it’s a living.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Have you ever worked on a farm or lived in a hut? Imagine that’s all you know in this world. Picture yourself planting rice in a paddy out in the hot sun with one of those big hats. How would you like to do that for a living?</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>進<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>advance</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Turkey, Water Slide</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Building a <font color=""#0af""><b>water slide</b></font> for a <font color=""#0af""><b>turkey</b></font> will <font color=""#f0a""><b>advance</b></font> its happiness to a whole new level. Turkeys live pretty boring lives. But if you build one a water slide… boom! Instant awesomeness. That is one happy turkey.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Pretend you’re a turkey. What do you do all day? Walk around? Eat? Hope it’s not Thanksgiving yet? It’s not very exciting. Now imagine someone gives you a water slide. Your life has advanced from being super lame to super awesome.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>酒<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>alcohol</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Alcohol, Tsunami</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">A <font color=""#0af""><b>tsunami</b></font> is an <font color=""#0af""><b>alcohol</b></font>ic beverage containing a lot of <font color=""#f0a""><b>alcohol</b></font>. It’s 3 different kinds of rums, pineapple juice, and grenadine. It’ll hit you like a tsunami though. This alcoholic drink has a kick to it.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: It’s made with spiced rum, coconut rum, and dark rum. Imagine yourself on a sandy beach drinking this cocktail. Feel the sun on your face and the wind in your hair as you sip on this fruity and rumy alcoholic beverage known as a tsunami. You could even picture an actual tsunami in the water coming right for you. I wouldn’t recommend it though – actual tsunamis are scary, not drinkable and delicious.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>業<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>business</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Fins, Sheep, Spikes</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">If a <font color=""#0af""><b>sheep</b></font> is having trouble trying to eat a fish with <font color=""#0af""><b>spikes</b></font> on its <font color=""#0af""><b>fins</b></font>, then the sheep probably has no <font color=""#f0a""><b>business</b></font> trying to eat it in the first place. Don’t sheep usually eat like, grass and stuff? What is this sheep doing trying to eat a fish with spikes on its fins? What silly business this is.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine this crazy sheep. Why is it trying to eat this fish? This sheep is blood crazed. Blood crazed for fish meat, especially the meat from fish with spikes on their fins. This crazed sheep means business.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>算<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>calculate</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Eye, Bamboo, Twenty</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">If you get stabbed in the <font color=""#0af""><b>eye</b></font> <font color=""#0af""><b>twenty</b></font> times with <font color=""#0af""><b>bamboo</b></font>, you’re going to have a hard time beginning to <font color=""#f0a""><b>calculate</b></font> where anything is. Taking a bamboo shoot to the eye is no pleasant experience, especially if done twenty times. You’d be blinded for sure. And a newly blinded person is going to have one heck of a time calculating where everything is without the power of sight.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine getting jabbed with a bamboo shoot. Now imagine getting jabbed in the eye with a bamboo shoot. It’s going to hurt. Try and calculate exactly how painful this would be and imagine it happening to you.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>運<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>carry</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Car, Forehead, Water Slide</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">If you smash your <font color=""#0af""><b>forehead</b></font> on a <font color=""#0af""><b>waterslide</b></font>, you’re going to get put in the back of a <font color=""#0af""><b>car</b></font> and have your friends <font color=""#f0a""><b>carry</b></font> you to the nearest hospital. Forehead injuries are no joke, especially those on waterslides. You’re too woozy to walk anywhere on your own which is why you’re getting carried. This kanji also means <font color=""#f0a""><b>luck</b></font> because if you're 'carrying' you're creating your own luck... except in this case, when you get taken to a hospital. Guns won't help with your luck at all here.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: You can get to moving pretty fast on big water slides. Imagine the force you’d hit the side of the slide with should something go terribly wrong. Now imagine hitting it that hard with your forehead. Ouch.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>漢<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>chinese, china</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Tsunami, Chinese</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">If an ancient <font color=""#0af""><b>Chinese</b></font> deity becomes angered, it’s going to send a <font color=""#0af""><b>tsunami</b></font> at <font color=""#f0a""><b>China</b></font>. This Chinese deity is very powerful, and creating something like a tsunami requires nothing more than a flick of its wrist. Poor China, they never saw it coming.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Picture yourself in China, surrounded by Chinese people, when out of nowhere swells a tsunami and its headed right for you. This is terrifying. Feel the fear swell in your stomach as the tsunami swells up in front of your eyes.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>鳴<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>chirp</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Mouth, Bird</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">When a <font color=""#0af""><b>bird</b></font> opens its <font color=""#0af""><b>mouth</b></font>, you’re most likely to hear a <font color=""#f0a""><b>chirp</b></font>. This is how birds communicate. They open their mouths and let out a series of chirps. Chirp chirp chirp!</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine yourself out in the wilderness on a sunny spring day. The weather is perfect and the scenery is beautiful. The only sound you can hear is the chirp of birds throughout the woods around you. It’s very peaceful.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>集<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>collect</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Tree, Turkey</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">If a <font color=""#0af""><b>turkey</b></font> manages to climb up into a <font color=""#0af""><b>tree</b></font>, it’ll be no easy task to <font color=""#f0a""><b>collect</b></font> it. Either this turkey has managed to fly, or it’s taught itself to climb. Either way, this turkey is smarter than the average bird. You’re going to have a tough time collecting it for sure.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Picture a turkey. They’re pretty awkward animals. Now imagine this turkey climbing up a tree. How is it doing that? It’s some freak of nature. How strange.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>配<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>distribute</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Cobra, Alcohol</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text""><font color=""#0af""><b>Alcohol</b></font>, placed upon the <font color=""#0af""><b>cobra</b></font>'s back. It slithers around, taking the alcohol from place to place. Its job is to <font color=""#f0a""><b>distribute</b></font> the alcohol.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Stop and talk to the cobra. He won't talk long, because he has a job to do. He has to distribute all the alcohol on his back.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>飲<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>drink</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Eat, Lack</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">If you <font color=""#0af""><b>lack</b></font> things to <font color=""#0af""><b>eat</b></font> you only have one alternative... to <font color=""#f0a""><b>drink</b></font>!</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Look around at the food you don't have. You need some kind of nourishment, so you pull out something to drink and drink it. Go ahead and do that in your mind.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>終<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>end</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Two, Winter, Thread</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Having to wear <font color=""#0af""><b>two</b></font> sets of <font color=""#0af""><b>winter</b></font> <font color=""#0af""><b>thread</b></font>s is a pretty good indicator that autumn has come to an <font color=""#f0a""><b>end</b></font>. Once it’s cold enough that you have to wear two sets of winter threads, it’s definitely winter.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine being so cold that you have to wear twice the amount of winter clothes as usual. It’s freezing. Brr. Feel your body shiver and your teeth chatter. Now you can’t wait for winter to end and spring to begin.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>顔<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>face</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Hair, Stand, Cliff, Geoduck</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Here you <font color=""#0af""><b>stand</b></font>, a <font color=""#0af""><b>hair</b></font>’s breadth away from the edge of a <font color=""#0af""><b>cliff</b></font>, when out of nowhere a <font color=""#0af""><b>geoduck</b></font> slaps you right in the <font color=""#f0a""><b>face</b></font>. Geoducks are gross, and you back away from the edge of the cliff you were standing but a hair’s breadth away from just before. Your face is all gooey from the geoduck’s slimy residue.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine being slapped in the face with a geoduck. It’s probably one of the worst things that could ever happen to someone. Those things are disgusting. Now you have geoduck goo all over your face. It’s sticky and slimy and gross.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>落<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>fall</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Kiss, Tsunami, Flowers</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">A violent <font color=""#0af""><b>tsunami</b></font> causes <font color=""#0af""><b>flowers</b></font> to be ripped from the branches of trees and they swirl around and <font color=""#0af""><b>kiss</b></font> your face gently as they <font color=""#f0a""><b>fall</b></font>. With the tsunami came a great windy storm that blew many flowers all about. It’s a pretty sight amongst all the destruction.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine being out in this tsunami induced storm. But you see some flowers being blown to the ground and you are mesmerized by the dance they do on the wind before they finally fall to the ground.</i></span><p> "

"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>頭<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>head</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Beans, Geoduck</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">If a <font color=""#0af""><b>geoduck</b></font> eats lots of <font color=""#0af""><b>beans</b></font>, its <font color=""#f0a""><b>head</b></font> will grow larger. "<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>聞<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>hear</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Ear, Gate</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">If you press your <font color=""#0af""><b>ear</b></font> up to a <font color=""#0af""><b>gate</b></font>, you’re likely to <font color=""#f0a""><b>hear</b></font> what’s going on on the other side.
