"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>秋<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>autumn</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Fire, Pine</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The <font color=""#0af""><b>pine</b></font>s are all catching on <font color=""#0af""><b>fire</b></font>! It must be a pretty dry season - it must be <font color=""#f0a""><b>autumn</b></font>.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: The summer makes things dry for autumn, when things really burn. So, don't get it confused with summer - this is autumn because all the non-pine trees have dead leaves, giving the fire plenty of fuel to burn the pines as well.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>信<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>believe, trust</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Leader, Say</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You <font color=""#0af""><b>say</b></font> to your <font color=""#0af""><b>leader</b></font>, “<font color=""#f0a""><b>Believe</b></font> and <font color=""#f0a""><b>trust</b></font> in me, I’m responsible.” The leader doesn’t think you can handle your duties, so this is why you said this to him. You want him to believe and trust you. You can handle this task.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine yourself saying this to your leader. Say it out loud as you imagine saying it to a leader of some sort.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>岩<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>boulder</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Mountain, Stone</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">A <font color=""#0af""><b>mountain</b></font> <font color=""#0af""><b>stone</b></font> is probably going to be a really big stone. We're talking about a <font color=""#f0a""><b>boulder</b></font> here.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: This kanji makes a lot of sense. Just follow the logic.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>仏<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>buddha</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Pile, Leader</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You have a <font color=""#0af""><b>leader</b></font> of a <font color=""#0af""><b>pile</b></font>... or in this case, you have a leader that's shaped like a pile. Do you know those little statues of Buddha that are sitting cross-legged on the ground, meditating? They kind of look like piles of something, neatly stacked up. So, the leader of piles is actually <font color=""#f0a""><b>Buddha</b></font> himself, because he sort of looks like a pile sitting there.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Another way to remember this kanji meaning is by thinking of someone who claims to be the leader of a pile of arbitrary things. You ask him, 'why are you the leader of this?' and he replies something abstract and thoughtful, like 'because I am the leader of nothing, and something' ... whatever the case may be, we know he's <font color=""#f0a""><b>Buddha</b></font> because he can come up with neat sayings like that (but hopefully neater than mine).</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>建<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>build</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Brush, Big Bird</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text""><font color=""#0af""><b>Big Bird</b></font>, with a <font color=""#0af""><b>brush</b></font> in hand, starts pounding in nails to <font color=""#f0a""><b>build</b></font> a new building on Sesame Street.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Picture Big Bird working on this building. It's hard going because he has to build a building with a brush. Go ahead and pick up a brush and help him out!</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>猫<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>cat</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Rice Paddy, Flowers, Animal</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">If you see an <font color=""#0af""><b>animal</b></font> among the <font color=""#0af""><b>flowers</b></font> in a <font color=""#0af""><b>rice paddy</b></font>, chances are it’s a <font color=""#f0a""><b>cat</b></font>. Cats love rice paddy flowers, almost as much as they love catnip.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Picture this cat meowing and purring as it rubs up against all the flowers in the rice paddy field. Aww, it’s so cute!</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>変<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>change, strange</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Winter, Red</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">If the snow in <font color=""#0af""><b>winter</b></font> was <font color=""#0af""><b>red</b></font> instead of white, that’d be a <font color=""#f0a""><b>strange</b></font> <font color=""#f0a""><b>change</b></font> wouldn’t you say? White snow is normal, red would just be strange. Can you imagine what it would be like if the winter snow changed to the color of red?</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: This strange change radical is a modified version of the red radical. Use that to remember it. It’s a strange change from the normal red radical.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>晴<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>clear up</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Sun, Blue</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">When the <font color=""#0af""><b>sun</b></font> comes out from behind the clouds and the sky is <font color=""#0af""><b>blue</b></font>, things have begun to <font color=""#f0a""><b>clear up</b></font>. The sun looks beautiful against the bright blue sky.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Look into the blue sky and imagine the clouds parting, allowing you to see the sun. Gorgeous! The beauty is so great you have to squint.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>築<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>construct</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Tree, Bamboo, Saw</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You <font color=""#0af""><b>saw</b></font> down a <font color=""#0af""><b>bamboo</b></font> <font color=""#0af""><b>tree</b></font> to <font color=""#f0a""><b>construct</b></font> and <font color=""#f0a""><b>build</b></font> a building. Bamboo trees are great for construction, so you saw down a bunch of bamboo trees to build this new building.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine yourself sawing down this bamboo tree. Feel the saw in your hands as you slide through the bamboo, wood chips flying everywhere.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>勇<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>courage</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Mama, Man</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">A <font color=""#0af""><b>man</b></font> who cries for his <font color=""#0af""><b>mama</b></font> lacks <font color=""#f0a""><b>courage</b></font>. A man who needs his mama to be brave is not a man at all.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine yourself crying for your mama. You’re a wuss. Crybaby.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>泣<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>cry</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Stand, Tsunami</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">If you <font color=""#0af""><b>stand</b></font> in front of a <font color=""#0af""><b>tsunami</b></font>, you’re going to <font color=""#f0a""><b>cry</b></font>. That tsunami is going to hit you hard, and rip you right off the ground on which you stand. And then you’ll cry like a little baby.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine getting hit with the full force of a tsunami. It slams into you and crushes every bone in your body. It hurts so much you cry.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>司<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>director</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Cloak, Creeper</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">A&nbsp;<b><font color=""#0af"">creeper</font></b>&nbsp;inside of a&nbsp;<b><font color=""#0af"">cloak</font></b>, who are they? They’re the&nbsp;<b><font color=""#f0a"">director</font></b>&nbsp;of a movie. They try to look all mysterious, but you know it’s just so people go see their movies and think they’re cool. Really they’re just a creep deep down.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Picture the creepiest director you know. Wearing a cloak and cackling as he directs your favorite actors.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>区<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>district</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Treasure, Cage</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The <font color=""#0af""><b>treasure</b></font> is in a <font color=""#0af""><b>cage</b></font>... that can only mean one thing - the treasure is in the zoo <font color=""#f0a""><b>district</b></font> of town.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Hard part about memorizing this radical is that you have to focus in on the <font color=""#f0a""><b>district</b></font> part of the mnemonic, which doesn't stand out as the other elements. Try to think of all the different districts a treasure in a cage could be located in... Think through all of them in your head, and narrow in on one particular district. Then, say the district name out loud, because that's where you have to go.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>英<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>england</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Central, Flowers</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">There are many <font color=""#0af""><b>flowers</b></font> in <font color=""#0af""><b>central</b></font> <font color=""#f0a""><b>England</b></font>. You wouldn’t expect it as England has many buildings and the like, but there’s actually a lot of flowers in central England. This kanji also often means <font color=""#f0a""><b>English</b></font>, which is a pretty similar concept so hopefully it's not hard to remember as well.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Picture yourself in central England, out in a field somewhere, smelling the flowers. The flowers smell nice. Smell the English smelling flowers in your nose holes.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>丈<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>height</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Height</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The meaning of the kanji is the same as the meaning of the radical: <font color=""#f0a""><b>height</b></font>. It can also be used as a measurement that's approximately <font color=""#f0a""><b>ten feet</b></font>.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: If you know the radical's meaning, you'll know the kanji's meaning as well.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>夫<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>husband</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Husband</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The&nbsp;<font color=""#0af""><b>husband</b></font>&nbsp;radical and the&nbsp;<font color=""#f0a""><b>husband</b></font>&nbsp;kanji are the same. How useful, unlike some husbands, I'd imagine.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: </i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>飯<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>meal</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Eat, Devil</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">A <font color=""#0af""><b>devil</b></font> can’t afford not to <font color=""#0af""><b>eat</b></font> a <font color=""#f0a""><b>meal</b></font> because devils need their nutrients and energy. Devils need to eat their meals. If they don’t, they wither away and die.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Regardless of whether or not you’re a devil, you need to eat meals to live. Feel how hungry you are not eating a meal, feel your stomach growling devilishly.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>計<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>measure</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Cross, Say</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">So, would you <font color=""#0af""><b>say</b></font> we make the <font color=""#0af""><b>cross</b></font> ten meters long? I'm not sure... maybe we should <font color=""#f0a""><b>measure</b></font> it?</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Nah, let's just say ten and call it a day. We don't need to measure it.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>法<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>method, law</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Cemetery, Tsunami</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">If a <font color=""#0af""><b>tsunami</b></font> hits a <font color=""#0af""><b>cemetery</b></font>, it can change the <font color=""#f0a""><b>method</b></font> of the <font color=""#f0a""><b>law</b></font> by which it is governed. The cemetery is ruled by zombies and they’ve decided to change the way things are after the tsunami – the cemetery needs a change. The laws and methods of government must be changed.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Picture this zombie government in the cemetery as they debate over laws and methods. It’s a lot of moaning and rotted limbs falling off. Hear the sound of their groans and moans as you smell the rotting flesh in the air.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>晩<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>night</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Sun, Excuse</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The <font color=""#0af""><b>sun</b></font> has an <font color=""#0af""><b>excuse</b></font> for disappearing at <font color=""#f0a""><b>night</b></font>. The sun gets really tired, same as anyone else – so when night rolls around the sun excuses itself and goes to sleep. It’s a valid excuse.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine you’re the sun, working all day. Of course you get tired. This is a good excuse to go to bed at night and get some rest. Feel how sore and hot and sweaty and exhausted you are after a hard day’s work of being the sun.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>昼<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>noon</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Ground, Sun, Shrimp</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The <font color=""#0af""><b>sun</b></font> rises from the <font color=""#0af""><b>ground</b></font>, and on top of it is a giant <font color=""#0af""><b>shrimp</b></font>. It doesn't do anything except for every day right at <font color=""#f0a""><b>noon</b></font>, when it tells you the time. 'Hey guyz, it's <font color=""#f0a""><b>noon</b></font>, mmk?'</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Really try to imagine this giant shrimp on the sun as a normal thing that happens, without fail, every day. The shrimp also tells the time right at noon, every day (so important you stress remembering that it's noon, not some other time). Maybe you could have him sing a 'noon song' in your imagination as well.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>毒<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>poison</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Life, Window</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Sitting by the <font color=""#0af""><b>window</b></font> and contemplating <font color=""#0af""><b>life</b></font>, you decide to <font color=""#f0a""><b>poison</b></font> yourself. You’ve realized that life has no meaning sitting by this window, so you’ve decided to take your own life by means of poison.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: What a terrible way to go. Imagine yourself being poisoned. Feel the poison coursing through your veins as your body starts to fail on you. It’s intense pain followed by nothingness.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>昨<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>previous, yesterday</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Sun, Key</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">With the right <font color=""#0af""><b>key</b></font> you can unlock the <font color=""#0af""><b>sun</b></font> to <font color=""#f0a""><b>yesterday</b></font>, or a <font color=""#f0a""><b>previous</b></font> day. The sun is in charge of the day changes, so if you use a key to unlock it, you can control the flow of time and return to yesterday, or a previous day in the past. Behold the power of the sun.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine having the power to control time like this. Picture yourself unlocking the sun to go back in time. Feel the heat of the sun and the bright light in your eyes as you unlock the door to the past.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>帰<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>return</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Forehead, Two Face, Wolverine, Ribs</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You have <font color=""#0af""><b>two face</b></font>'s <font color=""#0af""><b>forehead</b></font> with a <font color=""#0af""><b>wolverine</b></font> attached to it and a couple of <font color=""#0af""><b>ribs</b></font> off to the side. It's obvious that he's been beaten up really badly, and still has a wolverine chomping at him. After all this fighting, he realizes, he's ready to <font color=""#f0a""><b>return</b></font> home.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Who wouldn't be ready to return home after such a beating? It's all he wants. Imagine him on the ground with the wolverine on his forehead chewing away, and he reaches out to you asking you to help him to return home. 'I just want to return home... please help me...'<br>Note that this kanji has to do with returning home, usually.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>式<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>ritual, equation</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Construction, Ceremony</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">To <font color=""#0af""><b>construct</b></font> a whole <font color=""#0af""><b>ceremony</b></font>, you can’t just make it up on the spot. That is not a ceremony. A ceremony has a past. A ceremony is done a certain way because that’s the way it’s always been done. In short, to build a ceremony, you have to create a <font color=""#f0a""><b>ritual</b></font> first. Then, the ritual can be constructed into a bigger, more lavish ceremony.<br>This kanji also means <font color=""#f0a""><b>equation</b></font> for some reason too. Just think of a ceremony that involves doing math and coming up with equations. How strange would that be? Pretend you're at this ceremony.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Ritual and Ceremony kind of mean the same things, sort of. Don't worry too much if you mix them up a little - both will help you to remember the other. There's a reason this kanji is made up of the ceremony radical already!</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>列<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>row</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Bad, Ribs</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You've got yourself some <font color=""#0af""><b>bad</b></font> <font color=""#0af""><b>ribs</b></font>, I'm afraid. How many? Several in a <font color=""#f0a""><b>row</b></font>.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Feel your bad ribs. They're tender and bruised, and multiple of them are hurt in a <font color=""#f0a""><b>row</b></font>. Feeling the pain a bit will help you to remember this kanji's meaning better too, so make sure you do that!</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>浅<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>shallow</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Tsunami, Bar</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">If you visit a <font color=""#0af""><b>bar</b></font> after a <font color=""#0af""><b>tsunami</b></font>, you’ll be hanging out in <font color=""#f0a""><b>shallow</b></font> water. After a tsunami, you want to relax with a drink at the bar. Unfortunately, tsunamis cause floods, and the bar floor is immersed in shallow water.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Picture yourself at this bar, sipping on a drink while you’re wading in this shallow water. Feel the shallow water getting your socks and shoes all wet. It’s uncomfortable and cold.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>単<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>simple</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Witch Doctor</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">A <font color=""#0af""><b>witch doctor</b></font> lives a <font color=""#f0a""><b>simple</b></font> life. A simple way of living is best for a witch doctor. The more simple their day to day life is, the more in tune with their witch doctor ways they are.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: See this witch doctor. He is dressed in simple clothes, has a simple home, and does simple things. Very simple he is.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>坂<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>slope</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Grave, Devil</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The <font color=""#0af""><b>devil</b></font>'s <font color=""#0af""><b>grave</b></font> is right before you. All that's left is having to walk up this sharp <font color=""#f0a""><b>slope</b></font> to get there.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine how painful it is to climb up this steep slope. It's long too... really long. Focus in on the slope / hill and think about how terrible this is. Your legs are burning and you feel like you're going to collapse.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>春<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>spring</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Sun, Train</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The <font color=""#0af""><b>train</b></font> is bringing the <font color=""#0af""><b>sun</b></font> back to your part of the world. When the sun comes back, that means winter is over, and <font color=""#f0a""><b>spring</b></font> is about to begin!</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine yourself waiting at the train station for the train to arrive with the sun. You and everyone else are really excited about it coming because it's been a nasty winter.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>寺<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>temple</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Temple</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The <font color=""#0af""><b>temple</b></font> radical and the <font color=""#f0a""><b>temple</b></font> kanji are exactly the same! Brilliant.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: </i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>浴<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>bathe</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Valley, Tsunami</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">A <font color=""#0af""><b>tsunami</b></font> hits a <font color=""#0af""><b>valley</b></font>, filling it up with water. Lucky for you, you're a giant, so you just lay down in the valley and use it to <font color=""#f0a""><b>bathe</b></font>.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Sure, there's a lot of water in the valley, but you're big too. It's the perfect place for you to bathe... and good thing too, you're getting smelly.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>箱<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>box</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Tree, Eye, Bamboo</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Having a keen <font color=""#0af""><b>eye</b></font> for woodworking, you can tell that the <font color=""#0af""><b>bamboo</b></font> from that <font color=""#0af""><b>tree</b></font> over there will make an excellent <font color=""#f0a""><b>box</b></font>. Boxes made from bamboo trees are very sturdy and fashionable. You have an eye for fashion as well, you see.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: At some point in school, you most likely had some sort of woodshop class to take. Remember back to those times and imagine yourself crafting a bamboo box out of a bamboo tree you felled yourself. Don’t forget to wear eye protection though! Wouldn’t want anything to happen to those valuable eyes of yours.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>係<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>connection</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Ground, Leader, Thread</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">A psychic <font color=""#0af""><b>leader</b></font> can pick a <font color=""#0af""><b>thread</b></font> up off the <font color=""#0af""><b>ground</b></font> and make a <font color=""#f0a""><b>connection</b></font> with the person that it came from. This leader is very powerful, so even a thread is enough for them to make a psychic connection with the person who was wearing the thread.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine you are this leader and you just picked up this piece of thread from the ground. You get a jarring psychic connection with the owner of the thread. Your head spins, your heart races, and your hands tremble. Picture this happening to you as you pick up the thread from the ground.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>治<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>cure, reign</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Tsunami, Machine</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">After a&nbsp;<b><font color=""#0af"">tsunami</font></b>, use this&nbsp;<b><font color=""#0af"">machine</font></b>&nbsp;to&nbsp;<b><font color=""#f0a"">cure</font></b>&nbsp;the people and the country from the damage.&nbsp;<font color=""#f0a""><b>Heal</b></font>ing machines are all over Japan just in case a tsunami does way more damage than they can handle.<br>Oh, and whoever cures and heals the most people will be able to&nbsp;<b><font color=""#f0a"">rule</font></b>&nbsp;over them once everything starts going back to normal. So keep that in mind, kay?</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine if you had your own machine to cure yourself if a tsunami came to where you live. It would be pretty convenient!</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>危<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>dangerous</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Enclosure, Cliff, Snake</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Keeping a <font color=""#0af""><b>snake</b></font> in an <font color=""#0af""><b>enclosure</b></font> by a <font color=""#0af""><b>cliff</b></font> is both <font color=""#f0a""><b>dangerous</b></font> for you as well as the snake. It’s dangerous for you because the snake is incredibly poisonous, and it is dangerous to the snake because the enclosure isn’t very secure and the snake might fall down off the cliff to its demise.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine this cliff with the enclosed snake. The cliff itself was scary enough because it’s quite steep and dangerous. The danger is further compounded by the shoddily enclosed dangerous snake. It’s a scary place to be.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>冒<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>dare</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Sun, Eye</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">When the <font color=""#0af""><b>sun</b></font> gets in your <font color=""#0af""><b>eye</b></font>, I <font color=""#f0a""><b>dare</b></font> you to stare at it. I dare you to look right at the sun. I dare you.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Looking at the sun straight on hurts. It’s bad for your eyes and burns your brain. Imagine how painful it is to stare at the sun.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>留<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>detain</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Pile, Rice Paddy, Sword</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">If you swing your <font color=""#0af""><b>sword</b></font> around in a <font color=""#0af""><b>rice paddy</b></font> and create a <font color=""#0af""><b>pile</b></font> of dead bodies, a group of police officers will come and <font color=""#f0a""><b>detain</b></font> you. Murdering people with a sword is bad, especially in a rice paddy. The pile you’ve created is a bit off though, the murdered bodies are all mechanically altered cyborgs (because the radical for pile in this kanji is altered a bit). But yeah, you’re going to get detained for sure.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine yourself swinging this sword around in a murderous fashion. You’ve created a pile of dead bodies. How do you feel?</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>弁<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>dialect, speech</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Pile, Twenty</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">In a <font color=""#0af""><b>pile</b></font> of <font color=""#0af""><b>twenty</b></font> <font color=""#f0a""><b>dialect</b></font>s, <font color=""#f0a""><b>speech</b></font> will be difficult. There’s twenty dialects you have to deal with here. A massive pile of dialects, so many accents and styles of speech. You’re going to have a hard time getting everyone to understand you and understand everyone in return.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine trying to talk to twenty different people with twenty different dialects of your native language. Imagine what all of them sound like as you talk to them and how you must alter your own speech to accommodate.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>証<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>evidence</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Say, Correct</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">What I <font color=""#0af""><b>say</b></font> is <font color=""#0af""><b>correct</b></font> 100%. You may use it as <font color=""#f0a""><b>evidence</b></font> in this murder case.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Picture yourself saying something. You're solving the crime. What you say is the evidence itself because you know everything.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>遠<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>far</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Water Slide, Zombie</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Why'd you put the <font color=""#0af""><b>zombie</b></font> on the <font color=""#0af""><b>water slide</b></font>? Because you want to send it <font color=""#f0a""><b>far</b></font> away from you.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Watch it slide off into the distance. It's a HUGE water slide, so it goes really far.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>園<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>garden, park</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Mouth, Zombie</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You're examining the <font color=""#0af""><b>mouth</b></font> of a <font color=""#0af""><b>zombie</b></font>. You look inside with a microscope, and you're surprised to see a little <font color=""#f0a""><b>garden</b></font> growing in there. <br>This also means <font color=""#f0a""><b>park</b></font>, too. If you think about it, parks are like cool gardens, especially when you think about Chinese and Japanese gardens. They're so neat and park-like, ammiright?</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: There's everything! It's just on a miniature scale. So, now you have to figure out why there's a garden growing in a zombie's mouth... so strange.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>門<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>gates</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Gate</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The radical for <font color=""#0af""><b>gate</b></font> and the kanji for <font color=""#f0a""><b>gates</b></font> are the same!</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Know your radicals or you won't be allowed to pass.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>府<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>government</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Mullet, Glue</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You can <font color=""#0af""><b>glue</b></font> a <font color=""#0af""><b>mullet</b></font> on to avoid the <font color=""#f0a""><b>government</b></font>. A mullet is a great disguise when you are being pursued by government agents and all you have to do is just glue it right on. Mullets – the perfect disguise.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Just imagine yourself with a mullet. You look silly. Now imagine yourself in a high action spy movie (with a mullet) trying to evade government agents.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>幸<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>happiness</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Lid, Spicy</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Your best friend こういち has a <font color=""#0af""><b>lid</b></font> on his head after eating all the <font color=""#0af""><b>spicy</b></font> food and now he is filled with <font color=""#f0a""><b>happiness</b></font>. The lid is on こういち's head because he ate all the spicy food out of the pot headfirst, so the lid ended up atop his noggin. But now that all the food is gone, こういち is filled with happiness because his tummy is full and he really loves spicy foods.</span></span></span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine こういち's happiness. "<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>阪<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>heights, slope</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Devil, Butcher</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">A <font color=""#0af""><b>devil</b></font> <font color=""#0af""><b>butcher</b></font> who is afraid of <font color=""#f0a""><b>heights</b></font> will be sure to stay away from steep downward <font color=""#f0a""><b>slopes</b></font>. This particular devil has chosen butchery as a profession, because he’s too scared to stand around and maintain the pit of hell. Heights scare the devil butcher, and the slope down to hell is a steep one. Very scary.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine you are this butcher devil who is very afraid of heights. You’re standing on a very steep slope and the drop is terrifying. Imagine your terror as you fear falling from this great height.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>急<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>hurry</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Enclosure, Heart, Wolverine</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text""><font color=""#0af""><b>Wolverine</b></font>’s <font color=""#0af""><b>heart</b></font> <font color=""#0af""><b>enclosure</b></font> is failing – <font color=""#f0a""><b>hurry</b></font>, we need to fix it! He’s been stabbed and his adamantium heart enclosure is falling apart. We need to repair it with more adamantium. Hurry! There isn’t much time.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Hearts are important to everyone. Imagine if your heart was failing on you. It wouldn’t be pleasant. Would you want everyone to dawdle and putter around when they were fixing you up? No! You want them to hurry!</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>笑<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>laugh</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Heaven, Bamboo</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text""><font color=""#0af""><b>Bamboo</b></font> <font color=""#0af""><b>heaven</b></font> is a place for <font color=""#f0a""><b>laughing</b></font>. Bamboo is a very jolly plant, and they love to laugh. Even after death in bamboo heaven, the bamboo continue to laugh joyfully. Bamboo heaven is truly a place of laughter.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine yourself as a bamboo plant, laughing in heaven. What are you laughing about? "<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>荷<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>luggage</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Leader, Lip Ring, Flowers</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The <font color=""#0af""><b>lip ring</b></font> wearing <font color=""#0af""><b>leader</b></font> of the <font color=""#0af""><b>Flowers</b></font> Gang does not carry his own <font color=""#f0a""><b>luggage</b></font> anywhere. He is so powerful, respected, and feared that people always carry his luggage for him wherever he goes. You might not think a leader of a gang called the Flowers would be intimidating, but he is.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Picture this lip ring wearing gang leader. "<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>政<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>politics</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Winter, Correct</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">That’s <font color=""#0af""><b>correct</b></font>, <font color=""#0af""><b>winter</b></font> is the time for <font color=""#f0a""><b>government</b></font> and <font color=""#f0a""><b>politics</b></font>. Elections start to creep up around winter time, so there’s lots of politics and government to talk about. That’s correct.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine all this politics and government talk as you shiver outside in the winter cold. You’re freezing and you’re bored.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>保<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>preserve, guarantee</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Mouth, Tree, Leader</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The <font color=""#0af""><b>mouth</b></font> of a <font color=""#0af""><b>tree</b></font> <font color=""#0af""><b>leader</b></font> is all about trying to <font color=""#f0a""><b>preserve</b></font> the trees. In fact, he <font color=""#f0a""><b>guarantee</b></font>s that he will preserve the trees if it's the last thing he does.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Basically, a tree leader is someone who stands up for trees. "<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>品<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>product</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Products</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The <font color=""#0af""><b>products</b></font> radical and the <font color=""#f0a""><b>product</b></font> kanji are exactly the same! "<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>守<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>protect</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Helmet, Measurement</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You have to get the <font color=""#0af""><b>measurement</b></font> of the <font color=""#0af""><b>helmet</b></font> to make it fit your head. If it doesn't fit properly, it can't <font color=""#f0a""><b>protect</b></font> you properly.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Alternately, you can just put a measured helmet on, and go to battle, using it to <font color=""#f0a""><b>protect</b></font> you from all the enemies. Even better, imagine yourself naked except the helmet you have on. It's your only protection.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>辞<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>quit, word</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Tongue, Spicy</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">When your&nbsp;<b><font color=""#0af"">tongue</font></b>&nbsp;becomes too&nbsp;<b><font color=""#0af"">spicy</font></b>&nbsp;for you to bear, it’s time to&nbsp;<font color=""#f0a""><b>quit</b></font>&nbsp;the jalapeño eating contest. You’ve been eating them for three hours now and the spiciness from the peppers is really burning your tongue. Throw in the towel, it’s time to quit the contest.<br>This kanji has another meaning too:<br>Eating isn't the only thing that makes your&nbsp;<b><font color=""#0af"">tongue</font></b>&nbsp;<b><font color=""#0af"">spicy</font></b>, so do certain&nbsp;<b><font color=""#f0a"">word</font></b>s. Say your favorite words out loud right now. Feel them on your tongue. Words are the spicy food of language!</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: You may have to quit eating but you never have to quit saying words. Especially if you're, well, trying to learn a whole new language full of them.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>真<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>reality</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Fins, Ground, Pope</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">If the&nbsp;<b><font color=""#0af"">pope</font></b>&nbsp;spends all day staring at&nbsp;<b><font color=""#0af"">fins</font></b>&nbsp;on the&nbsp;<b><font color=""#0af"">ground</font></b>, he’s going to lose touch with&nbsp;<b style=""color: rgb(226, 0, 150);"">reality</b>. He should be focusing on his popish duties, but instead he’s looking at the fish fins he dropped, and now can’t eat because they’re dirty. Silly pope. You can’t let this one thing get you down. You have other things to do.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Picture trying to get the pope to stop staring at the fins laying on the dirty ground. His eyes are all big. Yup, he’s completely lost touch with reality, you think.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>喜<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>rejoice</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Mouth, Drum</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">If there is a&nbsp;<b><font color=""#0af"">drum</font></b>&nbsp;in your&nbsp;<b><font color=""#0af"">mouth</font></b>&nbsp;it's time to&nbsp;<b style=""color: rgb(226, 0, 150);"">rejoice</b>! And because of your mouth drum your rejoicing will be loud and booming!</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine having a drum in your mouth and rejoicing about it! Imagine how loud it would be!</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>関<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>related, connected</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Heaven, Gate, Horns</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The <font color=""#0af""><b>gate</b></font> of <font color=""#0af""><b>heaven</b></font> goes hand in hand with the notion of heaven, but <font color=""#0af""><b>horns</b></font> are not <font color=""#f0a""><b>connected</b></font> or <font color=""#f0a""><b>related</b></font> to the aspect of heaven at all. Horns are more connected to that other place down below. Definitely not related to the gate of heaven at all.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine you have horns and you’re standing at the gate of heaven. This isn’t the place for you, what are you doing here? Imagine the scorn the gatekeeper has for you and your horns. You don’t belong!</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>険<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>risky</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Butcher, Squid</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">To <font color=""#0af""><b>butcher</b></font> a <font color=""#0af""><b>squid</b></font> is quite <font color=""#f0a""><b>risky</b></font>. It has a beak and tentacles, and they can grab you and tear you apart.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine yourself being tasked with the job of butchering a live giant squid. You jump in and begin to butcher, but it's too strong for you. This was so risky, not to mention you decided to butcher it on a slope, so you and the squid are rolling down the slope with knives flying everywhere.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>典<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>rule</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Fins, Music</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">If you play <font color=""#0af""><b>music</b></font> with your <font color=""#0af""><b>fins</b></font>, one <font color=""#f0a""><b>rule</b></font> is that you must be a fish. You can’t play music using fish fins that don’t belong to you. That’s the rule. And it’s also rude.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine a fish playing music using his fins. What kind of a song is it? Imagine it in your head as you see a sign with the fish fin rule on it.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>専<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>specialty</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Cross, Rice Paddy, Measurement</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Applying a <font color=""#0af""><b>measurement</b></font> to a <font color=""#0af""><b>cross</b></font> and sticking it in the ground of a <font color=""#0af""><b>rice paddy</b></font> has become your <font color=""#f0a""><b>specialty</b></font>. You’ve been practicing measurements on crosses and sticking them into rice paddies all your life and you’ve become quite well known for your rice paddy cross measurement abilities. You’re famous.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Visualize this skill being your specialty. Over the years you’ve gotten many splinters from the work. Imagine having tons of splinters in your hands. Such is the price one pays for specialized perfection.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>冗<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>superfluous</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Forehead, Table</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You just had your <font color=""#0af""><b>forehead</b></font> smashed into the <font color=""#0af""><b>table</b></font> for being <font color=""#f0a""><b>superfluous</b></font>. You know you aren’t supposed to say unnecessary things but you did it anyway. It really hurts, but you deserved it. There’s even a mark in the table where your head hit it. Ouch.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine how much it would hurt to have your forehead slammed into a table. A lot. It would hurt a lot. Now imagine the pain on your head too. Think about the lesson you learned... don't be superfluous.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>存<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>exist, suppose</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Child, Narwhal, Stick</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">If a <b><font color=""#0af"">narwhal</font></b> <b><font color=""#0af"">stick</font></b>s a <font color=""#0af""><b>child</b></font> with its horn then you have to admit that it <b><font color=""#f0a"">exist</font></b>s. We know some of you have been doubting narwhals and whether they're real. Well now your kid is a kabob, so do you believe they exist now? I <font color=""#f0a""><b>suppose</b></font> you do.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine needing this kind of horrible proof to believe something exists. Maybe you should have more faith in what we teach.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>面<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>surface, face</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Robot</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Every <font color=""#0af""><b>robot</b></font> has a <font color=""#f0a""><b>surface</b></font>. Then, when you get under the surface you have its innards. The surface is what's scary, though, making them impervious to your attacks. This kanji also means <font color=""#f0a""><b>face</b></font>, though more like 'the face of the wall' or something.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Try punching the <font color=""#f0a""><b>surface</b></font> of this robot. Bam! Doesn't work.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>取<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>take</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Stool, Ear</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">There's an <font color=""#0af""><b>ear</b></font> just sitting on a <font color=""#0af""><b>stool</b></font>. Nobody's watching, so, you just <font color=""#f0a""><b>take</b></font> it.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Feel the rush of stealing something (even though it's a weird something, admittedly). Start walking away quickly. You don't want to get caught!</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>曜<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>weekday</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Sun, Wolverine, Turkey</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">As the <font color=""#0af""><b>sun</b></font> rises over the hills, the ferocious <font color=""#0af""><b>wolverine</b></font> stalks a <font color=""#0af""><b>turkey</b></font> on a <font color=""#f0a""><b>weekday</b></font> morning. The wolverine hunts turkeys for a living, but on the weekends, he likes to play racquetball at the local gym. That’s why the turkey is getting hunted on a weekday.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: You’ve probably seen those nature shows like on National Geographic. Think back to one of those shows where the hunter stalks its prey and leaps out in slow motion to do the murder. Now imagine this scene with the wolverine leaping out at the turkey. The wolverine howls a bloodcurdling shriek as the turkey lurches in agony, feathers flying everywhere as the wolverine sinks its teeth into flesh.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>書<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>write</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Sun, Brush</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Why would you try to take a <font color=""#0af""><b>brush</b></font> to the <font color=""#0af""><b>sun</b></font>? It's almost too obvious, because you want to <font color=""#f0a""><b>write</b></font> something down.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Just imagine yourself sitting on the sun, writing back to your friends and family with a brush. For someone who can visit the sun, it's really weird that you are writing with a brush like this, but you're doing it just the same.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>是<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>absolutely</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Sun, Correct</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The <font color=""#0af""><b>sun</b></font> is <font color=""#0af""><b>correct</b></font>, <font color=""#f0a""><b>absolutely</b></font>. The mighty sun is never wrong. It is absolutely correct, always.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine the sun in the sky. Its rays blind you as it corrects all of the errors you’ve made.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>結<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>bind, tie</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Thread, Longcat</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">When you run out of <font color=""#0af""><b>thread</b></font>, you can use <font color=""#0af""><b>longcat</b></font> to <font color=""#f0a""><b>bind</b></font> and <font color=""#f0a""><b>tie</b></font> things. Since longcat is so long, he has the ability to bond and tie things together just like thread.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine tying your shoes with longcat. How much more interesting would tying your shoes be? Just imagine.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>底<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>bottom</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Ground, Mullet, Duck</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">If a <font color=""#0af""><b>duck</b></font> grows a <font color=""#0af""><b>mullet</b></font> that goes to the <font color=""#0af""><b>ground</b></font>, the mullet goes to the <font color=""#f0a""><b>bottom</b></font> of the duck. A duck mullet so long that it reaches the ground is pretty long. The hairs get tangled and stick to the bottom of his duck feet.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine a duck, waddling around with a mullet, quacking as he waddles. This duck looks ridiculous.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>因<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>cause</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Big, Mouth</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Your <font color=""#0af""><b>big</b></font> <font color=""#0af""><b>mouth</b></font> is the <font color=""#f0a""><b>cause</b></font> of all your problems. If you kept your big mouth shut, you wouldn’t cause so much trouble for yourself.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine all the dumb things you blabber about with your big mouth. Saying things you shouldn’t say, causing drama and stuff. Shame on you.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>識<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>discerning</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Say, Drunkard, Sound</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">If you <font color=""#0af""><b>sound</b></font> like a <font color=""#0af""><b>drunkard</b></font> when you <font color=""#0af""><b>say</b></font> things, people will not think of you as a <font color=""#f0a""><b>discerning</b></font> person. 'AWh yeah, that game is greatttt,' you say in your drunken slurs. But, really, it sounds like you think all games are great, which isn't all that <font color=""#f0a""><b>discriminating</b></font> of you at all.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Picture yourself as a drunkard. What sort of discerning things are you saying? What are you trying to discern? Do you know?</i></span><p> "

"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>敗<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>failure</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Winter, Clam</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">A <font color=""#0af""><b>clam</b></font> who doesn’t live in the <font color=""#0af""><b>winter</b></font> is a <font color=""#f0a""><b>failure</b></font>. Any proper clam would survive through the winter, but these weak clams are failures.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine you’re a clam in the cold of winter. The water is freezing but you must tough it out as to not be labeled a failure.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>渉<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>ford</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Walk, Tsunami</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You don’t <font color=""#0af""><b>walk</b></font> across a <font color=""#0af""><b>tsunami</b></font>, you <font color=""#f0a""><b>ford</b></font> a tsunami. Think about it – you ford a river, you ford anything that’s water, unless you’re Jesus – you’re not Jesus. You don’t walk across a tsunami, you ford it.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Picture yourself fording a tsunami. You must be very resilient to do so. Hear the splash of the water and the cool wetness as you ford the tsunami water.</i></span><p> "

"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>官<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>government</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Helmet, Bear</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Put a <font color=""#0af""><b>helmet</b></font> on a <font color=""#0af""><b>bear</b></font> in a room with all the <font color=""#f0a""><b>government</b></font>’s problems and he’d be just about as effective at solving them as the government officials are.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine this bear, blinded by the helmet, bumbling around the room trying to solve all of the government’s issues. How silly he looks! Roaring and stumbling around, silly bear.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>署<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>government office</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Sauron, Someone</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Even&nbsp;<b><font color=""#0af"">Sauron</font></b>&nbsp;needs&nbsp;<b><font color=""#0af"">someone</font></b>&nbsp;to help him run the horrible apocalypse he’s creating. So he made a&nbsp;<b style=""color: rgb(226, 0, 150);"">government office</b>&nbsp;for them to work in. They sit in there and go over paperwork about how to best punch hobbits in the face.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine Sauron sitting with someone who works in his new government office. Picture them looking at extensive diagrams of hobbits and thinking about where to kick them. Imagine them turning away all the sad people who go there to ask for peace.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>察<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>guess</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Helmet, Tent, Jackhammer, Slide</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">If a man in a&nbsp;<b><font color=""#0af"">helmet</font></b>&nbsp;uses a&nbsp;<b><font color=""#0af"">jackhammer</font></b>&nbsp;on an old&nbsp;<b><font color=""#0af"">slide</font></b>&nbsp;next to a&nbsp;<b><font color=""#0af"">tent</font></b>&nbsp;of people,&nbsp;<b style=""color: rgb(226, 0, 150);"">guess</b>&nbsp;who’s going to be unhappy? The people in the tent are going to be very upset with the man in the helmet using a jackhammer on a slide. It’s not hard to guess – jackhammers are annoying.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine yourself in the tent when the jackhammering starts. You can only guess as to why they are jackhammering so close to you. The jarring rumbling sound reverberates in your ears.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>堂<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>hall</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Worm, Viking</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">A <font color=""#0af""><b>worm</b></font> has no place in a <font color=""#0af""><b>Viking</b></font> <font color=""#f0a""><b>hall</b></font> or <font color=""#f0a""><b>public chamber</b></font>. These are spaces reserved for brave Vikings, not measly worms!</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine a worm inside a Viking hall or public chamber. Now imagine it getting squashed under the mighty boot of a Viking. Worms don’t belong there.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>幻<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>illusion</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Poop, Cloak</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You hide <font color=""#0af""><b>poop</b></font> in a <font color=""#0af""><b>cloak</b></font> as part of your <font color=""#f0a""><b>illusion</b></font> routine in your magic show. Your acts are kind of gross and this one involves creating the illusion of disappearing poop by hiding it within the folds of your cloak.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine having poop in your cloak. "<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>愛<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>love</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Heart, Winter, Forehead, Cleat</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Putting on <font color=""#0af""><b>cleats</b></font> in the <font color=""#0af""><b>heart</b></font> of <font color=""#0af""><b>winter</b></font> and braving the harsh elements just to plant a kiss on your sweetheart’s <font color=""#0af""><b>forehead</b></font> – that’s <font color=""#f0a""><b>love</b></font>. Sure, you could see them another day, but you need to plant this smooch on their forehead today, so you get some cleats for better grip on the winter snow and you keep thoughts of your dear in your heart as you travel to see your love.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Feel the joy of love in your heart as you travel out in the winter. It’s cold outside, but the feeling of love in your heart keeps you warm. Feel this warm love emanating and heating your body.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>薬<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>medicine</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Comfort, Flowers</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text""><font color=""#0af""><b>Flowers</b></font> can be used for <font color=""#0af""><b>comfort</b></font>, but also for <font color=""#f0a""><b>medicine</b></font>. Sure, it’s a comfort to smell flowers because they smell nice, but one can also use them as medicine to heal people.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine having some medicine that smells and tastes like fresh cut flowers. Smell the smell in your nose and taste the taste on your tongue.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>覚<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>memorize, awake</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">See, Viking</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text""><font color=""#0af""><b>Viking</b></font>&nbsp;<font color=""#0af""><b>see</b></font>, Viking&nbsp;<font color=""#f0a""><b>memorize</b></font>. That’s how Vikings learn things. They see something, and then they memorize it. Quite simple, really.<br>It can also mean&nbsp;<b><font color=""#f0a"">awake</font></b>. Just remember that a viking can't see if it isn't&nbsp;<b><font color=""#f0a"">awake</font></b>. There won't be anything to memorize if their eyes are still closed, after all!</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: How else would a Viking memorize something? Imagine having to memorize sea charts for your Viking navigation. Look and see the maps in your brain as you memorize them.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>常<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>normal</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Mouth, Two Face, Viking</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">If <font color=""#0af""><b>Two Face</b></font> was a <font color=""#0af""><b>Viking</b></font> but had no <font color=""#0af""><b>mouth</b></font>, he’d be an <font color=""#f0a""><b>ordinary</b></font>, <font color=""#f0a""><b>normal</b></font> Viking. Vikings get into a lot of battles, so it wouldn’t be so out of the ordinary for one of them to be missing a mouth or have a mangled face like Two Face. He’d fit right in.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Picture Two Face as a Viking, gurgling and waving his weapon around, ravaging and pillaging the countryside. This is pretty normal behavior for a Viking, I think.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>鼻<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>nose</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Rice Paddy, Self, Twenty</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You are all by your lonesome <font color=""#0af""><b>self</b></font> and you have to check <font color=""#0af""><b>twenty</b></font> <font color=""#0af""><b>rice paddie</b></font>s. The thing you have to check is the smell of all the rice paddies to see if they're ready for harvest. At each one, you open up your <font color=""#f0a""><b>nose</b></font> and smell deeply.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Focus in on your nose. Your nostrils get huge, and your nose is huge. Smell the rice in your imagination. Your nose is amazing.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>無<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>nothing</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Nothing</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The <font color=""#0af""><b>nothing</b></font> radical and the <font color=""#f0a""><b>nothing</b></font> kanji are exactly the same! Woah!</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: </i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>原<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>original, fundamental</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Diamond</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">A <font color=""#0af""><b>diamond</b></font> is the <font color=""#f0a""><b>original</b></font> <font color=""#f0a""><b>fundamental</b></font> of a dramatic movie. They just aren’t the same without a diamond proposal scene. It’s pretty fundamental.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Picture this fundamental scene in your head. It’s not so original anymore since everyone does it, but proposals happen in movies and always with diamonds. Visualize it in your mind. Are you the one receiving or presenting the diamond?</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>栄<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>prosperity</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Tree, Viking</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The <font color=""#0af""><b>Viking</b></font> cuts down a <font color=""#0af""><b>tree</b></font> and carves it with his bare hands into a longboat. With this, he will be able to move up in the world, experiencing <font color=""#f0a""><b>prosperity</b></font> and being able to <font color=""#f0a""><b>flourish</b></font>.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Picture yourself as this viking. You're so excited about the prosperity you'll experience you are able to use your bare hands to tear apart the wood.</i></span><p> "

"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>側<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>side</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Clam, Leader, Ribs</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The <font color=""#0af""><b>clam</b></font> <font color=""#0af""><b>leader</b></font> has <font color=""#0af""><b>ribs</b></font> on each <font color=""#f0a""><b>side</b></font> of his body. You may try to forget a death, when the heart fails and the loved one passes away, but you can never really, truly forget.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine someone close to you experiencing the death of their heart. "<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>訓<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>instruction</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">River, Say</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You <font color=""#0af""><b>say</b></font> stuff to a <font color=""#0af""><b>river</b></font>, giving it <font color=""#f0a""><b>instruction</b></font>. "<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>種<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>kind, type</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Pine, Heavy</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">A <font color=""#0af""><b>pine</b></font> is <font color=""#0af""><b>heavy</b></font>, and also a <font color=""#f0a""><b>kind</b></font> of needle <font color=""#f0a""><b>type</b></font> tree. There are many kinds and types of trees, but the pine is one of the most abundant. Most are pretty heavy too, as they grow to become quite large.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine lifting this kind of tree. A really heavy pine tree. Feel how heavy it is as your hands get all sticky with sap and poked by needles.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>報<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>news</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Stool, Stamp, Happiness</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Sitting on a <font color=""#0af""><b>stool</b></font>, you learn that the best way to <font color=""#0af""><b>stamp</b></font> out <font color=""#0af""><b>happiness</b></font> is by watching the <font color=""#f0a""><b>news</b></font> <font color=""#f0a""><b>report</b></font>. Every report on the news is sad and violent and filled with death which makes you very sad, stamping out your happiness.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine the saddest news report story you can think of and imagine watching that story while sitting on a stool. What is happening in the news report?</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>句<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>paragraph</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Paragraph</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The <font color=""#0af""><b>paragraph</b></font> radical and the <font color=""#f0a""><b>paragraph</b></font> kanji are exactly the same! Yus!</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: </i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>許<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>permit</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Say, Noon</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text""><font color=""#0af""><b>Say</b></font> it at <font color=""#0af""><b>noon</b></font>. That's the only time I will <font color=""#f0a""><b>allow</b></font> you to say it. That's the only time I will <font color=""#f0a""><b>permit</b></font> you to say it. Other than that, no saying anything. Noon is your window.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine a world where you're not allowed to say anything except for at noon. At that moment, after you've been staring at the clock, waiting for that opportunity, you burst forth with things you want to say. But, once it hits 12:01, you are grabbed and your mouth is covered. You are not permitted to say anything outside of that time.</i></span><p> "

Having a lip ring grants you the power to conquer any obstacle, achieve any goal. Everything becomes possible through the mystical power of a lip ring.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine yourself getting a magical lip ring. First you have to go through the pain of having your lip pierced. Imagine yourself having a hot needle pierce your skin in order to get this lip ring.
