It’s very pretty.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine yourself siting under the tree in the grass with the woman. Smell the cherries and see the sakura blossoms falling down all around you. How whimsical.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>密<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>secrecy</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Mountain, Helmet, Certain</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">As I put on my mining <font color=""#0af""><b>helmet</b></font>, I was <font color=""#0af""><b>certain</b></font> that <font color=""#0af""><b>mountain</b></font> was filled with <font color=""#f0a""><b>secrecy</b></font>. Therefore, I decided to dig into the mountain and make a mine. The helmet is for protection. I shall discover what secrecy lies beneath. I’m certain there’s something there, I just don’t know what.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine yourself in a helmet digging into this mountain. What sort of secrecy do you think it holds? You’re certain there is something there, it’s just a matter of what.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>秘<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>secret</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Pine, Certain</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">A <font color=""#0af""><b>pine</b></font> tree is <font color=""#0af""><b>certain</b></font> to keep a <font color=""#f0a""><b>secret</b></font> if you promise to shower it with water. The pine tree needs water to live on, so you give it some water in exchange for it keeping your secret.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: What is the secret? I can’t tell you! It’s a secret. I bet you wonder what it is though. Try and coax the pine into telling you what the secret is. Go ahead – try.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>厳<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>strict</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Winter, Cliff, Grass, Elf</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">If you see an&nbsp;<b><font color=""#0af"">elf</font></b>&nbsp;standing on a&nbsp;<b><font color=""#0af"">grass</font></b>y&nbsp;<b><font color=""#0af"">cliff</font></b>&nbsp;in&nbsp;<b><font color=""#0af"">winter</font></b>, you know their elf parents are super&nbsp;<b style=""color: rgb(226, 0, 150);"">strict</b>. When elf kids misbehave they're supposed to go stand on grassy cliffs to think about what they've done. But only really really strict parents make their kids do that in the middle of winter.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Picture the elf shivering on the grassy cliff, the winter air freezing their pointy ears. "<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>捨<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>throw away</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Mouth, Grave, Hat, Nailbat</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Taking a <font color=""#0af""><b>nailbat</b></font>, you hit a <font color=""#0af""><b>hat</b></font>, a <font color=""#0af""><b>grave</b></font>, and someone’s <font color=""#0af""><b>mouth</b></font> before you <font color=""#f0a""><b>throw away</b></font> the bat. You hit someone’s hat when you bash their head in with the nailbat, and you hit the grave with the nailbat to pack the dirt over their corpse. You hit the mouth of someone who got suspicious and asked too many questions, and then you throw away the nailbat to get rid of the evidence.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine hitting all these things with your nailbat. Hit the hat, hit the grave, and hit the mouth. Feel the bat in your hands as you connect with all these things then finally throw the nailbat away.</i></span><p> "

"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>異<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>differ</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Fins, Rice Paddy, Blackjack</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">A <font color=""#0af""><b>rice paddy</b></font> and the game of <font color=""#0af""><b>blackjack</b></font> can both incorporate <font color=""#0af""><b>fins</b></font> but they <font color=""#f0a""><b>differ</b></font> in many ways. For one, blackjack is a card game and a rice paddy is where you grow rice. They differ. There really aren’t any similarities here at all. Except that you can use fins to fertilize a rice paddy and can use fins as betting chips in blackjack, but other than that - nothing.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Think of more ways that a rice paddy and blackjack differ. There are plenty of reasons, so pick your favorites.</i></span><p> "

"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>誌<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>magazine</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Heart, Samurai, Say</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">They <font color=""#0af""><b>say</b></font> that the <font color=""#0af""><b>samurai</b></font> from this town once cut a <font color=""#0af""><b>heart</b></font> out of a <font color=""#f0a""><b>magazine</b></font> and gave it to the princess. "<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>筋<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>muscle</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Power, Moon, Bamboo</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text""><font color=""#0af""><b>Bamboo</b></font> from the <font color=""#0af""><b>moon</b></font> is very <font color=""#0af""><b>power</b></font>ful and can easily destroy a <font color=""#f0a""><b>muscle</b></font> or a <font color=""#f0a""><b>tendon</b></font> with one hit. This moon bamboo grows on the moon and is specifically cultivated for its muscle and tendon destroying abilities. The moon bamboo is made into weapons specifically designed for this purpose.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Pick up one of these moon bamboo weapons. Be careful not to hit yourself with it. If you hit something with it, the muscles and tendons hit would instantly be rendered useless.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>否<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>no</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Mouth, Not</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The <font color=""#0af""><b>Not</b></font> <font color=""#0af""><b>Mouth</b></font> says “<font color=""#f0a""><b>no</b></font>”. What else would you expect from something named the “Not Mouth”? The Not Mouth will always say “no”, regardless of the question.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine encountering this Not Mouth. Ask it a question. It answers, “No”. Imagine doing this over and over until you believe that the Not Mouth always says “no”.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>盛<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>pile</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Plate, Become</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You <font color=""#0af""><b>become</b></font> a <font color=""#0af""><b>plate</b></font> <font color=""#f0a""><b>pile</b></font>, <font color=""#f0a""><b>heaps</b></font> and heaps of plates. You’ve been turned into a pile of plates by an evil wizard. Heaps of plates make up your form now. You have become a pile of plates.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine yourself becoming a pile of plates. Feel your arms and legs become nothing more than heaps of dinnerware. Hear the plates clinking about as you struggle.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>宣<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>proclaim</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Ground, Helmet, Sunrise</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Over a <font color=""#0af""><b>helmet</b></font> on the <font color=""#0af""><b>ground</b></font>, a <font color=""#0af""><b>sunrise</b></font> arrives to <font color=""#f0a""><b>proclaim</b></font> a new day’s beginning! You took off your helmet and put it on the ground when you went to sleep, and now that the sunrise is showing, you know that the morning has arrived. The sun will proclaim the arrival of the new day with its bright and shiny rays!</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine yourself being awakened by the sunrise. Pick up your helmet and proclaim to the skies that a new day has arrived. Proclaim it aloud! Be very animated as you do so.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>賃<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>rent</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">King, Clam, Leader</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The <font color=""#0af""><b>leader</b></font> who is <font color=""#0af""><b>king</b></font> of every <font color=""#0af""><b>clam</b></font> sets the <font color=""#f0a""><b>rent</b></font> for everyone. "<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>敬<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>respect</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Winter, Poem</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Writing a <font color='#0af'><b>poem</b></font> in <font color='#0af'><b>winter</b></font> is the only way to gain the <font color='#f0a'><b>respect</b></font> of other poets. Rumor has it that you’re not considered a true writer of poems until you write a poem in the dead cold of winter. Only then will you gain the respect of the community.<br></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: You have to do this to gain respect. The horns can be used in medicine, so they are very valuable, those alcoholic monster horns.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Look at one of these revered horns. "<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>熟<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>ripen</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Circle, Fish Tail, Sock</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">A&nbsp;<b><font color=""#0af"">sock</font></b>&nbsp;that's become a&nbsp;<b><font color=""#0af"">circle</font></b>&nbsp;from being stuffed with the remnants of many a&nbsp;<b><font color=""#0af"">fish tail</font></b>&nbsp;begins to&nbsp;<b style=""color: rgb(226, 0, 150);"">ripen</b>, giving off an awful odor. Every time you find a fish tail you put it in this sock. You find a lot so this sock has become pretty circular. The fish tails start to rot and ripen, and now the sock smells absolutely foul.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Smell the smelly smell of each fish tail as it begins to ripen. "<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>劇<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>drama</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Pig, Tiger, Ribs</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">A <font color=""#0af""><b>tiger</b></font> kills a <font color=""#0af""><b>pig</b></font>, eating the meat from its <font color=""#0af""><b>ribs</b></font> at the climax of a <font color=""#f0a""><b>drama</b></font> about the animal kingdom. The tiger and pig used to be friends when they were younger but the tiger grew up and his ferocious instincts kicked in and he ate the pig, ribs and all. What a drama.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine watching this and hearing the tiger gobbling up the pig, slurping the meat from the ribs. This drama is so moving that you find yourself shedding a tear. How touching.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>奴<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>dude</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Woman, Stool</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The&nbsp;<b><font color=""#0af"">woman</font></b>&nbsp;sitting on that&nbsp;<b><font color=""#0af"">stool</font></b>&nbsp;is actually a&nbsp;<b style=""color: rgb(226, 0, 150);"">dude</b>. Oh oops! You thought he was a woman because of his long hair and the way he was sitting. Maybe you shouldn't be judging people based on their looks!</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Dude, I can't believe you called that dude a woman. What's wrong with you?!</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>聖<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>holy</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Mouth, King, Ear</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The <font color=""#0af""><b>ear</b></font> and the <font color=""#0af""><b>mouth</b></font> of a <font color=""#0af""><b>king</b></font> are <font color=""#f0a""><b>holy</b></font>. The king has holy hearing and holy eating abilities. This king is divine.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: See the holy ear and mouth of this king. They glisten and glitter and people write hymnals about their holy prowess. Imagine a song playing as you witness their holy majesty.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>推<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>infer</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Turkey, Nailbat</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Seeing a <font color=""#0af""><b>nailbat</b></font> in the hands of a <font color=""#0af""><b>turkey</b></font>, you <font color=""#f0a""><b>infer</b></font> that he wants revenge. This turkey knows you killed his brother for dinner last night, and now he’s going to make you pay. You infer that this turkey is going to take this nailbat and beat you to death.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Look at this turkey. See the nailbat. Fear the nailbat. Infer what will happen next.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>臓<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>internal organs</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Moon, Storehouse</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">A <font color=""#0af""><b>storehouse</b></font> <font color=""#0af""><b>moon</b></font>s (remember, sometimes the moon radical indicates an internal organ!) is your&nbsp;<b style=""color: rgb(226, 0, 150);"">internal organs</b>. They are storehouses for various bodily functions.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Alternatively, think about storehouses on the moon, filled to the brim with internal organs. You open the door, and they kind of slowly bounce out (because of less gravity) and get all over your pretty white space suit.</i></span><p> "

"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>磁<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>magnet</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Ground, Stone, Poop, Horns</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Seeing a <font color=""#0af""><b>stone</b></font> and some <font color=""#0af""><b>horns</b></font> on the <font color=""#0af""><b>ground</b></font> next to a piece of <font color=""#0af""><b>poop</b></font> and another piece of <font color=""#0af""><b>poop</b></font>, you try and pick each of them up with a <font color=""#f0a""><b>magnet</b></font>. The magnet fails to pick up either piece of poop. The magnet doesn’t pick up the horns either. But wait! The magnet picks up the stone!</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine yourself trying to pick each object up off the ground with your magnet. How did that cedar tree get in your hair?</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine having a cedar tree in your hair. It’s just a little tree, a sapling, but it’s pretty strange and awkward. It does smell nice though. Mmm… cedar.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>銅<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>copper</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Gold, Same</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text""><font color=""#0af""><b>Gold</b></font> is not the <font color=""#0af""><b>same</b></font> as <font color=""#f0a""><b>copper</b></font>. They are two different metals. Gold is not the same as copper.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Take a piece of gold in one hand and a piece of copper in the other. Bang them together furiously as you shout. “GOLD IS NOT THE SAME AS COPPER! GOLD IS NOT THE SAME AS COPPER!”</i></span><p> "

You’re standing next to a cottage. You have a grave in your mouth. Why? You were hungry. You’re eating the grave. The grave has a hat on it because it’s sensitive to the sun.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: You’re next to the cottage so look at it. Picture that cottage. Nine times more drunk than ever before.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Feel how drunk you are as you look at the cross shaped bottle that once held the alcohol. "<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>酢<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>vinegar</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Alcohol, Key</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">To make <b><font color=""#0af"">alcohol</font></b> the <b><font color=""#0af"">key</font></b> is to ferment it. "<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>伸<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>stretch</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Leader, Say Humbly</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">An honest <font color=""#0af""><b>leader</b></font> can <font color=""#0af""><b>say humbly</b></font> that he does not <font color=""#f0a""><b>stretch</b></font> the truth. This leader refuses to stretch the truth and always tells things like it is. This is something he can say humbly, he’s not trying to brag about how he doesn’t stretch the truth, he just wants you to know. He tells you the only thing he does stretch is his body.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine this leader telling you about how he doesn’t stretch the truth. While he does so, imagine him doing the splits and stretching his arms and neck all about as well.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>姓<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>surname</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Woman, Life</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">That special <font color=""#0af""><b>woman</b></font> in your <font color=""#0af""><b>life</b></font> will eventually take your <font color=""#f0a""><b>surname</b></font> and make it her <font color=""#f0a""><b>family name</b></font> too. Traditionally, a woman will change her last name when she gets married and keep that name for the rest of her life. Her husband’s family name becomes her family name too.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine having your surname changed for the rest of your life. How do you feel about having a different family name? Is it a big deal to you or does it not matter much?</i></span><p> "

Magic, of course.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine the sun as it leaks more and more light out of the enclosure. You start off cold then start to feel warmer. Shorts are in season now! Sauron has been having chest pains lately and he’s also found God, hence the cross. You press your ear to his chest to listen to his heart to see if he’s healthy.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Listen to the heart of Sauron. Thump. Thump thump… thump. Thump!</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>臨<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>look to</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Products, Servant, Gun</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You give your <font color=""#0af""><b>servant</b></font> a <font color=""#0af""><b>gun</b></font> along with some other <font color=""#0af""><b>products</b></font> to <font color=""#f0a""><b>look to</b></font>. You can’t look to them yourself since you are very busy. You allow your servant to look to your gun and the other products.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine your servant as he looks to your gun and products. You can always look to him to take care of your menial tasks. You feel smug.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>兆<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>omen</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Omen</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The <font color=""#0af""><b>omen</b></font> radical and the <font color=""#f0a""><b>omen</b></font> kanji are exactly the same! Ominous!</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: </i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>契<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>pledge</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Big, Sword, Master</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">A <font color=""#0af""><b>master</b></font> with a <font color=""#0af""><b>sword</b></font> makes a <font color=""#0af""><b>big</b></font> <font color=""#f0a""><b>pledge</b></font> to protect the entire city from harm. This sword master is a pretty big guy, but his pledge to protect the entire city might be too big even for him. It’s a mighty big pledge.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine you are this sword master making this big pledge. Say aloud, “I, the sword master, pledge to defend this big city!”</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>刑<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>punish</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Lantern, Ribs</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">A <font color=""#0af""><b>lantern</b></font> smashes into your <font color=""#0af""><b>ribs</b></font> to <font color=""#f0a""><b>punish</b></font> your crime. It’s punishment for stealing the lantern. You stole the lantern so they take the lantern and smash it into your ribs to punish you for your crime.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Feel your ribs crack and splinter as the lantern collides with your body. This punishment really hurts. How could they punish you like this? It’s so cruel!</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>募<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>recruit</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Power, Greenhouse</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">A <font color=""#0af""><b>greenhouse</b></font> is the newest <font color=""#0af""><b>power</b></font> of the city you decided to <font color=""#f0a""><b>recruit</b></font>. You’re trying to recruit all the buildings in town and the greenhouse was the next on your list. It adds just a little but of power to the town, but it's important nonetheless.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine what you had to do to recruit this greenhouse. Imagine schmoozing with the previous greenhouse owners to recruit them to your cause and sell you the greenhouse.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>償<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>reparation</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Leader, Prize</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The <font color=""#0af""><b>leader</b></font> presents you with a <font color=""#0af""><b>prize</b></font> as <font color=""#f0a""><b>reparation</b></font> for his past deeds. This leader wronged you in the past and wishes to make amends. Therefore the leader presents you with a reparation in the form of a glittering prize.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine receiving your reparation prize. Feel the prize in your hand. It’s all wrapped up but it’s heavy and feels expensive. What could it be?</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>抵<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>resist</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Ground, Duck, Nailbat</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Carrying a <font color=""#0af""><b>nailbat</b></font>, you see a <font color=""#0af""><b>duck</b></font> on the <font color=""#0af""><b>ground</b></font> and must <font color=""#f0a""><b>resist</b></font> smashing it. You hate ducks and love smashing them with nailbats. However there are old people and small children around so you must resist smashing this duck into the ground with your nailbat.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Must… resist… smashing… Imagine holding the nailbat. You really wanna smash that duck. Resist the temptation!</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>戻<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>return</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Big, Door</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">This <font color=""#0af""><b>door</b></font> is <font color=""#0af""><b>big</b></font> and you need to <font color=""#f0a""><b>return</b></font> it to its rightful owner. "<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>昭<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>shining</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Sun, Joker</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Both the <font color=""#0af""><b>sun</b></font> and the <font color=""#0af""><b>Joker</b></font> are <font color=""#f0a""><b>shining</b></font>. The sun is shining because it’s the sun and the sun is always shining. The Joker is shining because he has this big wicked grin on his face. The sun and the Joker are having a competition to see who is shining the brightest.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine both the sun and the Joker shining bright. What looks brighter in your mind? The shining glare of the sun or the shining grin of the Joker?</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>闘<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>struggle</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Measurement, Gate, Beans</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Next to a <font color=""#0af""><b>gate</b></font> there is a <font color=""#0af""><b>bean</b></font> trying to <font color=""#0af""><b>measure</b></font> out the best way to <font color=""#f0a""><b>struggle</b></font> past the guards and gain access to the private community. The gate is the entrance to a gated community and the bean wants to get outside. However, there are guards and the bean would have to struggle past to get in.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Pretend you are this bean. You want to get past that gate so bad. You go for it. "<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>執<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>tenacious</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Circle, Happiness</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text""><font color=""#0af""><b>Happiness</b></font> is a <font color=""#0af""><b>circle</b></font> and <font color=""#f0a""><b>tenacious</b></font>. Happiness is a circle because it’s meant to be shared, shared all around! Happiness is tenacious because happiness doesn’t like to let go. Happiness latches onto you and tenaciously holds on.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Envision happiness as a circular thing that’s latched onto you. It’s super tenacious. Imagine happiness screaming at you, “WHY WON’T YOU ACCEPT ME?”</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>跡<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>traces</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Foot, Red</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Your <font color=""#0af""><b>foot</b></font> is an off-<font color=""#0af""><b>red</b></font> color and you see <font color=""#f0a""><b>traces</b></font> of ink on it. What happened? Why is your foot this reddish color? What do these traces of red ink mean? Where are you?</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: As you look at your foot and examine the traces of off-red ink, try and think of what could have happened to cause this strange occurrence. Also remember that the red is an off-red color because the red radical in this kanji is slightly altered.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>削<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>whittle down</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Moon, Triceratops, Ribs</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">A <font color=""#0af""><b>triceratops</b></font> attacks the <font color=""#0af""><b>moon</b></font> with his own <font color=""#0af""><b>ribs</b></font> in an attempt to <font color=""#f0a""><b>whittle down</b></font> the moon. The triceratops is not the smartest dinosaur so that is why it tore out its own ribs to attack the moon. It uses its ribs to whittle down the moon, both physically and emotionally.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Hear the scraping sound as the triceratops continues to whittle down the moon with its ribs. Scrape, scrape, scrape.</i></span><p> "

"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>齢<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>age</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Orders, Tooth</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You have to stop the <font color=""#0af""><b>tooth</b></font> that <font color=""#0af""><b>orders</b></font> you to <font color=""#f0a""><b>age</b></font>. No anesthetic. This is incredibly painful at any age.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>宜<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>best regards</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Helmet, Top Hat</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You wear a&nbsp;<b><font color=""#0af"">helmet</font></b>&nbsp;on top of your&nbsp;<b><font color=""#0af"">top hat</font></b>&nbsp;if you want to give someone your&nbsp;<b style=""color: rgb(226, 0, 150);"">best regards</b>&nbsp;before you go off to war. You can't just wear one or the other. The top hat makes it polite, but the helmet helps people know that you're leaving. You need both for them to understand that you're offering your absolute best regards.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine giving someone your best regards while wearing a helmet and a top hat. Try to say it fast because wearing them both is a bit hard.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>賂<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>bribe</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Clam, Kiss</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You take a <font color=""#0af""><b>clam</b></font> and <font color=""#0af""><b>kiss</b></font> it on a <font color=""#f0a""><b>bribe</b></font>. That clam is bad news. "<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>房<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>cluster</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Direction, Door</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The <font color=""#0af""><b>door</b></font> in that <font color=""#0af""><b>direction</b></font> is among a <font color=""#f0a""><b>cluster</b></font> of doors. "<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>慮<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>consider</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Tiger, Think</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">A <font color=""#0af""><b>tiger</b></font> needs to <font color=""#0af""><b>think</b></font> and <font color=""#f0a""><b>consider</b></font> its actions before it attacks. Tigers are smart hunters, so they need to consider all options and really think through a situation.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Look at this tiger as it approaches you. Think what things it has to consider. It has to consider how big of a threat you are and so on. You need to consider how you’re going to escape from this tiger.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>託<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>consign</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Seven, Slide, Say</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">They <font color=""#0af""><b>say</b></font> if you put things on a <font color=""#0af""><b>slide</b></font>, <font color=""#0af""><b>seven</b></font> things to be exact, that’s the best way to <font color=""#f0a""><b>consign</b></font> good to someone. They say if you consign seven things to someone, you should send them over on a slide. Slide ‘em on down. All seven of ‘em.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine what seven things you consign over to this other person for safekeeping. "<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>却<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>contrary</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Stamp, Cemetery</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">In a <font color=""#0af""><b>cemetery</b></font> you stick a <font color=""#0af""><b>stamp</b></font>, something very <font color=""#f0a""><b>contrary</b></font> to your relative, on their grave. Your relative hated stamps and didn’t want anything to do with them. That’s why you sticking a stamp on their headstone in the cemetery is very contrary to their beliefs.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine what could have happened to your relative to make them have such an aversion to stamps. Some sort of accident? Stamp abuse? Something contrary to popular belief?</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>需<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>demand</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Rain, Rake</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">In the <font color=""#0af""><b>rain</b></font> I take my <font color=""#0af""><b>rake</b></font> and shake it, making a <font color=""#f0a""><b>demand</b></font> that the rain stop! I demand this rain stop right now! Don’t make me shake my rake more violently than I am currently shaking it!</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Go out into the rain and shake your rake. Imagine shouting your demand at the sky as the rain pelts you from above.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>致<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>do</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Winter, Boob Grave</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Building a <font color=""#0af""><b>boob grave</b></font> in <font color=""#0af""><b>winter</b></font> is an easy thing to <font color=""#f0a""><b>do</b></font>. It’s so easy to do that boob graves are the only kind of graves that people make in winter. The boob grave is very soft and pliable and easy to work with, even in the winter.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine what you do as you do what you do. Take the boob grave in your hands and feel its likeness to an actual boob. As you do this, also feel the chill of winter around you.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>避<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>dodge</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Water Slide, Propaganda</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You’re going down a <font color=""#0af""><b>water slide</b></font> when some <font color=""#0af""><b>propaganda</b></font> comes flying at you but you <font color=""#f0a""><b>dodge</b></font> out of the way at the last second. You don’t like getting misled by propaganda, so it’s a good thing you managed to dodge it. The water slide will now carry you further away from the propaganda and off to safety.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine yourself careening down the wet water slide, wind in your hair. See the propaganda coming at you. Visualize it as a big flaming poster, TV, magazine, whatever. Now dodge! Jerk your body out of the way violently! Do it! Hear the flaming propaganda whoosh by you.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>描<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>draw</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Rice Paddy, Nailbat, Flowers</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You see a <font color=""#0af""><b>nailbat</b></font> and some <font color=""#0af""><b>flowers</b></font> in a <font color=""#0af""><b>rice paddy</b></font> so you <font color=""#f0a""><b>draw</b></font> a picture of it. The scene is just too beautiful not to draw. You draw the rice paddy first, then the flowers, and lastly the nailbat.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine this scene as you draw it. Feel your feet in the damp rice paddy, smell the flowers, swing the nailbat. Really experience the scene as you draw it.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>刊<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>edition</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Antenna, Ribs</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">There are <font color=""#0af""><b>antenna</b></font>&nbsp;attached to your <font color=""#0af""><b>ribs</b></font> because they are the latest <font color=""#f0a""><b>edition</b></font>. These new edition ribs of yours have an antenna attached to them because they are electronic. They get a signal from space and your new edition can play music, get weather reports, and so much more!</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine having antenna sticking out of your ribs. At first it’s uncomfortable but soon you realize how useful these new edition ribs are. Super useful.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>逃<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>escape</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Omen, Water Slide</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Seeing a <font color=""#0af""><b>water slide</b></font> is a bad <font color=""#0af""><b>omen</b></font> so you should <font color=""#f0a""><b>escape</b></font> this situation. Every time you see a water slide, something bad happens, so water slides have become sort of a bad omen for you. Upon seeing a water slide, you need to escape or else something bad will happen to you.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine seeing the water slide omen and being filled with fear and anxiety of what might happen to you. You need to escape. Run! Run away from the water slide!</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>扱<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>handle</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Escalator, Nailbat</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You use a <font color=""#0af""><b>nailbat</b></font> on the <font color=""#0af""><b>escalator</b></font> to <font color=""#f0a""><b>handle</b></font> any obstacles. People, pets, luggage, all of that is easy to handle when you’ve a nailbat.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine yourself riding up the escalator with a nailbat in your hand. Imagine smacking every obstacle out of the way as you ride, hearing the screams from those around you as you handle them.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>奥<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>interior</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Big, Drop, Head, Rice</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">If there’s a <font color=""#0af""><b>drop</b></font> on your <font color=""#0af""><b>head</b></font> and the <font color=""#0af""><b>rice</b></font> is <font color=""#0af""><b>big</b></font>, you know you’re in the <font color=""#f0a""><b>interior</b></font>. And by interior, I mean you’re actually inside someone. The rice is big because you’ve shrunk to a tiny size and are inside someone’s stomach. The drop on your head is actually digestive fluid.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine being in the interior of someone’s tummy. See the big pieces of rice all around you as drops of stomach fluid continue to drop down on your head.</i></span><p> "

He needs more people to join his cause so he can get his horns removed. He’s embarrassed of them which is why he only travels at night, hence the lantern.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine this shady leader approaching you in the night. This is the tradition of the prefecture. Your ancestor started this prefecture and the tradition of his lineage is as follows. Plus the rest of the tree crabs need one last chess piece to complete their set.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine finding this tree crab in your games cabinet trying to make off with your chess piece. "<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>譲<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>defer</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Say, Nurse</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">What you&nbsp;<b><font color=""#0af"">say</font></b>&nbsp;to a&nbsp;<b><font color=""#0af"">nurse</font></b>&nbsp;he will soon&nbsp;<b style=""color: rgb(226, 0, 150);"">defer</b>&nbsp;to the doctor. He isn't going to treat you himself, sure he'll do a few things, but then he'll defer all of that to your real doctor. The person who's REALLY going to help you.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine your nurse deferring to your doctor. He wasn't going to treat you at all. Why even have nurses?</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>雇<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>employ</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Door, Turkey</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Standing in the <font color=""#0af""><b>door</b></font> is a <font color=""#0af""><b>turkey</b></font> wanting you to <font color=""#f0a""><b>employ</b></font> him. This turkey needs a job. He needs you to employ him. He’s gonna stand in your door until you give him a job.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Will you employ this turkey? Look at him. He’s very sad and poor. The turkey standing in your door really needs you to employ him.</i></span><p> "

"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>敏<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>alert</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Winter, Every</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text""><font color=""#0af""><b>Every</b></font> <font color=""#0af""><b>winter</b></font> you are <font color=""#f0a""><b>alert</b></font> for danger. Everyone knows that the worst monsters come out in the winter so you need to be alert if you want to survive.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine yourself out in the winter wilderness. You hear twigs snapping, growling, leaves rustling. You’re incredibly alert and aware of everything going on around you.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>吹<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>blow</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Mouth, Lack</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You attempt to expel wind out of your <font color=""#0af""><b>mouth</b></font> but <font color=""#0af""><b>lack</b></font> the breath to <font color=""#f0a""><b>blow</b></font> out any. You’re using your mouth and trying to blow out some air, but you are failing to do so.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Blow some air out of your mouth. It’s easy, right? Imagine what could cause you to fail at this activity.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>唱<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>chant</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Mouth, Sun</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">It is time to do the <font color=""#0af""><b>mouth</b></font> <font color=""#0af""><b>sun</b></font> <font color=""#0af""><b>sun</b></font> <font color=""#f0a""><b>chant</b></font>. Mouth! Sun sun, mouth! Sun sun! This chant you do with your mouth makes the sun rise. You’re very good at this chant.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Let’s practice the chant some more, shall we? Mouth! Sun sun, mouth! Sun sun! Mouth, sun sun mouth! Sun sun!</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>衝<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>collide</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Heavy, Go</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">If you try to&nbsp;<b><font color=""#0af"">go</font></b>&nbsp;somewhere but you're too&nbsp;<b><font color=""#0af"">heavy</font></b>&nbsp;you'll&nbsp;<b style=""color: rgb(226, 0, 150);"">collide</b>&nbsp;with everything. Cars, people, houses. You're too heavy to dodge, so you collide with it all.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imaging being too heavy to go anywhere without colliding with things.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>戒<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>commandment</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Twenty, Drunkard</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">A <font color=""#0af""><b>drunkard</b></font> of <font color=""#0af""><b>twenty</b></font> years of age thinks that a new <font color=""#f0a""><b>commandment</b></font> should be issued. “Thou shalt never be sober!” Since he’s a drunkard, this suggestion for a commandment makes sense, but only to him. He’s only twenty years old, after all.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine this twenty year old drunkard tottering around as he proclaims his new idea for a commandment. Thou shalt never be sober!</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>兼<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>concurrently</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Mona Lisa</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You examine the <font color=""#0af""><b>Mona Lisa</b></font> and paint an exact replica <font color=""#f0a""><b>concurrently</b></font>. You’re a master forger of paintings, but you need to concurrently look at the painting you forge as you paint or else the forgery will be no good.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Have you ever tried to draw something without actually looking where you’re drawing? Imagine doing this except with paints and copying the Mona Lisa. It’s pretty stressful.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>薄<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>dilute</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Specialty, Tsunami, Flowers</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The <font color=""#0af""><b>flowers</b></font> are being worked upon by a <font color=""#0af""><b>tsunami</b></font> with a <font color=""#0af""><b>specialty</b></font> for knowing how to <font color=""#f0a""><b>dilute</b></font> things. The tsunami can dilute the flowers by pouring itself onto it. A tsunami can dilute things because it is made of water. You could say that it’s its specialty.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Look at the flowers as they begin to dilute. Their color and fragrance and dimensions become weaker and more spread out. It’s really trippy to witness.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>堀<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>ditch</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Flag, Grave, Exit</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Out of the <font color=""#0af""><b>grave</b></font> you pull a <font color=""#0af""><b>flag</b></font> and then <font color=""#0af""><b>exit</b></font> the <font color=""#f0a""><b>ditch</b></font>. Someone had dug a grave in this ditch and put a flag in there to mark it. You like the flag, so you climbed into the ditch and pulled it out.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine yourself climbing in and out of this ditch to take this flag from the grave. Feel the flag pole in your hand as you climb back out of the ditch onto flat ground again.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>剤<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>dose</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Stilts, Ribs</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You use <font color=""#0af""><b>stilts</b></font> made of your own <font color=""#0af""><b>ribs</b></font> to get your daily <font color=""#f0a""><b>dose</b></font> of exercise. It’s hard to walk in stilts especially if you have no ribs, so if you need a dose of exercise that is difficult but also fun, stilts are the way to go.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine walking around in these stilts. If you’re good at it you can cover a lot of ground. This dose of exercise is the best you’ve ever had. Feel the sweat running down your face as you parade around in your stilts. Feel the hole in your side.</i></span><p> "

The fins are left over from the fish you dismembered and they do not believe it was an act of honor. Now they are just sitting on the ground on the grass, calling you out for having no honor.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Listen to what the fins have to say as they flop around on the ground in the grass. You picked the flowers from the luxuriant garden, not the drunkard, mind you. Also the drunkard has a cane, but not flowers. That’s why you picked some from your luxuriant garden and slid down your cool slide.. Now the drunkard has a cane and some flowers.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine picking these flowers from your luxuriant garden then shooting down the slide. There are so many flowers that you are simply overwhelmed by their aroma. Now hand your flowers to the drunkard and watch his face light up as he excitedly thanks you for the gift.</i></span><p> "

The lion and the pope are both bad, actually. The bad lion keeps the pope’s enemies away so the pope is free to multiply his family and gain larger influence in the land.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine the pope as he multiplies. He actually reproduces asexually so just watch the pope split into multiple popes as the bad lion fends off those who would do him harm.</i></span><p> "

The butcher may not be a protestor herself, but you always look out for your neighbors. And that means eating rice with them when they're hungry from protesting for so long.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Picture all your protesting neighbors standing and eating rice while still trying to hold their signs up. Picture the butcher eating with them. The butcher brought the rice, you know!</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>繁<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>overgrown</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Winter, Thread, Every</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text""><b><font color=""#0af"">Every</font></b> <font color=""#0af""><b>winter</b></font> the <font color=""#0af""><b>thread</b></font> fields become <font color=""#f0a""><b>overgrown</b></font>. Yes, thread grows in fields these days. And the thread grows the most in the winter because reasons. The thread gets so overgrown that you can’t even walk through it without cutting the thread down with a machete.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine trying to wade through this overgrown field of thread. It’s really difficult, and also it’s really cold because it’s winter. You shiver. Imagine chopping the thread down with your machete. Chop chop chop!</i></span><p> "

You patrol the perimeter of this waterpark and sometimes you shoot arrows at the water slide for target practice. It’s okay, no one uses that water slide, so no one is in danger.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine patrolling around this waterpark with your bow and arrows. The pillar is subservient to its tree master because the tree is so great and awesome and big and cool and stuff. Using the nailbat to reject those who would actually be good for your group, but since it’s the nailbat of injustice, you can’t really expect it to do anything good.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Hit these applicants with the nailbat of injustice as you reject them one by one. "<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>駐<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>resident</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Master, Horse</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">A <font color=""#0af""><b>horse</b></font> is your <font color=""#0af""><b>master</b></font> and you are merely a <font color=""#f0a""><b>resident</b></font> in his house. Hear him neigh out orders to you and the other residents of the horse master’s house.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>顧<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>review</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Employ, Geoduck</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You <font color=""#0af""><b>employ</b></font> a <font color=""#0af""><b>geoduck</b></font> to <font color=""#f0a""><b>review</b></font> your taxes. Geoducks are known for reviewing things well, so it makes sense to employ one when you have something to review.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Look at this geoduck you employed flopping around on your tax forms as it reviews them. It’s kind of revolting. Slap, slap, flap, slap.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>犠<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>sacrifice</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Cow, Righteousness</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The <font color=""#0af""><b>cow</b></font> of <font color=""#0af""><b>righteousness</b></font> is always there for us. He is the cow that must <font color=""#f0a""><b>sacrifice</b></font> himself for us to survive. What righteousness this cow has!</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: The reason he is sacrificing himself is so we can all eat! Yum! This cow is special though.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>獲<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>seize</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Stool, Turkey, Flowers, Animal</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You see an <font color=""#0af""><b>animal</b></font> with some <font color=""#0af""><b>flowers</b></font> and a <font color=""#0af""><b>turkey</b></font> on a <font color=""#0af""><b>stool</b></font> trying to <font color=""#f0a""><b>seize</b></font> them. The animal with the flowers is really tall so the turkey needs to stand on the stool in its attempt to seize the flowers.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Look at this turkey straining itself on the stool trying to seize the flowers, grunting with effort. "<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>鋭<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>sharp</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Gold, Guard</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The&nbsp;<b><font color=""#0af"">guard</font></b>&nbsp;guarding the&nbsp;<b><font color=""#0af"">gold</font></b>&nbsp;has a really&nbsp;<b style=""color: rgb(226, 0, 150);"">sharp</b>&nbsp;sword. At least, he should if he wants to guard the gold well. If he has a dull sword, bad guys could just walk on by him.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Picture how sharp the guard's sword is. It shines in the sunlight. It could cut anything, it's so sharp!</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>敷<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>spread</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Cross, Rice Paddy, Direction, Winter</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Taking a <font color=""#0af""><b>cross</b></font>, you walk through the <font color=""#0af""><b>rice paddy</b></font> in the <font color=""#0af""><b>direction</b></font> of <font color=""#0af""><b>winter</b></font> and <font color=""#f0a""><b>spread</b></font> your arms wide. You spread your arms to halt the approach of winter because your rice paddy is not done growing yet. You take the cross with you for some extra religious power of persuasion.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine facing the direction of the approaching winter while facing away from the rice paddy. Feel the weight of the cross in your hands as you spread your arms and implore the winter to hold off on its arrival.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>透<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>transparent</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Pine, Stairs, Water Slide</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">There is a <font color=""#0af""><b>water slide</b></font> made from <font color=""#0af""><b>pine</b></font> next to some <font color=""#0af""><b>stairs</b></font> that are <font color=""#f0a""><b>transparent</b></font>. Since the stairs are transparent, they’re really hard to see so it almost looks like the water slide has no way to ascend it. Once you get closer though, you can see that there are actually stairs to get up there.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine ascending these transparent stairs. The water slide is up really high and being able to see through the stairs is making you really uncomfortable.</i></span><p> "

Why would this boob abandon its weapon, a trident, by a tree? Why would it abandon the only thing that can protect it from harm? The boob runs away from the tree with tears in its eyes.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine the boob as it jiggles away from the trident it just abandoned. "<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>至<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>attain</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Boob Grave</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">After unearthing a <font color=""#0af""><b>boob grave</b></font>, you <font color=""#f0a""><b>attain</b></font> a boob. "<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>拠<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>based on</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Winter, Table, Nailbat</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">A <font color=""#0af""><b>nailbat</b></font> takes time in the <font color=""#0af""><b>winter</b></font> to reflect on the <font color=""#0af""><b>table</b></font> it was <font color=""#f0a""><b>based on</b></font>. The creator of the nailbat had a table he really liked, so that’s what the nailbat’s design was based on. The nailbat’s creator died in the winter, so this is why the nailbat takes time each winter to reflect on his creator and the table he was based on. Winter is a tough time for the nailbat.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine the nailbat out in the winter cold, reflecting on the table he was based on. It’s really cold out and the wind and snow are blowing, but the nailbat cares not. Keep in mind that the winter is a bit altered, as this is a tumultuous time for the nailbat as he remembers his long dead creator.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>蜂<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>bee</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Winter, Insect, Signpost</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The <font color=""#0af""><b>insect</b></font> in <font color=""#0af""><b>winter</b></font> that lands on a <font color=""#0af""><b>signpost</b></font> is a <font color=""#f0a""><b>bee</b></font>. "<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>侵<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>invade</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Stool, Forehead, Leader, Wolverine</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">There is a tiny <font color=""#0af""><b>leader</b></font> on <font color=""#0af""><b>Wolverine</b></font>’s <font color=""#0af""><b>forehead</b></font> sitting on a <font color=""#0af""><b>stool</b></font> and commanding his troops to <font color=""#f0a""><b>invade</b></font> Wolverine’s brain. "<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>伺<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>pay respects</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Leader, Director</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Your&nbsp;<b><font color=""#0af"">leader</font></b>&nbsp;is also a&nbsp;<b><font color=""#0af"">director</font></b>&nbsp;so you need to&nbsp;<b style=""color: rgb(226, 0, 150);"">pay respects</b>&nbsp;to him before you can start filming. "<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>徹<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>penetrate</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Moon, Winter, Loiter, Boob</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You <font color=""#0af""><b>loiter</b></font> around to see the <font color=""#0af""><b>boob</b></font> <font color=""#0af""><b>moon</b></font> that only comes out in the <font color=""#0af""><b>winter</b></font>. It's like a full moon, except it looks like a boob in the sky and it only happens once in the winter season. As you're staring up at it, all of a sudden something flies into it, so hard that it <font color=""#f0a""><b>penetrate</b></font>s the surface and disappears inside.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: You're not sure if you saw what you think you saw, as it only happened in a second. Think about whether or not you actually saw it.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>瀬<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>rapids, shallows</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Ent, Tsunami, Geoduck</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">A <font color=""#0af""><b>tsunami</b></font> crashes into an <font color=""#0af""><b>ent</b></font> and a <font color=""#0af""><b>geoduck</b></font>, knocking them into some <font color=""#f0a""><b>rapids</b></font> whereupon they get washed into the <font color=""#f0a""><b>shallows</b></font>. Being scared for their lives, the ent and geoduck flail around the entire time.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Look at the ent and the geoduck flailing around in terror as they get washed through the raging rapids and into the shallows. Hear them splashing about as they scream and yell for help.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>墟<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>ruins</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Grave, Tiger, Cactus</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Surrounding the <font color=""#0af""><b>grave</b></font> of a <font color=""#0af""><b>tiger</b></font> is a <font color=""#0af""><b>cactus</b></font> and some <font color=""#f0a""><b>ruins</b></font>. The tiger was the hero of the desert, which is why they made a nice grave for him here next to a cactus and the ruins that used to be his kingdom. This tiger used to have a whole kingdom all to himself. But now it is just ruins.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine looking at these ruins around the tiger’s grave. Most of the ruins are tiger themed with tiger busts and carvings everywhere. Just look at them all!</i></span><p> "

You remember this nailbat. It is a nailbat which you <font color=""#f0a""><b>set aside</b></font> for this very purpose! It's dusty and old and from long ago, but you knew this day would come. You pick up the nailbat and go outside.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: You can imagine what's outside waiting for you (that would require setting aside a nailbat), but the important thing is you feel the relief from finding the nailbat that your past self put there. What a good thinker you were. You set it aside for yourself in the future, knowing this day would come!</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>誠<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>sincerity</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Say, Become</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Something you <font color=""#0af""><b>say</b></font> to someone you <font color=""#0af""><b>become</b></font> attached to should be said with <font color=""#f0a""><b>sincerity</b></font>. It’s very pretty.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine walking through your lawn and smelling all the flowers as you travel over the rolling hills. What a delightful lawn this is.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>肝<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>liver</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Moon, Antenna</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The <font color=""#0af""><b>moon</b></font> has an <font color=""#0af""><b>antenna</b></font> on it that sends a signal directly to your <font color=""#f0a""><b>liver</b></font> to tell you whether or not your liver is doing okay.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Go ahead and have a drink. Your liver has to process that. When you drink, the moon antenna signal sends you an alert. When you don't, it is all fine and dandy.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>喪<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>mourning</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Cross, Mouth, Clothes</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You have a <font color=""#0af""><b>cross</b></font> in your <font color=""#0af""><b>mouth</b></font>, and also in your <font color=""#0af""><b>mouth</b></font> you have some <font color=""#0af""><b>clothes</b></font> to muffle the sounds of your <font color=""#f0a""><b>mourning</b></font>. You’re mourning your Christian grandmother’s death. That’s why you have a cross. The reason you have all these things in your mouth is because you had been mourning so loudly and for so long, your family was getting annoyed. These things are in your mouth to keep your mourning noises to a minimum.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine having a cross in your mouth and also some clothes. Taste the wood of the cross and the cloth of the clothes as you feel a strong sense of mourning for having lost your grandma.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>網<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>netting</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Thread, Hill</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You have a <font color=""#0af""><b>thread</b></font> <font color=""#0af""><b>hill</b></font>, but the hill is a bit weird looking (take a look at the hill radical in this kanji). It's not any normal hill, it's a weird lumpy hill that isn't quite right. That's because it is a thread hill of <font color=""#f0a""><b>netting</b></font>, and parts of the nets have caught things, like fish and cats, so there's weird abnormal lumps in them.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: You'll need to differentiate this from 綱, which uses the same radicals (though 綱 has a real hill radical). Just remember that the weird 'hill' has stuff caught in it because it is <font color=""#f0a""><b>netting</b></font>.</span></span></i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>克<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>overcome</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Legs, Old</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Even though you’ve <font color=""#0af""><b>old</b></font> <font color=""#0af""><b>legs</b></font>, you <font color=""#f0a""><b>overcome</b></font> your disability. You're super interested in studying it, in fact, so you try to <font color=""#f0a""><b>enroll</b></font> in the group that gets to study it.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine yourself going to the research lab that is involved with studying this anomaly. "<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>露<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>expose, dew</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Foot, Rain, Kiss</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">If the&nbsp;<b><font color=""#0af"">rain</font></b>&nbsp;touches your&nbsp;<b><font color=""#0af"">foot</font></b>&nbsp;and gives it a little rain&nbsp;<b><font color=""#0af"">kiss</font></b>, you know that part of your foot is&nbsp;<b style=""color: rgb(226, 0, 150);"">expose</b>d to the elements. You can also see some&nbsp;<b style=""color: rgb(226, 0, 150);"">dew</b>&nbsp;forming on your exposed foot. So that's what rain kisses are!</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Ugh, you shouldn't have bought these open toed shoes, at least not during rainy season!</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>炉<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>furnace</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Fire, Door</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">A <font color=""#0af""><b>fire</b></font> <font color=""#0af""><b>door</b></font> is a door that leads to something full of fire. That thing is a <font color=""#f0a""><b>furnace</b></font>.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Open the fire door and feel the heat of the <font color=""#f0a""><b>furnace</b></font>.
