"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>偏<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>biased</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Leader, Bookshelf</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The <b><font color=""#0af"">leader</font></b> of that <b><font color=""#0af"">bookshelf</font></b> thinks that all the books on it are better than everyone else's books. He's a very <b><font color=""#f0a"">biased</font></b> person. If he wasn't the leader of that specific bookshelf he'd probably feel differently.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine showing the leader your favorite book. If he doesn't see it on his bookshelf he'll tell you it sucks. That's so biased! He didn't even read it...</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>茨<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>briar, thorn</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Flowers, Next</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">If you look at <b><font color=""#0af"">flowers</font></b> the first thing you notice are the leaves and petals themselves, then the <b>next</b> thing you notice are the <b><font color=""#f0a"">briar</font></b>s. You never see <b><font color=""#f0a"">thorn</font></b>s first, only after you've looked at the flowers.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine what you see next after looking at the pretty flowers. The brairs are what you see next. Spiky and sharp. It would have been nice if you had seen them first.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>陥<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>cave in</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Enclosure, Stick, Sun, Butcher</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">When a <b><font color=""#0af"">butcher</font></b> tries to build an <b><font color=""#0af"">enclosure</font></b> made out of <b><font color=""#0af"">stick</font></b>s around the <b><font color=""#0af"">sun</font></b>, you can bet it's going to result in a <b><font color=""#f0a"">cave in</font></b>. The sun is way too strong to let an enclosure of sticks stop it from shining.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Picture the butcher being crushed by the cave in of sticks. Picture the sun being exposed as the sticks fall onto him.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>鎖<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>chain</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Triceratops, Clam, Gold</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The famous <font color=""#0af""><b>gold</b> <b>triceratops</b> <b>clam</b></font> is good for only one thing, and that's being made into <b><font color=""#f0a"">chain</font></b>s. They link their triceratops horns together and form an unbreakable gold chain. You can't eat them, because they're gold. So they're only really good for their chaining together ability.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Picture these little gold clams, triceratops horns linking them together in a chain around your neck. Feel them hanging there. Sparkly and cold.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>賠<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>compensation</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Clam, Clown</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You give a bunch of <b><font color=""#0af"">clam</font></b>s to a <b><font color=""#0af"">clown</font></b> as <b><font color=""#f0a"">compensation</font></b>. The clown did you some favors, and everyone knows clowns only accept clams as a form of currency. So your compensation is clams.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Picture the clams in your hands. Picture handing them over to the clown as compensation for the unspeakable acts you had him do for you.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>恒<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>constant, always</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Ground, Fish Stick, Sunrise</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">If you wake up at <b><font color=""#0af"">sunrise</font></b> and look outside at the <b><font color=""#0af"">ground</font></b> you'll see a <b><font color=""#0af"">fish stick</font></b>. This is a <b><font color=""#f0a"">constant</font></b>. If you look at the right time you will <b><font color=""#f0a"">always</font></b> see it. I promise. Try tomorrow morning if you don't believe me.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine constantly waking up at sunrise just to peek outside at the ground to see the fish stick sitting out there. It's always there. You wonder why.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>綾<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>design</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Thread, Frostbite</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You're sewing something with <b><font color=""#0af"">thread</font></b> but you and your creation get <b><font color=""#0af"">frostbite</font></b> while you're still working. Luckily the snowflakes freeze themselves into the cloth and turn into a pretty <b><font color=""#f0a"">design</font></b>. They swirl around and press a unique snowy design into the fabric. This is nice for you because you can't sew anymore with your frostbitten hands.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine holding your creation in your frostbitten hands as the snowflake design starts to appear. The design gets more and more complicated the longer you watch, twisting this way and that, like it's dancing in front of your eyes.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>没<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>die</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Tsunami, Ikea</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">If a <b><font color=""#0af"">tsunami</font></b> were to hit <b><font color=""#0af"">ikea</font></b>, everyone inside would <b><font color=""#f0a"">die</font></b>. That's why, if you want to live, you should never go to ikea during a tsunami.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine all the people in ikea watching as a tsunami approaches. If they don't get out of there, they'll all die.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>擁<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>embrace</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Lid, Nailbat, Poop, Turkey</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You see a <b><font color=""#0af"">nailbat</font></b> sitting next to a <b><font color=""#0af"">lid</font></b> covering something, so you lift it and see a <b><font color=""#0af"">turkey</font></b> next to some <b><font color=""#0af"">poop</font></b> in there. The turkey looks so sad and you can't help but take it out of there and <b><font color=""#f0a"">embrace</font></b> it. Who would put a turkey under a lid stuck with poop?! And then leave a nailbat... what were they planning? You embrace the turkey tighter.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine embracing the poor turkey. Imagine what the people who put it here were going to do. Now embrace the poor thing harder.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>遭<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>encounter, meet</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Ground, Sun, Water Slide, Music</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">When you combine a <b><font color=""#0af"">water slide</font></b>, <b><font color=""#0af"">music</font></b> on the <b><font color=""#0af"">ground</font></b>, and the <b><font color=""#0af"">sun</font></b> in summer, you're bound to <b><font color=""#f0a"">encounter</font></b> a whole bunch of new people. In fact, this probably the best way to <b><font color=""#f0a"">meet</font></b> new people, since everybody loves sliding down water slides and listening to music in the summer sun.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Picture yourself encountering a bunch of new people as you lay on the ground listening to music in the sun as everyone slides down the water slide. Everyone you encounter here just wants to have fun!</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>噴<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>erupt</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Cross, Mouth, Clam, Flowers</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">If you try to shove enough <b><font color=""#0af"">flowers</font></b> into the <b><font color=""#0af"">mouth</font></b> of a <b><font color=""#0af"">clam</font> </b>by hammering them in there with a <b><font color=""#0af"">cross</font></b> it will <b><font color=""#f0a"">erupt</font></b>. The flowers will fly everywhere and it will be really pretty. At least that's what you hope will happen.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine using a cross to bash a bunch of flowers into a clams mouth hole thing. It's hard work, but the eruption that results will be worth it. Imagine what a clam erupting with flowers will look like.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>殊<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>especially</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Slide, Bad, Jet</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">A <font color=""#0af""><b>bad</b> <b>jet</b></font> will <b><font color=""#0af"">slide</font></b> <b><font color=""#f0a"">especially</font></b> far to one side. Not a little, not an okay amount, an especially drastic slide to one direction or the other. And it's especially dangerous to be in one while it's sliding!</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Think about how especially steep the bad jet it sliding. Feel especially bad about whoever is in there.</i></span><p> "

Majestic.</i></span><p> "

"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>惰<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>lazy</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Construction, Moon, Narwhal, Fish Stick</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">If you tell a <b><font color=""#0af"">narwhal</font></b> to start <b><font color=""#0af"">construction</font></b> of a replica of the <b><font color=""#0af"">moon</font></b> made out of <b><font color=""#0af"">fish stick</font></b>s, you'll realize just how <b><font color=""#f0a"">lazy</font></b> they are. So lazy.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Picture the lazy narwhal, laying on the beach next to a pile of fish sticks staring up at the moon. It isn't going to start construction. "<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>怠<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>lazy, neglect</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Mouth, Pile, Heart</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">If you <b><font color=""#0af"">pile</font></b> food into your <b><font color=""#0af"">mouth</font></b> to fill your broken <b><font color=""#0af"">heart</font></b> you'll just get really <b><font color=""#f0a"">lazy</font></b>. Food can't fill you heart. And food will just make you slower and more sad. Being lazy isn't going to make this any better.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Picture yourself piling food into your mouth and pretending it's going into your heart while you become lazier and lazier. You can't even reach the food eventually because you're too lazy to raise your hands to get it.</i></span><p> "

"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>秩<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>order, regularity</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Pine, Fault</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">If a <b><font color=""#0af"">pine</font></b> has a <b><font color=""#0af"">fault</font></b> and it's found then it needs to be put back in <b><font color=""#f0a"">order</font></b>. Pine trees must be perfectly straight and tall, otherwise they'll be cut down. So special people will go out and check them to confirm their <b><font color=""#f0a"">regularity</font></b>. When their parents are dead. You only give an <b><font color=""#f0a"">orphan</font></b> a melon. "<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>貫<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>pierce, sushi counter</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Clam, Window</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Put a <b><font color=""#0af"">clam</font></b> on a <b><font color=""#0af"">window</font></b> sill and then slam the window shut to <b><font color=""#f0a"">pierce</font></b> the clam's tough shell. This is the best way to pierce a clam, I promise.  This kanji also has a second meaning. That clam you pierced with the window is in two halves now. You can use those halves as plates for sushi. If you count the broken shells you'll know how much sushi you have. That makes them&nbsp;<b><font color=""#f0a"">sushi counter</font></b>s!</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine the window piercing into the clam shell. "<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>糧<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>provisions</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Rice, Sunflower, Sunrise</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Once the <b><font color=""#0af"">sunrise</font></b> appears all of your <b><font color=""#0af"">rice</font></b> and <b><font color=""#0af"">sunflower</font></b>s will be turned into <b><font color=""#f0a"">provisions</font></b> for the army. "<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>颯<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>quick</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Stand, Wind</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">If you <b><font color=""#0af"">stand</font></b> in the <b><font color=""#0af"">wind</font></b> it will be really <b><font color=""#f0a"">quick</font></b> to knock you over. So quick that you probably won't even know the wind did it. You'll end up standing up again just to be knocked over again, just as quick.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine how quick the wind knocks you over when you stand up. "<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>慢<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>ridicule</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Sun, Stool, Sauron, Fish Stick</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text""><b><font color=""#0af"">Sauron</font></b> sits on a <b><font color=""#0af"">stool</font></b> in the <b><font color=""#0af"">sun</font></b> eating <b><font color=""#0af"">fish</font> <font color=""#0af"">stick</font></b>s while he <b><font color=""#f0a"">ridicule</font></b>s his troops. "<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>膨<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>swell</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Grave, Hair, Moon, Beans</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">If you sit on a <b><font color=""#0af"">grave</font></b> and plant some <b><font color=""#0af"">beans</font></b> in your <b><font color=""#0af"">hair</font></b> during the full <b><font color=""#0af"">moon</font></b>, your hair will <b><font color=""#f0a"">swell</font></b> to enormous size. If you've been suffering from flat, boring hair, this is the only remedy.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine yourself sitting on the grave, beans in your hair, the full moon rising in the distance. "<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>遇<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>treatment</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Water Slide, Splinter</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">If <b><font color=""#0af"">Splinter</font></b> slips down a <b><font color=""#0af"">water</font> <font color=""#0af"">slide</font></b> he'll need <b><font color=""#f0a"">treatment</font></b> as soon as he hits the bottom! How did this happen?!</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine what kind of treatment Splinter will need after hurdling down a water slide at top speed.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>諭<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>admonish</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Say, Death Star</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">If you tried to get the <b><font color=""#0af"">death</font> <font color=""#0af"">star</font></b> to <b><font color=""#0af"">say</font></b> something it would only <b><font color=""#f0a"">admonish</font></b> you. It was made to destroy planets, after all, so I don't know why you'd expect it to have anything nice to say. It just admonishes you about everything you've ever done wrong until you can't stop crying.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine being admonished by the death star. It's hovering above you, giant and round, just yelling at you about everything you've ever messed up. It's really awful being yelled at. But the death star doing it is particularly scary and embarrassing.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>随<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>all</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Water Slide, Butcher, Have</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">If you let a <b><font color=""#0af"">butcher</font></b> have a <b><font color=""#0af"">water</font> <font color=""#0af"">slide</font></b> he'll end up wanting to <b><font color=""#0af"">have</font></b> it <b><font color=""#f0a"">all</font></b>! You can't let him have that water slide. Once he gets going he can't be stopped. All the water slides, all the pool toys, all the ducks. He'll take them ALL! Don't you see?</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Picture the butcher hugging the water slide you gave him. Now he's hugging all the water slides. Uh oh.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>胡<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>barbarian</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Moon, Old</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Who will you find dancing under the <b><font color=""#0af"">old</font></b> <b><font color=""#0af"">moon</font></b>? <b><font color=""#f0a"">Barbarian</font></b>s! Japan has so many pretty colored carp because they have just as many sunflowers. The fish eat the sunflowers and turn into all kinds of pretty colors, becoming famous Japanese carp, also known as <b><font color=""#f0a"">koi</font></b>.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine feeding a sunflower to an ordinary fish and watch as the color spreads from its mouth, down its back, and to the rest of its fishy body. "<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>艇<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>rowboat</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">King, Sail, Big Bird</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You decide to <b><font color=""#0af"">sail</font></b> with <b><font color=""#0af"">big</font> <font color=""#0af"">bird</font></b> who just so happens to be the <b><font color=""#0af"">king</font></b>. But you just end up rowing him around in a rowboat all day.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Picture yourself in the rowboat with king big bird. Think about how disappointed you are to not be sailing in a grand vessel, and instead how you're aching arms are stuck rowing this rowboat.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>丹<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>rust colored</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Sail</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">This is a <b><font color=""#0af"">sail</font></b>, but it's missing some pieces. That's because it's really rusty, so parts are falling off of it and it looks <b><font color=""#f0a"">rust colored</font></b>. It's getting more and more rusty as time goes on.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Picture this half broken, rust colored sail. It's like a reddish-brown color and it's definitely missing some important pieces.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>緋<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>scarlet</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Thread, Injustice</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text""><b><font color=""#0af"">Thread</font></b> signifying <b><font color=""#0af"">injustice</font></b> is always going to be <b><font color=""#f0a"">scarlet</font></b> colored. Haven't you ever red the Scarlet Letter? That scarlet thread used to sew the A on her shirt marks the injustice of doing what she did. People are marked with red when other people think what they did was really crummy.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine sewing a big scarlet A on the clothes of someone who's caused some kind of injustice in your life. It's so bright and red, you know everyone will hate them too now.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>准<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>semi</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Ice, Turkey</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Put a <b><font color=""#0af"">turkey</font></b> on <b><font color=""#0af"">ice</font></b> and it will only get <b><font color=""#f0a"">semi</font></b> frozen. What the heck!</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine covering a turkey in ice and every time you check it, it's only semi frozen. It doesn't matter what you do, it just refuses to freeze all the way through.</i></span><p> "

"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>疎<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>neglect</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Coat Rack, Ent</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">An <b><font color=""#0af"">ent</font></b> will give up on life and become a <b><font color=""#0af"">coat</font> <font color=""#0af"">rack</font></b> if you <b><font color=""#f0a"">neglect</font></b> it. Ents need lots of love and care. You have to water them, fertilize and prune them, but you didn't and now your friend the ent has given up it's life to become a coat rack.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine your sadness to see the ent you've been neglecting is now a lumpy coat rack, sitting outside your door.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>謡<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>noh chanting</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Say, Satellite</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Whatever you <b><font color=""#0af"">say</font></b> through a <b><font color=""#0af"">satellite</font></b> turns into <b><font color=""#f0a"">Noh chanting</font></b>. It gets all drawn out and distorted from going through the satellite, which makes it SOUND like Noh chanting at least.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Say whatever you want and send it up to the satellite. Now imagine listening to it when it comes back and hearing beautiful, deep Noh chanting back!</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>哺<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>nurse</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Mouth, Wedding</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">After your <b><font color=""#0af"">wedding</font></b> you have a baby and it uses its <b><font color=""#0af"">mouth</font></b> to <b><font color=""#f0a"">nurse</font></b> from you post-marriage boobs. Yes, babies nurse from breasts. Get over it, kids.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: You waited until your wedding to have your baby and all it seems to do with its mouth is want to nurse. It doesn't cry, which is nice, but it doesn't laugh or talk either.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>栽<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>planting</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Drunkard, Redwood</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">When a <b><font color=""#0af"">drunkard</font></b> gets it in his head that he wants to grow a <b><font color=""#0af"">redwood</font></b>, he'll usually start <b><font color=""#f0a"">planting</font></b> right away. It doesn't matter where he is. Sometimes you'll see a drunkard trying to dig out weeds on the floor of a bar, behind a car in a parking lot, or even under your kitchen table. Planting is great and all, but drunkards try to do it everywhere because they're drunk and don't know the right way to do it. The redwood ends up looking kind of funny too, because they weren't planted right.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Picture a drunkard planting their funny looking redwood in the dirt by an outhouse. That redwood is going to look really funky because of this guy.</i></span><p> "

That's a big accomplishment since you're here leaning how to walk on that long bar like all the cool gymnasts. But you can't just start right away, you need lots of practice so that's why you're here in this class. But so far you got your foot on the bar already, good for you!</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Picture your foot touching the bar. This is it. This is exactly what you're at this gym to practice.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>呈<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>present, display</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Mouth, King</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">If you want your food to go into the <b><font color=""#0af"">mouth</font></b> of a <b><font color=""#0af"">king</font></b> you have to <b><font color=""#f0a"">present</font></b> it in the most attractive way possible! Whoever made it was very <b><font color=""#f0a"">proud</font></b> of this guy because it says ""We are so proud of you"" on the grave. "<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>茜<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>red dye</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Flowers, West</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text""><b><font color=""#0af"">Flowers</font></b> that grow in the <b><font color=""#0af"">west</font></b> are colored by the sun setting so they turn bright red. That's why red flowers that grow in the west are used to make <b><font color=""#f0a"">red dye</font></b>. They're the closest to the actual color of the red sun, so they're prized by painters and other artists for their perfect color for dye.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Picture yourself sitting in the west as the red sun sets, smashing those pretty red flowers into a paste to make red dye. Flowers and <b><font color=""#f0a"">crystal</font></b>s look really good together, and he can't have them out in the open because all the commoners will steal them! So your pretty flowers will be put with his huge crystal collection.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine how pretty the king's crystals reflect the colors from the flowers in his secret chamber in a central point in the castle.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>旦<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>dawn</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Sunrise</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">At <b><font color=""#0af"">sunrise</font></b> you can see the <b><font color=""#f0a"">dawn</font></b>! And it will also BE dawn.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Look at the pretty sunrise at dawn. It's so peaceful.</i></span><p> "

Everyone knows <b><font color=""#f0a"">urine</font></b> dilutes in water, and if everyone just pees in one place, it won't be gross. So go pee over by that flag when you have to go. "<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>賓<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>vip, guest</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Ground, Clam, Helmet, Few</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Put a <b><font color=""#0af"">helmet</font></b> with a <b><font color=""#0af"">few</font></b> <b><font color=""#0af"">clam</font></b>s in it on the <b><font color=""#0af"">ground</font></b> and you'll instantly become the <b><font color=""#f0a"">VIP</font></b> of the night. Well I guess you all know now, but shh don't tell.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine what it would be like to just put a few clams in a helmet, toss it on the ground, and then get the VIP treatment. Go try right now!</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>那<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>what</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Two, Sword, Butcher</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">If you hand <b><font color=""#0af"">two</font></b> <b><font color=""#0af"">sword</font></b>s to a <b><font color=""#0af"">butcher</font></b> he'll ask you <b><font color=""#f0a"">what</font></b> you want him to do with them.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine handing two swords to a butcher and just waiting while he stares at you asking ""What... WHAT?"" over and over again.</i></span><p> "

"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>尉<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>military officer</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Flag, Measurement, Jackhammer</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Who loves their <b><font color=""#0af"">flag</font></b>, using <b><font color=""#0af"">jackhammer</font></b>s, and precise <b><font color=""#0af"">measurement</font></b>s? Your <b><font color=""#f0a"">military officer</font></b>! He's always saluting the flag, jackhammering near all the new recruits to test them, and checking the measurement between the floor and their pants. Who else could it be?</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Picture a military officer doing all those things.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>靖<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>peaceful</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Stand, Blue</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text""><b><font color=""#0af"">Stand</font></b> staring up at the <b><font color=""#0af"">blue</font></b> sky and you'll feel more <b><font color=""#f0a"">peaceful</font></b> than you ever have. Blue is a color that promotes peaceful thoughts and feelings. That's why all the social media sites are blue. To stop you from being a jerk.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine how peaceful staring at the blue ocean, the blue sky, or the blue tumblr makes you.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>恭<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>respect</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Drop, Small, Together</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">When <b><font color=""#0af"">small</font></b> <b><font color=""#0af"">drop</font></b>s of water work <b><font color=""#0af"">together</font></b> they gain <b><font color=""#f0a"">respect</font></b> for one another. If you end up working with someone long enough, and they end up being really great, you'll respect them too!</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine being a small drop of water and seeing other drops of water come to help you by working together. You'd really respect them, right?</i></span><p> "

Thread can really only be made into other things by sewing, so unless you know someone else who can, you're gonna have to learn how to sew.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Don't worry, sewing is pretty easy, you'll have a signpost telling those kids not to ride the water slide in winter in no time!</i></span><p> "

Most white sails don't really just drift around at sea without a ship to be attached to. Try this with deer and moose and sheep. They'll take a couple sips of the alcohol and then stand perfectly still for the rest of the day. The just freeze up and when you come back hours later, they'll still be there. Not moving.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Picture the horned sheep drinking the alcohol you offer it. The rice paddy was just too big, rice was popping out of it and hitting people and birds and causing injuries. The whole world was going out of wack! That's why you had to go put it in an enclosure. "<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>腸<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>intestines, guts</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Moon, Gravity</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The <b><font color=""#0af"">moon</font></b> doesn't have any <b><font color=""#0af"">gravity</font></b> so when you go there your <b><font color=""#f0a"">intestines</font></b> will float around inside your body and sometimes they'll try to come out of your mouth. When nothing is there to hold them down they just kind of go where they please. "<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>瑠<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>lapis lazuli</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">King, Pile, Rice Paddy, Sword</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The <b><font color=""#0af"">king</font></b> threw a <b><font color=""#0af"">pile</font></b> of <b><font color=""#0af"">sword</font></b>s in a <b><font color=""#0af"">rice</font> <font color=""#0af"">paddy</font></b> and told us that the first person to get the most <b><font color=""#f0a"">lapis lazuli</font></b> and give it to him would be allowed to live. But how are you supposed to dig with a sword? It doesn't matter, dig and look for blue rocks!</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine being told by the king that you have to use a pile of swords to find lapis lazuli for him or you'll be killed. What do you do?</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>乙<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>latter</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Nose</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Your <b><font color=""#0af"">nose</font></b> isn't the first thing people see about your face, it's the <b><font color=""#f0a"">latter</font></b>. They see your eyes THEN your nose, then your mouth, in order going down. Just label them A <b><font color=""#f0a"">B</font></b> and C and you'll never forget!</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine saying A B C as you look down someones face at their eyes, nose and mouth. Their nose is B!</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>楓<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>maple</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Tree, Wind</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">A <b><font color=""#0af"">tree</font></b> that does well in the <b><font color=""#0af"">wind</font></b> is a <b><font color=""#f0a"">maple</font></b> tree. Maple trees don't have fruit so the wind can't knock anything off of it. They don't seem upset, they actually seem really happy.</i></span><p> "

Two tatami mats, that it. A lot of people can't, and die. Then again, you managed to endure touching ice long enough to get frostbite in the first place, so maybe this is baby stuff for you.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine having to endure the pain of frostbite because you were a jerk who put his hand on ice for a few hours.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>藩<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>fiefdom</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Flowers, Tsunami, Number</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You have to reach a certain <b><font color=""#0af"">number</font></b> of <b><font color=""#0af"">flowers</font></b> and <b><font color=""#0af"">tsunami</font></b>s hits to become a legitimate <b><font color=""#f0a"">fiefdom</font></b>. At least in the old days. If you don't meet one of these conditions, like if you get hit by tsunamis all the time but you only have two or three flowers that will grow, you can't be your own fiefdom.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine being the person who has to check whether each fiefdom has enough flowers and tsunamis per year to keep their status.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>譜<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>genealogy, score</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Sun, Say, Line Up</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">If you <b><font color=""#0af"">say</font></b> the <b><font color=""#0af"">lineup</font></b> of your family members that have lived on this earth under the <b><font color=""#0af"">sun</font></b>, you're really explaining your <b><font color=""#f0a"">genealogy</font></b>.<br>This kanji has a second meaning too. It means score. So if you're <b><font color=""#0af"">say</font></b>ing the the <b><font color=""#0af"">line up</font></b> of what happened today under the <b><font color=""#0af"">sun</font></b> you're really just saying the <b><font color=""#f0a"">score</font></b> of a game. So which is it? Are you talking about the past or something that happened today? That's what makes the difference.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Say the line up of what happened under the sun. It's the genealogy of your family or the score of your game!</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>璃<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>glassy</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">King, Rocket</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">If you want to make a <b><font color=""#0af"">rocket</font></b> the <b><font color=""#0af"">king</font></b> will like, you have to make the whole thing look <b><font color=""#f0a"">glassy</font></b>. It won't be very stable, and it probably won't work, but making it glassy and pretty is the only way to make the king will approve.If you want to make a rocket the king will like, you have to make the whole thing look glassy. It won't be very stable, and it probably won't work, but making it glassy and pretty is the only way to make the king will approve.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine a king who won't accept a rocket that isn't made of glassy material. "<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>絹<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>silk</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Mouth, Moon, Thread</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Put <b><font color=""#0af"">thread</font></b> in the <b><font color=""#0af"">mouth</font></b> of a worm while the <b><font color=""#0af"">moon</font></b> is out and it will poop out some <b><font color=""#f0a"">silk</font></b>. That's why they call them silkworms, didn't you know? But it has to be while the moon is out, otherwise normal thread will come right back out the other end of the worm. The moon is what makes the magic happen.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Picture feeding some thread into the mouth of a worm as the light from the full moon shines in on you. See the silk come out of the worms butt and into your hands.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>窃<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>steal</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Seven, Sword, Hole</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You see <b><font color=""#0af"">seven</font></b> <b><font color=""#0af"">sword</font></b>s just sitting in a <b><font color=""#0af"">hole</font></b> and so you decide to <b><font color=""#f0a"">steal</font></b> them. Feel the urge to steal them all. Do it, do it!</i></span><p> "

"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>礁<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>reef</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Stone, Fish Tail, Turkey</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text""><b><font color=""#0af"">Turkey</font></b>s that grow <b><font color=""#0af"">fish</font> <font color=""#0af"">tail</font></b>s have to hide in <b><font color=""#0af"">stone</font></b>s underwater because they aren't quite turkeys and they aren't quite fish, so they can't just live anywhere in the open or they'll get made fun of. That's why they live in <b><font color=""#f0a"">reef</font></b>s in the ocean. That way the turkeys can't find them and the fish can't see them through the rock bunches!</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine being a turkey who grew a weird fish tail and having to spend the rest of your life hiding in an underwater reef.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>峠<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>ridge</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Mountain, Above, Below</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">If you look at what's <b><font color=""#0af"">above</font></b> and <b><font color=""#0af"">below</font></b> a <b><font color=""#0af"">mountain</font></b> you'll just see a bunch of <b><font color=""#f0a"">ridge</font></b>s. Mountains are made of ridges going up and down, that's why they're so pointy and so hard to climb.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine looking off the edge of a mountain at all the big ridges going above and below it.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>沙<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>sand</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Tsunami, Few</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">People think <b><font color=""#0af"">tsunami</font></b>s are only made of water but they have a <b><font color=""#0af"">few</font></b> pieces of <b><font color=""#f0a"">sand</font></b> in there too. There's actually more sand in the ocean than most people think. And tsunamis can't just have water and sharks in them. A few grains of sand will always slip in.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine how those few grains of sand feel to get swept up into a tsunami. They didn't ask for this. This guy's probably gonna die.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine the scorn on Sauron's (eye)face as a drunkard tries to butter him up by slide dropping flowers at his feet. "<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>謹<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>humble, discreet</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Say, Kiln</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You want to <b><font color=""#0af"">say</font></b> something in private so you have them meet you inside a <b><font color=""#0af"">kiln</font></b> so you can be more <b><font color=""#f0a"">humble</font></b> and <b><font color=""#f0a"">discreet</font></b> about it. There's no humbler a place than an giant oven full of lumpy pottery. So say whatever you want and the other person should understand you're trying to lower yourself.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine taking someone inside a kiln to say what you want to say but while being humble about it. This way no one can get mad at you for rewarding or being rewarded in front of everyone else.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>藍<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>indigo</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Flowers, Oversee</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text""><b><font color=""#0af"">Flowers</font></b> that you <b><font color=""#0af"">oversee</font></b> are always <b><font color=""#f0a"">indigo</font></b>. You aren't sure why though...</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine if every flower you were supposed to oversee was indigo. Indigo everywhere!</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>桟<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>jetty, pier</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Tree, Bar</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Carve a <b><font color=""#0af"">tree</font></b> into a <b><font color=""#0af"">bar</font></b> and lay it sticking out into the water to make a <b><font color=""#f0a"">jetty</font></b> or a <b><font color=""#f0a"">pier</font></b>. Now you can walk out on the jetty and go further into the water without needing a boat or getting wet.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine laying your tree turned bar into the water to make your own jetty. Innovative!</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>殉<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>martyr</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Enclosure, Sun, Bad</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">If you try to hide in a <b><font color=""#0af"">bad</font> <font color=""#0af"">enclosure</font></b> from the <b><font color=""#0af"">sun</font></b> it's not going to work, you'll die of exposure, and become a <b><font color=""#f0a"">martyr</font></b> for people who have no shelter. Soon homeless people will look to you as an example of what they shouldn't have to become. You'll be their hero, like a lot of martyrs become. That doesn't really help you stop being dead though, sorry.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine people calling you a martyr because you tried to hide from the hot sun in a bad enclosure and died. It's nice that they remembered you, at least.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>坑<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>pit</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Lid, Grave, Table</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You see the <b><font color=""#0af"">lid</font></b> of a <b><font color=""#0af"">grave</font></b> under your kitchen <b><font color=""#0af"">table</font></b> and lift it to find a <b><font color=""#f0a"">pit</font></b> right in your house! Who dug this? Where did this grave lid even come from? Why would someone dig a pit under your table in the first place?</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine moving the grave lid to the side and lowering yourself down into the pit under your table.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>罷<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>quit</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Sauron, Ability</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text""><b><font color=""#0af"">Sauron</font></b> is the only person with the <b><font color=""#0af"">ability</font></b> to <b><font color=""#f0a"">quit</font></b>. The rest of you are pretty much slaves to him, but if he wanted to <b><font color=""#f0a"">leave</font></b> he could at any time. He is in charge, after all.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine how unfair it is that Sauron gets to quit whenever he wants, but you can't.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>妄<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>reckless</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Woman, Death</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">If the <b><font color=""#0af"">death</font></b> of a <b><font color=""#0af"">woman</font></b> occurs it's because she was being <b><font color=""#f0a"">reckless</font></b>. People don't just die out of no where! They have to have done something super crazy to cause it. Right? Yes... right.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Picture yourself watching the news about a woman's death. The word RECKLESS?! pops up on your screen and keeps flashing. Huh, she must have been, you think to yourself.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>藻<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>seaweed</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Tree, Flowers, Tsunami, Products</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text""><b><font color=""#0af"">Flowers</font></b> in a <b><font color=""#0af"">tsunami</font></b> that look like they're <b><font color=""#0af"">products</font></b> of a <b><font color=""#0af"">tree</font></b> are really <b><font color=""#f0a"">seaweed</font></b>. Trees don't grow underwater, so what else could it be? Seaweed is the flower and leaf of the sea! And tsunamis sure like dumping lots of it on land.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Picture all of the seaweed building up on the tsunami and pouring down on the land. Some of it gets stuck in trees, making it look even more like flowers and leaves. You know better though. That's just seaweed.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>泌<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>secrete</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Tsunami, Certain</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text""><b><font color=""#0af"">Tsunami</font></b>'s have a <b><font color=""#0af"">certain</font></b> tendency to <b><font color=""#f0a"">secrete</font></b> things as they go back out to sea. When they bash themselves onto the land they just throw a bunch of sea water around, but there are only certain things that they'll secrete when they're leaving.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Certain tsunami secretions are dangerous. Can you think of any?</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>唄<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>shamisen song</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Mouth, Clam</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Use your <b><font color=""#0af"">mouth</font></b> to sing and a <b><font color=""#0af"">clam</font></b> shell to stroke your shamisen, and you'll be performing a <b><font color=""#f0a"">shamisen song</font></b> just like that! Yes, it's that easy. Just go find a clam shell, open your mouth, and you'll be singing one too in no time!</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine using your mouth to sing and a clam shell to play the shamisen to perform your shamisen song!</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>畔<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>shore</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Rice Paddy, Half</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text""><b><font color=""#0af"">Half</font></b> of a <b><font color=""#0af"">rice</font> <font color=""#0af"">paddy</font></b> is always on the <b><font color=""#f0a"">shore</font></b>. Japan is surrounded by water, after all. So it only makes sense that half of every rice paddy is right next to the ocean shore, right?</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Picture a rice paddy. Half of it is trailing off into the shore. Hear the seagulls. Feel the ocean breeze!</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>倹<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>thrifty, frugal</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Leader, Squid</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Your <b><font color=""#0af"">leader</font></b> has some <b><font color=""#0af"">squid</font></b> but he's being really <b><font color=""#f0a"">thifty</font></b> and <b><font color=""#f0a"">frugal</font></b> with them. You're hungry too, but he won't let you have more than one piece. What the heck. How can one person be so frugal with their food?</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine being as thrifty as your leader. Do you think you could hoard all that squid to yourself?</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>拷<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>torture</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Nailbat, Beggar, Coffin</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Put a <b><font color=""#0af"">beggar</font></b> in a <b><font color=""#0af"">coffin</font></b> and hit them with a <b><font color=""#0af"">nailbat</font></b> to <b><font color=""#f0a"">torture</font></b> them. Wow, you're awful.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine pushing the beggar into the coffin. Imagine lifting the nailbat. Why would you torture someone like this?</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>醜<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>ugly</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Alcohol, Demon</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Give <b><font color=""#0af"">alcohol</font></b> to a <b><font color=""#0af"">demon</font></b> and you'll see how <b><font color=""#f0a"">ugly</font></b> it really is. Demons need to concentrate to keep their disguises going. Even if it looked pretty when you met it, like super handsome, give it a few drinks and its facade will slide off and reveal its super gross demon face.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Picture the drunk demon as it's pretty face drips off revealing the ugly crap piled underneath.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>渓<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>valley</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Tsunami, Husband, Cleat</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">After a <b><font color=""#0af"">tsunami</font></b> recedes back into the ocean, your <b><font color=""#0af"">husband</font></b> puts on his <b><font color=""#0af"">cleat</font></b>s to go check if anyone still needs help down in the <b><font color=""#f0a"">valley</font></b>. Tsunamis like to dump most of their water into valleys, and usually it gets stuck there, even after everything else is over. And you need cleats to walk through the valley because it's all wet and you will slip without them. Valleys are dangerous during and after tsunamis!</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Picture your husband putting on his cleats and heading down to the valley after the tsunami to look for people to help. What a good guy. Not everyone would risk their life to go down to the dangerous valley.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>湧<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>well, boil</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Tsunaim, Courage</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">When you see a <b><font color=""#0af"">tsunami</font></b> coming <b><font color=""#0af"">courage</font></b> <b><font color=""#f0a"">well</font></b>s up inside you and you gain the power to save everyone you meet before they get washed away! Feel that courage <b><font color=""#f0a"">boil</font></b> and spread throughout all your limbs. You feel like you have super strength. This tsunami isn't going to hurt anyone while you're alive to stop it!</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine what it feels like to have courage well up inside you. Courage in the face of certain death!</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>寡<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>widow</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Ground, Sword, Helmet, Geoduck</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">If you don't wear a <b><font color=""#0af"">helmet</font></b> a <b><font color=""#0af"">geoduck</font></b> will jump out of the <b><font color=""#0af"">ground</font></b> with a <b><font color=""#0af"">sword</font></b> and stab you in the face. When you die your wife will be a <b><font color=""#f0a"">widow</font></b>. How dare you be so careless by not wearing a helmet!</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Picture your widowed wife angrily holding the helmet you refused to wear when you went out on the day you were stabbed by a geoduck.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>慕<br><br><br><br></div>  Meaning:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>yearn for, adore</b></font></span><p>  <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Drop, Small, Greenhouse</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Meaning Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You're walking in a <b><font color=""#0af"">greenhouse</font></b> when you see a <b><font color=""#0af"">small</font></b> <b><font color=""#0af"">drop</font></b> of water fall and it makes you <b><font color=""#f0a"">yearn for</font></b> the person you <b><font color=""#f0a"">adore</font></b>. You haven't seen them in so long. But something about being in this greenhouse and seeing that tiny water droplet made your heart burst with longing.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine how it feels to yearn for someone else when you see the small water drop. Imagine how your heart feels.</i></span><p> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>上<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>above, up</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>じょう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">うえ, あ, のぼ, うわ, かみ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Ground, Toe</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The toe sticking <font color=""#f0a""><b>up</b></font> <font color=""#f0a""><b>above</b></font> the ground is just a little thing... You go up to poke it and then you realize that the toe actually belongs to <font><b>Jo</b></font>seph (じょう) Stalin. Joe doesn't like people messing with his toes, so you slowly back away.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Joseph Stalin, if you didn't know, has very sensitive toes. He's also very mean. Imagine yourself backing slowly away from Joe as to not incur his mighty wrath.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>下<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>below</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>か, げ</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">した, さが, くだ,&nbsp;お</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Ground, Toe</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You keep digging for the <font color=""#0af""><b>toe</b></font> <font color=""#f0a""><b>below</b></font> the <font color=""#0af""><b>ground</b></font>, and instead of hitting a <font color=""#0af""><b>toe</b></font> you hit something hard and metallic. You keep digging and digging around it, but it's huge. Turns out, you found yourself a <font><b>car</b></font> (か). Keep digging until you unearth the car. Inside, you find the toe you were looking for.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: There's another useful on'yomi reading that just isn't useful enough for you to learn now. That reading is げ, but we're only going to worry about that much, much later when you have to learn one or two vocab words that read 下 as げ. That's the problem with really common kanji - too many readings.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>大<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>big</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>たい, だい</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">おお</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Big</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">There's this big guy (that's how you remember the radical, remember?), and he's wearing a huge <font><b>Tie Dye</b></font> (たい, だい) shirt. Because he's so huge, the tie dye shirt is also super huge. Everything about him is pretty big, but the tie dye stands out more than anything.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: When you look at the big guy in your head, imagine him covered in tie dye head to toe. Think about how ridiculous it looks on him, especially since he's such a big guy. Shirt. Sweatpants. Hat. Shoes... it goes on and on.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>八<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>eight</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>はち</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">や</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Fins</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">After you count and smell all <font color=""#f0a""><b>eight</b></font> of your fins, it's time to put them away. You open a large <font><b>hatch</b></font> (はち) and put them in. This is where you keep your fins, always putting in eight at a time because that's what the boss wants.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: You've asked him why you can only put eight fins at a time in the hatch, but he never wants to answer. What could be down in the hole that the hatch covers? Why is there a hatch at all? What's with numbers and hatches being mysterious?</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>入<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>enter</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>にゅう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">はい, い</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Enter</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Turns out, after you <font color=""#f0a""><b>Enter</b></font> the teepee (you'll remember that the radical is a teepee with a big entrance to it), you're given a <font><b>new</b></font> (にゅう) car!</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine lights turning on and flashing, and an entire audience inside. You're at a gameshow, and the announcer announces the <font><b>neeeeew</b></font> car in his announcey voice. Feel the surprise. Feel the happiness. Feel the excitement. Check the year on the car, too. It's this year! It really is new!</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>工<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>construction, industry</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>こう,&nbsp;</b>く</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Construction</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">To remember the sound こう we use the name こういち. <br>Think of a <font color=""#0af""><b>construction</b></font> worker. But, instead of thinking of a normal construction worker, think of one that's just wearing suspenders and a hard hat. No shirt. He's a sexy construction worker, in fact. Then, imagine this sexy construction worker as <font><b>こう</b></font>いち, your favorite Japanese textbook writer, obviously. Boy is he looking sexy.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: If you're somehow not attracted to the hunk of a man that this construction worker version of こういち is, that's okay. It's still ridiculous enough to hook a memory into that brain of yours. Make yourself mad over the fact that he's not following construction site regulations (where's his shirt, shoes, and pants?). That's dangerous! Even if you do look that sexy. Hey, put out that cigarette, it's bad for you!<br>On the other hand, say you do really like what you see (you'll probably have to imagine a better looking version of Koichi's face, though). You two make eye contact. He nods as he puts out his cigarette and takes off his construction worker helmet, letting his long Fabio-esque locks flow. You beckon him over. What happens next is up to you and your own imagination. My guess is you have a conversation about kanji and the best ways to learn it.</span></i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>山<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>mountain</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>さん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">やま</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Mountain</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Think about <font color=""#f0a""><b>mountains</b></font> talking to each other, calling each other by their names and adding the Japanese name-ender <font><b>san</b></font> (さん) to each of their names. 'Hello, Everest-<font><b>san</b></font>.' 'Oh hi, Fuji-<font><b>san</b></font>.'</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Be sure to imagine this vividly. The more absurdly you can imagine it, the more likely you are to remember the reading, <font><b>san</b></font>.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>口<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>mouth</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>こう,&nbsp;</b>く</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">くち</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Mouth</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Whenever we need to remember the sound こう we use the name こういち. You'll become familiar with this name after a while because the reading こう comes up a lot.<br>Think of a <font color=""#f0a""><b>mouth</b></font> (that should be easy). Now, change it into the scariest mouth you can imagine. Perhaps the teeth are a foot long but just as skinny... or, the lips are bleeding and crispy... whatever scares you, think of it. Then, pan back away from the mouth to see whose mouth it is. Turns out it's <font><b>こう</b></font>いち's mouth. See こういち there with a terrifying mouth. How scary!</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Make sure to vividly imagine that disgusting mouth on こういち. He needs some facial upkeep, I think. The scarier you make it for yourself, and the more ridiculous it is, the more likely you're going to remember this reading. So, imagine away!</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>九<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>nine</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>きゅう,&nbsp;</b><b>く</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">ここの</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Nine</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Although this kanji has two on'yomi to learn, the pronunciations of those two on'yomi are very similar, and nearly the same thing (making it easier to remember). Let's use the meaning, <font color=""#f0a""><b>Nine</b></font>, to remember the on'yomi as well. Whenever you try to hit on some <font><b>cute</b></font> (きゅう, く) guy/girl (your choice) <font color=""#f0a""><b>Nine</b></font> out of ten times they just spit in your face.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Think of the cutest guy or girl you can. It's important to get it in your mind that these people are super cute, and not just 'somebody.' If you have to, think puppies and kittens instead, the ultimate-cute-machine. They just bite you nine out of ten times. And yes, you keep stats, so imagine yourself writing down stats of this every time you try.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>一<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>one</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>いち</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">ひと</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Ground</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">As you're sitting there next to <font color=""#f0a""><b>One</b></font>, holding him up, you start feeling a weird sensation all over your skin. From the wound comes a fine powder (obviously coming from the special bullet used to kill One) that causes the person it touches to get extremely <font><b>itchy</b></font> (いち).</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Make sure you feel the ridiculously <font><b>itchy</b></font> sensation covering your body. It climbs from your hands, where you're holding the number <font color=""#f0a""><b>One</b></font> up, and then goes through your arms, crawls up your neck, goes down your body, and then covers everything. It becomes uncontrollable, and you're scratching everywhere, writhing on the ground. It's so itchy that it's the most painful thing you've ever experienced (you should imagine this vividly, so you remember the reading of this kanji).</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>人<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>person</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>にん, じん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">ひと, と</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Person</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Only one <font color=""#f0a""><b>Person</b></font> at <font><b>Nintendo</b></font> (にん) complained about the new <font><b>Jeans</b></font> (じん) policy, and that person was you.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine how angry you were about the policy. You'll have to come up with something to be angry about yourself (pick something that would actually make you angry, like maybe you're only allowed to wear cut off short-shorts jeans at Nintendo now), but if you pick something good, you'll definitely remember the two readings for this. Just remember you're working at <font><b>Nintendo</b></font>, and the policy has to be something about <font><b>jeans</b></font>. Then, imagine yourself as the only <font color=""#f0a""><b>person</b></font> complaining and everyone else in their dumb jeans (or lack-thereof) shaking their head at you because you're being a fool.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>力<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>power</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>りょく, りき</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">ちから</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Power</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Who has the most Power of anyone? It's the <font color=""#f0a""><b>Power</b></font> Rangers. Who are they battling? <font><b>Ricky the Rock</b></font> (りき, りょく) Monster.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Know anyone named <font><b>Ricky</b></font> (りき), even a famous person like Ricky Ricardo or Ricky Gervais? Put his face on the monster the <font color=""#f0a""><b>Power</b></font> Rangers are fighting. Also, imagine him throwing <font><b>rocks</b></font> (りょく) and hitting people with them. You should imagine it as more gruesome than Power Rangers was on the show. This is real, yo (and gruesome will help you to remember).</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>川<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>river</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">かわ　(せん)</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>かわ</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">River</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">So you're in a river. As you're floating down, enjoying yourself, you bump into something. It says 'moo' to you. You look around. There are hundreds of&nbsp;<b>cow</b>s (かわ) surrounding you.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Touch them as you float by. Smell them. Is the river filled with cow poop? Probably. Use that to help you to remember that you run into cows when you're in the river.</i></span><br> "
