"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>分<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>part, understand, minute</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ぶん, ふん,&nbsp;ぶ</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">わ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Fins, Sword</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Now that you've cut the fish, it's time to cut something else into <font color=""#f0a""><b>parts</b></font>. Next on your list is the <font><b>buns</b></font> (ぶん) which need to be split up amongst the people. If you'd like to learn the second reading, just think about how <font><b>fun</b></font> (ふん) it will be to do this task.</span></span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Think about the <font><b>buns</b></font> (ぶん) as absolutely delicious things you want to eat really bad. If you want to eat the buns, and you taste the buns in your imagination, you'll surely remember that the reading for this kanji is ぶん as well.</span></span></i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>公<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>public</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>こう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Fins, Pile</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">When we need to remember こう, we'll think of こういち, the person who writes all these things. Hopefully I'm not too abstract in your mind - if I am, take a second to memorize my name, so that way you can memorize a lot of kanji that use the reading こう as well! <br>So, who's the greediest member of the <font color=""#f0a""><b>public</b></font> knocking people out of the way, stealing fins from children and old ladies? Of course, that's the horrible <font><b>こう</b></font>いち. I'm so, so evil when it comes to getting my fins.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Make sure you make こういち appalling in your mind. How can someone even act like this? How can someone be so terrible? These questions should come to mind while you're imagining me throwing babies to the side to get closer to the pile of fins.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>引<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>pull</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">ひ (いん)</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ひ</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Spring, Stick</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Amazingly, your spring propelled stick flies right into the <font><b>hee</b></font>l of Achilles. You know what happens when <font><b>he</b></font> gets hit in the heel, don't you?</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine him grabbing his heel, screaming like a little baby. That's his weakness after all (that's why they call it the Achilles Heel and not something else). He falls to the ground and slowly groans himself to death, all because of your little stick.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>止<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>stop</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>し</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">と,&nbsp;や</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Stop</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">When we need to remember the sound し, we use the word 'Charlie Sheen.' - When you think <font color=""#f0a""><b>stop</b></font>, do you also think 'stop sign'? I hope you do. You're coming up to a stop sign, and on top of it, standing straight up and down, you see Charlie <font><b>Shee</b></font>n, saluting the sky. Even before you come to a stop, Sheen starts yelling 'STOPP! STOPPP!!' and jumps down onto the hood of your car, breaking the windshield in.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Make sure to feel the curiosity of someone standing like that on a stop sign. Then, feel the surprise when you figure out it's a celebrity standing up there. Lastly, feel the fear as he jumps onto your car and busts your windshield. See his face on the glass, looking in on you, all crazy like.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>用<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>task, use</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>よう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">もち</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Elephant</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">To remember the reading よう, we use the word 'yogurt.' - Unfortunately, your elephant (which can achieve any <font color=""#f0a""><b>task</b></font>) runs out of power. The elephant collapses, and you have to pull off a big jug of <font><b>yo</b></font>gurt (よう) off its back, and put its trunk in it to recharge him.</span></span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine the smell of the yogurt (it's getting kind of gross because you're in the sun). Also, listen to the elephant sucking down the yogurt, recharging itself. Be sure to think that it's a bit odd an elephant would run on yogurt, but you won't question what has to be done.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>万<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>ten thousand</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>まん, ばん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Sword, Leaf</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">When you cut the <font color=""#0af""><b>leaf</b></font> in half with your sword at <font color=""#f0a""><b>ten thousand</b></font> mph, it falls into the ocean. The ripples in the water attract ten thousand <font><b>manatees</b></font> (まん). They jump out of the water and swarm you, and you can feel their little manatee mouths all over you, tearing you apart.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Whenever we need to remember the reading まん we'll use the word 'manatee' - it's better than something generic like 'man.' Be sure to feel the manatees all over your body, chomping and biting you. The pain will help you to remember the reading. Keep thinking how you wish you hadn't let the leaf fall in the ocean, because it's what attracted them in the first place.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>広<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>wide</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">ひろ (こう)</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ひろ</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Pile, Mullet</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">When you put the <font color=""#f0a""><b>wide</b></font> mullet on, though, you feel like a different person. The disguise gives you strength. Soon, they will call you a <font><b>hero</b></font> (ひろ).</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine yourself running around with the mullet on, stopping crime. The mullet gives you a superpower too - to become really, really wide, whenever you want. This is good for blocking people from going down alleyways. You are the Hero this city deserves, Mulletman/woman.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>冬<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>winter</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">ふゆ (とう)</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ふゆ</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Two, Winter</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">This kanji is a little different from the radical 夂 though has the same meaning… but don’t let that <font><b>fool you</b></font> (ふゆ).</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Try to spend a little extra time with this one - the mnemonic isn't as strong as it could be, so you'll need to add a little extra old-fashioned memorization to this soup if you want to remember it later. ふゆ ふゆ ふゆ...</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>竹<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>bamboo</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">たけ</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>たけ</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Bamboo</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">There's a little <font color=""#f0a""><b>bamboo</b></font> shrub sitting there, holding onto a lollipop. Because you're bigger than the bamboo shrub, you just <font><b>take</b></font> (たけ) it from the bamboo, causing it to cry.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Of course, focus on the absurdity of a bamboo shrub that can cry and eat a lollipop. Also, think about how mean you are to <font><b>take</b></font> the lollipop away from a defenseless bamboo shrub in the first place!</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>車<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>car</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>しゃ</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">くるま</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Car</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">When we need to remember the reading しゃ, we use 'shaman'.<br>There's a <font color=""#f0a""><b>car</b></font>. It's the nicest car you've ever seen. Exquisite, beautiful. Wouldn't you be surprised to learn it belongs to a <font><b>sha</b></font>man (しゃ)? Well it does. This shaman charges a premium for his shaman services so he can afford fancy cars like this.</span></span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: The more fantastic you make this car, the better. Also, feel the surprise of a shaman getting out of this car. What a cool dude that shaman is.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>央<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>center</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>おう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Big, Head</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">If you look at his head harder, you'll notice that his head is shaped like a huge letter '<b>O</b>.'</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Envision the letter&nbsp;<b>O</b>&nbsp;over his head. It's a perfect match, and giant.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>写<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>copy</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>しゃ</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">うつ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Ground, Forehead, Beggar</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">To remember the reading しゃ, we use the word 'shaman'.<br>You finally decide on how you're going to <font color=""#f0a""><b>copy</b></font> him. You hire a <font><b>sha</b></font>man (しゃ) and have the shaman perform a sacred shaman cloning ritual.</span></span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: The shaman runs around for a bit, doing ridiculous things. Imagine it dancing about and mumbling shamanic chants as the beggar is copied.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>仕<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>doing</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>し</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">つか</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Leader, Samurai</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">When remembering the reading し we use Charlie 'Sheen.' - You go to visit the leader samurai who's known for <font color=""#f0a""><b>doing</b></font> rather than waiting. You walk into his room, and he's facing away from you. When he turns to face you, it's Charlie <font><b>Shee</b></font>n (し) sitting there. He's the samurai leader... what the!</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: You!? YOU are the samurai leader? Charlie <font><b>Shee</b></font>n!?? Be awe struck. This is worse than Tom Cruise being the last samurai.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>耳<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>ear</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">みみ (じ)</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>みみ</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Ear</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Put your hand to your <font color=""#f0a""><b>ear</b></font> and sing... '<font><b>Mimi</b></font>mimimimiiiii!' (みみ) and listen to your tone with your ear.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: This is sort of a stereotypical singer sort of image. Make sure you concentrate a lot when you're listening to your mimimimiiii tone. In fact, why don't you do it out loud right now - make a little fool of yourself. It's fun, and it'll help you to remember!</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>早<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>early, fast</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>そう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">はや,&nbsp;さ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Cross, Sun</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">To remember そう we use the word 'sew' - You wake up really <font color=""#f0a""><b>early</b></font> to go to church. When you arrive and go inside, the doors slam behind you, and a couple of armed guards grab you and throw you forward to a desk with a sewing machine on it. They then yell at you '<font><b>SEW</b></font>!!' (そう) and you're forced to start sewing. Church tricked you... it's actually a sweat shop where you sew clothes for no pay, and now you're stuck here.</span></span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Make sure to follow the whole story along (starting at the meaning) and make your way to the church. Open the door and go inside, and look around (probably all tired-like, because it's early). When you just start to figure out what's going on, you get the shock of being grabbed and thrown into a chair, and then you start sewing and keep sewing, until you feel your fingers numbing up.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>気<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>energy, spirit</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>き,&nbsp;け</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">いき</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Treasure, Energy</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">As you reach inside the <font color=""#f0a""><b>energy</b></font> <font color=""#f0a""><b>spirit</b></font>, you feel something hard inside. It's a large <font><b>key</b></font> (き) that gives you access to another treasure.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: You take the <font><b>key</b></font> and open another treasure that's nearby. Open it up and see what's inside. Imagine something spectacular.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>平<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>flat, peace</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>へい,&nbsp;</b>ひょう, びょう</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">たいら,&nbsp;ひら</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Antenna, Horns</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Then, after destroying everything of yours, they walk over to your pastures and eat all of your <font><b>hay</b></font>, because they're quite hungry.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Feel angry about this too, because you were about to sell all that <font><b>hay</b></font> to make a living... good thing you're probably not living anymore.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>花<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>flower</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">はな　(か,&nbsp;け)</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>はな</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Spoon, Leader, Flowers</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The leader can't stop planting <font color=""#f0a""><b>flower</b></font>s though. He's going crazy. Maybe it's the pollen? He comes up to someone named <font><b>Hannah</b></font> (はな) and starts planting flowers in her face, probably killing her in the process.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Do you know anyone named Hannah? Any famous people, perhaps? Try to come up with someone you know of named Hannah that you can imagine to be in this mnemonic, to help you remember it better.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>足<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>foot</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>そく</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">あし, た</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Foot</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">What do you wear on your <font color=""#f0a""><b>foot</b></font>? You wear a <font><b>sock</b></font> (そく).</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Just think about your bare feet. Think about them too much. Feel how cold it is on your feet. Now, put on a sock to make it feel better. Ahhh, so nice!</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>世<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>generation</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>せ, せい</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">よ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Generation</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">For the reading, when we need to remember せい, we think Hard Gay, because he says 'SEI SEI SEI' a lot. Think of multiple <font color=""#f0a""><b>generations</b></font> of people - what would the older generations hate more than anything? Of course, it would have to be Hard Gay shouting '<font><b>Sei</b></font> (せい), sei, sei!'</span></span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Just imagine someone of an older generation watching Hard Gay. Imagine their disgusted looks and their confusion. Hopefully you can get some joy out of their reactions, too, to help you remember the reading. Maybe they try to imitate Hard Gay's catch phrase, and only say 'Se, se, se' instead of 'Sei, sei, sei' - that way you have both readings in your mnemonic!</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>打<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>hit</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">う　(だ)</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>う,&nbsp;</b>ぶ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Nail, Nailbat</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">To remember the reading う we use the word うに (sea urchin).<br>You have a nail that <font color=""#f0a""><b>hit</b></font> you in your eye. You're flailing around, trying to recover from this terrible situation. As you're moving around you step back on some <font><b>u</b></font>ni (う) which stabs your foot. Now you have uni in your foot and a nail in your eye. This can't get any worse.</span></span></span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Of course, think about the feeling of these things hurting you. Also think of the absurdity of the uni part - where are you that there's uni on the ground anyways? Feel it cracking under your foot, getting all its spines up in there. It's really painful, probably because of the poison.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>百<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>hundred</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ひゃく</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">もも</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Sun, Leaf</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You fly closer, counting all one <b><font color=""#f0a"">hundred</font></b> leaves when you hear a strange sound. You take off your space helmet and hear, ""GUH <b>HYUCK</b> (ひゃく)!"" You know that laugh... it's Goofy! On top of the hundredth leaf is Goofy laughing and waving around. He must have built this leaf tower to get your attention.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imaging hearing Goofy guh-hyuck over and over after you save him from being stranded on the sun. How would you feel being stuck in a cramped ship with laughing Goofy and his hundred leaves? Oh, you thought he would leave those behind? Nope, they saved him so you have to take them back too. Happy travels!</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>氷<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>ice</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">こおり　(ひょう)</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>こおり</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Drop, Water</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">When you think of <font color=""#f0a""><b>ice</b></font>, I want you to think of someone frozen with ice. Do you know anyone named <font><b>Corey</b></font> (こおり)? Anyone famous named Corey, perhaps Corey Feldman? Imagine this Corey person frozen solid with ice.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: How did this happen? Was it your fault? Imagine the situation that would get Corey frozen like this.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>虫<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>insect</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">むし　(ちゅう, き)</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>むし</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Insect</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">It's an <font color=""#f0a""><b>insect</b></font>! Get it! You squish it with your foot - what sound does it make? A <font><b>mush</b></font> (むし) sound.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine little words that say 'mush' flying out from under your foot as you mush the poor thing. What does a 'mush' sound sound like? You'll have to come up with something unique to yourself, and focus on it to remember this reading.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>字<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>letter</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>じ</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Child, Helmet</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">As you're watching the kid arrange all his <font color=""#f0a""><b>letters</b></font> around, you see one letter in particular standing out... 'A-B-C-D-E-F-<font><b>G</b></font>...' he says, as he puts the <font><b>G</b></font> (じ) aside. You ask him why he doesn't like the letter 'G.' He replies: 'G is for God. And God is actually aliens from the past... we must hide this letter from him.'</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine an alien God looking down on the kid, shaking his head either in approval or disappointment. You choose - whichever you think would be more interesting and memorable to you. The alien version of God should be pretty memorable enough to remember <font><b>G</b></font> is for <font><b>G</b></font>od, though.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>男<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>man</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>だん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">おとこ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Power, Rice Paddy</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Who da <font color=""#f0a""><b>man</b></font>? <font><b>Dan</b></font>'s (だん) the man.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Say this over and over in a chanty fashion, preferably with a super manly voice, if you can swing it (out loud, now). Also, if you can think of someone named Dan that you know to imagine with this, it will help you out a lot.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>主<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>master</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>しゅ</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">おも, ぬし</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Master</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Do you remember back to the radical mnemonic, where the master is balancing a water drop on his head? Imagine back to there. Once you do, the most amazing thing happens. The <font color=""#f0a""><b>master</b></font> takes off a <font><b>shoe</b></font> (しゅ) and places it gently on top of the water drop, where it balances on top, not breaking the water.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Seriously, this ought to not be allowed, at least when it comes to the physics we know and love on this earth. This is so amazing, so feel amazed by it in your imagination as well. Also, it might help if his shoe is something ridiculous... like a clown shoe, or something. You choose!</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>名<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>name, famous</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>めい, みょう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">な</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Mouth, Evening</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">So, when does “Evening Mouth” appear? Turns out, “Evening Mouth” only comes out to talk in <font><b>May</b></font> (めい). You know this because it’s just starting to be spring, and when you look around (you’re watching “Evening Mouth” again) you see some spring flowers come up.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: You know what they say. April showers bring May Flowers. What do <font><b>May</b></font> Flowers bring? They bring “Evening Mouth,” baby.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>不<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>not</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ふ</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Not</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">To remember ふ we'll use the word 'fool.'<br>Think of those jokes, where someone says something, then ends with a loud '<font color=""#f0a""><b>NOTTTT</b></font>!' Someone is doing that to you, over and over. What is that person? That person is a <font><b>foo</b></font>l (ふ).</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Be sure to feel irritated at that person. Think in your head as they're telling these dumb 'not' jokes how much of a fool they are... and how much of a fool you are for sitting here and listening to them.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>号<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>number</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ごう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Enclosure, Ground, Mouth</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">When remembering the reading ごう, we use 'Grandpa Koichi.' こう is こういち, so ごう is ごういち, aka 'Grandpa Koichi' (ごう). So to help you figure out these <font color=""#f0a""><b>number</b></font>s, you go and contact <font><b>ごう</span></b></font>いち because he is so old and wise.</span></span></span></span></span></span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Like I said, ごういち is very old and wise, so just imagine こういち, but much older. Imagine sitting with ごういち and concentrating very hard to try and figure out these numbers.</span></span></span></i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>他<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>other</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>た</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">ほか</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Alligator, Leader</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">To remember the reading た, we use the word 'Taco'<br>Then there's the <font color=""#f0a""><b>other</b></font>s of the others. These are the <font><b>ta</b></font>co (た) worshipers. They're really strange.</span></span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Just imagine the 'others' shaking their heads at these taco worshipers. Seriously, what the heck?</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>去<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>past</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>きょ, こ</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">さ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Grave, Pile</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">To remember the reading きょ, we'll use 'Little Kyoto'. This will differentiate きょ from きょう, which is regular sized Kyoto. Get it? Okay, so all these tombstones from the <font color=""#f0a""><b>past</b></font> are located in Little <font><b>Kyo</b></font>to (きょ). Each grave pile represents a Japanese immigrant that came to Little Kyoto and died :( <br>Alternatively, the reading can be こ as well. Just like Little Kyoto is a little Kyoto, it is also a child kyoto, like a 子 Kyoto, making it <font><b>こ</span></b></font> as well.</span></span></span></span></span></span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Come up with some kind of emotion along with this grave. It's probably a sad emotion as death is usually pretty sad. Feel sad about these dead people in Little Kyoto. They're no longer around to do fun things or play with their families.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>皿<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>plate</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">さら</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>さら</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Plate</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The person washing all the <font color=""#f0a""><b>dish</b></font>es was named <font><b>Sarah</b></font> (さら). She was named that because of her large head, which was shaped like Sarah Jessica Parker’s head (very big).</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine someone with a huge head, washing dishes. When I say huge, I mean huge. She turns towards you with her big head and says “Hi, I’m Sarah” and you see her name tag, which also says Sarah. She is Sarah, the dish washer. The plates she holds up next to her head pale in comparison, even though they're the biggest pieces.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>先<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>previous</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>せん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">さき, まず</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Slide, Grave, Legs</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">To remember せん we use the word <font><b>cen</b></font>taur. <br>At the bottom of the <font color=""#f0a""><b>previous</b></font> grave slide, there was also a centaur as well. He started slapping you around with his hooves as your legs are stuck in the ground, and all you can do is take the beating.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Feel the scratchiness of the hooves on your face. He's not hitting you hard, but it's plenty enough to be irritating. Imagine him clopping around you in circles too, and make sure to vividly see the centaur, since that's important to the reading. Also make sure to think he's a real bastard, that centaur...</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>赤<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>red</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">あか　(せき)</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>あか</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Red</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Think of Fozzie Bear. He says 'Wakka wakka wakka' a lot. Now, think of an evil, <font color=""#f0a""><b>red</b></font> (and I mean totally red) Fozzie Bear. He drops the 'w' and just says '<font><b>Aka</b></font> Aka Aka,' because he's totally evil.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: You'll have to think of him as really, really red, though. Like, a glowing, searing kind of red. Red enough for you to associate red with this evil Fozzie Bear. If you do, then you'll be good to go (as long as you know his catch phrase as well).</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>休<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>rest</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>きゅう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">やす</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Tree, Leader</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">To remember きゅう we use the word 'cute' - The leader who's <font color=""#f0a""><b>rest</b></font>ing under the tree suddenly gets surrounded by all the animals living in the tree... but, they're not evil, they're very, very <font><b>cute</b></font> (きゅう), adorable things. Squirrels with big eyes, funny birds, and so on. Everything is just so amazingly cute.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Make sure you imagine really cute things and get the 'awww' factor going in your heart. It'll help you to remember this kanji's reading.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>申<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>say humbly</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">もう (しん)</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>もう</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Cross, Mouth</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">When you think of saying humble things, think of the humblest man in the world. His name is <font><b>Moe</b></font> (もう).</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine this character in your head. If it helps, you can take a Moe you already know of (Simpsons, perhaps?) and pretend he's extremely humble - ridiculously so. Just remember to make it crazy so you can remember it better.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>見<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>see</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">み (けん)</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>み</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">See</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You see something. It's walking towards you, but you need to see better. When the person comes close, you realize 'That person is <font><b>me</b></font> (み)!'</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: The struggling to see bit is pretty important - make sure that you slowly see a little better and better as the person comes closer, but it's difficult the whole time (struggles are good for memory). Then, it starts to become more and more clear, and you start saying 'that can't be <font><b>me</b></font>. No way it's me...' When the person comes up to you (the person, being you) you learn about parallel universes and other fabulous things. Still, the whole time you can't stop thinking about how 'this person looks just like me... no, this person is me!'</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>貝<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>shellfish, clam</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">かい</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>かい</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Clam</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">To remember the reading かい we use the word “coyote” (which is pronounced kai-oh-tee)<br>Imagine a <font><b>coyote</b></font> (かい) with a huge <font color=""#f0a""><b>shell</b></font> making up its back area. You try to punch it, but the coyote shell skin is too strong and the coyote comes at you to devour you. Suddenly, someone with a sledge hammer comes in and smashes the coyote's shell, bursting shellfish all over you.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Taste the shellfish juice, smell it, and feel it. When you think this shell, you should think of this shell coyote that tried to eat you. If you're afraid enough in your imagination, there's a good chance you'll remember this reading quite easily.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>皮<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>skin</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">かわ (ひ)</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>かわ</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Slide, Frog</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The frog makes it to the bottom of the slide, with no skin. He flies into a <font><b>川</b></font> (かわ), which is full of skin from all the other animals and frogs that thought it would be a good idea to use this evil slide. So, the frog has to swim through a 川 of skin to get out. Ugh, disgusting.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Now imagine this happening to you, too. How disgusting.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>代<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>substitute, age, period</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>だい</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">か, かわ,&nbsp;しろ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Ceremony, Leader</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Turns out you were being kind of mean. The original (who got replaced by the <b><font color=""#f0a"">substitute</font></b>) leader actually <b>die</b>d (だい), and you were all pissed at them. They tried to joust a train, thinking it was a medieval <b><font color=""#f0a"">age</font></b> dragon. How do you feel now? That wasn't very nice.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine how you'd feel if this happened. Hopefully will teach you not to think bad things about people, because maybe it could cause them to <font><b>die</b></font>, you know?</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>礼<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>thanks</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>れい</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Pelican, Umbrella</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Then you notice something else... The pelican is also holding a gun and pointing at you, and it's demanding all your money. Well, first of all, no more <font color=""#f0a""><b>thanks</b></font> for this pelican. Second, the gun is a bit crazy. It's a futuristic <font><b>ray</b></font> (れい) gun - one that looks different from any other gun you've seen.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Then, the pelican shoots a <font><b>ray</b></font> out of the ray gun, to show you she's not messing around. It melts the wall behind you, causing you to be totally frightened.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>糸<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>thread</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">いと　(し)</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>いと</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Thread</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You have some <font color=""#f0a""><b>thread</b></font>... what's the first thing you do with it? You take it and put it in your mouth, and start sucking it down like spaghetti. You have decided to <font><b>eat</b></font> (いと) the thread.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Think about how it tastes. Think about how it feels in your throat. Let it get caught on your teeth and around your tongue. It's a weird feeling having thread in your mouth, and you want to use that weird feeling to remember you're going to <font><b>eat</b></font> it.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>町<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>town</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ちょう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">まち</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Nail, Rice Paddy</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Do you remember the kanji 丁? The on’yomi is also ちょう, and the kanji means “street.” The mnemonic for that one had to do with Mrs. Chou who was scattering nails all over the street. Oh, and guess what <font color=""#f0a""><b>town</b></font> that street is in? So who does that mean lives here? Yeah, it’s Mrs. <font><b>Chou</b></font> (ちょう).</span></span></span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Do you remember Mrs. Chou? She’s notorious, by now.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>村<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>village</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">むら　(そん)</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>むら</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Tree, Measurement</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">They take all the wood back to where they're building their <font color=""#f0a""><b>village</b></font> and once they construct the village center they paint a <font><b>mura</b></font>l (むら) on the side of it. The mural is of the forest where they got the tree from so they remember the building's origins.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Look at the mural on the side of this newly constructed village center. So many trees! Visualize the whole process as the tree becomes a building as you gaze and reflect on the message of the mural.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>年<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>year</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ねん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">とし</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Cow, Gun</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">It is New <font color=""#f0a""><b>Years</b></font>, though, so when you bring the dead cow back home, it’s time to celebrate. Using the cow’s organs and bones, you and your siblings construct a <font><b>nen</b></font>doroid (ねん). Nendoroids are Japanese toys - little plastic figurines (Google it if need be). You make a little cow nendoroid holding a gun. How cute.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: How funny that you use dead cow parts to make a miniature cow holding a gun much like the one you murdered earlier. Imagine yourself playing with this nendoroid as you think about how weird it was to make a cow nendoroid out of a dead cow.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>角<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>angle</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>かく</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">かど</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Enclosure, Elephant</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You finally figure out the right <font color=""#f0a""><b>angle</b></font> to get the elephant into the enclosure. Wow, this is great! But, the moment you start squeezing it in, you hear a big squawk. The enclosure is already filled with <font><b>cocks</b></font> (かく), and they're all flying around fighting with each other, and scratching the elephant too.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: This causes the elephant to freak out, destroying the enclosure in the process. Thousands of these roosters (cocks) stream out and fly everywhere, darkening the sky with how many there are.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>青<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>blue</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>せい,&nbsp;</b><b>しょう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">あお</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Blue</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">When we need to remember the on'yomi せい we think of Hard Gay (because he says ""sei sei sei."" When we need to remember the on'yomi しょう we think of a shogun. Remembering both of these readings is the real challenge here!  Start by thinking of something that's very blue. What's the bluest thing you can think of? For me, it's the <b><font color=""#f0a"">Blue</font></b> Man Group. Imagine the Blue Man Group, but instead of the regular members, you have Hard Gay (<b>sei</b>) and a Shogun (<b>shou</b>), both painted from head to toe in blue paint. They are playing for you an amazing concert. It's fantastic! It's blue!</span></span></span></span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: You'll want to imagine Hard Gay and the Shogun doing things that you would imagine them to do. Something crazy, something wild, and something memorable. Preferably, they do something together. Whatever it is, make sure it's crazy enough for you to be shocked into remembering it.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>体<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>body</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>たい</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">からだ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Real, Leader</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">How do you know this is the real leader's <font color=""#f0a""><b>body</b></font> though, and not someone else's body? Because the real leader always would wear a <font><b>tie</b></font> (たい) with monkeys on it, and this body has a tie with monkeys on it. Now you know the facts.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Spend some time analyzing the situation. You're a detective here. The telling item is the tie, so focus in on that as grounds for knowing.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>色<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>color</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">いろ　(しき, しょく)</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>いろ</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Color</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You already have <font color=""#f0a""><b>color</b></font> on the mind because you know the meaning of this kanji, so think of something colorful about yourself. Imagine your <font><b>ear</b></font> (いろ) being a weird color... green, purple, red, whatever. Just make it really bright and standing out.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: You can even have someone ask you about your ear... 'Is your ear okay? I think it's the color blue...'</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>来<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>come, next</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>らい</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">く</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Ground, Rice</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">When they come, though, everyone is disappointed. It turns out it's <font><b>rye</b></font> (らい) grains, and rye grains taste terrible. Yuck.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: If you love rye grains, on the other hand, imagine everyone being really happy that they came to get the rice. They're so lucky it's rye!</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>社<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>company</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>しゃ</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">やしろ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Grave, Pelican</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">To remember the reading しゃ we use the word 'shaman'.<br>The <font color=""#f0a""><b>company</b></font> hired a <font><b>sha</b></font>man (しゃ) to help them kill all the pelicans. The shaman does a shaman ritual that lulls the pelicans into a false sense of security and then the company kills them.</span></span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine you're one of the people working at the company. Watch the shaman doing his shaman dance as the pelicans all become blissfully unaware. Now shoot the pelican! BLAM!</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>図<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>diagram</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ず,&nbsp;と</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">え, はか</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Mouth, Treasure, Ice</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">What will you do when you find these treasures that are shown on the <font color=""#f0a""><b>diagram</b></font>? Well, you get there, and you find that the treasure is actually a wooly mammoth! What will you do with this wooly mammoth? You grab it and put it in your <font><b>zoo</b></font> (ず).</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine dragging a wooly mammoth back with you to the town or city you live in, then throwing it in a zoo to be kept. People are quite amazed by this mystical creature you’ve found, though, which is pretty cool.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>毎<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>every</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>まい</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">ごと</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Window, Gun</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Now that <b><font color=""#f0a"">every</font></b> single window is broken you feel pretty stupid because a bunch of <b>mi</b>ce (まい) come pouring in through them. You've made a way for them to get into your house. That wasn't smart.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Now you need to shoot every one of the mice that came through those broken windows. You can't let any survive. You have to get every last one out of here!!</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>羽<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>feather, wing</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>はね,&nbsp;は (</b>う)</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>はね,&nbsp;は</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Feathers</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">All these <font color=""#f0a""><b>feather</b></font>s. You're a bird man / woman, and you're getting ready to fly. Just as you're about to take off, someone dumps you with <font><b>honey</b></font> はね and you're all goopy, unable to go anywhere.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Taste the honey, feel it all over your feathers. Go ahead and plummet towards the ground (because you were jumping off a building to fly when someone doused you with honey). At least it's a tasty way to go, no?</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>林<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>forest</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">はやし (りん)</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>はやし</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Tree</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">So, now you have this <font color=""#f0a""><b>forest</b></font> and you want to cut it down (so much money!). But, you don't have any tools, only your hands. You think... I've done karate for a while, so I can probably chop it down that way. You get in a chopping stance, then do your battle cry and hit: '<font><b>HAYA ... .SHI******</b></font>!'</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Obviously that didn't work well - you'll want to focus on your battle cry plus indecent swearing right afterwards to remember this reading.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>行<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>go</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>こう,&nbsp;ぎょう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">い, おこな, ゆ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Go</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Knowing the kanji's meaning, you know you have to <font color=""#f0a""><b>go</b></font> somewhere. So, where will you go? You will go to <font><b>こう</b></font>いち's house.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Come up with a good story that involves you going to こういち's house. Perhaps something crazy, weird, or interesting happens when you get there.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>金<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>gold</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>きん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">かね</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Gold</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">If you have a lot of <font color=""#f0a""><b>gold</b></font> your long lost <font><b>kin</b></font> will start appearing out of nowhere, pretending to be friendly.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: I always associate the word 'kin' with a American Southern sort of thing. So, perhaps your long lost kin are coming from Texas or somewhere like that.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>草<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>grass</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">くさ　(そう)</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>くさ</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Cross, Sun, Flowers</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">We're going to combine a couple things here. When you need to remember く we use 'cooties.' When you need to remember さ we use 'saw.' So, くさ is a 'cooties saw.'<br>You have plenty of <font color=""#f0a""><b>grass</b></font> in front of you, but you want to get rid of it. You take your <font><b>cooties saw</b></font> (くさ), which is a saw made out of cooties, and cut out a huge chunk of the grass and tear it up so that you can replant and get those flowers back again.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: The reason you're using a cooties saw is because it actually eats up the grass (because it's made up of a million little bugs) - that way there isn't a big pile of grass to throw away afterwards.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>里<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>home village</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">さと (り)</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>さと</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Sunflower</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You were so excited to visit your <font color=""#f0a""><b>home village</b></font> this year that when you got home you put a <font><b>saddle</b></font> (さと) on your horse and rode around in the middle of the sunflower field and took in the smells. The saddle prevents unnecessary chafing. Good choice.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Smell those sunflowers and enjoy it. They're so nice! Also feel that cozy saddle beneath your butt as you ride around.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>作<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>make</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>さく, さ</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">つく</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Leader, Key</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You <font color=""#f0a""><b>make</b></font> a key for an underling, and he looks at it disapprovingly (even though you're their leader!). He simply says, 'this key <font><b>sucks</b></font>' (さく) and then walks off. How could this be?</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Feel angry about this. Maybe you should kick your foot in his mouth and make him <font><b>suck</b></font> on that.<br>Also keep in mind that there's another reading that pops up too that's <font><b>さ</b></font>. It's similar to さく, though, and I think you'll be able to learn both the readings via the vocabulary.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>多<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>many</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>た</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">おお</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Evening</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">To remember the reading た we use the word 'Taco'<br>Let's start with the kanji meaning: <font color=""#f0a""><b>many</b></font>. You go outside in the evening (because that's what this kanji is made up of) and are surprised when you're hit by <font color=""#f0a""><b>many</b></font> <font><b>ta</b></font>cos flying from the sky. For some reason it's raining tacos, and of course you have no idea why.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: The tacos pelt you and knock you off your feet. Hard shell, soft shell, meat, lettuce, tomatoes, cheese... it's terrible. And there are so many of them, flying from the sky to drown you in tacos. This is absolutely absurd (and you should think that too, so you remember the reading).</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>肉<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>meat</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>にく</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Meat</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You know there's people-eating going on here, with this kanji. So, when you think of this <font color=""#f0a""><b>meat</b></font>, you'll have to think about who's meat it is. In this case, it's <font><b>Nick</b></font>'s (にく) meat.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Do you know someone named <font><b>Nick</b></font> you can imagine? There's celebrities too, if you don't have someone. Someone like <font><b>Nick</b></font> Cage would do the trick.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>会<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>meet</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>かい</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">あ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Meet</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">To remember the reading かい we use the word coyote.<br>Do you remember how you remembered the radical? You had two hat piles meeting each other. You think it'll be love. Finally, the date is set, and they are about to <font color=""#f0a""><b>meet</b></font> for the first time. You have a good feeling about this. Just as they begin to meet each other, things are looking good... until a <font><b>coyote</b></font> (かい) jumps out from nowhere, grabs one of the hat piles, shakes it around, then runs off with it.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: This is a disaster. This meet was your idea, and now you've gotten a pile of hats killed. How terrible. You probably shouldn't have chosen to let them meet in a coyote sanctuary.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>交<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>mix</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>こう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">まじ,&nbsp;ま, か</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Lid, Father</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Just before your father dies from you <font color=""#f0a""><b>mix</b></font>ing him in a pot of boiling water, he has to tell you something. 'I'm not your father! Your father is... <font><b>こう</b></font>いち!</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Oh my God! Quite the bomb. Feel the shock, anger, and then forgiveness. You killed the person who you thought was your father because crazy people made you do it... but then you find out that こういち is your real father?? Such a mix of emotions to draw on to remember this reading! Think on this a bit. What will your next actions be? Will you seek out your real father?</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>近<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>near</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>きん,&nbsp;こん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">ちか</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Axe, Water Slide</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The problem with how <font color=""#f0a""><b>near</b></font> the axe water slide is to your home is that your <font><b>kin</b></font> (きん) are always wanting to come over to your house so they can go ride it - they don't actually want to see you, they just want to ride the awesome axe water slide.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine your 'kin' as a bunch of stereotypical hillbillies. At least, that's what I think when I think of the word 'kin.'</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>池<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>pond</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">いけ (ち)</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>いけ</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Alligator, Tsunami</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Eventually, the alligator dies. You come upon it and think it's alive. You shriek '<font><b>EEEEK</b></font>!' (いけ) when you see it.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Actually scream 'EEEK' wherever you are as you imagine yourself coming across this alligator. Then think about how weird it was that you screamed 'EEEK.' Be sure to feel the surprise and fear from seeing the alligator as well.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>雨<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>rain</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">あめ　(う)</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>あめ,&nbsp;</b>あま</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Rain</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">What if the <font color=""#f0a""><b>rain</b></font> actually tried to <font><b>aim</b></font> (あめ) for you? As in, drops would move out of their normal flight path just to hit you on your head? You'd be a lot wetter, that's for sure.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine a world where each rain drop had to choose a target to aim for. How strange would rainfall be? Also, あめ and 'aim' don't really sound too much alike, but the goal is to use 'aim' to get to あめ, so make sure to take note of that in your mind as you learn the reading.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>米<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>rice</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>べい,&nbsp;</b>まい</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">こめ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Rice</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You've got tons of dry grains of <font color=""#f0a""><b>rice</b></font>. You have no idea what you're going to do with it. Then, you come up with a solution. All this dry rice could go towards filling up the <font><b>bay</b></font> (べい), so you have more land to farm on!</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: In your mind, bulldoze the rice into the bay, watching it fill it up, then pile high. It's not particularly good looking land, but it'll do, and it's already full of seeds, so that's pretty good. The important thing is that you think you have way too much of the stuff, so the only way to get rid of it is to dump it in a large body of water, and that large body of water is a bay.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>当<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>right, success</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>とう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">あ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Wolverine, Triceratops</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">When we need to remember the reading とう, we use the Japanese city, Tokyo. The last question in the Jeopardy match is the following: 'The capital of Japan.' The triceratops answers first. 'What is... <font><b>To</b></font>kyo (とう)?' <font color=""#f0a""><b>Right</b></font> again!</span></span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: What a ridiculously easy question to ask. Think of it from the poor wolverine's perspective... he could have won if he had hit the buzzer more quickly. Ugh!</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>走<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>run</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>そう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">はし</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Run</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">To remember the reading そう we use the word 'sew.'<br>You're <font color=""#f0a""><b>run</b></font>ning and running and running. You can't stop. In fact, you run so hard, your leg just falls clean off from overuse.
