You stop and grab it, then try to <font><b>sew</b></font> (そう) it back on again.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Of course, imagine yourself sewing on your leg. How much would it hurt? Would it stay on or be floppy? Maybe if you used a sewing machine?</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>同<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>same</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>どう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">おな</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Ground, Mustache</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">When we need to remember the reading どう, we use the word 'doughnut'.<br>While this is already strange enough, you notice something stranger. Over a couple feet away is a <font><b>dou</b></font>ghnut (どう) who also has the <font color=""#f0a""><b>same</b></font> mustache as you (and the one that fell on the ground). The doughnut looks at you for a moment, then scampers off. This doughnut must be a mutant because normally doughnuts don't move.</span></span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: If it helps, imagine hundreds or thousands of doughnuts all around you with the same exact mustache. First of all, it's terrifying to be surrounded by thousands of mutant doughnuts. Secondly, it's really weird they all have the same mustache as you.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>言<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>say</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>げん,&nbsp;</b>ごん</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">い, こと</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Say</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">I want you to <font color=""#f0a""><b>say</b></font> this out loud. Really say it. What <font><b>gen</b></font>eration are you from? Gen Y? Gen X? Please say it out loud.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: You'll have to really focus in on this set of requests and connect them to the meaning of this kanji. Meaning of the kanji is easy to get to, but connecting it to remember the reading is a little more difficult. Spend a little time thinking about how they relate before moving on.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>自<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>self</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>じ,&nbsp;</b>し</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Self</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">When we need to remember じ we use the word 'Jesus.'<br>Who said you should always look at your <font color=""#f0a""><b>self</b></font> before tossing stones (or whatever) at others? <font><b>Je</b></font>sus (じ) did. So, make sure you look at your own self before being a jerk.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: You can feel free to do some introspection here.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>売<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>sell</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">う (ばい)</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>う</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Legs, Forehead, Samurai</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">To remember the reading う we use the word うに (sea urchin).<br>After he’s sold half of his body, the Samurai starts trying to sell uni (う) as well. He keeps pushing the uni at you, trying to get you to buy it.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: It’s up to you what you imagine after this (whether you buy it or not). Maybe you can take and sample some of it first (and taste the uni). Whatever you do, come up with a continuation for this story, and be sure to imagine the samurai as only a forehead on top of some legs. What is he talking out of? Why is he selling uni?</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>形<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>shape</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>けい</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">かた, かたち</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Hair, Lantern</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The lantern also has a weird <b><font color=""#f0a"">shape</font></b>d marking on it under all the hair. It turns out the <b>K</b>KK (けい) have been here, and they left their sign (a big ""K"") on the lantern. Someone covered it up with their hair because they didn't like seeing it.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Carefully put the hair back over the lantern and the shape of the big K. Never look under it again.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>空<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>sky</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>くう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">そら, から,&nbsp;あ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Construction, Legs, Helmet</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">To remember the reading くう we'll use the word 'cooties.'<br>You finally make yourself taller. But once you reach the sky, you find it's full of nasty <font><b>coo</b></font>ties (くう) that knock you over and make you fall down.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: You'll have to come up with something interesting for cooties in terms of what they look like. Are they like small bugs to you? Millions of small bugs running into you while you're up in the sky, knocking you down?</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>音<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>sound</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>おん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">おと,&nbsp;ね</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Sun, Stand</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">This <font color=""#f0a""><b>sound</b></font> is ridiculously loud. To counteract this, you turn <font><b>on</b></font> (おん) your noise canceling headphones.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: You could turn on many other things too, to help out... maybe a fan to cool you off. Maybe the AC. Think of a bunch of things you turn on, and imagine yourself switching the 'on' switch to 'on' as well, to help bring home the point.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>学<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>study</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>がく</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">まな</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Child, Viking</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">This crazy viking child who prefers <font color=""#f0a""><b>study</b></font> over pillaging (and other viking activities)... the other vikings just stop and <font><b>gawk</b></font> (がく) at him when they walk by.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: You should tell the other vikings to stop gawking at this child. Just because he likes to study doesn't mean he's a bad viking...</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>光<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>sunlight, light</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>こう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">ひかり, ひか</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Triceratops, Pi</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Then you see it's actually fighting someone (that's what pitriceratops do best). He's fighting <font><b>こう</b></font>いち, shooting him with bolts of <font color=""#f0a""><b>sunlight</b></font>, melting him where he stands.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine this sight and make it somewhat traumatic. It will help you to remember that this kanji's reading is こう.</span></i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>考<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>think</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">かんが　(こう)</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>かんが</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Beggar, Coffin</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">As he's being lowered into the grave in his coffin, <font><b>conga</b></font> (かんが) music begins to play. It interrupts his thinking, and he's unable to think clearly anymore.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine his frustration (or, imagine it's you and your thinking is getting interrupted). This conga music is really irritating.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>回<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>times, revolve</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>かい</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">まわ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Mouth</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">When we need to remember the reading かい we use the word 'coyote'<br>At the very end... at the very last mouth... there's a big surprise for you there, which causes you to fall back. There's a tiny <font><b>coyote</b></font> (かい) that jumps out of the tiny little mouth and then gets bigger as it flies out at you, grabbing onto your face.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: During all this, do you remember the number of <font color=""#f0a""><b>times</b></font> you had to count mouths in order to get to the <font><b>coyote</b></font>? Also, don't forget to feel surprised by the coyote jumping out at you. That surprise will help you to remember the reading!</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>谷<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>valley</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">たに (こく)</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>たに</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Fins, Mouth, Hat</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Hanging around with all the <font color=""#f0a""><b>Valley</b></font> Girls in the sunny area of LA is also a robot. It's WALL-E's distant (and lazy, lounging relative), <font><b>TAN-E</b></font> (たに). He sits around getting a tan in LA with the Valley Girls while his cousin picks up trash.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: What a jerk he is. Imagine the deep tan lines on TAN-E as well. He's the epitome of robot laziness.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>声<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>voice</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">こえ　(せい)</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>こえ</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Flag, Samurai, Stick</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Once you start asking the samurai more specific questions about how he wants more <font color=""#f0a""><b>voice</b></font> he starts playing <font><b>coy</b></font> (こえ) with you. He doesn't really know what he wants, he's just here for the sake of protesting.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Then you ask him out on a date. He still plays coy with you... one of those samurai, I guess.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>西<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>west</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>せい,&nbsp;</b>さい</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">にし</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">West</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">To remember the reading せい we use 'Hard Gay' because he always says 'sei sei sei!!!'<br>What's to your <font color=""#f0a""><b>West</b></font>? Think about the globe, and just keep going West until you hit Japan. Imagine <font><b>Hard Gay</b></font> (せい) standing on top of the image of Japan, thrusting his hips and saying 'SEI SEI SEI!!'</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Make it as odd as possible. It's already pretty odd, thinking of a guy standing on a country on a globe, not to mention a weird guy like the character Hard Gay, but the stranger you make it in your mind, the more likely you are to remember it later!</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>何<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>what</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">なに (か)</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>なに, なん</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Leader, Lip Ring</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The leader with his lip ring is now eating some <font><b>nan</b></font> (なん) and curry. It's delicious, of course... but then he gets it caught on his lip ring, and tears half his lip off. He screams: '<font><b>Nannnnn eeeeeeeeeehhh</b></font>!!' (なに) in anger at the nan and curry.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Make this one vivid and scary. He's eating the nan (that's your なん), and then he screams at the nan but gets overwhelmed with pain (that's the なに). Smell the nan (you're there) and see the blood gushing out of his/her lip. It's terrifying. How did the nan even catch on his lip ring anyways.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>麦<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>wheat</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">むぎ　(ばく)</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>むぎ</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Life, Winter</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You found your <font color=""#f0a""><b>wheat</b></font>. Thank God. You'll survive. You have to take the wheat back to your house, though. On your way, you get <font><b>mug</b></font>ged (むぎ).</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine the disappointment. You go from finding life to losing it all... now you have no hope for the winter :( Also, keep in mind that むぎ and mug aren't super-alike, so you'll have to use it to get  close enough to remember the actual reading, むぎ.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>弟<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>younger brother</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>だい,&nbsp;で,&nbsp;</b>てい</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">おとうと</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Slide, Spring, Stick, Horns</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Unfortunately he goes down this slide too fast, bounces off the bottom with his spring shoes, and then falls right on his stick. It goes through him, causing your <font color=""#f0a""><b>younger brother</b></font> to <font><b>die</b></font> (だい).&nbsp;That's right, he's <b>de</b>ad (で) now.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Be sure to feel bad about your younger brother. He was your younger brother, after all… just not a very careful younger brother. Very tragic. Just think about all the things you could have done to prevent this from happening. Was there anything? Was it kind of your fault?</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>全<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>all</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ぜん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">すべ, まった</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">King, Hat</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">But, as you're going through all the kings, it turns out not <font color=""#f0a""><b>all</b></font> them have hats after all. The last one you come to does not have a hat. He is the king of <font><b>Zen</b></font> (ぜん) Buddhism. He has simple clothes and a shaved head, unlike all the other fancy kings standing around nearby.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: To add to this story and make it more memorable, you can imagine the other kings getting upset, saying things like '<font color=""#f0a""><b>All</b></font> kings must wear hats! You are no king!' The king of <font><b>Zen</b></font> Buddhism just ignores them and begins to meditate.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>後<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>behind, after</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ご, こう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">うし, あと,&nbsp;のち</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Poop, Winter, Loiter</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">To pass the time while you wait for your poop to thaw from your <font color=""#f0a""><b>rear</b></font>/<font color=""#f0a""><b>behind</b></font>/<font color=""#f0a""><b>back</b></font>, you play a rousing game of <font><b>go</b></font> (ご) with your good pal <font><b>こう</b></font>いち. <font color=""#f0a""><b>After</b></font> the game of go is done, your poop has finally thawed out. Finally.</span></span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine playing this game of go with こういち. He's very talented, so the game is exciting. However, as your poop begins to thaw, the room smells more and more like poop. Smell the terrible poopy smell as it fills the room.</span></i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>血<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>blood</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>けつ</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">ち</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Blood</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">To remember the reading けつ, we use the word ""ketsup."" The perfect mix of ketchup and catsup!  The radical is technically <b><font color=""#0af"">blood</font></b>, but you know that radical is just a drop (of blood) on a plate. So, you ask yourself... Is that really blood on the plate? Could it be? You decide to take a gamble and lick it off. When you taste it, it's definitely not blood. No, it's <b>ketsup</b> (けつ).</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Feel the relief that you didn't just lick up someone's blood. Taste the ketsup taste, too. It's pretty good. Not quite ketchup, but not quite catsup. Yum!</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>両<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>both</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>りょう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Ground, Mountain, Head</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">But, you dig too deep and water flows into where you are. Your only hope is a <font><b>row</b></font> (りょう) boat floating off in the distance.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Also think... 'What's that row boat doing here?' But, it's your only hope, so you have to focus on it really hard.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>明<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>bright</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>めい</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">あか, あき,&nbsp;あ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Sun, Moon</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">When do things start to get <font color=""#f0a""><b>bright</b></font> outside? I'd say when things start getting sunny, and that is the month of <font><b>May</b></font> (めい).</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: If your months don't match up with this too well (if you're down in the southern hemisphere, for example) then you'll have to imagine all this up in the Northern Hemisphere. Sorry about that, South Hemisphere ladies and gents.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>京<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>capital</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>きょう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">みやこ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Lid, Mouth, Small</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">To remember the reading きょう we use the Japanese city, Kyoto. Remember how there's a revolution brewing in the <font color=""#f0a""><b>capital</b></font> (via the radical?). It is drawing near. The people will take the capital soon. They've already taken <font><b>Kyo</b></font>to (きょう), and they took it with ease. If they can take Kyoto this easily, the capital will be no problem.</span></span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: See the revolution. Be the revolution. Feel the swarm of people all around you as you overtake Kyoto and move on to take the capital city as well!</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>化<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>change</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>か</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">ば</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Spoon, Leader</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Then, this hero of yours takes their spoon and says some magic words into it, <font color=""#f0a""><b>changing</b></font> it into a <font><b>car</b></font> (か).</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Of course, doing something like this is utterly amazing. Feel amazed in your imagination, because if you don't, then it'll be hard to remember the reading for this kanji. If you are amazed, you'll know that spoons going to cars = the reading is か, so make sure you take the time to be amazed.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>国<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>country</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>こく</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">くに</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Drop, Mouth, King</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Turns out the king of this <font color=""#f0a""><b>country</b></font> loves drinking <font><b>Coke</b></font> (こく). Every morning that big mouth of his swallows a whole 2-liter bottle of Coke for breakfast.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Would you drink that much soda for breakfast? Now this king says he wants to pass a law requiring everyone in the country to drink nothing but Coke! That's crazy!</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>死<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>death</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>し</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">し</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Spoon, Bad</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">To remember し we use the word 'Charlie Sheen.' - You're taken to the <font color=""#f0a""><b>Death</b></font> Kingdom, where you are put in a waiting room. There next to you is Charlie <font><b>Shee</b></font>n (し). He says 'what's up?' and you two talk for a bit.</span></span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine the whole conversation play out. What do you talk to Sheen about? Do you talk about how you both died? Something like that?</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>亡<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>deceased</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ぼう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">な</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Death</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">When you think of <font color=""#f0a""><b>deceased</b></font> people, and possibly hanging out with deceased people, you can't help but think that they really are pretty <font><b>bo</b></font>ring.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine yourself sitting with a <font color=""#f0a""><b>deceased</b></font> person. Are you having fun? Probably not. Feel the boredom. Take out your phone to do something, only to realize you've done everything there is to do on your phone. So boring. So, so boring... ugh.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>画<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>drawing</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>が, かく</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Rice Paddy, Box, Leaf</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Now you get it! Someone created this rice paddy in this box. The <font color=""#f0a""><b>drawing</b></font> is trying to depict a <font><b>go</b></font>d (が) that is creating the earth. It's like his little sandbox for creation experiments. Putting the rice field in the box and watching it grow is one of those experiments.  Then he fills it with <font><b>cock</b></font>s (かく)... the bird kind, you sicko.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine the gods in the corner of the picture, looking down, commenting on the creation and adding feedback. What a strange drawing indeed.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>地<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>earth</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ち,&nbsp;</b>じ</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Grave, Alligator</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">When we need to remember the reading ち we use the word 'cheese' - You keep digging until you're surrounded by <font color=""#f0a""><b>earth</b></font>. You are digging down into the giant alligator's throat now, and in its throat you find a huge, rotting  chunk of <font><b>chee</b>se</font> (ち).</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: This is what killed the giant alligator! Dig into the <font><b>cheese</b></font> a little bit, smell it... even taste it! Anything to help you to remember that the reading for 地 is 'cheese' (aka ち).</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>東<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>east</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>とう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">ひがし</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Cross, Fins, Rice Paddy</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You walk to what you think is <font color=""#f0a""><b>east</b></font> and test the rice paddy waters out. Eventually you find yourself in <font><b>To</b></font>kyo (とう), which is about as far east as you can get. Once in Tokyo, you reach into the water and pull out some fish fins.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Feel these scaly, webbed fins in your hands. You're very tired from walking all the way to Tokyo, but these fins were worth it. Hold them up to the sky as you collapse into the rice paddy exhausted.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>食<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>eat, meal</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>しょく</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">た,&nbsp;く</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Eat</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Thank goodness, you finally get to <font color=""#f0a""><b>eat</b></font> your <font color=""#f0a""><b>meal</b></font>. You're so hungry. Someone has been starving you and now they've finally given you food. Unfortunately, though, every time you take a bite, you get a <font><b>shock</b></font> (しょく) from somewhere.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: So, do you keep eating and keep getting shocked? Or do you not eat and continue to starve? What is worse? Obviously you're in one of the Saw movies, or something, too, so feel the fear. What will you choose? Life with shocks or death from hunger?</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>直<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>fix, direct</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ちょく, じき</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">なお</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Cross, Eye, Lion</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Of course, there's not much you can do to <font color=""#f0a""><b>fix</b></font> this issue, and eventually Tyson finds out. In his rage, he grabs you around the neck and <font><b>choke</b></font>s (ちょく) you. As he rattles you, you make a '<font><b>jiki</b></font>jikijiki' (じき) noise as well. How's that for taking the <font color=""#f0a""><b>direct</b></font> approach?</span></span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine Tyson grabbing your neck choking you out. You can't breath. You stop struggling. Then everything goes black. In your last moment, think about the mistake you made, wishing you could have <font color=""#f0a""><b>fix</b></font>ed it.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>前<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>front, before</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ぜん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">まえ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Ground, Moon, Horns, Ribs</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You're going crazy with these things in <font color=""#f0a""><b>front</b></font> of you all the time. You finally seek the help of a <font><b>Zen</b></font> master, who tells you that meditation will save you from this curse. You try it out, and sure enough, the objects are gone! It worked!</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Go ahead and do some Zen Buddhist meditation. Maybe it'll help you to remember this kanji's reading better (and calm your mind so you're ready for the next kanji!).</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>有<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>have</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ゆう,&nbsp;</b>う</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">あ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Moon, Narwhal</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Who wants these things? Duh, that's <font><b>you</b></font> (ゆう).</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Who else could it be that'd want something so strange as this combination?</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>知<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>know</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ち</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">し</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Mouth, Arrow</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">To remember the reading ち we use the word 'cheese.' - One of the things you <font color=""#f0a""><b>know</b></font> is actually very strange but very important. The president's <font><b>chee</b></font>se has been poisoned and only you know. If you could just say something then maybe you could save him... but... you have an arrow in your mouth.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Try saying the words 'cheese' with an arrow in your mouth. What would that sound like? Go ahead and pretend out loud.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>活<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>lively</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>かつ</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">い</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Mouth, Thousand, Tsunami</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">After the <font color=""#f0a""><b>lively</b></font> mouth tsunami is over, the town is infested by thousands of <font><b>cats</b></font> (かつ) who enjoy feeding on mouths.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Nom nom nom nom. There's just as many cats as there are mouths, making for a really crazy scene. Imagine a standing room only cat fest.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>長<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>long, leader</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ちょう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">なが</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Long</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Its been a <font color=""#f0a""><b>long</b></font> time, Mrs. <font><b>Chou</b></font> (ちょう), but we meet again.'</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Remember your arch nemesis, Mrs. Chou? She's the one who spread all those nails around in the town. Well, she's back, and it's time for vengeance (even though it's been such a long time). Say the phrase in the mnemonic out loud a few times, doing a cool voice, and you'll be more likely to remember it.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>曲<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>music, bend</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>きょく</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">ま</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Mouth, Twenty</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The twenty mouths make so much <font color=""#f0a""><b>music</b></font> that they literally <font><b>cloak you</b></font> (きょく) with it. They cloak you with the music.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine how you feel as they cloak you with music. Feel the music all around you, enveloping you. Become the music itself.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>首<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>neck</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">くび (しゅ)</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>くび</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Neck</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You find this alien with the strange <font color=""#f0a""><b>neck</b></font> (remember how the radical is an alien with a strange neck?). You poke it. It wakes up and starts yelling things it's seen on American television (you know, to try to fit in, though it's pretty obvious it's an alien). '<font><b>Kooby</b></font> (くび) Dooby Doo!' it yells, trying to say 'Scooby Dooby Doo!' and failing.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Kooby Dooby Doo? you ask? Then, like a broken record, the alien with the weird neck just keeps going and going and going, nonstop, until you break its neck. Then it stops.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>次<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>next</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>じ</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">つぎ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Ice, Lack</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">To remember the reading じ, we used the word 'Jesus' - Finally, when you're at the last store in existence, you decide it's time to pray to <font><b>Je</b></font>sus (じ), asking for a miracle. He comes down from the heavens with ice in his hands.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine him coming down. Imagine your surprise. He hands you the ice, and it's cold. You thank him, and he flies away.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>夜<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>night</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>や</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">よる, よ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Drop, Lid, Winter, Leader</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Question is, what is he protecting them from during the <font color=""#f0a""><b>night</b></font>? Turns out, it's the <font><b>Ya</b></font>nkees (や) baseball team. They're out for blood, and only the leader can protect us.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine the Yankees stomping towards the leader, baseball bats in hand, blood on their faces. They're here to eat, and nobody will stop them. Feel the fear of their approach. Will you survive another night with them on the prowl?</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>姉<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>older sister</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>し</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">お, ねえ, あね</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Lid, Woman, Two Face</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Two Face looks at you and your <font color=""#f0a""><b>older sister</b></font>. 'HA!' he yells. I'm not Two Face, I'm Charlie <b>Shee</b>n! He tears off a mask and sure enough it's Charlie Sheen.<br>And guess who this two face good for nothing <font color=""#f0a""><b>older sister</b></font> is marrying? What a good match. She's marrying Charlie <font><b>Shee</b></font>n.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: This is actually worse than Two Face. Feel the rage build up inside of you. Give Charlie Sheen a push away from your older sister. He's not the kind of guy your older sister should be dating. Urgh!</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>点<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>point, decimal</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>てん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">つ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Fortune, Fish Tail</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The <font color=""#f0a""><b>decimal</b></font> is still fiery in your mind. 'Wait!' she says again. 'I messed up again. I should move this decimal to the <font><b>ten</b></font> spot. There you go. You have ten years to live.'</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: This is getting ridiculous. You start with 100. Then go down to one. Now you're at ten?? What is it going to be next? Actually, it turns out to be ten. Imagine yourself 10 years later - how do you die? The fortune teller was absolutely right on the last fortune - exactly ten years, down to the second.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>安<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>relax, cheap</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>あん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">やす</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Woman, Helmet</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">When she falls over again, super <font color=""#f0a""><b>relax</b></font>ed, you pull out her wallet and open it up (because obviously, this lady needs help). You find her name, it's <font><b>Anne</b></font> (あん).</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Say her name over and over as you're trying to revive her (without pulling the helmet off, of course!). 'Anne! Hey, you okay. Anne!?'</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>室<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>room</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>しつ</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Grave, Pile, Helmet, Ground</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You think ""this can't be my room!"" So you walk to the corner, where you keep a box filled with your <b>shit</b> (しつ) *sorry kids and moms.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: When you look in the box, there it is, just how you left it. This is definitely your room. Or at least a perfect replica.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>科<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>science</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>か</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Chopsticks, Pine</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Using all your <font color=""#f0a""><b>science</b></font> skills, you take the things you harvested and add a couple of scientific drops of something else to it. You step back, and watch it grow rapidly into a <font><b>car</b></font> (か).</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: This isn't at all what you expected. Why did it turn into a car? You should be terribly surprised by it. Check it out. It's a weird looking car, based off whatever you harvested from the pine tree earlier (you decided that part, remember?).</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>海<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>sea</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>かい</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">うみ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Window, Tsunami, Gun</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Once the <font color=""#f0a""><b>sea</b></font> starts running, you sic your pack of <font><b>coy</b>ote</font>s (かい) on it, and they go and chase down the sea.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Watch the pack of coyotes bringing the sea down, and have them drag the sea back to you. 'Well well well. What do we have here.'</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>羊<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>sheep</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>よう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">ひつじ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Sheep</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">To remember よう, we use the word 'Yogurt.' - The <font color=""#f0a""><b>sheep</b></font> are after you. There are too many of them, and they're chasing you down, stalking you... waiting for you to get tired. You are so hungry, and all you have in your pocket is some sheep's milk <font><b>yo</b></font>gurt (よう). You eat it, and recharge.</span></span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine the taste of this yogurt. You're so hungry and it tastes so good!</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>店<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>shop</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>てん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">みせ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Mullet, Fortune</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">How many do you buy? The allure must have been strong, because you just bought <font><b>ten</b></font> (てん) mullets! TEN! Wow. Way to spend.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Seriously, though. What's up with the fortune teller with the mullet? How did he know you'd go into this shop, let alone buy ten mullets? Some sort of conspiracy is going on, obviously.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>南<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>south</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>なん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">みなみ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Cross, Head, Sheep</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">When you go down to the <font color=""#f0a""><b>south</b></font> you have to stop in somewhere to eat. Of course, a sheep-headed cross-wearing person serves you and asks you what you want. Tell the sheep what you want. He says, 'sorry, the only thing we serve in this city is <font><b>naan</b></font> (なん). Would you like naan?'</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Only nan? That's pretty odd. Go around to a bunch of other places as well. Turns out the sheep was telling the truth. They only eat nan here. Time to go back north, I think.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>星<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>star</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">ほし (せい)</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ほし</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Sun, Life</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">On one of the planets that has gotten life from a distant <font color=""#f0a""><b>star</b></font>, there is a particularly strange life form. They look like hoes with the faces of Charlie Sheen. They are known as the <font><b>Ho-Shee</b></font>n (ほし) race of beings.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine these beings as vividly as you can. Make them strange so you remember them. Watch them go about their daily lives and come up with habits these creatures have. Are they intelligent? Are they like humans? Are they totally different? That's all up to you - just make sure to make it strange.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>州<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>state</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>しゅう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Drop, River</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Each <font color=""#f0a""><b>state</b></font> is known for something in particular, right? Let's take the United States. Think through the ones you know in your head, asking each one what they're known for. Strangely, every single state says they're known for their <font><b>shoo</b></font>ters (しゅう). Well, the United States does love their guns, after all.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Each state representative even shows you their shooter. These shooters are very proud of themselves and their guns and they even put on a shooting demonstration for you. Hear the guns shoot all around you. It's overwhelming.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>茶<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>tea</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ちゃ,&nbsp;</b>さ</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Angel, Flowers, Hat</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">In your <font color=""#f0a""><b>tea</b></font> you find a little metal button. I guess you missed it while you turned the angel into tea. You look at the button - on the back it says 'To <font><b>Cha</b></font>d, you'll make an awesome angel.' Looks like you're drinking Chad the Angel.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: It gets kind of weird when you know their names... Usually you just make them into tea without knowing who they are (easier that way). This one... this one is Chad, and you remember it vividly, because now you feel kind of bad.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>思<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>think</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>し</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">おも</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Rice Paddy, Heart</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Then, you see another heart in the rice field. Since the first heart did so well, and made you a great <font color=""#f0a""><b>think</b></font>er, you go for it again. You eat the heart, but this one is Charlie <font><b>Shee</b></font>n's heart, and it dumbs you right back down to where you started.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: If only you had thought a little harder, maybe you would have realized that the only direction you could have gone is down. Now you have the power of Charlie Sheen and Einstein in you, but they cancel each other out, leaving you where you started.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>歩<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>walk</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ほ</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">ある,&nbsp;あゆ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Slide, Small, Stop</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">So, you're <font color=""#f0a""><b>walk</b></font>ing around, minding your own business, when suddenly something flips up and whacks you in the face. You stepped on the head of a <font><b>hoe</b></font> (ほ) and it caused it to swing up from the ground and hit you.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Of course, imagine the pain of your face. Did your nose break? After bringing yourself together, look down at what hit you. It's a hoe! How did you manage to step on just the right spot to flip it up on you like that? Examine the hoe. Pay close attention to it. Who's hoe is this? etc.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>向<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>yonder, facing</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>こう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">む</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Cyclops</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">As the cyclops is looking <font color=""#f0a""><b>yonder</b></font> he sees something moving (finally!). Turns out it's <font><b>こう</b></font>いち, who's trying to get rid of the one ring! 'Oh crap,' thinks the cyclops. 'I better go take him out.'</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Now you can imagine the cyclops and こういち battling it out. It's an epic fight, but you decide who wins.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>妹<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>younger sister</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>まい</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">いもうと</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Woman, Jet</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Wait now your <b><font color=""#f0a"">younger sister</font></b> seems to be running even faster and she doesn't look happy anymore. Oh, it's because there are some <b>mi</b>ce (まい) on the floor and now they're chasing her. They seem to want a ride on your younger sister. They probably think she's a real jet.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Watch at your younger sister screams, running away from a bunch of little mice. They're all over her now. Your little sister is covered in mice.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>辺<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>area</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>へん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">あた,&nbsp;べ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Sword, Water Slide</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">As you’re looking in on the blocked off <font color=""#f0a""><b>area</b></font> (all sad and stuff), you see something flapping around coming your way. It’s a <font><b>hen</b></font> (へん)… a female chicken, flying around avoiding flying swords, trying not to get hit. The hen looks like it’s flying around all crazy, but it’s really avoiding everything quite well. It’s very ninja-like.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Feel impressed by how good the <font><b>hen</b></font> is at avoiding things. Feel concerned for this hen as well. The more you feel for the hen, the more likely you are to remember it when you need to!</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>付<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>attach</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">つ (ふ)</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>つ</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Leader, Measurement</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You have to remember the kun'yomi reading of this kanji, and the part you need to remember is つ. So, think of <font color=""#f0a""><b>attach</b></font>ing something to something else. What would you need? You'd need <font><b>two</b></font> (つ) things to put together!</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Just focus on how attaching requires two things to remember this reading.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>札<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>bill</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>さつ</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">ふだ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Tree</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The tree couldn’t take the body parts of his friends falling down on him, so he <font><b>sat</b></font> (さつ) down, and began crying uncontrollably.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: What else could he do? He couldn’t move, so he sat. It’s weird imagining a tree trying to sit…</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>鳥<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>bird</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ちょう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">とり</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Bird</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Do you remember evil Mrs. Chou? The one who likes dropping nails on streets in towns? She's going to make a reappearance now. You're looking at some pretty birds. Think of the prettiest bird you can think of. Enjoy this moment, because Mrs. <font><b>Chou</b></font> (ちょう) suddenly walks in, grabs your favorite bird, breaks its neck, then puts it in a bag to take home for supper.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Of course, feel the shock of this experience. You can't do anything because you can't believe what just happened. Zero in on Mrs. Chou (she's the important part, really) and think about how much you hate her. She's going to eat your favorite bird! Go ahead and yell out Darth-Vader style 'CHOOOOOOUUUUUU!' if you want to really remember this.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>黒<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>black</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>こく</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">くろ.い</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Black</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You're in a completely <font color=""#f0a""><b>black</b></font> room. There's no way out, and you can't see. The room starts to fill with liquid. It gets in your mouth. You taste it. It's <font><b>Coke</b></font> (こく)! Mm, tasty Coke.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: You need to drink all this Coke, otherwise you're going to drown. Drink this Coke and keep tasting its cold sweetness as you drink it all to survive.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>船<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>boat</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>せん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">ふね</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Fins, Mouth, Sail</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">What do <font color=""#f0a""><b>boat</b></font>s do? They <font><b>sen</b></font>d you across the ocean.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Also think about someone giving you some letters to <font><b>sen</b></font>d as well.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>以<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>by means of</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>い</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Drop, Person, Lion</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">To remember the reading い we use the word “Eagle.”<br>You’re about to do a drop by means of a lion person drop. Everything goes to plan, but as you’re falling towards the ground an <font><b>ea</b></font>gle (い) flies by and tears open your parachute.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Feel the fear of falling. Focus in on the eagle… how did the enemy know?? They used the direct counter to your lion person drop. Be angry. Yell at the eagle. How could it!??</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>必<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>certain</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ひつ</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">かなら.ず</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Slide, Heart</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">As the beeping heart things starts to do one long continuous beeeeeeeeeeeeeep, the doctor puts his hands together and <font><b>hits</b></font> (ひつ) the dead patient over and over, attempting to bring him back.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Maybe imagine yourself running in there too, just trying to <font><b>hit</b></font> the patient back to life, because the patient was your friend.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>末<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>end</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>まつ</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">すえ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Jet</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">When you get to the <font color=""#f0a""><b>end</b></font> of the world, you land your jet and put out a few <font><b>mats</b></font> (まつ) to sit on so you can view the sights.&nbsp;</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: It's surprisingly dirty down here, because all the water takes the garbage this way. That's why you sit on these mats you brought.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>氏<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>family name</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>し</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">うじ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Duck</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Who else is a part of your family and who else shares your <font color=""#f0a""><b>family name</b></font> now? Turns out that Charlie <font><b>Shee</b></font>n (し) married into your family, so now his last name is the same as yours: Charlie Duck.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Make sure you feel a bit angry about his joining your family and using your Family Name like that. A Sheen doesn't deserve to be a Duck! C'mon!</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>失<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>fault</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>しつ</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">うしな.う</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Slide, Husband</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Remember the dog that got squished? The husband was really sad about this, because it turned out to really be his <font color=""#f0a""><b>fault</b></font> because he built the slide too, so to make it up to the kids, he buys a new puppy. That new puppy is a <font><b>shitsu</b></font> (しつ).</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine the kids holding up the new shitsu puppy, so happy! They've forgotten all about the dog that's under the slide in the backyard... how horrible. <font><b>Shitsu</b></font> dogs aren't that distracting, are they? I guess they're puppies.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>魚<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>fish</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ぎょ</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">さかな</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Fish</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You catch a <font color=""#f0a""><b>fish</b></font>. As you pull it out of the water, it starts yelling and pointing: 'GO!' (ぎょ). 'GO GYO GYO GYO!' There's a huge cruise ship coming right towards your little fishing boat. No wonder the fish was yelling GO at you.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Have him continue to scream 'GO GYO GYO GYO!' as you try to get your engine started and attempt to flee your impending doom. The fish helps too, because he's pretty worried as well.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>組<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>group</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>そ</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">くみ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Thread, Top Hat</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Even though the thread is connecting your top hats, the <b><font color=""#f0a"">group</font></b> itself is just <b>so</b>-so (そ). Being a group doesn't make you great. And none of you were that great to begin with, so you're just a bunch of so-so people in a so-so group now.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine explaining your group to someone who isn't in it. When they ask how it is you shrug and say, ""Eh, it's so-so.""</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>家<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>house</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>か,&nbsp;</b>け</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">いえ, や, うち</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Helmet, Pig</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Not only does he protect your house, though, he also protects your <font><b>car</b></font> (か). What a great package!</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine someone trying to get next to your car. The helmeted pig b-lines it to that person and takes them out.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>欠<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>lack</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>けつ</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">か.ける</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Lack</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">To remember けつ, we use the word ""ketsup."" It's the perfect blend of ketchup and catsup!  You're <b><font color=""#f0a"">lack</font></b>ing something in your fridge. You look around, trying to find the <b>ketsu</b>p (けつ) you lack. You can't find it, because you lack it.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine having to use regular, ordinary ketchup, or just old, boring catsup on your burger. Or even worse, an actual tomato. BLEH!</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>未<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>not yet</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>み</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">ま, いま,&nbsp;ひつじ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Jet</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">What a selfish kid, right? Well, all he thinks about is '<font><b>Me</b></font> (み) me me me me me me me me me me.' Hate kids like that.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Go ahead and pretend to listen to the kid asking if we're there yet. Then in your mind go 'me me me me me me me' quietly.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>紙<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>paper</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">かみ　(し)</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>かみ</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Thread, Duck</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Turns out this duck is like a shredder. You put in <font color=""#f0a""><b>paper</b></font> and it shreds the paper into one long line of really skinny paper (thread). What paper are you trying to shred so nobody can see them? All the papers that show you're a <font><b>Commi</b></font> (かみ), aka a communist.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: This duck is your only hope to hide the information before someone catches you! So, keep feeding those Commi papers to the duck as fast as he'll let you!</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>通<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>pass through</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>つう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">とお,&nbsp;かよ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Elephant, Mama, Water Slide</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">How big was this elephant she needed to <font color=""#f0a""><b>pass through</b></font>? <font><b>Too</b></font> (つう) big. Too, too big. So big she just passed right through one end and out the other. Ewww.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine being inside this too big elephant. How did it get to be this too big size? Ponder this a while longer as you pass through the elephant's rear.</i></span><br> "
