"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>民<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>peoples</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>みん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">たみ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Mouth, Duck</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Another feature of these duck mouthed <font color=""#f0a""><b>people</b></font>? They're all terribly <font><b>mean</b></font> (みん).</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: They all come at you with their duck mouths and start biting you with them. Also imagine them saying mean things to you. Maybe they're making fun of your hair, or something. Whatever happens, be sure you associate these peoples being mean to you, whatever 'mean' means to you.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>理<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>reason</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>り</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">ことわり</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">King, Sunflower</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You don't have <font color=""#f0a""><b>reason</b></font> without <font><b>re</b></font> (り).</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: </i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>由<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>reason</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ゆう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">よし, よ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Cross, Mouth</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Why me? you ask. 'Because only <font><b>you</b></font> (ゆう) can do this,' they reply.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Just like most things like this, there's always a specific person in mind. In this case, it's <font><b>you</b></font>.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>校<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>school</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>こう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Lid, Tree, Father</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">It's just you and one other student at this ridiculous <font color=""#f0a""><b>school</b></font>. Your other classmate is a big trouble maker. It is <font><b>こう</b></font>いち, the class clown.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine こういち doing dumb things and bothering you and your father, who is the teacher. He throws こういち from the tree and expels him from this ridiculous school.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>雪<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>snow</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">ゆき</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ゆき</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Rain, Wolverine</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You ask the wolverine, 'Why do you want this <font color=""#f0a""><b>snow</b></font> so bad?' He replies quickly: 'Because the rain is <font><b>yucky</b></font>' (ゆき).</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: He keeps saying 'Yucky yucky yucky' over and over again. Imagine him doing this with an accent that would bring the word closer to ゆき.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>強<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>strong</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>きょう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">つよ.い</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Pile, Spring, Insect</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">To remember the reading for きょう we use the Japanese city, Kyoto. When the bodybuilder is watching you try to pull the spring down (you aren't <font color=""#f0a""><b>strong</b></font> enough, though), he gets impatient (must be all the steroids). He shoves you out of the way, pulls down the spring, and launches all the insects from here to <font><b>Kyo</b></font>to (きょう). Dang, he's strong.</span></span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: How far away are you from Kyoto? Probably pretty far. Imagine someone being strong enough to launch this pile of insects off of the spring and all the way to Kyoto.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>夏<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>summer</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">なつ (げ,&nbsp;か, が)</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>なつ</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Eye, Winter, Leaf</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Now it's summertime! What do you do during the <font color=""#f0a""><b>summer</b></font>? You just sit around with your favorite string tying <font><b>knots</b></font> (なつ) in it over and over again.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Think about summer. Now think about yourself tying knots. Now think about summer again. Now think about tying knots again. Now think about your mother getting upset at you because all you do is tie knots all summer long. Go play video games like a normal kid!</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>高<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>tall, expensive</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>こう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">たか.い</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Lid, Mouth, Mustache</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Who is this <font color=""#f0a""><b>tall</b></font> monster with two mouths, a lid on his head, and a mustache? It's your good buddy <font><b>こう</b></font>いち!</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine こういち being really tall with this scary face setup, looking down at you with both mouths open. Rwaawwwrh!</span></i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>教<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>teach</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>きょう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">おし,&nbsp;おそ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Child, Winter</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Teacher can <b><font color=""#f0a"">teach</font></b> the most about Japan in winter by going to <b>Kyo</b>to (きょう). Kyoto is where all the old temples and history of Japan is centered. And it's really gorgeous when it snows.</span></span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine the teaching teacher teaching you about Japan in Kyoto in winter. You've always wanted to go to Kyoto!</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>時<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>time</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>じ</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">とき</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Sun, Grave, Measurement</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">When we need to remember the reading for じ, we use the word 'Jesus.'<br>One thing people think about when they think about <font color=""#f0a""><b>time</b></font> is the ability to do time travel. Now imagine <font><b>Je</b></font>sus (じ) being able to perform time travel magic. He performs an incantation, and goes back to the dinosaur ages, where he wrestles down a T-rex. Then, he goes to WWII era and punches Hitler in the mouth.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine him going to all kinds of different <font color=""#f0a""><b>time</b></font>s (since the word 'time' is important to our mnemonic) and also make sure you're specifically imagining Jesus doing all these things. Put these two together and you'll remember the reading in no time.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>弱<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>weak</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>じゃく</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">よわ.い</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Spring, Ice</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You are driving your truck over a frozen lake in a blizzard and one of your tires gets a flat. All you have in the car is a spring but it's covered in ice. You put it under your car and try to use it as a <b>jack</b> (じゃく), but it breaks because the ice made it so <b><font color=""#f0a"">weak</font></b>. Now you're stranded on this lake with your truck and this broken, weak jack.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: This makeshift jack is so weak that it broke the moment you tried to shove it under your truck. The weakest jack you've ever seen, why even bother using such a weak jack?</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>週<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>week</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>しゅう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Ghost, Water Slide</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">As the ghost goes down the water slide this <font color=""#f0a""><b>week</b></font>, he thinks everything is going fine, when suddenly a <font><b>shoo</b></font>ter (しゅう) shoots him and the ghost flies off and goes over the edge into the bushes under the slide. Ughh, how irritating!</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Pretend that you're the ghost - think of how irritating it would be to get shot by a shooter. The shooter is also a ghost, so that's how he is able to hit you. Ghost shooters are the worst. This happens like every week, too!</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>風<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>wind, style</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ふう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">かぜ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Slide, Head, Insect</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The only way you can distract yourself from the <b><font color=""#f0a"">wind</font></b> and the insect sliding around under your table is by eating lots of <b>foo</b>d (ふう). That’s why you were at the table in the first place. It’s your dining room table and it’s dinner time!</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Try to stuff food in your mouth in the wind. Food tastes even better when you have to fight for it!</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>記<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>write down, record</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>き</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">しる</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Say, Cobra</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">At least one thing you want the cobra to <font color=""#f0a""><b>write down</b></font> is the location of a <font><b>key</b></font> (き) that will lead to untold treasures.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: You think about this for a moment, realizing that now the cobra knows the location of this key. You'll have to take care of him later.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>黄<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>yellow</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">き (おう)</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>き</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Yellow</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You're in a room, surrounded completely by <font color=""#f0a""><b>yellow</b></font>. You can't get out. Somewhere in the room is a yellow <font><b>key</b></font> (き) but you can't find it, because everything looks the same. You crawl around trying to find this tiny thing so that you can escape.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: The Walls are coming in closer, too. Make sure you feel a bit of peril as you look for this key. The walls have a slight opening at the bottom too, so if you don't find it before the wall goes over it, the key will be lost forever, and you'll be smushed!</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>答<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>answer</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">こた (とう)</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>こた</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Bamboo, Suit</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">So, instead of a shirt now, you try something else. Maybe a <font><b>coat</b></font> (こた) will get you an <font color=""#f0a""><b>answer</b></font>.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: You put on this weird bamboo coat. Smell it and feel the texture. How is it? Probably a bit bulky.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>反<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>anti</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>はん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Stool, Cliff</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Turns out, when you go to this guy and pull off his beard, he's <font><b>Han</b></font> (はん) Solo, the <font color=""#f0a""><b>anti</b></font>-hero from Star Wars! What is Han doing here, so hidden away? He's obviously hiding from Jabba because he doesn't want to get frozen in carbonite again.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Make sure you get to the point where you pull this anti-social guy's beard off, to reveal Han Solo beneath. Be surprised... not just because he's Han Solo, but because he's real, too! Maybe you can yell out 'Han! Your people need you!'</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>君<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>buddy</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>くん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">きみ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Mouth, Slide, Wolverine</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">As you're about to embrace your <font color=""#f0a""><b>buddy</b></font> wolverine, a rac<font><b>coon</b></font> tackles the wolverine off the slide, preventing your mouth embrace.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: RaCCOON! you yell. 'THIS IS NONE OF YOUR BUSINESS. Get out of here.' Feel some hate for the raccoon. He ruined everything.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>局<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>bureau</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>きょく</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Mouth, Flag, Cloak</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The best bit of secret tech they have is the cloaking device. It can <font><b>cloak you</b></font> (きょく) with the press of a button.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Now, this mnemonic isn’t perfectly close, but the goal is to get you close enough in your brain so that you can remember きょく later. If you can get to CLOAK YOU, then you can get to きょく much easier than just trying to get there from scratch. So, imagine yourself getting cloaked. What would you do with this power?</span></span></i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>買<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>buy</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">か (ばい)</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>か</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Clam, Sauron</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Some how Sauron goes from trying to <font color=""#f0a""><b>buy</b></font> clams to buying an entire <font><b>car</b></font> (か). He drives away in it, forgetting about the clams. Come up with a story about how he ended up buying this car from the clam salesman. Should be ridiculous to help you to remember that the kun'yomi reading for this kanji is か.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: The on'yomi for this kanji (which you're not learning with the mnemonic, because it's not as common) just sounds like the word 'buy,' which makes it pretty easy to remember later on, when you need to.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>雲<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>cloud</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">くも (うん)</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>くも</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Rain, Boobs</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Let's imagine something besides rain coming out of these <font color=""#f0a""><b>cloud</b></font>s though. Imagine a <font><b>cool mom</b></font> (くも) falling through the sky towards the earth (or a lot of them). They're all doing things that cool moms do.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Such a strange mnemonic, but くも doesn't lend itself well to mnemonics. Come up with cool things that the cool moms are doing while they fly towards the earth from their clouds. Depending on you, those things will be different, so I want you to make something up here that will help you to remember that these are cool moms (and not anything else!).</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>楽<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>comfort, ease, pleasure</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>らく,&nbsp;</b><b>がく</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">たの</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Tree, White, Ice</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You want more of this, You gather as much as you can, and create an entire <font><b>rack</b></font> (らく) at your store with this tree. You sell out immediately, and have to refill your rack.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine setting up the rack. Make it look beautiful. Shift around the flowers. Fill up the entire rack. Of course, your focus should be on the rack portion.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>数<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>count</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>すう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">かぞ, かず</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Woman, Winter, Rice</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Why are you so low on rice? It's because someone <font><b>sue</b></font>d your farm and took everything you owned. So, you had barely enough rice (or not enough).</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Come up with a story about why your farm got sued for everything. Go to the court  case. Listen to the judge come up with your verdict. Be angry. This has ruined everything.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>決<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>decide</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>けつ</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">き</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Person, Hook, Tsunami</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">To remember the reading けつ we always use the word 'catsup.'<br>You finally <font color=""#f0a""><b>decide</b></font>. You're going to go with the tsunami... but not just any tsunami. You'll kill him with a tsunami of <b>ke</b><font><b>tsu</b></font>p (けつ).</span></span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Get everything ready to take your target down. How will you plan this? Where will you put it? Go ahead and watch your plan unfurl, too.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>絵<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>drawing</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>え</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Thread, Meet</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You tell someone that you drew this <font color=""#f0a""><b>drawing</b></font> only using a a thread. Their response? '<font><b>EH</b></font>?!?!?' (え)</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Tell a few more people how you drew this. Have them all do the same 'Eh!!??' reaction.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>住<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>dwelling</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>じゅう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">す.む</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Leader, Master</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You are lucky. You finally find the <font color=""#f0a""><b>dwelling</b></font> of this leader master, and it's not at all what you expected. He lives in a <font><b>Jew</b></font>ish (じゅう) synagogue. It's quite splendid, too.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Be sure to imagine this place totally over the top. Your master leader is living in a small dorm room somewhere in the basement, which also surprises you.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>電<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>electricity</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>でん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Rice Paddy, Rain</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">After the <font color=""#f0a""><b>electricity</b></font> hits you, you feel your face. In it is a huge <font><b>den</b></font>t.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Feel the indent in your face. It doesn't hurt, strangely, but it is pretty huge. Panic about this dent a bit.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>森<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>forest</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">もり (しん)</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>もり</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Tree</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">One tree? No. Two trees? Not enough. I want <font><b>more</b></font> (もり) trees, please!</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Keep repeating this pattern over and over, continually focusing in on how you need 'more' trees to make this forest. For some reason the person working with you only goes up by one at a time, though, so you have to say it a lot (it'll help you to remember, anyways!).</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>助<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>help</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>じょ</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">たす, すけ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Power, Top Hat</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">With your newfound <b><font color=""#f0a"">help</font></b>ing powers you materialize a <b>jo</b> (じょ) fighting stick in your hands to help get rid of bad guys. You're a helpful super hero with a top hat and a jo!</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine helping the townspeople with your jo! Smack the evildoers away!</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>馬<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>horse</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ば</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">うま</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Horse</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You are looking at a horse. It's looking at you. You try making horse noises at it, to get a reaction. Instead of reacting with a normal horse noise, it just makes sheep noises: '<font><b>Baaa</b></font>,' (ば) it says. 'Baaaaa.'</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Feel the shock of this. It sounds just like a sheep, it's strange.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>間<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>interval</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>かん,&nbsp;</b>けん</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">あいだ, ま</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Sun, Gate</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The <font color=""#f0a""><b>interval</b></font> is perfect... at least, until now. Genghis <font><b>Khan</b></font> and his Mongol horde come down on the gate and destroy it, delaying the sun by several hours. Now the interval is all messed up due to the Khans. Time to build a great wall, or something, to protect.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: It's not too out there to assume a Khan attacked something Chinese (remember, we're pretending this interval sun gate is Chinese!). That's what Genghis, Kublai, and all the other Khans were known for, after all - attacks on China!</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>場<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>location</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">ば (じょう)</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ば</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Grave, Gravity</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The <font color=""#f0a""><b>location</b></font> you're being pulled towards is the secret sheep graveyard. You can hear the '<font><b>Baa</b></font> (ば) baa baaaaaa!' noises more clearly the closer you get. It's scary!</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: The reading for this kanji is actually quite difficult to pinpoint. It uses both on'yomi and kun'yomi readings quite often, and there's no real good rules to figure out when to do which. The kun'yomi reading seems slightly more common, though, which is why we're going with that one. You will, however, have to work a little bit when you get to this kanji's vocab. Just a warning!</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>医<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>medicine</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>い</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Arrow, Cage</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">When we need to remember the sound い we use the word 'Eagle.'<br>You need your <font color=""#f0a""><b>medicine</b></font> really bad. Then, you look up. There's an <font><b>ea</b></font>gle flying overhead. He has a package. It's medicine! You're saved!</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Or, so you think. He just keeps circling and circling. Feel some hate for the eagle. Why isn't he dropping the medicine? You don't have long to live!</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>朝<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>morning</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">あさ (ちょう)</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>あさ</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Cross, Sun, Moon</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">But, they're kind of grumpy because they have to wake up early in the <font color=""#f0a""><b>morning</b></font>. So, they're constantly cutting each other off, pushing each other, and being jerks. Imagine all of these people yelling back and forth at each other: 'You <font><b>ass</b></font>!' (あさ) a ridiculous amount, then all suddenly becoming quiet when they sit down in the church.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: It might help if you think about them all being Italian too. At least when it comes to a stereotypical Italian accent, they'd say something like 'you ass-a hole-a!' If you're Italian, this is probably absolutely how you don't sound.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>番<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>number in a series</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ばん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Rice Paddy, Sickle</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">This <font color=""#f0a""><b>turn</b></font>-based rice sickle system is a contest as well! But, you are disappointed to find out that you have been <font><b>ban</b></font>ned from the game because of the performance enhancing steroids you've been taking.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Try to feel disappointed by this. Strange thing to feel disappointed by, but you were a great sickler. You were going to win the great prize, too (come up with something huge!), but now you're banned for the season.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>所<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>place</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>しょ</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">ところ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Door, Axe</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You finally break through the door and jump in. Inside is a great circus <font><b>show</b></font> (しょ). There are elephants, tightrope walkers, bears on unicycles, and more! The greatest show on earth, but why is it here at this <font color=""#f0a""><b>place</b></font>?</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Come up with a weird reason as to why the circus is at this place you hate so much. Why did you come here with your axe? Does it have something to do with the circus show?</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>究<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>research</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>きゅう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">きわ.める</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Nine, Hole</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You dig up the ninth hole. You think you’ve found what you're looking for. Your <font color=""#f0a""><b>research</b></font> could finally be complete... but instead, you find the <font><b>cu</b></font>test (きゅう) animal in the world (what is your cutest animal?). It jumps out of the hole and gives you super adorable eyes.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: D’awwwww. Go ahead and remember this animal that you use – we’ll use it later with other words that have きゅう as the on’yomi.</span></i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>道<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>road</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>どう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">みち</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Neck, Water Slide</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">To remember the reading どう we use the word 'doughnut'.<br>You're going so fast on this <font color=""#f0a""><b>road</b></font> that you don't see the giant <font><b>dou</b></font>ghnut (どう) until the last minute. You crash into it, and both you and the doughnut go tumbling down.</span></span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Be sure to feel the last minute panic as you see the giant doughnut in the middle of the road. How did it get here? Also feel, smell, and taste the doughnut as you're tumbling along, crashing. Maybe steal a few bites while you're at it. Mmm, doughnuts.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>役<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>service</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>やく</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Loiter, Ikea</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Why are you getting such bad <font color=""#f0a""><b>service</b></font> from people who supposedly have great service as their <font color=""#f0a""><b>duty</b></font>? It turns out the employees are all standing around just going '<font><b>yak</b></font> (やく) yak yak yak yak' (that's the sound of people talking, by the way).</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Go ahead and mock these employees by saying 'yak yak yak' over their talking. Feel a bit upset about this as well.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>研<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>sharpen</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>けん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">と</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Stone, Lantern</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">When you've <font color=""#f0a""><b>sharpen</b></font>ed your sword, you turn around to do battle. What are you fighting? Several giant <font><b>ken</b></font> (けん) dolls.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine yourself doing battle with these human-sized dolls. They're quite good at fighting, despite being made out of plastic. What gives?</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>身<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>somebody</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>しん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">み</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Slide, Self</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You’re falling down this metaphorical slide… And then you hit something… and you hit it really hard. It’s your metaphorical <font><b>shin</b></font> (しん). You split it in half and it’s at a right angle. The pain is incredible (shins have a lot of nerves!). It may have been broken, and you may not be able to walk correctly again… metaphorically speaking, that is.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Just make the tumble and shin hit as painful as possible in your imagination and you’ll surely remember this kanji’s on’yomi.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>者<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>someone</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>しゃ</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">もの</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Sun, Coffin</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">To remember the sound しゃ we use 'shaman.'<br>It's time you open the coffin and check. Maybe there's more answers in there. There's no way this person could just be '<font color=""#f0a""><b>someone</b></font>.' You lift the lid, and sure enough, you're able to figure out who it is. It's a <font><b>sha</b></font>man (しゃ), dressed in full shaman garb.</span></span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: How strange that a shaman was delivered to you this way! Come up with a story explaining why this shaman's body is here at your door, rotting in the sun. Make it ridiculous and interesting so you remember it.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>合<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>suit</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">あ、あい (ごう,&nbsp;がっ)</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>あ,&nbsp;あい</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Suit</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You wear the hat you found out around the town (remember the strange hat with a mouth on it from when you learned the radical 合?). You think it <font color=""#f0a""><b>suit</b></font>s you really well, but nobody else agrees. They start screaming. <font><b>あ</b></font>あああああああ!&nbsp;Well <b>I</b> (あい) think it suits you. So, you know, there's that at least.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine little あ characters coming out of their mouths while they scream to hit home the point that they're screaming あ and not something else.&nbsp;But あい am there too. あい think you look great.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>支<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>support</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>し</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">ささ.える</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Frog</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">To remember the reading し, we use the name  Charlie 'Sheen.' - Remember the frog from when you learned that this kanji means <font color=""#f0a""><b>support</b></font>? He's holding up an entire building to keep the children safe. Just when you think he's going to succeed, Charlie <font><b>Shee</b></font>n jumps on the building, pushing it down until it crushes the frog. He laughs maniacally as he runs off.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Make sure you're rooting for the frog! He's trying to support everything by himself, after all. True underdog story. Then, feel horrified when Sheen makes his appearance, ruining everything the frog ever worked for.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>話<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>talk</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>わ</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">はな, はなし</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Say, Tongue</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text""><font><b>Wha</b></font>t (わ) are you <font color=""#f0a""><b>talk</b></font>ing about? You're talking about <font><b>wa</b></font>lruses.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Or, if you'd like, you can come up with some other 'wa' starting word to use to think about what you're talking about. Just be sure to actually imagine yourself talking about that thing.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>投<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>throw</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">な (とう)</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>な</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Ikea, Nailbat</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Then an accident happens. Your friend <font color=""#f0a""><b>throw</b></font>s a drawer set at you, and you smash it to bits... but, the drawer was full of <font><b>na</b></font>ils (な) that fly out and hit you in the face.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Feel all the nails hitting you. There's so many of them and you try to pull them out. Why did your friend throw that ikea furniture at you?</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>対<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>versus</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>たい</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Doll, Measurement</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Why are you measuring dolls <font color=""#f0a""><b>versus</b></font> this crazy lady? It's because you need to know how big to make the <font><b>tie</b></font> that you'll be putting on it.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Stick a little tie on that doll of yours. Is it pretty looking? Did you measure right? How is it versus your opponent's?</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>受<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>accept, receive</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">う (じゅ)</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>う</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Stool, Forehead, Cleat</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">After you got kicked, the club leader shouts “<font><b>U</b></font>no (う) mas!” Knowing this means “one more” in Spanish, you now realize that they plan to cleat you in the forehead at least one more time as part of this demented <font color=""#f0a""><b>accept</b></font>ance ritual. Why couldn’t they have just stopped at uno?</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine the anxiety and fear you’d be feeling knowing you’re about to get cleated in the forehead again. Will they stop at dos? Tres? You pray to God they don’t say uno mas anymore.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>事<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>action, matter, thing</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>じ</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">こと,&nbsp;つか</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Cross, Mouth, Brush</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You try the special action out. You brush in a cross pattern, and *poof* <font><b>Je</b></font>sus (じ) appears in your mirror, blessing you and your teeth. 'Jesus, you're here!' you say through your toothpaste filled mouth.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine Jesus touching your teeth and removing the cavities. What a swell dude.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>美<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>beauty</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>び,&nbsp;</b>み</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">うつく</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Big, King, Horns</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text""><font color=""#f0a""><b>Beauty</b></font> and the who? Beauty and the <font><b>Bea</b></font>st (び). The Beast. That’s right. Beauty and the Beast! How could you forget?</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: It’s a Disney movie. Everyone knows about it. How many times have you seen it? Remember the movie Beauty and the Beast.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>予<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>beforehand</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>よ</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">あらかじ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Nail, Mama</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">She took away the barbed nail <font color=""#f0a""><b>beforehand</b></font> because she knew you'd hurt yourself. You were upset about losing this amazing looking toy, but she gives you a <font><b>yo</b></font>-yo (よ) to play with instead, making you very happy.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Compare the two things in your mind (the yo-yo and the nail). Which one is better? Weight it out. Think about it. Then, hopefully you come to the decision that the yo-yo is better. Go ahead and play with the yo-yo for a bit too. Should help you to remember it.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>始<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>begin, start</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">し</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>はじ</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Woman, Machine</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Actually, before the woman can <b><font color=""#f0a"">begin</font></b> she has to complete <b>Haj</b> (はじ). (Haj is the fifth pillar of Islam, and is a pilgrimage to Mecca during the month of Dhu al-Hijja). Only then can her work with the machine <b><font color=""#f0a"">begin</font></b>. It's still really fast though!</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Visualize this journey in your head. It is a great undertaking, but think of what great sights the woman will see on her journey to Mecca and imagine how proud she will feel upon arrival. She has to begin this journey before she can begin to tell you how to use this machine.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>服<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>clothes</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ふく</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Moon, Stool, Stamp</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">As you tear your <font color=""#f0a""><b>clothes</b></font> off to moon the world you scream '<font><b>F*#$ YOU</b></font> ふく, WORLD!!! AHHHAHAHAHAH!'</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Of course, if you're not familiar with the word that has all the symbols in it, you'll just have to remember the reading of this word straight up.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>度<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>degrees, occurence</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ど,&nbsp;</b>たく</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">たび</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Stool, Hick</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">As you stare at the 100 <b><font color=""#f0a"">degrees</font></b> Fahrenheit hick, a <b>do</b>g (ど) runs out of no where and bites them! It drags the sick hick out of your sight. You've never seen such an <b><font color=""#f0a"">occurrence</font></b> before!</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Now you know that if your fever goes over 100 degrees a dog will come get you. Better keep an eye on those degrees next time you're sick.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>発<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>departure</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>はつ</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Tent, Lantern</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Oh! Don’t forget your <font><b>hats</b></font> (はつ) either. Wouldn’t want to start a <font color=""#f0a""><b>departure</b></font> without hats or a lantern. That’d be a short journey.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: How cold and unprotected would your head be without a hat? Very. Taking hats along with departures is integral to their success. Imagine how unsafe you would feel with no hats. That’s no departure I want to set out on.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>定<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>determine</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>てい,&nbsp;</b>じょう</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">さだ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Helmet, Coat Rack</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You're <b><font color=""#f0a"">determined</font></b> to determine whose helmet this is! You pick it up and there's a <b>ta</b>ter (てい) tot inside it! Okay, you think you can determine whose helmet it is now. Probably the guy who brought the tater tots to your house.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: You determined that this helmet belongs to no other than the guy who brought tater tots to your party! Now you don't have to keep staring at it!</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>談<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>discuss</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>だん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Fire, Say</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The fireman chief has finally arrived to <font color=""#f0a""><b>discuss</b></font> your transgression. What is his name? <font><b>Dan</b></font> (だん). His name is Dan. And Dan is not happy with you.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Picture Dan’s screaming face. Feel the spittle spraying on your face as he screams at you for saying there was a fire when there really wasn’t. This isn’t so much a discussion as it is a good old fashioned tongue lashing. But hey, you deserve it.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>表<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>express</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ひょう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">あらわ,&nbsp;おもて</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Life, Kick</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Before you can <font color=""#f0a""><b>express</b></font> the agony you feel, everyone around you shouts “<font><b>Heyo</b></font>!” (ひょう) to you. Not the most sensitive thing to say, but that’s what happens.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine them saying it more like ひょう, though, so you have to try to figure out what they are saying.</span></i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>客<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>guest</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>きゃく</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Mouth, Winter, Helmet</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Another part of the <font color=""#f0a""><b>guest</b></font> ritual is to eat <font><b>Kia coo</b></font>kies (きゃく). Yes, Kia cookies. Kia, the Korean manufacturer of cars makes cookies. Now you must eat them.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Cookies taste great. Kia cookies taste even better. Imagine how awesome these Kia cookies taste after having that yucky leather strap in your mouth. Kia cookies are delicious.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>重<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>heavy</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>じゅう,&nbsp;</b>ちょう</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">おも,&nbsp;かさ, え</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Heavy</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Think of a very, very <b><font color=""#f0a"">heavy</font></b> person. The heaviest person you have ever seen. But, you don't want to let that they are heavy define them. So, you talk. You spend the evening with them, and learn that they are very, very <b>Jew</b>ish (じゅう) as well. In fact, being a <b><font color=""#f0a"">heavy</font></b> <b>Jew</b>ish person is what defines them.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: This very <b><font color=""#f0a"">heavy</font></b> <b>Jew</b>ish person also combines being heavy with being Jewish. ""Did you know, the most important thing you must do to get into heaven is be heavy?"" he tells you. ""Heavy and heaven, they share many letters, so it must be so, and I must get heavy."" This argument is frustrating to you. Or, maybe it's interesting. You can decide how you react to this conversation by yourself so this mnemonic is more personalized to you.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>持<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>hold</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">も (じ)</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>も</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Grave, Measurement, Nailbat</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">What would you do if you grabbed onto and held a nailbat like this? You would probably <font><b>mo</b></font>an (も) in pain. It would hurt. Why must you <font color=""#f0a""><b>hold</b></font> it that way? You would moan and groan in agony until you let go of that bat. Nails hurt. I don’t blame you for moaning about it.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine having nails sticking out of your palm and fingers. You’d be in a lot of pain. Think of how much that would hurt and how you’d be crying and moaning and whining. Ouchie.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>負<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>lose</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ふ</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">ま,&nbsp;お</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Enclosure, Clam</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You’re going to die in here. You’re going to starve from lack of <font><b>foo</b></font>d (ふ). If only you had some food, you’d be able to survive in this enclosure.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Picture starving to death enclosed in a clam. Feel the hunger pangs as your body slowly wastes away. It’s a terrible way to go.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>相<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>mutual</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>そう,&nbsp;</b>しょう</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">あい</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Tree, Eye</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">But how did this tree come to be? Someone had to <font><b>sew</b></font> (そう) it together with the strands of life. Someone sewed the strands into the tree, and in return for love and care, the tree grew. It’s a <font color=""#f0a""><b>mutual</b></font> relationship.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Have you ever sewn a tree before? Probably not. Try to imagine the mutual relationship between yourself and a little tree you sewed together. You and nature are connected.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>要<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>need</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>よう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">い,&nbsp;かなめ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Woman, Helicopter</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Finally she knows what she <b><font color=""#f0a"">need</font></b>s! It's <b>yo</b>gurt (よう)! Delicious, creamy yogurt!</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: What does she need? Yogurt!</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>新<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>new</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>しん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">あたら,&nbsp;あら, にい</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Tree, Stand, Axe</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You cut down the tree and make a <font color=""#f0a""><b>new</b></font> chair. It immediately explodes, sending splinters into your <font><b>shin</b></font>.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Only your shin got hit, so focus all your imaginary pain down there. Try to pull out the splinters. Ouch!</i></span><br> "

Of course it was the <font><b>bu</b></font>tcher (ぶ).&nbsp;</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine walking in on the butcher.</i></span><br> "

You brought <font color=""#f0a""><b>peace</b></font> to the Japanese. In response for this great peace, they give you a <font><b>Wa</b></font>lrus.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: What are you going to do with a walrus, though? Imagine thinking how you shouldn't brought peace to Japan by chewing down that pine... this walrus is a pain.</i></span><br> "

He’s really excited to rule his <font color=""#f0a""><b>prefecture</b></font>. His name is Ken.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Ken the lion will make a great king. Ken can do it. "<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>乗<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>ride</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">じょう</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>の</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Mouth, Pine</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Remember, just say <font><b>no</b></font> (の) to pines. All the cool kids might try and pressure you into sticking pines into your mouth, but just say no. Be above the influence. No means no. You know what’s cooler than not sticking pines in your mouth? Not getting a <font color=""#f0a""><b>ride</b></font> to the hospital.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Be proud of yourself for standing up to peer pressure. You said no and you aren’t afraid who knows it. Pines have no power over you and your mouth. Well done.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>屋<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>roof, shop</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">おく</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>や</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Ground, Flag, Grave, Pile</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">What team did Babe Ruth play for again? Oh, yeah – the <font><b>Ya</b></font>nkees (や). How forgetful of you. The flag in the <font color=""#f0a""><b>roof</b></font> of his grave is a Yankee flag! Duh.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Do you like the Yankees? Imagine if you played for them. You’d be like, super popular if you were a Yankees player. Just imagine the fame and fortune.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>送<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>send</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>そう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">おく</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Heaven, Horns, Water Slide</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Do you know what your punishment is in the underworld? You have to <font><b>sew</b></font> (そう) and patch old clothes by hand for eternity. Then you <font color=""#f0a""><b>send</b></font> them away where they get ripped and sent back to you. The pile of clothing for you to sew is never-ending. What a drag.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine how awful this would be. Sewing clothes back together for eternity? Your hands would be all cramped and in pain all day. Plus you’d probably poke yourself with a needle. Sewing is lame!</i></span><br> "

But the <font><b>cu</b></font>ckoo (く) bird is coming! It will end this <font color=""#f0a""><b>suffering</b></font>, surely! The cuckoo bird notices you and plucks you from the ground, devouring you whole, ending your suffering.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Feel as much hope as you can for the cuckoo bird. Imagine it off in the distance, and all you want is for it to come to you and end your suffering. Think of the joy you feel when it does come to eat you.</i></span><br> "

Oy, stop daydreaming about when you were a child and get outta there! There's a tsunami coming! You don't want to have to <font color=""#f0a""><b>swim</b></font> back home, do you?</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Picture yourself swimming home in the aftermath of the tsunami. Imagine yourself in the water, each swim stroke saying, 'Oy'. Now swim back home. Oy, oy, oy.</i></span><br> "

You should be. Trains are big. And that’s the truth.</i></span><br> "

"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>待<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>wait</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">ま (たい)</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ま</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Grave, Loiter, Measurement</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Okay, you’re scared. What do you want? You want your <font><b>ma</b></font>ma (ま). Mama will make it less scary. You don’t want to <font color=""#f0a""><b>wait</b></font> here any longer by yourself. You want your mama.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: We usually want our mamas when we’re in scary situations like these. Imagine how comforting your mama is. This graveyard would be a lot less creepy if your mama was there to make everything better.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>勝<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>win</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>しょう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">か</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Power, Moon, Horns, Train</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Actually, this race is all part of a demonic event being put on to amuse the <font><b>sho</b></font>gun (しょう). The sports car is possessed, and they’re just putting on the event for the shogun's entertainment. Even though the shogun knows it’s all staged, it is still very exciting to see who <font color=""#f0a""><b>win</b></font>s.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Picture yourself along with the shogun and thousands of other fans in the audience watching the race. Hear the roar of the crowd and feel the rumble of the grandstand. This is the single greatest event the shogun has ever seen.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>界<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>world</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>かい</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Rice Paddy, Hut</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You're sitting in your little hut on your rice paddy and everything is good in the <font color=""#f0a""><b>world</b></font> when suddenly a pack of <font><b>coyotes</b></font> (かい) bust down your hut and start tearing everything to pieces.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Yell out 'COYOTE!
