"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>進<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>advance</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>しん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">すす</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Turkey, Water Slide</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Unfortunately for the turkey, you’ve made the ladder up to the waterslide a bit hard for it to climb. As a result, the turkey bangs its <font><b>shin</b></font>s (しん) on every rung of the ladder as it <font color=""#f0a""><b>advance</b></font>s up to the top. Poor turkey. Although, I bet you’re wondering, “Do turkeys even have shins?” Sure they do.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Picture this scene. It’s entertaining enough seeing a turkey advance up a ladder and slide down a water slide, but with the turkey banging its little shins on the ladder rungs as it climbs? Priceless.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>酒<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>alcohol</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>しゅ</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">さけ,&nbsp;さか</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Alcohol, Tsunami</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Remember that beach you’re on? To fully enjoy the experience, you’ve removed your <font><b>shoe</b></font>s (しゅ). Being able to feel the sand between your toes is a great feeling. Especially when paired with <font color=""#f0a""><b>alcohol</b></font>.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine wearing shoes on the beach. It’s probably the worst footwear choice you could make. You’re going to get sand in your shoes. Guaranteed. Isn’t that the worst? Make sure you take off your shoes when you walk on sand. It’s way better, trust me.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>業<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>business</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ぎょう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Fins, Sheep, Spikes</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">What’s this? The sheep is also trying to eat some <font><b>gyo</b></font>za (ぎょう) dumplings! Where will this sheep’s madness end? First spikey finned fish and now gyoza? This is some crazy <font color=""#f0a""><b>business</b></font>.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine you’re at an Asian style restaurant and you just ordered a big plate of gyoza dumplings. Next thing you know, this crazy sheep busts through the front door and starts devouring all your gyoza! Where did this sheep come from and why does he love gyoza so much!?</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>算<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>calculate</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>さん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">そろ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Eye, Bamboo, Twenty</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Do you know how <font><b>San</b></font>ta-san (さん) punishes naughty boys and girls in Asia? He doesn’t give them coal, Santa-san tortures them with twenty bamboo jabs to the eye. Yikes. Do you know how Santa-san <font color=""#f0a""><b>calculate</b></font>s who is naughty and who is nice? By their school grades, of course.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Picture this evil Asian Santa-san, clad in blood red garments and brandishing pointed bamboo shoots in each hand. He’s a cold and calculating madman! You’d better start studying! Santa-san is watching!</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>運<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>carry</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>うん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">はこ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Car, Forehead, Water Slide</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">To make matters worse, it’s started to rain outside. So not only do your friends have to <font color=""#f0a""><b>carry</b></font> you, they also have to carry an <font><b>um</b></font>brella (うん). It’s very cumbersome and very inconveniencing. Way to go and hit your forehead on that waterslide, you’ve just ruined everyone’s day.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: It’s hard enough to carry an umbrella while you’re carrying groceries or something, but just imagine trying to carry the dead weight of an unconscious human while still holding an umbrella so you don’t get wet. It’s going to be like, super difficult. Just picture it.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>漢<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>chinese, china</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>かん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Tsunami, Chinese</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Wait a minute, that’s not a Chinese deity at all! That’s the powerful spirit of the Mongolian warlord Genghis Khan (かん) and he’s having his wrath unloaded on all of <font color=""#f0a""><b>China</b></font>. KHAAANNNN!!!</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Remember that Star Trek movie, Star Trek II: The Wrath of Khan? Remember when he yells out, “KHAAANNNN!!” in the film? If so, picture that scene in your mind and imagine yourself doing it in the face of a tsunami. If you don’t know what scene I’m talking about, look it up on YouTube.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>鳴<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>chirp</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">めい</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>な</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Mouth, Bird</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The best place to experience the <font color=""#f0a""><b>chirp</b></font> chirping of birds is when you’re out in <font><b>na</b></font>ture (な). You’re not going to hear birds chirping in a crowded city, so you need to get out into nature to fully experience the birds and their chirps.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Nature is a great place to clear your mind and relax. Picture yourself in nature’s wilderness once again. The sun on your face, the wind in your hair, the grass beneath your feet, and the chirps of birds in the air. It’s quite nice.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>集<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>collect</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>しゅう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">あつ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Tree, Turkey</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Okay, so the turkey is in a tree – you have to go up there to <font color=""#f0a""><b>collect</b></font> it. Or, or - you could just hire a <font><b>shoo</b></font>ter (しゅう) and have them shoot the turkey right out of the tree. Yeah, that'd be much easier than actually going up there to collect it yourself.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Picture this shooter about to shoot the turkey out of the tree so you can collect its carcass from the ground afterwards. BAM! The shooter shoots the turkey and it falls on the ground dead.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>配<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>distribute</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>はい</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">くば</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Cobra, Alcohol</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">But, the cobra does stop long enough not to speak to you, but to say a <font><b>hai</b></font>ku (はい).<br>I take alcohol<br>And give it to restaurants<br>They pay me in rats</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: If you stop him again, he tells you another haiku. Want to come up with this one on your own?</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>飲<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>drink</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">いん</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>の</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Eat, Lack</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Do you know what the only beverage to <font color=""#f0a""><b>drink</b></font> that you have is? It’s <font><b>no</b></font>g (の). Egg nog. Thick and creamy egg nog. Yum.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Most people either love egg nog or hate egg nog. If you love it, imagine how good it tastes and how nice it is to drink on a winter’s day, curled up in front of a fire. Or if you hate it, imagine how gross it tastes and how it makes you want to drink something else like apple juice or something.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>終<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>end</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>しゅう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">おわ, お</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Two, Winter, Thread</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You are a <font><b>shoo</b></font>ter (しゅう), a hired gun. You have to shoot someone to fulfill your contract, but you're so cold, you can't shoot straight. You wish winter would <font color=""#f0a""><b>end</b></font> so you could shoot again like normal.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine yourself as a shooter with a sniper rifle. Look down the scope and try to aim it at something, even though you are shivering violently. This would be very frustrating. It's almost impossible to hit your mark.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>顔<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>face</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">がん</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>かお</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Hair, Stand, Cliff, Geoduck</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">But where did that geoduck come from anyway? As you turn around from the cliff edge, wiping the goop from your <font color=""#f0a""><b>face</b></font> and out of your eyes, you see an angry <font><b>cow</b></font> (かお). This cow is the one who hit you in the face with this geoduck. I know not the reason, but this cow is most definitely not happy with you.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Cows are big animals. So you probably got hit in the face with that geoduck pretty hard. Feel the geoduck shaped welt starting to form on the side of your face. It’s very painful and stings a lot.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>落<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>fall</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>らく</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">お</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Kiss, Tsunami, Flowers</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You want to save these flowers you see <b><font color=""#f0a"">fall</font></b>ing in around you, so you take out a drying <b>rack</b> (らく) and place them carefully on it. Now whenever you feel scared, you can look at the flowers on this rack and you won't be scared anymore.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine running around catching the flowers as they fall. Imagine placing each little petal onto the rack to keep it safe and dry.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>農<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>farming</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>のう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Music, Superman</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">By day, you are simply known as <font><b>No</b></font>ah (のう), the boring ol’ farmhand, but by night you become the mighty <font color=""#f0a""><b>Farming</b></font> Man! Who would expect normal Noah to turn into such an amazing and stupendous superhero? Music swells in a crescendo! Farming Man is here to save the day!</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Is your name Noah? Do you know someone named Noah? Do they seem like the superhero type? Imagine them as a superhero. Picture how they would look like in farming gear and a cape.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>速<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>fast</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>そく</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">はや</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Ent</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The ent jumped on the water slide a little too <font color=""#f0a""><b>fast</b></font> though. He forgot to take off his <font><b>sock</b></font>s (そく). Now they're all soggy and wet, and he is very upset about this as well.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: First I go too fast on a water slide. Now my socks are wet. What could make this day any worse? SARUUMANNNNNNNNNN. A WIZARD SHOULD KNOW BETTER.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>頭<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>head</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">ず,&nbsp;とう</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>あたま</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Beans, Geoduck</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">As the geoduck eats more and more beans, its <font color=""#f0a""><b>head</b></font> gets bigger and bigger until finally the geoduck’s head explodes like an <font><b>atomi</b></font>c (あたま) bomb. BOOM! Geoduck parts go flying everywhere and pieces of the geoduck’s massive head float to the ground as atomic fallout.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Remember how gross geoducks are? Of course you do. Now imagine one exploding right in front of you. You’ve got geoduck mess all over yourself. It’s gross, slimy, sticky, and covering you from head to toe. It’s wretched.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>聞<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>hear</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ぶん,&nbsp;</b>もん</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">き</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Ear, Gate</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">From the other side of the gate, you <font color=""#f0a""><b>hear</b></font> one of the people on the other side start to play a song on a recorder. You recognize the song as “Hot Cross <font><b>Bun</b></font>s (ぶん).” You haven’t heard this song in a long time. “Hot cross buns… hot cross buns~”</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: I’m sure many of you were forced to play the recorder in school at some point and were made to play the song known as hot cross buns. Picture yourself playing this song and remember the melody when you see this kanji.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>院<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>institution</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>いん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Origin, Helmet, Butcher</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Where did the butcher helmet originate? Oh, yeah – that’s right, at the <font><b>In</b></font>stitution (いん). The <font color=""#f0a""><b>Institution</b></font> of Butchery.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Try and picture what an Institution of Butchery would look like. Imagine yourself walking through the halls past countless classrooms where nothing but meat carving is being done. It would probably be a bit gross if you’re squeamish and perhaps smell a bit funny depending on how fresh everything is.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>調<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>investigate, tone</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ちょう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">しら</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Say, Ghost</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The next morning as you’re eating breakfast you hear the ghost say, ""Murder Mrs.<b>Chou</b> (ちょう)… Murder… Mrs. ChooOoOuuUUuuUuu~” The ghost's <b><font color=""#f0a"">tone</font></b> of voice scares you half to death. Once you regain your composure, you vow once and for all to <b><font color=""#f0a"">investigate</font></b> the source of this ghost’s nonsense and solve the issue once and for all.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Why does the ghost want you to kill Mrs. Chou? Sure she's evil and all, but murder? Dang. You fantasize about killing Mrs. Chou for a moment before you realize that's not the solution. But first things first, you need to investigate this ghost issue of yours.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>鉄<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>iron</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>てつ</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Gold, Fault</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Do you know that movie, <font><b>Tetsu</b></font>o (てつ) the <font color=""#f0a""><b>Iron</b></font> Man? We talked about it on Tofugu a while back. It’s one of the wackiest Japanese movies of all time. If you don’t know about Tetsuo the Iron Man, you should definitely look it up. Tetsuo is one of the most insane movies in the history of ever.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Watch a trailer on YouTube for Tetsuo the Iron Man. Go ahead, do it now – I’ll wait. Did you watch it? Remember that nonsense every time you see this kanji.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>語<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>language</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ご</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">かた</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Mouth, Five, Say</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You know what you don't need to know five <font color=""#f0a""><b>language</b></font>s for? Playing a game of <font><b>go</b></font> (ご). Go is played by all sorts of people the world round, and you don't need to speak at all during the game. So stop studying language and get out there and play some go!</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine playing go against someone who doesn't speak the same language as you. The game itself is the same, but he keeps muttering things in a language you don't understand. What could he be saying?</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>葉<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>leaf</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">よう</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>は, ば</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Tree, Generation, Flowers</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You are the greatest tree type of them all, though, and your leaves are the best. You laugh at all the other trees: '<font><b>HA</b></font> HA HA!' you say.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Choose your favorite type of tree. Imagine the leaves of that tree. Now compare them to fellow trees. How terrible are they? So bad you laugh.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>習<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>learn</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>しゅう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">なら</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">White, Feathers</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">To study these white feathers and <font color=""#f0a""><b>learn</b></font> more about them, you’ve collected a ton of feathers in a lab room. To get all these feathers, you hired a <font><b>shoo</b></font>ter (しゅう) to shoot down all the doves in the area. The shooter shoots them all, and you get all the feathers you need.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: See this shooter taking joy in his job as he helps you collect feathers so you can learn about doves. Hear the gun firing as dove after dove drops from the sky, the shooter laughing maniacally all the way.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>軽<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>lightweight</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">けい</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>かる,&nbsp;</b>かろ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Car</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">What do you wish you had to transport this tombstone? Oh, that’s right – a <font><b>car</b></font> (かる). If you had a car, this tombstone moving business would be no problem. To cars, tombstones are naught but <font color=""#f0a""><b>lightweight</b></font> pebbles!</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Remember all that hard work you were doing before and how you got all sweaty and gross? Now imagine yourself inside of a nice car with air conditioning, and the tombstone in the trunk. It feels great doesn’t it? The air conditioning is perfect, and driving a car is much easier than carrying a tombstone around.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>線<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>line</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>せん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Water, White, Thread</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The person who threw you that <font color=""#f0a""><b>line</b></font> of thread is actually a <font><b>cen</b></font>taur (せん). How kind of him. After you are safe you hop on the centaur's back and ride around to get the wind to dry you off.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Coming out of the rushing water, this centaur is like an angel sent from heaven. He's just saved your life. Imagine the happiness and gratitude you feel towards this centaur as you are pulled to safety by that line of thread.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>最<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>most</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>さい</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">もっと</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Sun, Stool, Ear</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">When you get back inside and look at your ear in the mirror and see how red it is, you let out a big <font><b>sigh</b></font> (さい). This is the <font color=""#f0a""><b>most</b></font> embarrassing thing to happen to you in days! This sunburn is terrible. Sigh…</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: I’m sure you’ve had at least one bad sunburn in your life. Imagine how painful and uncomfortable it is. Trying to sleep with it, people slapping it - it’s very annoying and definitely something to sigh about. Picture yourself sighing at this terrible experience and actually sigh as you do it.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>開<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>open</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>かい</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">あ,&nbsp;ひら</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Gate, Lantern</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Once the gate gets open to your surprise a pack of <font><b>Coy</b></font>otes (かい) burst through, knocking you to the ground and tearing you apart. You wonder why you opened this gate in the first place. You wonder why you didn't realize why the gatekeeper was ignoring you when you asked for him to open the gate (as well as why he sounded like a coyote). Oh, woe is you. These coyotes will be your end.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine them pulling you apart. If you want, try to fight back, but they're too fast and strong. Run away for a while. Just be sure to focus on the fact that they're coyotes, and they're terrifying.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>親<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>parent</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>しん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">おや, した</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Tree, Stand, See</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Once you get closer to the tree, you and your <font color=""#f0a""><b>parent</b></font> see that it has some pretty crazy roots coming out of it. While making your way into the shade, you manage to bang your <font><b>shin</b></font> (しん) on one of these roots. Your shins already hurt from walking so much, and this is just icing on the cake.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Busting your shins on things really hurts. I'm sure you've hit your shins on coffee tables and the like all your life. Remember that pain and think how much worse it would be banging your bare shins on pointy tree roots after you've been hiking all day in the hot sun. Not enjoyable.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>読<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>read</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">とう, どく</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>よ</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Say, Sell</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">What are you forced to <b><font color=""#f0a"">read</font></b> aloud to sell? <b>Yo</b>-yo (よ) instructions! You’d think they’d be self explanatory, but there are actually a lot of rules and tricks that you have to read to get good at yo-yoing. Read all of these out loud so you can sell them.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine reading through your list of yo-yo tricks. Do you know how to pronounce those weird yo-yo names?</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>転<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>revolve</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>てん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">ころ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Car, Boobs</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Since he loves both cars and boobs, but can only drive one car at a time, he feels the need to compensate with women (boobs). As such, there are <font><b>ten</b></font> (てん) women packed into this car with ten sets of boobs. This man is in heaven. His world <font color=""#f0a""><b>revolve</b></font>s around car and boobs. He couldn’t be happier.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Is this reduction of women to nothing more than their boobs getting on your nerves? Especially when ten women are just referred to as ten sets of boobs? Use this annoyance to help you remember the reading and meaning of this kanji.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>路<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>road</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ろ</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">じ, みち</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Foot, Kiss</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">What was this person walking down again? Oh, that’s right – a <font><b>ro</b></font>ad (ろ). They were walking down a dirt <font color=""#f0a""><b>road</b></font>.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Walking down a dirt road barefoot like this is a sure way to dirty up your feet. Feel the dirt, rocks, and twigs under your feet. The road is hard and dry and is not making your journey very comfortable at all.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>病<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>sick</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>びょう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">や, やまい</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Dynamite, Sick</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Being nervous all the time about spontaneously exploding would probably make you sweat profusely. And you know what sweating causes? <font><b>B.O.</b></font> (びょう). You’d be one smelly stick of dynamite. B.O. is a very unpleasant smell, and being <font color=""#f0a""><b>sick</b></font> is no excuse.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Picture this as your life. You could explode at any moment, you’re sick, and you have B.O. Nobody wants to be around you because you might explode and kill them, and you stink. What a terrible way to live!</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>横<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>side</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">おう</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>よこ</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Tree, Yellow</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Wait, that woman with the chainsaw is <font><b>Yoko</b></font> (よこ) Ono! Yes, the same Yoko Ono who’s married to John Lennon of the Beatles. What’s she doing chopping down trees on the <font color=""#f0a""><b>side</b></font> of your house? Who can say. Silly Yoko.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Now picture the same scene as before only imagining Yoko Ono wielding that chainsaw. Maybe she’s dancing. Maybe there’s some Beatles music playing in the background. Either way it’s a strange sight – remember it.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>歌<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>song</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>か</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">うた</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Lip Ring, Lack</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You're singing a <font color=""#f0a""><b>song</b></font> with all these lip rings in your mouth and you sound terrible. You're on the side of the road singing. People are freaking out. Finally, someone drives into you with their <font><b>ca</b></font>r (か).</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine yourself getting hit by this car. All the air flies out of you as you sing your <font color=""#f0a""><b>song</b></font>. You think 'I shouldn't have tried to sing a song with all these lip rings...'</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>起<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>wake up</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">き</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>お</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Run, Cobra</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">When you step on the cobra, causing it to <font color=""#f0a""><b>wake up</b></font>, it bites you. You scream out a quick '<font><b>Oh</b></font>!' (お) because you're startled and bitten.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Then you say a more somber 'oh...' because you realize what it means to be bitten by a cobra, especially this far away from a hospital. You like to run in the wilderness for some reason.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>功<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>achievement</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>こう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Construction, Power</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Who are you? You are the mighty and powerful <font><b>こう</b></font>いち, master of all construction and power equipment. You yourself are a grand <font color=""#f0a""><b>achievement</b></font>, こういち. Very mighty indeed.</span></span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Picture こういち. Now picture こういち shirtless in a shiny yellow construction hat. Looks pretty powerful doesn’t he? He’s holding a power tool in one hand and your love and affection in the other. He’s majestic.</span></span></i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>成<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>become</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>せい</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">な</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Sword, Drunkard</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">This drunkard is so drunk that he thinks he’s Hard Gay. He runs around the streets brandishing his sword shouting, “<font><b>Sei</b></font> (せい), sei, sei!” If he wasn’t likely to <font color=""#f0a""><b>become</b></font> arrested before, he sure is now.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine that same sword brandishing drunkard from before. Now imagine him running all about shouting, “Sei, sei, sei!” Hear his loud, slurred voice in your ears as you watch him bumble around drunkenly.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>岸<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>coast</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>がん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">きし</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Mountain, Antenna, Cliff</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Do you know who maintains this mountain cliff antenna? It’s none other than <font><b>Gan</b></font>dhi (がん) himself. This is the world famous Gandhi antenna that connects all of India, <font color=""#f0a""><b>coast</b></font> to coast. Good Guy Gandhi strikes again.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: I’m sure you’ve seen all those crazy buildings in Dubai. Now imagine Gandhi crafting one of these feats of architectural genius in the form of a mega antenna. Imagine this Gandhi antenna in your mind. It’s gigantic and on top of a mountain. It’s impressive.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>競<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>compete</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>きょう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">きそ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Stand, Older Brother</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">One thing you think you might be able to compete with your older brother in is a foot race. As such, you challenge him in a race to <font><b>Kyo</b></font>to (きょう). You’ve competed in races before, and you’re pretty fast. Maybe even faster than your older brother. So you decide to race him to Kyoto. Kyoto is pretty far away, but that just makes the race more exciting.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Picture how far Kyoto is away from your current location. It’s probably pretty far. Imagine yourself competing against your older brother in a race to Kyoto. It’s a long way away and you’re gonna get really tired running there. Picture how tired and exhausted this competition will make you.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>争<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>conflict</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>そう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">あらそ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Barb, Enclosure, Wolverine</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">When the wolverine cuts itself on the barbed enclosure (which it will inevitably do at some point), you’re going to have to <font><b>sew</b></font> (そう) up its wound to keep it from dying. It might be a bit of a <font color=""#f0a""><b>conflict</b></font> getting the wolverine to stay still while you sew up the wound, but it needs to be done.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Pretend you’re the wolverine once again. You’re already in pain from gouging yourself on the barbed enclosure, and now you’re getting sewn up with a needle and thread! When will the agony end?</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>便<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>convenience</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>べん</b>, びん</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">たよ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Ground, Rice Paddy, Treasure, Leader</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">He finds a place to dig in the ground. It looks like there's some fresh dirt here. Finally, the treasure of <font color=""#f0a""><b>convenience</b></font> that will make this leader's life so much easier. He digs into the ground and pulls out a box. When he opens it, he finds out it's a <font><b>ben</b></font>to (べん). My god, he thinks. This really will make my life more convenient. My people can take their lunches with them now instead of coming back to base to eat, which will waste way less time!</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Feel the happiness that the leader would feel at this revelation. It will make everything much more convenient for him, since he's not the one doing all the manual labor. He won't have to eat out of a bento, that's for sure.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>老<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>elderly</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ろう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Spoon, Coffin</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Now that you’re&nbsp;<b><font color=""#f0a"">elderly</font></b>&nbsp;(and probably about to die) you suddenly crave some delicious&nbsp;<b>roe</b>&nbsp;(ろう). Salmon roe, sea urchin roe, tofugu roe, doesn’t matter. Your old, tired bones need roe after all that hard work!</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: You hated roe when you were still young, but now that you’re an elderly old fart you really want to eat it. Roe is for old people, you guess, as you slurp it up.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>命<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>fate</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>めい</b>, みょう</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">いのち</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Mouth, Orders</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You are the commanding officer on the <font><b>May</b></font>flower (めい). You give orders to colonize America. The orders spewing from your mouth hole determine the <font color=""#f0a""><b>fate</b></font> of the settlers and the fate of America and the fate of the world! You and the Mayflower have changed everything forever.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Students of American history are very familiar with the Mayflower. Recall learning about it in school whenever you see this kanji. Or look it up on Wikipedia if you don’t know about it. The Mayflower is a big deal!</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>指<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>finger</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">し</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ゆび</b>, さ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Sun, Spoon, Nailbat</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">What would <font><b>you be</b></font> (ゆび) if you had a nail driven through your <font color=""#f0a""><b>finger</b></font>? You be in pain. You be in a lotta pain, man.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Poking your finger on a nail from a nailbat was bad enough, imagine how much more painful it would be to have a nail driven right through your finger. You be in excruciating pain, yo – imagine this pain and how much you be cryin’.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>初<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>first</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>しょ</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">はじ, はつ, そ, ぞ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Sword, Pelican</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Since this sword wielding pelican is the <font color=""#f0a""><b>first</b></font> of its kind, it became quite famous. So famous that the pelican has become part of a traveling circus <font><b>show</b></font> (しょ). People come from miles around to see the show and the sword wielding pelican. He’s kind of a big deal.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Have you seen a circus show before? Picture yourself at that time and imagine yourself seeing a sword wielding pelican as part of that show. It’s the first time you’ve ever seen something like this so it’s quite impressive.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>味<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>flavor</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>み</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">あじ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Mouth, Jet</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">And what has more <font color=""#f0a""><b>flavor</b></font> than a big slab of <font><b>me</b></font>at (み)? You love meat and its flavor nearly as much as you love the flavor of this juice. So many good things to put in your mouth!&nbsp;</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Of course, if you're vegetarian imagine the flavor of the meat being terrible. Up to you. Make the mnemonic work for your lifestyle.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>追<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>follow</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">つい</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>お</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Bear, Water Slide</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">This particular water slide goes into the <font><b>o</b></font>cean (お). The reason the bear got on it was so that he could fish for ocean fish. This bear has a taste for ocean fish and couldn’t resist going down the water slide to get to the ocean. Maybe it would be safe to <font color=""#f0a""><b>follow</b></font> him once he got a meal of ocean fish, but definitely not safe to follow him down right away.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: So this waterslide goes down into the ocean. Picture yourself standing on the cliff at the top of the slide with the ocean spreading out in front of you. Feel the cool ocean breeze and smell the fresh salty air. It’s very relaxing. Except for the whole bear thing, that was king of horrifying.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>神<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>god</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>しん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">かみ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Pelican, Say Humbly</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Even though the pelican is speaking humbly, he manages to anger a passerby. This passerby runs up to the pelican and breaks both of his <font><b>shin</b></font>s (しん) with a baseball bat. “Oh, <font color=""#f0a""><b>God</b></font>!” the pelican cries, taking God’s name in vain. “My shins! You’ve broken them! Blimey!”</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Picture this scene in your mind. A crazed onlooker running up to this humble pelican and breaking his shins with a baseball bat. The pelican is screaming and squawking in pain as both of its shins are broken.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>良<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>good</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">りょう</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>よ</b>, い</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Drop, Good</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">A <font color=""#f0a""><b>good</b></font> way to pass the time until you finally get some water is by playing with a <font><b>yo</b></font>-yo (よ). You can spin it up and down, walk the dog, and do all other sorts of crazy tricks with this yo-yo. Before you know it, you'll have drop after drop of refreshment. Playing with a yo-yo sure does make the time fly!</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: See yourself playing with this good yo-yo out in the desert. You're still super thirsty, but having this yo-yo to play with makes it all a bit more bearable.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>意<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>idea</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>い</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Heart, Sound</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The heart of an <font><b>ea</b></font>gle (い) is very strong. The person who knew this probably came up with the <font color=""#f0a""><b>idea</b></font> to make the bald eagle a symbol of the United States. Eagles are always flying around and doing things, so their hearts are very strong.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Picture the majestic animal that is the bald eagle. Imagine the sound of an eagle screeching as it zooms through the air, flapping its wings in the wind. It’s pretty impressive.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>労<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>labor</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ろう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">いたわ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Power, Viking</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">It takes a lot of&nbsp;<font color=""#f0a""><b>labor</b></font>&nbsp;to harvest&nbsp;<b>roe</b>&nbsp;(ろう) so that’s what the Viking decides to take first! Roe is delicious, but it’s small and delicate. Vikings don’t labor for their own roe! They take it and eat it!</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Picture this powerful Viking laying siege on a small fishing village and taking all the roe and stuffing it into his bearded face. So much labor went into harvesting that roe! Vikings are so mean!</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>好<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>like</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>こう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">す, この</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Woman, Child</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Look at the child again. This child is <font><b>こう</b></font>いち, and you are the woman in charge of protecting him. You <font color=""#f0a""><b>like</b></font> こういち. He is your cub and you must protect him, just like a mother bear would.</span></span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine こういち. Now imagine how much love and adoration you have for this man-child. Use those incredibly strong feelings of devotion to remember this kanji and its reading.</span></i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>昔<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>long ago</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>むかし</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Sun, Blackjack</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Once you finally finish the game, you walk to long walk back home, in the sun, barefoot, on a dirt road that hasn’t been renovated since <font color=""#f0a""><b>long ago</b></font>. Your feet are all sweaty from being out in the sun, and walking on this dirt road gives you <font><b>muck ashi</b></font> (むかし). Your ashi (feet) are all mucky and muddy from the combination of dirt and sweat. Your muck ashi are really gross, man.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine your muck ashi, all dirty and muddy from walking on that old road from long ago. Feel the muck between the toes of your ashi, squishing with every step. Hear the sound the mud makes as it slides between your sweaty mucky toes.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>低<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>low</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>てい</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">ひく</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Ground, Leader, Duck</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You know what else makes you get&nbsp;<b><font color=""#f0a"">low</font></b>&nbsp;to the ground? "<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>育<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>nurture, raise</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>いく</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">そだ, はぐく</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Moon, Boob</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">People would be so amazed at this moon’s boobs and its ability to nurture that they’d write many a ha<font><b>iku</b></font> (いく) about it. These haikus would be great. Mother moon has boobs / They nurture all of mankind / This is a haiku.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Use this awesome haiku I wrote to help you remember this kanji. It’s so artistically moving, I don’t know how anyone could forget this haiku.</i></span><br> "

"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>注<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>pour</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ちゅう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">そそ, さ, つ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Master, Tsunami</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">If <font><b>Chew</b></font>bacca (ちゅう) was trying to attack you, you’d be able to defend yourself easily. Simply <font color=""#f0a""><b>pour</b></font> a tsunami on him and Chewbacca would surrender in a heartbeat. Chewbacca doesn’t like having water poured on him, especially not all the water from a tsunami.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine Chewbacca soaking wet. All his fur is matted down and he looks pretty depressed. He smells like wet dog too. Smell this smell in your nostrils as you imagine how pathetic this drenched Chewbacca feels.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>利<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>profit, advantage</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>り</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">き</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Pine, Ribs</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You know what goes great with pine smoked ribs? <font><b>Ree</b></font>se’s (り) Pieces. Imagine its chocolately, peanut buttery, piney, meaty taste in your mouth. Finger lickin’ good.</i></span><br> "

"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>級<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>rank, grade</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>きゅう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Thread, Escalator</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The reason they are marching <font color=""#f0a""><b>rank</b></font> and file up the escalator is to reach the top of the building where a <font><b>cu</b></font>te (きゅう) rabbit has been stranded. The thread running up the escalator will lead them right to the cute rabbit’s location. They must hurry for the cute rabbit’s life is in danger!</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Picture yourself saving this cute rabbit from certain doom. Rabbits are cute and cuddly and very fuzzy. Feel the soft fur of this cute rabbit ad you hold it in your arms and pet it.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>仲<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>relationship</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">ちゅう</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>なか</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Middle, Leader</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Since this guy doesn’t really have a strong opinion on anything, you find yourself wondering what’s going on in his head. You wish there was a door <font><b>knocker</b></font> (なか) on his forehead so you could use the knocker to see if anyone’s home. You could knock and ask why he’s being such a middle of the road leader and give him suggestions about how he could grow a backbone and better his <font color=""#f0a""><b>relationship</b></font>s with people.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine your favorite flip-flopper from before. Now imagine that there’s a knocker on his forehead and you get to knock that knocker as hard as you like. Sounds like fun, doesn’t it? Imagine yourself doing this.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>放<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>release</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ほう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">はな, ほう</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Direction, Winter</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Come wintertime, Harry <font><b>Hou</b></font>-dini (ほう) likes to <font color=""#f0a""><b>release</b></font> himself from the sky as well. Hou-dini falls down to the ground with the snow in winter and is miraculously unhurt upon his collision with the ground.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine Hou-dini plummeting towards the ground after being released from an airplane. Hear him splat on the ground, and then see him walk away, totally unscathed.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>秒<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>second</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>びょう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Pine, Few</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">It was hard work chopping down this pine, and once you get a <font color=""#f0a""><b>second</b></font> to rest, you realize that you smell pretty bad. Uh-oh, looks like you’ve got a bad case of <font><b>B.O. </b></font> (びょう). Chopping down the pine was a hard task, and you got all sweaty. Therefore, you hop inside for a quick second for some deodorant to take care of that rank B.O. smell.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Remember how sweaty and gross you can get after a physically demanding task – you probably don’t smell like roses and rainbows afterwards. Imagine that smelly smell of B.O. wafting up into your nostrils after a hard day’s work.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>別<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>separate</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>べつ</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">わか</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Mouth, Sword, Ribs</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Because this way of eating ribs is so ridiculous, one of your friends <font><b>bets you</b></font> (べつ) can’t eat a whole plate using nothing but the sword to <font color=""#f0a""><b>separate</b></font> and eat the ribs. This friend bets you to do a lot of things, but this has to be the most silly bet he’s ever made.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: How terrifying would it be cutting and skewering your rib meat with a sword and then eating from it. I don’t know about you, but I wouldn’t want the blade of a sword anywhere near my mouth, no matter how much the bet was for. Swords are sharp, bet or no bet.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>特<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>special</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>とく</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Cow, Temple</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Then, out of nowhere, the <font color=""#f0a""><b>special</b></font> cow begins to <font><b>talk</b></font> (とく)! What? A talking cow in the temple? This is the most special day in the history of ever! Animals can’t talk! How did this special cow gain the ability to talk?</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Now picture this special cow inside of the temple giving a sermon. The cow is dressed in special sacred vestments as it preaches to the parishioners. Listen to the cow talk as it spreads the good word. Who knew cows could talk?</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>共<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>together</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>きょう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">とも</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Fins, Blackjack</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Did you know that blackjack is the most popular card game amongst fish in <font><b>Kyo</b></font>to (きょう)? Well it is. Every year trillions of fish gather together in Kyoto to have the biggest blackjack tournament ever.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine a bunch of fish gathering together in Kyoto to participate in this blackjack tournament. With so many fish all together in one place, it probably smells pretty fishy. Imagine this strong stench of fish smell and ocean with all the fish gathered together in Kyoto.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>努<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>toil</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ど</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">つと</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Power, Woman, Stool</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The servants are making lots of food for you and your <font><b>do</b></font>g (ど). You're really hungry, so you encourage your minions to <font color=""#f0a""><b>toil</b></font> away faster so that you might feast a bit sooner.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine eating all this food with your dog. "<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>伝<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>transmit, tell</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">でん</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>つた</b>, つて</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Leader, Boobs</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Actually, the reason this man boob leader got elected to be a leader was because he was a <font><b>star</b></font> (つた) sumo wrestler. Sumo wrestlers can actually <font color=""#f0a""><b>transmit</b></font> a lot of authority and are well respected, so this leader and his position make a lot of sense. This leader actually settles conflicts with other government officials by sumo wrestling.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine this sumo star leader settling a conflict with another government official by sumo wrestling. Since he is a star sumo wrestler, he wins easily. What a star!</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>戦<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>war</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>せん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">たたか</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Drunkard, Witch Doctor</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The witch doctor, like the drunkard he is, uses his witch doctor magic and accidently conjures up a <font><b>cen</b></font>taur (せん). This centaur then summons other centaurs, and they amass a whole army of centaurs which the centaur leader uses to start a <font color=""#f0a""><b>war</b></font> on humanity.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine this army of centaurs. Half man, half horse, all business. War business. They’re out to conquer the world and they’re thirsty for human blood. Centaurs are scary. Be afraid.</i></span><br> "

It’s being carried along by the force of the wave and the hammerhead takes a bite out of your skin! Worst. Day. Ever.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: I surely hope you’ve not been attacked by a hammerhead shark before, but I’d like you to try and imagine what it would feel like to get bit by a shark as large as a hammerhead. You’ve heard things about acupuncture being good for the blood flow and the heart and such, so you decide to give it a go. <font color=""#f0a""><b>Bad</b></font> choice.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: The acupuncture doesn’t help at all. "<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>息<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>breath</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>そく</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">いき</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Heart, Self</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You know how when people are unconscious and their <font color=""#f0a""><b>breath</b></font> slows or comes to a stop, they use smelling salts to revive them? Well a smelly <font><b>sock</b></font> (そく) can work just as well. Socks get really stinky and their stench is powerful enough to revive someone who isn’t drawing breath.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine smelling this smelly sock. The performance is being put on to inspire others to pursue the literary arts and such, and everyone wants the shogun to donate money to the Rising Author's Foundation. Your chapter is a big part of the event, so you’d better not screw it up.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Picture yourself being such a famous author that people come from all over to see you speak, even the shogun. They all want to hear you speak and show them what it really means to be an author in today’s world. Feel pride with how important you are.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>登<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>climb</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>とう, と</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">のぼ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Tent, Beans</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">To get revenge on this bean induced fart man, you <font color=""#f0a""><b>climb</b></font> back into the tent after he’s fallen asleep. You then stick your <font><b>toe</b></font> (と) in his open mouth and wait for him to wake up and realize what has happened. Waking up with a toe in your mouth is never pleasant. To make matters worse, before you stuck your toe in his mouth, you walked all around <font><b>To</b></font>kyo (とう), barefoot. The Tokyo streets have made your toe particularly foul</span></span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine yourself waking up to a Tokyo soiled toe in your mouth. It’s stinky and tastes terrible. Taste the footy taste on your tongue as the smell of feet fills your nostrils.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>寒<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>cold</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">かん</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>さむ</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Helmet, Ice, Train</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Imagine an army of ice <font><b>samu</b></font>rai (さむ), all wearing helmets made of ice.
