The murderous stare of these samurai is nearly as cold as the ice helmets themselves.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>深<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>deep</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>しん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">ふか</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Tree, Pi, Tsunami</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Some tsunamis cut so <font color=""#f0a""><b>deep</b></font> that they flat out chop the tree right off its stump. In areas like this, you have to be careful not to bang a <font><b>shin</b></font> (しん) on them. These stumps are right about shin height, so you want to be cautious when walking around them as to not injure yourself.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine being deep in the woods and banging your shin on a stump you didn’t see. It hurts to bang your shin, so imagine this pain and the awful sensation it brings.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>倍<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>double, times</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ばい</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Leader, Clown</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">When the clown stop being funny, it’s time to say <font><b>bye</b></font> (ばい). "<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>勉<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>exertion</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>べん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Power, Excuse</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Excuse me, I don’t think I’ve introduced myself yet. My name is <font><b>Ben</b></font> (べん) and I use powerful muscle <font color=""#f0a""><b>exertion</b></font> to accomplish every task. Ben knows what Ben wants and how to get it. Remember that, kids.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Picture this Ben in your head. Ben always uses lots of exertion to do tasks. "<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>消<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>extinguish</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>しょう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">き, け</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Moon, Triceratops, Tsunami</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">I went to an event where they did a reenactment of this scene. The event was being put on for the <font><b>sho</b></font>gun (しょう), and at the event, the triceratops costume spontaneously combusted so they had to <font color=""#f0a""><b>extinguish</b></font> the flames with a fire extinguisher. It was the most memorable thing I've ever seen.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine you were the one in charge of extinguishing the flames at this event. Everyone is depending on you, especially the shogun. You'll get a medal for this. You’re a hero! Way to go.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>祭<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>festival</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">さい</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>まつり</b>, まつ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Tent, Jackhammer</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">While at the <font color=""#f0a""><b>festival</b></font>, a guy named Matt has to go to the bathroom. <font><b>Matt’s uri</b></font>ne (まつり) has been filling up his bladder ever since he began drinking that 64oz cup of soda. Matt’s urine is ready to bust out at any moment. He really has to go to the bathroom.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine this is you. You are Matt and you’re trying to keep Matt’s urine from spilling out and getting Matt’s pants all wet and creating a very embarrassing moment for Matt. Picture yourself doing the bathroom dance and doing all you can to hold it in.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>野<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>field</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>や</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">の</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Sunflower, Beforehand</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">This <font color=""#f0a""><b>field</b></font> is where the <font><b>Ya</b></font>nkees (や) play! The player you game the sunflower to is a famous Yankees baseball player.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine being on the field and handing the sunflower to this guy wearing a Yankees uniform. As you see him running around the field, listen to all of the Yankees fans cheering.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>階<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>floor</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>かい</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">White, Compare, Butcher</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">In a strange twist of events, the meat they must butcher is <font><b>coy</b></font>ote (かい) meat. As the coyote meat is wheeled out onto the <font color=""#f0a""><b>floor</b></font> for the butchers to prepare, everyone gasps in surprise.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: If you’ve ever seen Iron Chef, you know what it’s like when they wheel out the special secret ingredient. Imagine that same scene, but this time, it’s coyote!</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>庭<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>garden</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>てい</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">にわ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">King, Mullet, Big Bird</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">And of course the best way to celebrate Big Bird’s ascension to the <font color=""#f0a""><b>garden</b></font> throne is with a huge and awesome par<font><b>ty</b></font> (てい). Ever since he acquired that mullet, King Big Bird has loved to party. He wants to party every day of the week!</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Picture this version of Big Bird out in the club getting his party rock on. Imagine King Big Bird partying hard ‘til the break of dawn, dancing, drinking, and rocking out royally.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>港<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>harbor</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>こう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">みなと</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Fins, Cobra, Tsunami, Blackjack</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Let's expand the tsunami's wildness. Upon the tsunami of blackjack cards, fish fins, and cobras is <font><b>こう</b></font>いち, on a surfboard, riding it in. What a majestic sight that is, too.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: こういち also happens to come crashing down where you are, knocking you off your feet and taking you with him into the cards, fins, and cobras. 'Come with me,' he whispers. 'This is my harbor now.'<br>Of course! It was Koichi behind this terror attack!</span></i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>暑<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>hot weather</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">しょ</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>あつ</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Sun, Someone</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You need to get out of this <font color=""#f0a""><b>hot</b></font> sun and into some air conditioning. Then you remember there’s a great air conditioning unit <font><b>at Su</b></font>zie’s (あつ) house. Ah, Suzie – our savior! If you need me, I’ll be at Suzie’s place.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine that great feeling when you go from hot and sticky outside to nice and air conditioned outside. Feel the heat transition on your skin as you step into an air conditioned room at Suzie’s. It gives you goose bumps.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>湯<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>hot water</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">とう</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ゆ</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Gravity, Tsunami</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You’re right on the coast of the <font><b>Yu</b></font>catán (ゆ) Peninsula. It’s pretty rare to see a tsunami of this size in the Yucatán Peninsula, but regardless, gravity’s about to bring that <font color=""#f0a""><b>hot water</b></font> right down on top of your head. Yucatán Peninsula: worst vacation choice ever.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine yourself vacationing on the Yucatán Peninsula. It seemed great at first, but now you’re about to die from a tsunami of hot water. Imagine the regret you feel for choosing the Yucatán Peninsula as your vacation spot.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>島<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>island</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">とう</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>しま</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Mountain, Bird</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">But this <font color=""#f0a""><b>island</b></font> doesn't only belong to the bird. In fact, the bird shouldn't be on this island, because it belongs to <font><b>She-Ma</b></font>n (しま), He-Man's girlfriend. She-Man comes out of the water and grabs the bird, eats it, and then goes back into the sea from whence she came.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: I don't think She-Man is a real character, but you can make up this imaginary He-Man girlfriend in your mind. She is weird about her island, and weird about eating birds, but He-Man and She-Man are in love, so why are you judging? Imagine the two having dinner on their small island later that evening. He-Man wonders where she got the bird from.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>童<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>juvenile</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>どう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Stand, Sunflower</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">So you’ve graduated from the whole sunflower thing. Great. You’re no longer a <font color=""#f0a""><b>juvenile</b></font>. Now you’re a cop overlooking a juvenile detention center. Since you’re a police officer, you now love <font><b>dou</b></font>ghnuts (どう). They’re great. You eat doughnuts every day now.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Picture yourself as a doughnut dunking police officer. Imagine having the power of the law in your hands as you bite into a big tasty doughnut. It tastes like freedom.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>員<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>member</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>いん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Mouth, Clam</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Because this <font color=""#f0a""><b>member</b></font> of the invertebrate family has no eyes, it’s hard to tell if a clam is <font><b>in</b></font>nocent (いん). Usually, people’s eyes can give them away when they’re lying, but since clams have mouths but no eyes, you just have to listen to its story to tell if it’s innocent or not.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Now imagine yourself listening to this clam chatter away about how it is innocent of the crime that it’s accused of. I’m a clam and I’m innocent I tell you! Innocent!</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>商<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>merchandise</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>しょう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">あきな</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Legs, Stand, Mustache</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">In order to advertise his <font color=""#f0a""><b>merchandise</b></font>, the legged mustache pretends that he is actually the <font><b>sho</b></font>gun (しょう) in disguise, hence the mustache. As if a walking mustache with legs wasn't enough of a draw, he's now masquerading as the shogun himself in order to draw attention to his merchandise.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Picture this mustache pretending to be the shogun. He's going to get found out and thrown in jail for impersonation or something. It would definitely cause a commotion. Imagine what that would be like.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>都<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>metropolis</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>と</b>, つ</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">みやこ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Someone, Butcher</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You find a butcher in this <font color=""#f0a""><b>metropolis</b></font> (after looking around FOREVER) and you go inside his shop. You fall to the floor. In every fridge and hanging from the ceiling are rows and rows of <font><b>toe</b></font>s (と). Then the butcher offers you one as a sample.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: You put the toe in your mouth. Oh my, the nail is still on. What kind of <font color=""#f0a""><b>metropolis</b></font> is this? You're never coming here again, if this is how they eat meat in this part of the world.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>動<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>move</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>どう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">うご</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Power, Heavy</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Remember that 1 ton weight? Well, actually it’s a <font><b>dou</b></font>ghnut (どう). A huge, massive, 1 ton doughnut. It’s super heavy and hard to move, but it’s delicious.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Okay, so you don’t have enough power to move this doughnut as is. In order to move it, you’re going to have to use your superhuman power of eating. Once you eat enough of it, the remainder will be easy to move. Imagine yourself digging into this massive doughnut and taste its fresh baked goodness on your tongue. It’s mighty tasty.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>第<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>ordinal number prefix</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>だい</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Bamboo, Younger Brother</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">When you roll <font><b>die</b></font> (だい), you’ll end up with a number, 2 through 12. Normal numbers like these (the kind obtained from rolling die) aren’t ordinal numbers, so there’s no need for an <font color=""#f0a""><b>ordinal number prefix</b></font>.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Picture yourself throwing die on top of these bamboo shoots. Hear the plop and scatter of the die as they roll about.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>期<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>period of time</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>き</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Moon, Crab</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">In order for this crab to live on the moon for any <font color=""#f0a""><b>period of time</b></font>, you’re going to need to put him in a special moon aquarium and lock the lid with a <font><b>key</b></font> (き). This crab is crafty, so after you lock it, take the key with you and don’t let it out of your sight for any period of time. This crab knows how to use a key.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine this crab floating around in an aquarium half filled with water in little to no gravity. The water is floating all about and the crab is confused as can be. He just wants the key so he can get out of this crazy moon box and back to the real ocean where he belongs.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>植<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>plant</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>しょく</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">う</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Tree, Lion, Pope</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Seeing a lion chasing after you out of nowhere would be quite the <font><b>shock</b></font> (しょく). Where did this lion even come from? There aren’t even any zoos nearby so this comes as quite the shock. No time to think of how much of a shock it is though, there’s a lion after you – <font color=""#f0a""><b>plant</b></font> one foot after the other and run!</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine being chased by a hungry lion. It’s a shocking thing to imagine. You’ll be running faster than you’ve ever run in your life. If you don’t run faster than that lion, you’re dead meat.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>根<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>root</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>こん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">ね</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Tree, Good</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">After this good tree took <font color=""#f0a""><b>root</b></font> in the ground, a <font><b>con</b></font>dor (こん) crafted a nest in it. It’s very high near the top of the tree, so it’s a good place for condors. You trying to shake and move the tree, however, has made the condor angry…</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Angry with you for trying to shove the tree down, the condor dives at you! Imagine how scary it would be to get attacked by a bird of prey like a condor. The condor has a sharp beak and pointy talons. Imagine the condor scratching and pecking at you. It hurts.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>悲<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>sad</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">ひ</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>かな</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Heart, Injustice</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You're learning kanji right now, right? What makes you the most <font color=""#f0a""><b>sad</b></font> about kanji? It's the use of <font><b>kana</b></font> (かな). Don't use kana if you're learning kanji, what's the point, right? Also, if there's kana attached to a kanji, you know it's probably some weird reading. Once again, sad. Everything about kana makes me sad, what about you?</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine feeling ridiculously sad about kana. Look at some kana and sigh, making yourself feel a little depressed about it and what it stands for. Kanji is so beautiful, why muck it up with ugly easy to read kana? SAD.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>短<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>short</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>たん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">みじか</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Arrow, Beans</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">All this shooting of arrows to make the bean plants more short is taking a long time. Since you’re out in the sun, you’re starting to get a <font><b>tan</b></font> (たん). After the day is finally over, your tan is really, really dark.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine yourself being out in the sun for so long that you get an amazing tan. Your skin feels warm all over from all the sun you were getting throughout the day. Feel the warmth coming off of your tanned skin.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>球<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>sphere</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>きゅう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">たま</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Lid, King, Water</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The next creature the water king wants to seal in a <font color=""#f0a""><b>sphere</b></font> is a <font><b>cu</b></font>te (きゅう) rabbit. He has a transparent sphere for viewing his captured creatures, and he wants a cute rabbit to go in this sphere so he can admire the rabbit and its cuteness.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Picture this cute rabbit in this display sphere. While it is cute, you feel bad for it because it has no room to move. It might even die from these conditions inside of the sphere. Feel sad for this cute rabbit.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>泉<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>spring</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>せん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">いずみ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Water, White</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The only creature powerful enough to withstand the force of these white water <font color=""#f0a""><b>spring</b></font>s is the mythical <font><b>centaur</b></font> (せん). His horse body allows him to be stable and withstand the white water shooting up from the spring. Centaurs are pretty impressive creatures.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine this centaur standing over the white water. It’s just like a shower for him! Hear him laughing with mirth as the whoosh of the spring water washes him down.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>流<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>stream</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>りゅう</b>, る</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">なが</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">River, Tsunami, Boob</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">There is one way you can save yourself from this tsunami <font color=""#f0a""><b>stream</b></font> of death, however. And that is if you are <font><b>Ryu</b></font> (りゅう) from Street Fighter! You’re Ryu and you can shoot a hadoken at the tsunami and blow all of the stream water away with your mighty technique.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine yourself as Ryu. I’m sure you’ve seen him from the Street Fighter games and may have even pretended to do a hadoken once or twice. Imagine yourself as Ryu doing this hadoken to save yourself from the tsunami stream.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>陽<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>sunshine</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>よう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">ひ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Gravity, Butcher</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">After being in the <font color=""#f0a""><b>sunshine</b></font> for so long, the butcher has really worked up an appetite. So before getting back to work, he has some <font><b>yo</b></font>gurt (よう). The butcher really likes yogurt, and it really gives him energy.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine you are the butcher now and you’re eating this yogurt out in the sunshine. The yogurt is nice and cool, so imagine its refreshing taste on your tongue.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>歯<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>tooth</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">し</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>は</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Stop, Rice, Box</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">How can this rice chip your <font color=""#f0a""><b>tooth</b></font>? Because it’s so <font><b>ha</b></font>rd (は). Uncooked rice can be very hard, and something as hard as uncooked rice is just enough to chip your poor weak tooth.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine trying to bite into the hardest kernel of rice you’ve ever encountered. Biting into this hard piece of rice sends shockwaves throughout your entire body and the force with which you chomped on the hard piece of rice is enough to chip your tooth. How awful.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>族<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>tribe</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ぞく</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Arrow, Direction, Gun</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">When he starts to get closer, you notice that this guy is a boso<font><b>zoku</b></font> (ぞく) bike gang member. Bosozoku means “running <font color=""#f0a""><b>tribe</b></font>” and this guy is running right at you. With a gun. So gather your own tribe behind you and prepare to defend yourself against this bosozoku member.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: You remember what a bosozoku is, right? We wrote about them on Tofugu a while ago. They’re bike gang members and the “zoku” in bosozoku means tribe. Remember that article when you see this kanji.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>旅<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>trip</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>りょ</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">たび</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Direction, Gun, Tofu</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Your plan didn't work and the tofu went on your&nbsp;<b><font color=""#f0a"">trip</font></b>&nbsp;with you. And now it's wearing your hotel&nbsp;<b>ro</b>be (りょ)! It looks so comfortable, wrapped up in the robe. That's the best part of going on trips, and he stole it from you.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine being stuck on a trip with a block of tofu that took your robe and is wearing it around, still pointing the gun in your face. This vacation has been ruined.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>温<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>warm</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>おん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">あたた</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Sun, Plate, Tsunami</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The plate starts to get so <font color=""#f0a""><b>warm</b></font> that you could fry an <font><b>on</b></font>ion (おん) on it. Who doesn’t love fried onions? That plate sure is warm enough, so start cookin’ ‘em!</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine yourself frying onions on this plate warmed by the sun. Smell the onion smell as the onion fumes get into your eyes and your sinuses. It makes your eyes water as you are very sensitive to onions.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>着<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>wear, arrive</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">ちゃく</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>き, つ</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Slide, Eye, King, Horns</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Another thing the king <font color=""#f0a""><b>wear</b></font>s is a <font><b>key</b></font> (き) on a chain around his neck. This key unlocks the <font><b>two</b></font> (つ) treasure chests under his bed. Since the chests are very precious to the king with one eye, he keeps the key for the chests around his neck at all times.</span></span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine what wonderful things the king has in these two chests. If only you had the key, you could see for yourself. Imagine what could be inside them.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>皆<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>all</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">かい</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>みな, みんな</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">White, Compare</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You decide white is the ultimate color. You decide you want to put it on <font color=""#f0a""><b>all</b></font> things to make everything white. 'What a great idea,' your psychosis thinks. You try to put it on everything and you nearly succeed... except, the <font><b>miners</b></font> (みな). They keep getting dirty doing all their mining things. NOOO, your plan is ruined!</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine everything covered in white. Everything in the world. Then, you see a dark splotch. It's the miners, they're all covered in coal, ruining all your ambitions. Walk up to them and see all the dirt on the perfectly white uniforms you gave them just a few minutes earlier. Feel enraged at them. How could they ruin all this white you made for <font color=""#f0a""><b>all</b></font> all the people of the world!?</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>謝<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>apologize</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>しゃ</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">あやま</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Measurement, Say, Somebody</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Actually, this 'somebody' wasn't just anybody. It was <font><b>Sha</b></font>q (しゃ)! He measures in at quite a height, so you're probably even more scared now. Apologize more quickly. It's Shaq you're talking to.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Smell his sweat. Feel his giant hand on your face, holding it like a basketball. Now apologize.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>整<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>arrange</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>せい</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">ととの</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Winter, Ent, Correct</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">By talking to the wizard, the ent finds out that the only one who can <font color=""#f0a""><b>arrange</b></font> this is Hard Gay. He calls up Hard Gay and asks for the weather change. Hard Gay yells '<font><b>SEI</b></font> SEI SEI!' up at the clouds while thrusting his hips and the cold flees in terror, bringing about summer.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Think about how this was a good arrangement. Also be sure to think of Hard Gay making it nice and warm again (and feel the warmth on your skin as winter rolls away due to the arrangement that was made).</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>橋<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>bridge</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">きょう</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>はし</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Mouth, Tree, Heaven, Mustache</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The tree finishes crossing the&nbsp;<font color=""#f0a""><b>bridge</b></font>&nbsp;and on the other side is a plate of steaming&nbsp;<b>hash</b>(はし) browns! That's why it has a mouth. To eat yummy bridge hash browns.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine sitting on the bridge with the tree and eating hash browns with it. It's heavenly!</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>選<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>choose</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>せん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">えら</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Cobra, Fins, Water Slide, Blackjack</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Suddenly, a fifth option appears! A&nbsp;<b>cen</b>taur (せん). So now you must&nbsp;<font color=""#f0a""><b>choose</b></font>&nbsp;between the mythical centaur creature, a water slide, some cobras, swim fins, or blackjack.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine yourself choosing the centaur. You can ride on his back anywhere and he can also protect you from those who would bring you harm. Imagine how awesome that would be. I think the centaur is a pretty solid choice here.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>想<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>concept</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>そう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Tree, Eye, Heart</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Upon further inspection you realize that the artist used a needle and thread to <font><b>sew</b></font> (そう) his signature into the painting. What an interesting <font color=""#f0a""><b>concept</b></font> – using thread to sew your signature into a painting.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Have you ever seen someone sew their name into a work of art? I haven’t. Imagine what a novel concept this is. Imagine yourself threading a needle and sewing your name into a canvas.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>器<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>container</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>き</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">うつわ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Big, Products</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Once you get the big products into a <font color=""#f0a""><b>container</b></font>, you then lock it with a <font><b>key</b></font> (き). You wouldn’t want these products to bust out of their containers, so it’s best to lock them up with a key.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine the size of these big keys you have to use to lock these containers. It’s a really big key. Picture yourself straining to turn the key in the lock.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>暗<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>dark</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>あん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">くら, くれ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Sun, Stand</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Since the sun has blinded you, your vision is now very <font color=""#f0a""><b>dark</b></font>. You can’t see anything, but you are hungry so you reach around for some food and eat it. Yuck! It’s <font><b>an</b></font>chovies (あん). You don’t even like anchovies, how did they get in your house?</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Picture yourself eating anchovies. The anchovies taste particularly fishy and salty. Taste the anchovies on your tongue as you eat them in darkness.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>疑<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>doubt</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ぎ</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">うたが</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Arrow, Spoon, Mama, Coat Rack</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You decide to test this woman you&nbsp;doubt&nbsp;is your mama by asking her to play the&nbsp;<b>gui</b>tar (ぎ). Your mama is the best at guitar, but you highly doubt this fake mama has any guitar skills at all!</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Watch the mama you&nbsp;<b><font color=""#f0a"">doubt</font></b>&nbsp;sweat when you hand her the guitar. Yeah, your hunch was right. Now who ... is this person in your house?</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>感<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>feeling</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>かん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Heart, Drunkard, Creeper</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You have the <font color=""#f0a""><b>feeling</b></font> this drunkard has been drinking all day. You can tell because he has a beer <font><b>can</b></font> (かん) in his hand, a can in his pocket, and a can in his sock.&nbsp;</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine yourself carrying lots of cans. It would probably be a pretty awkward feeling to carry a can in your sock, but hey – you only have so many pockets.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>情<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>feeling, emotion</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>じょう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">なさけ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Blue, Fish Stick</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You start to get the feeling that this isn’t actually a fish stick at all. You think it might be human meat. Human meat from <font><b>Jo</b></font>seph (じょう) Stalin!?!? How did Joe end up in the fish sticks? What is quality control doing!?</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Now imagine the feeling of biting into a fish stick, only to realize it's Joseph Stalin. It’s hard to eat. And it's blue. Why is Joe so blue? Maybe he was really sad when they turned him into a fish stick.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>料<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>fee</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>りょう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Rice, Chopsticks</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You’ll also be charged a <font color=""#f0a""><b>fee</b></font> if you try and use chopsticks as paddles in a <font><b>row</b></font> (りょう) boat. Chopsticks are for eating rice, not rowing a row boat. Geez.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine how silly it would be trying to use chopsticks to row a boat. You wouldn’t get anywhere. You’d be old and dead by the time you got anywhere rowing with chopsticks. Picture yourself fruitlessly trying to row a boat with a pair of chopsticks.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>様<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>formal name title</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">よう</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>さま</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Tree, Water, Sheep</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">This sheep with the <font color=""#f0a""><b>formal name title</b></font> of Sir Wilburt Coddington III only likes to play outside in the water during the <font><b>summer</b></font> (さま). Summer is the best season for this fancy sheep. The other seasons just can’t compare.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine playing in the water in the summer. It’s crazy hot outside in the summer, so going in the water feels nice. Imagine the coolness of the refreshing water around your body.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>養<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>foster</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>よう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">やしな</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Fins, Sheep, Good</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The best way to <font color=""#f0a""><b>foster</b></font> a better relationship with these foster kids would be to give them some <font><b>yo</b></font>gurt (よう). Maybe they can dip the sheep fins in the yogurt to help mask the strange taste. Yogurt is also very nutritious, so it’s a good supplement to the foster kids’ diet.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Remember how bad those sheep fins tasted? Now imagine eating your favorite yogurt flavor instead. You’re a foster child, but you don’t even care about that right now – this yogurt is delicious.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>緑<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>green</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">りょく</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>みどり</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Water, Thread, Wolverine</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text""><font><b>Midori</b></font> (みどり) is a <font color=""#f0a""><b>green</b></font> colored melon liqueur with a sweet, fruity taste. This wolverine is too young to drink alcohol like Midori, so he just sticks to drinking water.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: If you’ve ever had Midori before, imagine that taste. It’s also green, so that’s an easy way to remember this kanji. If you haven’t had it, just picture the taste of melon and imagine that flavor on your tongue.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>熱<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>heat, fever</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ねつ</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">あつ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Circle, Fish Tail, Womb</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The best way to catch this fish would be with <font><b>nets</b></font> (ねつ). Nets are a great way to catch fish, especially ones like this who have too much <font color=""#f0a""><b>heat</b></font> from a <font color=""#f0a""><b>fever</b></font>. They use the nets to catch it so they can get it to a doctor.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Picture yourself using nets trying to catch these feverish fish. Feel the rock of the boat you’re on as the water sprays up in your face. Don’t lose your concentration!</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>億<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>hundred million</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>おく</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Leader, Idea</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The cult leader has his headquarters in <font><b>Ok</b></font>lahoma (おく). Are there a <font color=""#f0a""><b>hundred million</b></font> people in Oklahoma? No, probably not. But hey, this leader is shooting for the stars. First Oklahoma, then the universe!</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Picture this cult leader gathering a hundred million people into Oklahoma. It’d be awfully crowded. Imagine yourself being stifled by the bodies of a hundred million other people.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>殺<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>kill</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>さつ</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">ころ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Tree, Treasure, Ikea</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">After the <font color=""#f0a""><b>kill</b></font>, these trees are then made into Ikea chairs. You’re probably sitting in a chair right now. How long ago did you <font><b>sats</b></font> (さつ) down? Excuse me, did I say sats? I meant sit. My apologies. Sats isn’t a word! Please don't kill me for my mistake!</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: The English language is strange sometimes. We say sit and sat but not sats. Do you think sats should be a word? Think about it.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>宿<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>lodge</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>しゅく</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">やど</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Helmet, Leader, Hundred</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The entrance made by the hundred bodies <font><b>shook</b></font> (しゅく) the <font color=""#f0a""><b>lodge</b></font> to its foundation. Being shook by the soldiers steps, everyone else in the lodge was startled.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine being in a lodge and the ground shook beneath you. You’d probably think it was an earthquake. Feel your legs wiggling back and forth as the ground shakes beneath you.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>福<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>luck</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ふく</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Rice Paddy, Pelican, Creeper</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Finally the pelican gets so fed up with this creeper he decides to turn his <font color=""#f0a""><b>luck</b></font> around and face his creeper. The pelican stops, turns to the creeper and yells, “<font><b>F$%@</b></font> (ふく) YOU! LEAVE ME ALONE!”</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine if you were the creeper and you had a pelican yell this in your face. Feel the hot fishy breath of the pelican as he screams this right at you.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>鏡<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>mirror</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">きょう</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>かがみ</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Stand, See, Gold</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Your name is Amy and you are the CAG (Commander, Air Group) of the Battlestar Galactica. People call you <font><b>CAG Amy</b></font> (かがみ). You have so many gold medals on you that you’ve earned the nickname “Golden CAG Amy.” You like to look at yourself in the <font color=""#f0a""><b>mirror</b></font> and admire yourself.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine being the CAG of a ship You are in charge of all the pilots and defending the ship. It’s a lot of responsibility. Can you handle it?</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>然<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>nature</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ぜん</b>, ねん</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">しか, さ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Dog, Moon, Fish Tail</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">While you are out in <font color=""#f0a""><b>nature</b></font> meditating on nature, you drift into a <font><b>Zen</b></font> (ぜん) trance. While in this Zen trance you become one with nature.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine you are a Zen practitioner and picture yourself in the Zen trance. Imagine yourself traveling through nature like a breeze. Visualize all the scenery you see.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>詩<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>poem</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>し</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">し</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Say, Temple</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The god of this temple is the venerable Charlie <font><b>Shee</b></font>n (し). He only listens to your poem because it is about winning. Those are the only kinds of poems that the Sheen is interested in.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine reciting a poem to Charlie Sheen. You’d probably be nervous. Imagine how nervous you’d be reciting a poem in front of Charlie Sheen.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>練<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>practice</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>れん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">ね</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Thread, East</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Also, you are <font><b>Ren</b></font> (れん), from Ren &amp;, Stimpy the TV show. Since you’re not in the TV business anymore, you’ve decided to <b><font color=""#f0a"">practice</font></b> your other skills. How mature of you, Ren.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: If you’ve ever seen the show Ren &amp;, Stimpy, imagine what it would be like to be Ren. If not, watch a clip on YouTube and pretend you are Ren when you practice doing things, like studying kanji.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>賞<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>prize</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>しょう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Mouth, Clam, Viking</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">One of the biggest distractions from keeping your eyes on the <font color=""#f0a""><b>prize</b></font> here is the <font><b>sho</b></font>gun (しょう) giving a speech right next to you. The shogun is prattling on about political and military nonsense and all you want to do is win your prize!</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine what the shogun is saying. There are people clapping, cheering, and booing at him. It’s very hard to concentrate on winning that prize.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>問<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>problem</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>もん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">と, とん</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Mouth, Gate</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The reason you ran mouth first into this gate was because you were being chased by a <font><b>mon</b></font>ster (もん). A monster in and of itself is a big enough <font color=""#f0a""><b>problem</b></font> as is, let alone smashing your mouth into a gate. You poor, hapless soul.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Monsters are scary. Maybe you’ve had a dream where you were being chased by one. Remember how scary that is when you see this kanji.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>館<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>public building</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>かん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Helmet, Eat, Bear</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">While the bear is escorted out of the <font color=""#f0a""><b>public building</b></font>, the bear starts doing the <font><b>can</b></font>-can (かん). This bear is a dancing bear so he dances the can-can right on out of that public building.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Picture this dancing bear in your mind as you imagine can-can music being played. Bears look awfully amusing doing dances, especially the can-can.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>映<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>reflect</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>えい</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">うつ, は</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Sun, Central</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Somehow you get a closer look at these mirrors. They are in the shape of an <font><b>a</b></font>ce (えい), the ace of spades. So when the sun hits it and <font color=""#f0a""><b>reflect</b></font>s off, the reflected light is in the shape of an ace.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine hearing the song Ace of Spades playing in your head as you picture the reflection from the mirror hitting you in the eyes. Senses overload!</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>願<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>request</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>がん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">ねが, ねがい</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Diamond, Geoduck</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You're about to accept its&nbsp;<b><font color=""#f0a"">request</font></b>&nbsp;when&nbsp;<b>Gan</b>dhi (がん) walks up. He doesn't say a word, he just looks deeply into your eyes and shakes his head. You know in that moment that he's requesting that you decline the geoduck's request. He's right, you think, you shouldn't marry a geoduck just because it gave you a diamond.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Thanks to Gandhi you found the strength within yourself to turn down that request! Thanks Gandhi!</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>士<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>samurai</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>し</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">さむらい</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Samurai</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Do you know who is an awesome <font color=""#f0a""><b>samurai</b></font>? Charlie <font><b>Shee</b></font>n (し). What? You didn’t know that Charlie Sheen is a samurai? Well he is. Trust me.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Charlie Sheen wins at everything. But one thing he wins at the most is at being a samurai. Next time you see a samurai, just think of Charlie Sheen. Winning!</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>課<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>section</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>か</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Say, Fruit</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">To get to the fruit <font color=""#f0a""><b>section</b></font>, you have to go to the store. To get to the store you have to drive a <font><b>ca</b></font>r (か). Driving a car is the fastest way to get to the fruit section at the store.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Picture yourself driving a car and salivating over the fruit waiting for you in the fruit section. Imagine your favorite fruit as you put the pedal to the metal in your awesome car.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>標<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>signpost</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ひょう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">しるし</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Tree, &nbsp;Jackhammer, Helicopter</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">As you look at this weird&nbsp;<b><font color=""#f0a"">signpost</font></b>&nbsp;you notice a button. You press it because it will supposedly tell you more about these dangerous helicopters and jackhammers. Instead, it just yells out in a loud obnoxious voice:&nbsp;<b>HEYO</b>&nbsp;(ひょう)!!</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Press it a few more times and hear the sound in your head. Also spell it out in kana as you hear it as a nice little additional visual.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>銀<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>silver</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ぎん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Gold, Good</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You take your <font color=""#f0a""><b>silver</b></font> to the store. All you're going to buy is gallon after gallon of <font><b>gin</b></font> (ぎん) because you're an alcoholic. There's probably better things you could spend your silver on, but you're going to go with this.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine yourself going into the store trying to pay with some good gold. Doesn't work. Now you try to pay with silver. The store happily takes it. Silver is great, and you can buy gin with it. Now drink some! Yum!</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>駅<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>station</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>えき</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Horse, Shrimp</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The train pulls into the station. They walk up to the train doors, but they don't open. 'Perhaps '<font><b>a key</b></font> (えき) would help?' asks the station master, as he goes and opens the door to the train.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: But he says 'a key' strangely. He says 'Eh key' instead. Imagine the station master saying it in this way, with a strange accent to go along with it. You ask him if he has 'a key,' and he replies 'what is a key?' Then you say 'eh key' and he totally understands you.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>像<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>statue</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ぞう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Leader, Pig, Excuse</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">What’s even worse is that the image and statue are so big that they have to create new&nbsp;<b>zo</b>ning (ぞう) laws to cope with the sheer size of them.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: You are the zoning inspector. You are the one who created these zones, much to your embarrassment.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>題<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>topic</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>だい</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Sun, Coat Rack, Geoduck</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The first thing that pops into your head for today's&nbsp;<b><font color=""#f0a"">topic</font></b>&nbsp;is that geoducks will&nbsp;<b>die</b>&nbsp;(だい) if they're left suspended in the sun. Being hung on a coat rack is really dangerous for it already, but then baking in the hot sun... it's going to die! For sure!</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine using this topic as best you can, acting like the poor geoduck dies in your skit!</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>輪<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>wheel, ring</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>りん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">わ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Car, Books, Roof</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">What is a <font color=""#f0a""><b>wheel</b></font> shaped like? A <font><b>rin</b></font>g (りん). What does the other meaning of this kanji, <font color=""#f0a""><b>ring</b></font>, sound like? <font><b>Rin</b></font>g (りん).</span></span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: No matter how you look at it, we keep coming back to りんg.</span></i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>能<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>ability</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>のう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Moon, Pile, Spoon</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You drop the moon. “<font><b>NooOOOoooOOOoooOOOoooO~</b></font> (のう)” HOW COULD YOU?!?! We need that moon to live! Your ability has failed us! “NOoOOOOOOooooooo~”</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine dropping the moon. Now the earth’s gravitational field is all thrown out of whack and everyone dies. All thanks to you. How do you feel about that?</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>芸<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>acting</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>げい</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Boobs, Flowers</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You have to do some&nbsp;<b><font color=""#f0a"">acting</font></b>&nbsp;that involves you being&nbsp;<b>gay</b>&nbsp;(げい). Whether you are gay or not, imagine this scene.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Maybe you'll love it, maybe you'll hate it. Whatever happens though, feel some emotion with it to remember the scene your acting in. Use that imagination!</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>術<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>art</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>じゅつ</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Angel, Drop, Go</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You didn't ask for this&nbsp;<b><font color=""#f0a"">art</font></b>&nbsp;so you try to throw it back up into the sky at the angel. It doesn't like that (why would it?), and flies down to fight you. Too bad you didn't know that angels aren't just good at art. They're also trained in the art of nin<b>jutsu</b>&nbsp;(じゅつ)!!!</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Now you're artfully getting your arse kicked by the ninjutsu of this angry angel!</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>雰<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>atmosphere</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ふん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Rain, Part</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The reading for this kanji is actually the same as 分s. One trick about complicated kanji is they often take the reading of one of the pieces that they're made from. In this case it's 分, which is cool.</span></span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Also, studying the <font color=""#f0a""><b>atmosphere</b></font> is a ton of <font><b>fun</b></font> (ふん), if you're into that sort of thing.</span></i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>骨<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>bone</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>こつ</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">ほね</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Moon, Forehead, Mustache</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Outer space is cold, and if you're traveling to the moon, you're going to need a lot of <font><b>coats</b></font> (こつ). All of these coats will keep you warm, even if you do end up breaking your forehead <font color=""#f0a""><b>bone</b></font>.&nbsp;</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Again, feel your bones crack as you smash into the moon. At least you're warm though. Feel the cozy coats you're wearing and snuggle up in their warmth.</i></span><br> "
