"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>束<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>bundle</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>そく</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">たば</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Ent</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">To carry this <font color=""#f0a""><b>bundle</b></font> of treebeard you have to tie it all together. But, you don't have anything you can tie this bundle of wood up with. Ah ha! You have long socks. So you take off your socks and wrap up the bundle with said <font><b>sock</b></font>s (そく).</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Now you're barefoot, walking through the forest with a bundle of ent-wood tied up with socks. What a nice sight that must be (imagine it!).</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>周<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>circumference</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>しゅう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">まわ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Ghost</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">While this ghost can pass through anything regardless of the <font color=""#f0a""><b>circumference</b></font>, there is one place it cannot access. The afterlife. This ghost can't access the afterlife because it was a <font><b>shoo</b></font>ter (しゅう), and killed many people for money. The ghost needs to pay for these sins, so it must wander the earth for many years until it has been forgiven for all of its violent shootings.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Now see this ghost passing through things, only this time it's carrying a gun and crying. It has to carry the gun to remind it of its old ways and it is crying because it just wants to move on. The ghost is very sorry for shooting so many people, and it just wants forgiveness. How sad this ghost is. Feel sorry for it.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>協<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>cooperation</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>きょう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Cross, Power</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Nowhere is the power of&nbsp;<b style=""color: rgb(226, 0, 150);"">cooperation</b>&nbsp;more apparent than in&nbsp;<b>Kyo</b>to (きょう). When invaders are attacking, when the townspeople want to rebel, when there is a kitty up a tree, the people in power come from all reaches of Japan and cross into Kyoto to put a stop to the madness through cooperation.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine being a citizen of Kyoto. Watch as the powers from your neighboring prefectures march across the border to come cooperate together to stop the bandits that raided your farm. You admire their cooperation. You admire the Kyoto!</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>例<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>example</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>れい</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">たと</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Leader, Bad, Ribs</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Another <font color=""#f0a""><b>example</b></font> of something this bad leader does is use his death <font><b>ray</b></font> (れい) to kill innocent people. This leader is a bad guy. He has a death ray that he uses for murder. The ray kills all it touches.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Picture this ray, for example. Imagine a scene of all these innocents being wiped out by this death ray. So many lives wiped out in an instant. It’s very sad.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>折<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>fold</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>せつ</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">お</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Axe, Nailbat</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Once the person hitting the nailbat believes enough of a <font color=""#f0a""><b>fold</b></font> has been achieved, he <font><b>sets</b></font> (せつ) it onto a table for further inspection. He sets it on the table because the lighting is best in that area.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Picture yourself as the one picking up the nailbat to set it on the table. Feel the wood grain on the bat as you be sure to avoid the nails sticking out. You get a splinter from the wood. It hurts your hand, so you set it back on the ground. Should have been more careful.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>基<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>foundation</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>き</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">もと</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Grave, Crab</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You need a <font><b>key</b></font> (き) to get into this house with its <font color=""#f0a""><b>foundation</b></font> on the beach. The beach area is very popular so you are afraid of thieves. You wear the key around your neck so you don't lose it.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine having this key around your neck. You can feel it everytime you take a step. Feel the cold metal of the key on your bare skin and know that your beach house is safe and secure.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>性<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>gender</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>せい, しょう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Life, Fish Stick</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">When suddenly, a wild Hard Gay appears! “<font><b>Sei</b></font> (せい), sei, sei!” he shouts. “I’m of the male <font color=""#f0a""><b>gender</b></font> and I also like men! Hard Gay desu!” Looks like Hard Gay is hitting on the <font><b>sho</b></font>gun (しょう). I forgot to mention that you're sharing the fish sticks with the shogun. Apparently Hard Gay has a thing for the Shogun. Just continue to eat your fish stick and try to ignore Hard Gay.</span></span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Hard Gay says, “Sei, sei, sei.” Hard Gay is male and likes men. Gay people like people of the same gender. This one’s pretty easy to remember!</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>妥<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>gentle</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>だ</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Woman, Cleat</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Actually, the person she's being&nbsp;<b style=""color: rgb(226, 0, 150);"">gentle</b>&nbsp;with is her&nbsp;<b>da</b>d (だ). No one would ever want to hurt their dad, especially if he's asked you to walk gently on his back as a way of giving him a massage.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Poor, old dad. His back hurts so his daughter has to walk on his back with cleats to make it feel better. But if she isn't gentle enough, she'll just make it worse.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>卒<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>graduate</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>そつ</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Cross, Lid, Person</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Oops, looks like you forgot your lid. Without the lid, you’ll be held back. <font><b>So two</b></font> (そつ) more years now until you can graduate. So two more years, eh? Just for forgetting a lid? Nonsense!</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine being held back two more years from graduation. You’d lose all your motivation. Imagine how lousy this would be.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>固<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>hard</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>こ</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">かた</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Mouth, Old</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You touch your <font color=""#f0a""><b>hard</b></font> mouth and think: Wouldn't it be great to be a <font><b>子</span></b></font> (こ) again and not have this old hard mouth?</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Sigh and think back to your childhood when your mouth was nice and soft. Back when you were a 子...</span></i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>望<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>hope</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ぼう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">のぞ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">King, Moon, Death</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The odd thing about this version of Star Wars: A New <font color=""#f0a""><b>Hope</b></font>, though, is that instead of shooting a laser, the death star (moon) uses a huge <font><b>bow</b></font> (ぼう) and arrow. "<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>私<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>i</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>し</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">わたし</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Pile, Pine</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You know who else thinks they’re great at piling pines? Charlie <font><b>Shee</b></font>n (し). Charlie Sheen knows there’s no <font color=""#f0a""><b>I</b></font> in team, but there are two Is in winning.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Picture Charlie Sheen piling up pine branches as he chants to himself, “I am the best! I am winning!”</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>材<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>lumber</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ざい</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Tree</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Once you turn this tree into <font color=""#f0a""><b>lumber</b></font>, you’re going to use that lumber to build the largest <font><b>xy</b></font>lophone (ざい) known to man. Music is your passion and you love the xylophone. After you’ve collected the last of this lumber, you’ll finally have enough to create this grand xylophone.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine yourself playing this massive xylophone. It’s big and very loud. Imagine how loud it would be and hear the booming plink plink of the xylophone keys.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>参<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>participate</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>さん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">まい</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Big, Hair, Pile</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You know, under that red hat of his, <font><b>San</b></font>ta (さん) has a pile of big hair. He could <font color=""#f0a""><b>participate</b></font> in a big hair contest and easily win, but Santa thinks that would be unfair to the rest of the participants.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine Santa with a big pile of hair metal hair atop his head. Now imagine Santa shredding the guitar, waving his big hair around and shouting, “Ho, ho hooOoooOOOOo~!” like the hardcore metalist he is.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>完<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>perfect</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>かん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Origin, Helmet</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">This <font color=""#f0a""><b>perfect</b></font> soldier and his helmet will be the perfect weapon to use against Genghis <font><b>Khan</b></font> (かん) in the next battle. Genghis Khan is deathly afraid of soldiers with perfect helmets.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine this perfect helmet soldier getting into a scuffle with Genghis Khan. Hear the grunts of the great Khan as his weapons smash against the helmet and ding off. It’s a fantastic battle.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>松<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>pine</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">しょう</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>まつ</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Tree, Public</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">In case you fall, someone has laid <font><b>mats</b></font> (まつ) out around the base of the <font color=""#f0a""><b>pine</b></font> tree. That way, you’ll land on the mats should something unfortunate happen.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Picture yourself falling out of this pine tree and onto the mats. The mats are nice and soft so it’s nice. Hear the whoosh of air as you collapse onto the mats.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>約<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>promise</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>やく</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Thread, Pool</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">After you get out of the pool, you keep the <font color=""#f0a""><b>promise</b></font> you made to your mother. So you get on your <font><b>yak</b></font> (やく) powered mower and trim the grass. Yes, your mower is pulled by a yak. It’s very efficient.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine yourself sitting on a riding mower as you’re pulled around the yard by a yak. The yak is having a hard time pulling you so its making lots of yak noises. Hear them in your mind.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>残<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>remainder</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ざん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">のこ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Bad, Bar</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">This bar is in <font><b>Zan</b></font>zibar (ざん). You spent the <font color=""#f0a""><b>remainder</b></font> of your life savings to travel here. For a vacation spot, Zanzibar isn’t so bad.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: You’re at a beach bar in Zanzibar. Taste the drink on your tongue as you bask in the sun and hear the salty waves crashing on the Zanzibarian shoreline.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>求<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>request</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>きゅう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">もと</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Drop, Ground, Water</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">If the thing that spilled the water was a cute rabbit however, I might have trouble making a <font color=""#f0a""><b>request</b></font> for the <font><b>cu</b></font>te (きゅう) rabbit to clean it up. Cute rabbits are so cute, how could you make them do something they didn’t wanna?</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: It’s like puppy eyes but with a rabbit. Who can say no to a cute rabbit?</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>季<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>seasons</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>き</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Child, Pine</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The <font><b>key</b></font> (き) to pines staying the same throughout the <font color=""#f0a""><b>seasons</b></font> is their needles. This is key. They have needles instead of leaves, which is key to their survival.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine looking at one of these needles. The key to the pine’s survival. The needle is jabbed into your finger, you’re bleeding. It hurts. But this dastardly needle is what keeps the pine in shape all season so you respect it. Even though it has damaged you.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>技<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>skill</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ぎ</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">わざ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Frog, Nailbat</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Perhaps a method more effective than a nailbat would be a <font><b>gui</b></font>llotine (ぎ). Guillotines don’t take much <font color=""#f0a""><b>skill</b></font> to use either, so it would be an effective method of controlling the frog population.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Picture yourself in charge of dropping the guillotine. Would you be able to do it? Listen to the whistle in the air as the blade comes crashing down.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>格<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>status</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>かく</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Tree, Kiss</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Regardless of the <font color=""#f0a""><b>status</b></font>, you need to let the tree know how you feel. Being a <font><b>cock</b></font> (かく), y'know, a male chicken, you cock-a-doodle-do your true feelings to the tree. You actually just want to be friends.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Picture yourself as a cock, cock-a-doodle-doing about how you really feel about the tree. What would you say to let the tree down easy?</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>頑<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>stubborn</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>がん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Origin, Geoduck</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You know who else was <font color=""#f0a""><b>stubborn</b></font>? <font><b>Gan</b></font>dhi (がん). Gandhi believed in non-violent resistance and he was pretty stubborn about it.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Gandhi’s stubbornness, however, was pretty effective. "<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>囲<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>surround</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>い</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">かこ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Mouth, Well</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The well walls <font color=""#f0a""><b>surround</b></font> you as you look up to the mouth once again. This time you see an <font><b>ea</b></font>gle (い) flying overhead. You call out to the eagle to save you and the eagle comes swooping down into the well and flies you out to safety. What a nice eagle!</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: This eagle is basically a superhero. Imagine an eagle dressed in a superman outfit. He’s your savior. Imagine your gratitude towards this eagle superhero.</i></span><br> "

"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>希<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>wish</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>き</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">まれ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Narwhal, Treasure, Two Face</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">To open this treasure box where the <font color=""#f0a""><b>wish</b></font> granting genie was, the narwhal and Two Face used a <font><b>key</b></font> (き). The treasure was locked, so a key was necessary to open it.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine yourself using the key to open this chest. Feel the cold metal pressed into your hand as you turn the key in the lock and hear the clicking of gears and the popping of the latch when it’s finally unlocked.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>紀<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>account, narrative</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>き</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Thread, Cobra</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">After the cobra uses its thread to <font color=""#f0a""><b>account</b></font> these thrilling <font color=""#f0a""><b>narrative</b></font>s, it stores the fabric in a secret chest with lock and <font><b>key</b></font> (き). The cobra carries the key on its tail at all times as to not lose track of it.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine the cobra with a key on his tail. This makes him resemble a rattlesnake. When he gets angry or upset, his tail shakes and the key jingles. Hear this jingle in your ears as you picture the cobra chronicler.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>軍<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>army</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ぐん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Car, Forehead</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The <font color=""#f0a""><b>army</b></font> is after you. "<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>信<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>believe, trust</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>しん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">しん</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Leader, Say</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">To show you are serious as you say, “<font color=""#f0a""><b>Believe</b></font> and <font color=""#f0a""><b>trust</b></font> in me, I’m responsible,” you kneel down on each <font><b>shin</b></font> (しん). You have shin splints, so it hurts a bit, but you do it anyway to show how serious you are.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Picture yourself pleading with your leader to trust and believe in you. Imagine the hurt of your shins with the shin splints as you kneel. It hurts a lot, but it proves how serious you are.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>岩<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>boulder</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">がん</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>いわ</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Mountain, Stone</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Although it doesn't share the kanji, this <font color=""#f0a""><b>boulder</b></font> shares the reading of the first part of the famous 'Iwajima' (where a big battle in WWII took place). Think of a big boulder. Now think of it plopped into the ocean to make an island. What island is it? It's <font><b>Iwa</b></font>jima (the historical spelling of Iwo Jima).</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Hopefully you know what / where Iwajima is. If not, do a quick history lesson to catch yourself up!</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>仏<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>buddha</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ぶつ</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">ほとけ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Pile, Leader</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Now you're standing in front of <font color=""#f0a""><b>Buddha</b></font>. The stranger the better, because it will help you to remember the reading of this kanji, based off the meaning of this kanji.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>建<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>build</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>けん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">た</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Brush, Big Bird</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">When Big Bird is all done, much to his surprise he has helped to <font color=""#f0a""><b>build</b></font> Sesame Street's first <font><b>Ken</b></font>tucky Fried Chicken. He looks in horror as men in suits grab him and pull him inside.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Nobody on Sesame Street ever sees Big Bird again. Oscar the Grouch eats the leftovers thrown out. Cookie Monster just wants cookies.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>猫<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>cat</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ねこ</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Rice Paddy, Flowers, Animal</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Wait a minute… This <font color=""#f0a""><b>cat</b></font> is pretty odd looking. You take a closer look, seeing it is missing its <font><b>neck</b></font> (ねこ). It is disturbing.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>変<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>change, strange</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>へん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">か</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Winter, Red</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You know what else is a <font color=""#f0a""><b>strange</b></font> thing to <font color=""#f0a""><b>change</b></font>? The color of a <font><b>hen</b></font> (へん). Hens are already red, so we’d change them to another color, like purple. That would be a pretty strange color for a hen, right?</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine if hens were purple, or even other strange colors. It would be an unexpected change. Imagine this army of rainbow colored hens strutting around and clucking up a storm.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>晴<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>clear up</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">せい</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>は</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Sun, Blue</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You're so happy about this! You can't stop laughing. '<font><b>Ha</b></font> (は) ha ha ha!' you yell out. The sun feels great on your face, making you feel lively! And that blue sky ain't too shabby either.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Say the 'ha ha ha' part out loud while you imagine the sky clearing up. It'll help you to remember the reading of this kanji.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>築<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>construct</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ちく</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">きず</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Tree, Bamboo, Saw</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You’re a <font><b>chick</b></font> (ちく). Defying all convention, you’re a chick <font color=""#f0a""><b>construct</b></font>ion worker, <font color=""#f0a""><b>build</b></font>ing this building with bamboo. There aren’t too many chicks in this business, but you’re one of them.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine how you feel as you construct and build this building with your bare hands. Hear the bamboo donk, bonk, and clunk as you stack them atop one another to build your building.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>勇<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>courage</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ゆう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">いさ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Mama, Man</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Who is crying? <font><b>You</b></font> (ゆう) are. You lack <font color=""#f0a""><b>courage</b></font> and bravery and everything so that's why it is you who is doing the crying.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Feel the shame of being you. You cry and cry because you lack courage and bravery and all that. Feel sad as everyone laughs and jeers at you.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>泣<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>cry</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">きゅう</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>な</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Stand, Tsunami</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You know what else can make you <font color=""#f0a""><b>cry</b></font>? A <font><b>Na</b></font>zi (な). Nazis are mean, mean people, much worse than tsunamis. Nazis are bad news. Imagine a Nazi surfboarding on top of that tsunami that just hit you and made you cry. I imagine there’s nothing worse in this world than that.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Picture this mean Nazi riding toward you atop of this tsunami wave. Hear him screaming, “Heil!” just before the tsunami wave crashes over you. Rotten Nazi.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>司<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>director</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>し</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">つかさど</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Cloak, Creeper</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">When we need to remember&nbsp;し&nbsp;we use ""Sheen,"" as in ""Charlie Sheen."" I bet you know who is under that cloak now. Charlie&nbsp;<b>Shee</b>n (し) is the creeper directing the movie!</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Picture his face when you find out who the director really is. Wait… hey he’s running away! Grab his cloak, don’t let him get away!!</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>区<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>district</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>く</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Treasure, Cage</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">What <font color=""#f0a""><b>district</b></font> do you want to go to? Obviously, the best district is the <font><b>coo</b></font>l district.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine a district with all the coolest things in the world. What those things are depends on you, though. So, imagine these things, and feel like you’re in heaven. Coolest district evah’!</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>英<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>england</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>えい</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Central, Flowers</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">In this central park of flowers in <font color=""#f0a""><b>England</b></font>, you’re playing a game of poker. You were dealt one <font><b>a</b></font>ce (えい), and then another ace. Pocket aces! You’ll win for sure.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine the excitement of having pocket aces. Feel the grass on the ground, the wind in your hair, and the smell of the flowers in your nostrils as you try to contain your excitement.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>丈<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>height</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>じょう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">たけ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Height</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Your job is to figure out the <font color=""#f0a""><b>height</b></font> of <font><b>Joe</b></font>seph (じょう) Stalin. You measure him, and you find that his height is way higher than you imagined. In fact, he's not the height of a normal human. He's like, <font color=""#f0a""><b>ten feet</b></font> tall.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: It's pretty incredible you get to measure Joeseph Stalin's height. What's more incredible is his height, itself.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>夫<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>husband</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ふう, ふ</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">おっと</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Husband</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">What do all&nbsp;<b><font color=""#f0a"">husband</font></b>s love?&nbsp;<b>Foo</b>d (ふう)! "<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>飯<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>meal</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>はん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">めし</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Eat, Devil</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You sit next to the devil who is eating his <font color=""#f0a""><b>meal</b></font>.
