"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>計<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>measure</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>けい</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">はか</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Cross, Say</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">To remember the reading けい, we use the KKK (Ku Klux Klan) - So what were you supposed to <font color=""#f0a""><b>measure</b></font> earlier? Turns out, it was a cross for the <font><b>KKK</b></font> (けい). Now they're really pissed off at you, and they're coming for you (because their cross is like 10 meters too short).</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Scold yourself for not bothering to measure the cross you were making for them. How dumb of you. Now you're probably going to get beaten up or harassed a lot at the very least. You have to escape!</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>法<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>method, law</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ほう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Cemetery, Tsunami</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The first <font color=""#f0a""><b>method</b></font> they alter is the <font color=""#f0a""><b>law</b></font>s of magicians. They used to have a ban on living magicians, but they changed the law to allow Harry <font><b>Hou</b></font>-dini (ほう) to come and perform for them. They really like Hou-dini and are excited to have him perform.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine these zombies watching Hou-dini perform his magic. The zombies are easily amused, so listen to them moan and groan in amazement.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>晩<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>night</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ばん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Sun, Excuse</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Since you’re the sun, it’s pretty bright, so before you excuse yourself for the <font color=""#f0a""><b>night</b></font>, you’re wearing Ray-<font><b>Ban</b></font> (ばん) sunglasses. You keep these Ray-Ban sunglasses on all day to protect your eyes from being burned by yourself.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: You’re a pretty cool dude. Ray-Bans are cool. You even wear them at night you’re so awesome. Yeah.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>昼<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>noon</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ひる</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Ground, Sun, Shrimp</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">At <font color=""#f0a""><b>noon</b></font>, the shrimp also puts on its high <font><b>heel</b></font>s (ひる) to get ready for the evening, where it wants to make sure it looks good for the other shrimp he/she meets later on.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Right after the shrimp's announcement, imagine it struggling to put on heels, while sitting on the sun. This shrimp is almost bigger than the sun, actually, so all its struggles with its heels are easy to see.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>毒<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>poison</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>どく</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Life, Window</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Before you can find <font color=""#f0a""><b>poison</b></font>, you run across a Su<font><b>doku</b></font> (どく) puzzle book. Your life now has meaning! You love Sudoku! So you take your book of Sudoku puzzles back over to the window and decide not to poison yourself.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Have you done Sudoku before? Imagine yourself completing these puzzles and concentrating really hard. They’re fun, but also challenging.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>昨<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>previous, yesterday</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>さく</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Sun, Key</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Time traveling to a <font color=""#f0a""><b>previous</b></font> time, like <font color=""#f0a""><b>yesterday</b></font>, can be rough on the body. As such, you wear a small <font><b>sack</b></font> (さく) to hold your valuables while you’re ripped through the sands of time. The sack keeps your important stuff from getting lost. The sack holds your key to the sun as well.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine wearing this sack as you’re sucked through the vortex of time and space. Feel yourself spinning around as you hurtle back into yesterday.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>帰<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>return</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">き</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>かえ</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Forehead, Two Face, Wolverine, Ribs</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The best way for Two Face to <font color=""#f0a""><b>return</b></font> home is in a <font><b>kay</b></font>ak (かえ). He’s right next to a river, so a kayak is definitely the way to go.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Pretend you are Two Face, paddling down the river in your kayak to return home. Feel the breeze in your hair as you speed down the river, water spraying up onto your body.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>式<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>ritual, equation</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>しき</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Construction, Ceremony</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">So, you’re at a <font color=""#f0a""><b>ritual</b></font>. Think of the most ridiculous ceremony you can think of. Give it a shot – I’ll let you come up with the ridiculousness this time (it’s good practice). When you think of your mnemonic, make sure to imagine it with a Sheikh (an Arabic leader). Have the sheikh do something ridiculous to help you to think of this sheikh (しき) and then remember this on’yomi.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: It’s good to practice making your own mnemonics up every once in a while. It’ll help you to add on to the mnemonics already here and make better ones more personal to yourself!</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>列<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>row</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>れつ, れ</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Bad, Ribs</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">How'd you get these busted up ribs, all in a <font color=""#f0a""><b>row</b></font>? You were shot by someone with a ray beam. You remember it vividly. You were shopping, and someone busts in with a ray gun, shooting everywhere. As he's firing, he keeps shouting '<font><b>Let's</b></font> (れつ) <font><b>Ray!</b></font> (れ). Then, one ray hit you in the side, where it busted a row of ribs.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Focus on the 'let's ray' part of this mnemonic. Make it a bit ridiculous the way he's yelling it, several different ways.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>浅<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>shallow</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">せん</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>あさ</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Tsunami, Bar</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">What beer are you drinking at this bar while standing in <font color=""#f0a""><b>shallow</b></font> water? You’re drinking <font><b>Asa</b></font>hi (あさ), the beer of the salaryman. Asahi is super dry, so it takes your attention away from the shallow water a bit.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Picture yourself in the bar again sipping on this Asahi beer. Taste the beery beer taste of Asahi as you walk around the bar with your wet feet.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>単<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>simple</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>たん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Witch Doctor</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">This <font color=""#f0a""><b>simple</b></font> witch doctor spends a lot of time out in nature so he has developed a deep <font><b>tan</b></font> (たん). He tans easily, so it didn’t take long for him to develop a tan.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine the witch doctor again and how simple he is, only this time imagine him with a tan. He looks pretty good.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>坂<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>slope</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">はん</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>さか</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Grave, Devil</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">When you get to the top of the <font color=""#f0a""><b>slope</b></font>, you find something odd. A bunch of kids are playing <font><b>soccer</b></font> (さか), using the devil's gravestone as a goal.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Feel fear for the kids. You know that this is how you re-awaken the devil! You run over to stop the children from playing soccer, but it's too late. The soccer-form of the devil has arisen, and a new soccer devil is born. 'Want to play some soccer, kids?' he says, as he kicks their ball down the slope.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>春<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>spring</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">しゅん</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>はる</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Sun, Train</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">When the sun finally arrives, <font color=""#f0a""><b>spring</b></font>time is here! You're so happy. As the sun steps out of the train, you go to greet him. Like santa and his 'ho ho ho,' the sun has his own laugh. He goes '<font><b>Har</b></font> (はる) har har' as he greets everyone in your town.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Have everyone else greeting the sun also say 'har har har' back, as if it's some kind of ritual. Make sure you say it out loud as well while you're imagining the sun giving you a fist bump.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>寺<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>temple</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">じ</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>てら</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Temple</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Someone died. You ask how this person died, the person who's getting buried by the <font color=""#f0a""><b>temple</b></font>. The priest/monk says it was in a tragic <font><b>terror</b></font> (てら) attack.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: That's too bad - feel sorry for the person and learn a little more about the terror attack, if it will help you to remember the reading of this kanji better.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>浴<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>bathe</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">よく</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>あ</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Valley, Tsunami</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Of course, people live around here. When you lay down in the valley of water to <font color=""#f0a""><b>bathe</b></font>, you're raising the water level in the valley even more, crushing people and houses. When you do this they all scream <font><b>AHHHHH</b></font> (あ)!</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: It's not so peaceful anymore. It's just one constant scream of AHHHH while you try to bathe. Imagine this irritating you. Your bath is ruined by these dumb little people.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>箱<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>box</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>はこ</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Tree, Eye, Bamboo</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">While working on your wooden&nbsp;<b style=""color: rgb(226, 0, 150);"">box</b>&nbsp;you hear a strange cry from above. You look up and see an angry&nbsp;<b>hawk</b>&nbsp;(はこ) flying overhead. Oh no! That bamboo you cut down must have been where the hawk lived. Imagine finishing up the box, climbing up some bamboo and tying the box securely up there as a replacement home for the hawk.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Picture the hawk landing in the box and grumpily trying to stuff it full of straw and twigs. At least your beautiful box will put to good use.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>係<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>connection</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>けい</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">かか, かかり</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Ground, Leader, Thread</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">As you develop this psychic <font color=""#f0a""><b>connection</b></font> with the owner of the thread, you can tell that he is currently eating a <font><b>ca</b></font>ke (けい). Since the connection is so strong, you feel like you are eating the cake as well. It’s vanilla strawberry.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Because the connection is so strong, you feel like you too are eating the cake. You taste the fluffy and creamy vanilla strawberry flavors washing over your tongue. Imagine yourself eating this delectable cake. It’s fantastically delicious.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>治<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>cure, reign</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>じ, ち</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">なお</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Tsunami, Machine</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Alternative ways to&nbsp;<b><font color=""#f0a"">cure</font></b>&nbsp;yourself after a tsunami are either praying to&nbsp;<b>Je</b>sus (じ) or eating your weight in&nbsp;<b>chee</b>se (ち). I'm not sure if I have enough cheese for all the people that got hit though... Hmm, do you have cheese?<br>Before you make your decision, remember that whoever cures you will be able to&nbsp;<b><font color=""#f0a"">reign</font></b>over you and your people. So do you want to be led by Jesus or by some cheese? The choice is yours.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine getting Jesus to cure half the people and feeding the other half lots of cheese and their wounds miraculously healing on their own! You're a hero!</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>危<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>dangerous</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>き</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">あぶ, あや</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Enclosure, Cliff, Snake</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The enclosure that the <font color=""#f0a""><b>dangerous</b></font> snake is enclosed in is locked with a <font><b>key</b></font> (き). Unfortunately, the key has been lost, so the enclosure is no longer as secure as it used to be.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: How could someone lose the key to such an important lock? They should probably have a new key made before that dangerous snake decides to escape its enclosure. Imagine how frightened you would be knowing that there was an incredibly dangerous and venomous snake on the loose.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>冒<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>dare</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ぼう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">おか</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Sun, Eye</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">After you’ve blinded yourself from the <font color=""#f0a""><b>dare</b></font> of looking at the sun and losing sight in each eye, the guy dares you to go <font><b>bow</b></font>ling (ぼう). You’re blind now, so bowling will be quite the challenge.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Picture yourself bowling without the power of sight. It would be awfully difficult to do well. You’d just have to concentrate really hard on the sound of the pins and determine where you need to throw the ball.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>留<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>detain</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>る, りゅう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">と</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Pile, Rice Paddy, Sword</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You’re <font><b>Ryu</b></font> (りゅう) from Street Fighter and you thought you’d found a <font><b>loo</b></font>phole (る) in the system to avoid getting <font color=""#f0a""><b>detain</b></font>ed. You figured if you murdered cyborgs and not actual people you wouldn’t get in trouble. Well, it’s not a loophole, Ryu. You’re getting detained.</span></span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine yourself as Ryu. Ryu with a sword. You’re chopping to your right and shooting hadokens to your left. Awesome.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>弁<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>dialect, speech</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>べん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Pile, Twenty</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">With all these <font color=""#f0a""><b>dialect</b></font>s about, coherent <font color=""#f0a""><b>speech</b></font> is impossible. You decide to give up on it and just hand out <font><b>ben</b></font>to (べん) boxes to everyone. Bentos make for a lovely lunch, and everyone loves and enjoys eating bentos. Bento boxes to the rescue!</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine eating a whole pile of bento boxes. What’s your favorite part of a bento? Imagine eating so much of it that you aren’t even capable of speech anymore. Taste the tasty bento box food in your mouth.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>証<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>evidence</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>しょう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">あかし</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Say, Correct</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You give up the <font color=""#f0a""><b>evidence</b></font> to the detectives. Then, to top it off you take them to the culprit, the <font><b>sho</b></font>gun (しょう) who confesses his crime as proof that what you say is true.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Listen to the shogun blubbering away as he confesses his crimes. He can't deny what he's done!</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>遠<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>far</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">えん</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>とお</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Water Slide, Zombie</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">I mean, REALLY <font color=""#f0a""><b>far</b></font> away. <font><b>TOO</b></font> (とお) far even. It's too far, so far that the water slide loops back around the entire world and he lands right back next to you again.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: That really is too far, isn't it? A shorter water slide would have been better, methinks. Oops, no more time to think, the zombie is trying to eat you. Run!</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>園<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>garden, park</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>えん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Mouth, Zombie</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Go through the things in this zombie mouth <font color=""#f0a""><b>garden</b></font>. There's all the normal stuff, like tomatoes, lettuce, daikon, etc., but one thing that surprises you is the tree <font><b>en</b></font>ts growing in there. He's growing young ents somehow, even though the ent wives have all supposedly disappeared!</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Of course, you'll need to know what an ent is to make sense of this, so if you don't, do a little research (hint: it's a Lord Of The Rings thing - they're tree people).</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>門<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>gates</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>もん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Gate</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You're standing in front of some <font color=""#f0a""><b>gates</b></font>. You can't get through them, but on the other side you hear all kinds of loud <font><b>moan</b></font>s (もん). Are those zombie noises? Is this gate to keep the zombies out, or in?</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: They start pounding on the gate, and it begins to budge. Focus in on their moaning noises, because that's the reading of this kanji, but also feel the fear as well. When you start moaning too, it seems to calm them. Go ahead and pretend you're in front of this gate, and moan out loud for me a bit. Uwhhhhhh. Muhehwhhhhhhh.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>府<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>government</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ふ</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Mullet, Glue</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You’re <font><b>foo</b></font>ling (ふ) the <font color=""#f0a""><b>government</b></font> by looking like a silly fool with a mullet. The government will never realize you are who you really are. You’ve really got them fooled.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: You can fool anyone with your new mullet disguise, government agents or otherwise. Even your own mother wouldn’t recognize you.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>幸<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>happiness</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>こう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">しあわ, さいわ, さち</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Lid, Spicy</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Who is overflowing with <font color=""#f0a""><b>happiness</b></font>? It's <font><b>こう</b></font>いち. こういち has tons of happiness because he ate all the spicy food and it was magnificent.</span></span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: こういち likes spicy foods. Imagine him eating the spiciest food in the world, ever. こういち’s face looks so joyful, so full of happiness.</span></span></i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>阪<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>heights, slope</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>はん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">さか</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Devil, Butcher</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You know who isn’t scared of any sort of <font color=""#f0a""><b>heights</b></font> or steep <font color=""#f0a""><b>slopes</b></font>? <font><b>Han</b></font> (はん) Solo, that’s who. Han Solo may be a handsome devil, but he’s no wussy devil butcher who’s afraid of heights. Han Solo is a manly man.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine you are Han Solo. You fly around the galaxy and do all sorts of crazy things up in the sky so heights don’t bother you at all. You are Han Solo and you are very brave.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>急<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>hurry</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>きゅう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">いそ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Enclosure, Heart, Wolverine</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">As Wolverine struggles to stay alive, he starts to hallucinate. What does he see? <font><b>Cu</b></font>te (きゅう) rabbits. They’re the cutest rabbits anyone has ever seen ever. Is this normal for Wolverine? No. He’s seriously messed up. We need to <font color=""#f0a""><b>hurry</b></font> and get his adamantium fixed, like, pronto.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: How ridiculous would Wolverine be, fantasizing about cute rabbits. Imagine knowing his cute rabbit secret. Doesn’t seem like such a tough guy anymore, now does he?</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>笑<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>laugh</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">しょう</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>わら</b>, え</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Heaven, Bamboo</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">There’s actually a war a goin’ on up in that there bamboo heaven, y’know? Ye might not have heard of it with all that there <font color=""#f0a""><b>laughin’</b></font> a goin’ on, but there definitely be a <font><b>war a</b></font> (わら) goin’ on up in bamboo heaven, y’hear? The bamboo are scared so that’s why they be laughin’ so much. They nervous.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Now picture these bamboo again up in bamboo heaven, and remember this strange accent to remember that the bamboo plants up in bamboo heaven are laughing with nervous laughter at this bamboo war that’s a goin’ on up there.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>荷<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>luggage</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">か</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>に</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Leader, Lip Ring, Flowers</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Remember that giant thorny rose on the lip ring wearing leader’s back? The thorns coming out of it are real, and they’re as sharp as <font><b>nee</b></font>dles (に). You wouldn’t want to prick your finger on them. They’re super pointy and he uses them to defend his <font color=""#f0a""><b>luggage</b></font>.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine how much it hurts to get pricked by a needle, especially on your finger. Picture this happening to you now. Not comfortable, is it?</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>政<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>politics</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>せい</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Winter, Correct</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Just when you thought <font color=""#f0a""><b>politics</b></font> and <font color=""#f0a""><b>government</b></font> talk couldn’t get any less interesting, Hard Gay busts out from nowhere shouting, “<font><b>Sei</b></font> (せい), sei, sei!” Hooray, life is interesting again. Thanks, Hard Gay! Sei, sei, sei!</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine how much more interesting government talk and politics would be if Hard Gay was involved. Just picture it.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>保<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>preserve, guarantee</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ほ</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">たも</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Mouth, Tree, Leader</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">He chains himself to a tree to keep the lumberjacks out. Unfortunately, the lumberjacks just take a giant back <font><b>ho</b></font>e (ほ) and tear this tree leader and the tree he's attached to in half.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: What a terrible scene. Focus on the fact that they're using a horrible, modified back hoe. It's more like a weapon than a back hoe, and they show no mercy at all.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>品<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>product</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ひん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">しな</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Products</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">As you try to sell these <font color=""#f0a""><b>product</b></font>s, you finally get a buyer. It's a <font><b>Hin</b></font>du (ひん). She walks in and buys your products on the spot!</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Then another Hindu person walks in your store and buys some. Then another... What are all these Hindu people doing buying your products, you wonder? When you ask them, they tell you 'it's a cultural thing.'</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>守<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>protect</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>す, しゅ</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">まも, もり</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Helmet, Measurement</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The helmet you got for your head, though, did not <font color=""#f0a""><b>protect</b></font>. Imagine getting hit, and it splitting in half. In half a daze, the first thing you think is that you're going to <font><b>sue</b></font> (す) the helmet company for their shoddy helmets.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Go ahead and imagine yourself in court, actually suing the helmet company. Listen to the proceedings, listen to the judge, and get a verdict. How did you fare? Did you get a lot of money for suing the helmet company, which was supposed to <font color=""#f0a""><b>protect</b></font> you?</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>辞<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>quit, word</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>じ</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">や</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Tongue, Spicy</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You may have to quit eating but you never have to quit saying words. Especially if you're, well, trying to learn a whole new language full of them.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Picture Jesus scarfing down jalapeño peppers. He never quits. And then he says some words about how the jalapeños gave up their lives for this contest, so we better appreciate them. Thanks Jesus!</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>真<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>reality</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>しん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">ま</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Fins, Ground, Pope</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You’re doing your best to bring the pope back to&nbsp;<b style=""color: rgb(226, 0, 150);"">reality</b>&nbsp;when he snaps and kicks you in the&nbsp;<b>shin</b>&nbsp;(しん). Oww! What the heck, pope! But he’s already back staring at the fins and your shin is throbbing where he kicked.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine the pope angrily kicking your shin super hard. You fall over and pull it close. Feel how badly it aches. Who knew you’d need shin guards to deal with a pope that’s lost touch with reality just from dropping his dinner.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>喜<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>rejoice</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">き</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>よろこ</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Mouth, Drum</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You loudly&nbsp;<b style=""color: rgb(226, 0, 150);"">rejoice</b>&nbsp;for a while when suddenly someone yells, ""<b>Yo, rock o</b>n (よろこ)!"" Your voice swells, your rejoicing get even louder, you will rock on!</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Yo, rock on! Rejoice to the heavens!</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>関<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>related, connected</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>かん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">かか, せき</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Heaven, Gate, Horns</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The gatekeeper of heaven shouts that you are not <font color=""#f0a""><b>related</b></font> or <font color=""#f0a""><b>connected</b></font> to heaven in any way shape or form. He then goes on to throw a <font><b>can</b></font> (かん) right at your horned head. A can! How rude of this gatekeeper, throwing cans at people.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine being hit in the head with a can. It’d sure smart, regardless of whether or not you have horns. Imagine taking a can to the noggin as you’re chased from the gate of heaven.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>険<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>risky</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>けん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">けわ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Butcher, Squid</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Even though it’s <font color=""#f0a""><b>risky</b></font>, <font><b>Ken</b></font> (けん) from Street Fighter climbs up the <font color=""#f0a""><b>steep</b></font> slope to punch you out for butchering his best friend, the squid. Ken has known this squid all his life and they have bonded over the years. As such, Ken is not happy with you for butchering it.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Picture Ken from Street Fighter climbing up this steep slope to knock you out. You’re scared and you should be. Ken punches you right in the mouth and you die.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>典<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>rule</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>てん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Fins, Music</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">There’s also a <font color=""#f0a""><b>rule</b></font> in place to limit the amount of fish fin musicians. No more than <font><b>ten</b></font> (てん) are allowed to gather and play their music together. That’s the rule. No more than ten.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Picture a group of ten (as per the rule) fish playing music with their fins. Now the song can be louder and more intricate. Imagine it playing in your head.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>専<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>specialty</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>せん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">もっぱ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Cross, Rice Paddy, Measurement</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Hearing of your amazing <font color=""#f0a""><b>specialty</b></font> and cross measurement abilities, a <font><b>cen</b></font>taur (せん) from a far off land recruits you for a job. The centaur’s father has just passed away and the centaur wants you to measure out a cross in his rice paddy as part of the funeral ceremony.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Picture yourself at a centaur funeral. Tons of centaurs standing around and stamping their hooves as you make your measurement and stick a cross into the ground.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>冗<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>superfluous</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>じょう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Forehead, Table</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The person who smashed your forehead into the table was none other than <font><b>Jo</b></font>seph (じょう) Stalin. Joe here hates people who are <font color=""#f0a""><b>superfluous</b></font>. You're lucky Joe didn't kill you.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine the pain and emotional distress from having your forehead bashed into a table. You can’t just let it slide, so you harbor a grudge against Joseph Stalin for the rest of your life. Get really, really angry at Joe.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>存<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>exist, suppose</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>そん, ぞん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Child, Narwhal, Stick</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Oh, and the child we had to narwhal stab to prove they <b><font color=""#f0a"">exist</font></b> - that's your <b>son</b> (そん). Maybe you should have listened and kept your son out of the Narwhal Danger <b>Zone</b> (ぞん) after we warned you about it.</span></span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: I suppose you'll never forget that narwhals exist now that your son has one permanently stuck in him.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>面<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>surface, face</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>めん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">おも, おもて</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Robot</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Are robots <font><b>men</b></font> (めん)? No, they are machines. They may have <font color=""#f0a""><b>surface</b></font> area shaped like a humans, but they are not men (or women for that matter). They are made of nuts and bolts and such.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Think back to the sci-fi movies you have seen with robots. Many robots want to become like men, or conquer men. Just think of those conquering robots and their faces.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>取<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>take</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">しゅ</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>と</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Stool, Ear</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You see a security guard heading straight towards you. Your heart begins to beat faster. You have to hide the ear you took. You're not wearing any shoes, so you stick it onto your <font><b>toe</b></font> (と).</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Feel it stuck onto your toe. Can you hear anything with it? How does it feel there?</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>曜<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>weekday</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>よう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Sun, Wolverine, Turkey</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">This wolverine has a strange palate, however. It likes to turn its turkey into turkey <font><b>yo</b></font>gurt (よう). After the hunt every <font color=""#f0a""><b>weekday</b></font>, the wolverine spends the evening turning the turkey meat into a strange, thick and chunky, turkey yogurt.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine eating this turkey yogurt. It tastes pretty much exactly how you would expect. Chunks of turkey meat mixed with thick and creamy yogurt. It tastes like mushy Thanksgiving. Imagine eating this every day of the week.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>書<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>write</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>しょ</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">か</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Sun, Brush</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">What did you <font color=""#f0a""><b>write</b></font> about? You were writing about this amazing circus <font><b>show</b></font> (しょ)you just watched on the sun. You didn't expect there to be any shows here, but turns out you were wrong!</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Think of your favorite live shows and imagine them on the sun. Also imagine yourself writing back to your friends and family about said shows.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>是<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>absolutely</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ぜ</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Sun, Correct</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Then, a <font><b>ze</b></font>ppelin (ぜ) flies in front of the sun, blocking it out. <font color=""#f0a""><b>Absolutely</b></font>, the sun cannot ignore this transgression. Therefore, the sun corrects the zeppelin’s evil ways by frying it with sunshine and bringing it to the ground.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine the sun being so absolutely consumed with rage that it catches a zeppelin on fire and crashes it. Feel the heat from the grounded zeppelin as it smolders.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>結<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>bind, tie</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>けつ</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">むす, ゆ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Thread, Longcat</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The shoes that you are trying to <font color=""#f0a""><b>bind</b></font> and <font color=""#f0a""><b>tie</b></font> are <font><b>Keds</b></font> (けつ). You’re tying your Keds with longcat. You’re weird.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: You think Keds are really cool and you think Keds with longcat is even cooler. Picture yourself tying up your Keds with longcat.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>底<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>bottom</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">てい</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>そこ</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Ground, Mullet, Duck</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">This duck looks even sillier in the water. When the duck waddles into a pond, the&nbsp;<b style=""color: rgb(226, 0, 150);"">bottom</b>&nbsp;of its mullet gets&nbsp;<b>soak</b>ed (そこ). The duck didn't plan for this. Now the bottom half of his majestic mullet is full of water.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Picture this duck again, trying to swim around in a pond, the bottom of his mullet is soaked now. Silly duck, soaked mullets went out of style with the song ""Achy Breaky Heart.""</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>因<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>cause</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>いん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">よ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Big, Mouth</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You were the <font color=""#f0a""><b>cause</b></font> of your best friend breaking up with his girlfriend because your big mouth stated a rumor that she was cheating on him when actually she was <font><b>in</b></font>nocent (いん). And now you’re trying to say that you’re innocent and not to blame because you were only relating a rumor. But you’re not innocent, you’re a big mouth and you ruined their lives.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Feel bad about the lives you ruin with your big mouth. You’re not innocent, you’re guilty – guilty of being a no good big mouth. Lousy.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>識<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>discerning</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>しき</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Say, Drunkard, Sound</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">So, we've figured out that your drunken utterances are not very <font color=""#f0a""><b>discerning</b></font>. But let's think about someone who is discerning. You're sitting next to a <font><b>Sheikh</b></font> (しき) (an Arabic leader), and boy do they sound like they know what they are talking about. Maybe it's because he's not drunk like you. He has such discerning taste, that one!</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine him saying some very (in your eyes) discerning things about everything around him. Color yourself impressed (and feel the impressed-ness)!</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>干<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>dry</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>かん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">ほ.す</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Antenna</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You also use your antenna to <font color=""#f0a""><b>dry</b></font> out <font><b>can</b></font>s (かん). You just stick them on the ends of the wires and let them dry for a while before putting them in recycling.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Eww, wet cans!</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>敗<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>failure</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>はい</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">やぶ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Winter, Clam</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The best way to survive is to not get too <font><b>high</b></font> (はい) in the water. Too high and you will surely freeze. Better to stay in the deeper parts where there’s not much ice about. Only a <font color=""#f0a""><b>failure</b></font> would go up too high.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine floating high atop the water as the ice forms around you, freezing you in place. It’s super cold and you’re stuck there to die. What a failure you are.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>渉<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>ford</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>しょう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">わた</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Walk, Tsunami</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">This amazingly daring feat you’re currently doing is all part of a “defy nature” event that you're putting on for the <font><b>sho</b></font>gun (しょう). You’re the main act for the event and people come from miles around to see you <font color=""#f0a""><b>ford</b></font> the mighty tsunami. You better do a good job and please the shogun, or he might have you executed.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine yourself fording the tsunami again but this time with an audience of cheering fans and the shogun. Hear their cheers as you ford the mighty tsunami.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>果<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>fruit</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>か</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">くだ, は</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Fruit</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">They sell <font color=""#f0a""><b>fruit</b></font> at the store, and you need to drive your <font><b>ca</b></font>r (か) to get there. A car is the fastest way to fruit.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine you have a hankering for your favorite fruit. You gotta get in your car and put the pedal to the metal! Feel the wind in your hair as your car speeds down the road and listen to that engine purr.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>官<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>government</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>かん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Helmet, Bear</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">While the bear bumbles around inside the room, the rest of the <font color=""#f0a""><b>government</b></font> cheers him on shouting, “Yes, we <font><b>can</b></font> (かん)! Yes, we can!” I don’t think it’s working.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: You remember the slogan “Yes we can,” don’t you? Obama in the 2008 election - that was one of his catchphrases. Imagine this, but remember it with a blind bear with a helmet this time, trying to solve the government problems it doesn’t understand because it’s a bear.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>署<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>government office</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>しょ</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Sauron, Someone</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">If you want to visit the&nbsp;<b style=""color: rgb(226, 0, 150);"">government office</b>&nbsp;his one employee will&nbsp;<b>show</b>&nbsp;(しょ) you around. There’s no guarantee that he’ll show you the way out, but he will show you their hobbit charts and fancy government supplies.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine Sauron’s employee showing you around the government office. Picture him locking you somewhere in the basement for kick testing. Maybe you shouldn’t have asked to be shown around…</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>察<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>guess</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>さつ</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">さっ.する</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Helmet, Tent, Jackhammer, Slide</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The gentleman in the helmet with the jackhammer didn’t&nbsp;<b style=""color: rgb(226, 0, 150);"">guess</b>&nbsp;that there’d actually be people in the tent so when he found out he’d disturbed them, he got so sad that he&nbsp;<b>sat</b>&nbsp;(さつ) down and on the old slide and cried his eyes out. The slide was half destroyed from his jackhammer and that just made him cry even more.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine being this sad jackhammerer who just sat down on a half destroyed slide and cried his eyes out. You never guessed your day would end up like this.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>堂<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>hall</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>どう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Worm, Viking</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">When Vikings gather inside a <font color=""#f0a""><b>hall</b></font> or a <font color=""#f0a""><b>public chamber</b></font>, they always eat a <font><b>dou</b></font>ghnut (どう) to start the meeting. The eating of doughnuts has become synonymous with hall meetings and the like.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Picture these Vikings chowing down on their doughnuts as the meeting begins. Soft, warm, flaky doughnuts, Mmm.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>幻<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>illusion</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>げん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">まぼろし</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Poop, Cloak</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">This is the unfortunate new <font><b>gen</b></font>eration (げん) of poop magic. In past generations, people would use bunnies or birds or playing cards and whatnot, but the poop magic generation does all their <font color=""#f0a""><b>illusion</b></font>s with poop.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Try and imagine going to a poop magic show. It would be wretched. What a terrible, smelly generation for magicians.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>非<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>injustice, negative</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ひ</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Injustice</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Who turned up the <font><b>he</b></font>at (ひ) in here? What is this <font color=""#f0a""><b>injustice</b></font>? The heat is way too high! We need to add some <font color=""#f0a""><b>negative</b></font> numbers to the temperature in here. The heat is too much.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine the injustice you experience from such heat. It’s unfair! No one should have to put up with this heat. Feel the heavy, moist, heat on your body as you remember this kanji and the negativity and the injustice it brings.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>愛<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>love</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>あい</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">まな</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Heart, Winter, Forehead, Cleat</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Walking through the winter snows with your cleats on, you’ve gotta keep your <font><b>eye</b></font> (あい) on the prize. It’s a really hard journey, but you keep your eye on the prize, which is your <font color=""#f0a""><b>love</b></font> and the time you’ll get to spend with them.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine seeing your love with your own two eyes after a long time away from them. It feels great to be reunited and see eye to eye once again. Imagine this feeling.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>薬<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>medicine</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>やく</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">くすり</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Comfort, Flowers</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The best way to transport all the <font color=""#f0a""><b>medicine</b></font> on land is with a <font><b>yak</b></font> (やく). Yaks are big, strong, and very capable of transporting flower medicine like these.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Picture a yak in your mind. Pretend you are riding atop the yak as it transports this medicine. Feel the fur of the yak in your hands as you cling on for dear life.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>覚<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>memorize, awake</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>かく</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">おぼ, さ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">See, Viking</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Every morning, a <font><b>cock</b></font> (かく) crows and rouses the Vikings. Seeing this, one of the Vikings <font color=""#f0a""><b>memorize</b></font>s the cock crow so that he can mimic it and play pranks on his fellow Vikings.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine yourself memorizing the sound of a cock crow and using it to play jokes on your fellow Vikings. Cock-a-doodle-doo!</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>常<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>normal</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>じょう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">つね</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Mouth, Two Face, Viking</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Two Face the no-mouth Viking’s favorite historical figure is <font><b>Jo</b></font>seph (じょう) Stalin. Since Two Face can't have conversations like a <font color=""#f0a""><b>normal</b></font>, <font color=""#f0a""><b>ordinary</b></font> Viking, he reads a lot and his favorite subject is communist Joe.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Picture Two Face the no-mouth Viking reading a book about Joseph Stalin. Joe is his hero. It's kind of strange for someone to idolize Joseph Stalin this much, so use that weirdness to remember this kanji.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>鼻<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>nose</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">び</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>はな</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Rice Paddy, Self, Twenty</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You get to the last of the twenty rice paddies and you open up your <font color=""#f0a""><b>nose</b></font>. Something smells like <font><b>花</span></b></font> (はな). Oh! The 花 are in bloom! How lovely.</span></span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Breathe the smell of the 花 in deeply through your nose. How convenient that they share the same reading!</span></i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>無<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>nothing</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>む</b>, ぶ</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">な</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Nothing</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text""><font color=""#f0a""><b>Nothing</b></font> can <font><b>moo</b></font> (む) quite like a cow can moo. "<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>原<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>original, fundamental</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>げん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">はら</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Diamond</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The current <font><b>gen</b></font>eration (げん) of moviegoers doesn’t appreciate the <font color=""#f0a""><b>fundamental</b></font>s like these diamond ring proposals. They were so <font color=""#f0a""><b>original</b></font> and awesome back in the day, but this generation just sees them as old and lame.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Picture your generation. Can you see your generation getting excited over a diamond ring proposal scene in a movie? Even if it was the original one? Maybe. Imagine the indifference your generation feels towards these sorts of things.</i></span><br> "

"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>恋<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>romance</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>れん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">こい</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Heart, Red</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">A red heart will <font><b>ren</b></font>der (れん) you love struck with <font color=""#f0a""><b>romance</b></font>. It feels good to feel all the love and stuff, but you’re rendered useless in other areas of life due to your obsession with red hearts and romance stuff.</i></span><br> "
