"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>兵<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>soldier</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>へい</b>, ひょう</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Fins, Ground, Axe</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Uh-oh, it looks like this axe&nbsp;<b style=""color: rgb(226, 0, 150);"">soldier</b>&nbsp;was so excited about chopping the fins off his fish that he didn't think about how he was going to cook them. The only thing nearby to light on fire is a bale of&nbsp;<b>hay</b>&nbsp;(へい). Well, it's not the best thing, but at least it will get these fish cooked.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine this soldier lighting a bale of hay on fire to cook his fish. The hay burns really fast, but it should be enough.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>説<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>theory</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>せつ</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">と</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Say, Guard</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The guard listens to your&nbsp;<b style=""color: rgb(226, 0, 150);"">theory</b>&nbsp;but then he says his OWN! He thinks there are two&nbsp;<b>sets</b>&nbsp;(せつ) of guarded items, and he's only guarding one. According to his theory, either one could be real! His theory is more plausible, don't you think?</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Which theory do you believe? That there is nothing or that there are sets of things?</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>細<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>thin</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">さい</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ほそ, こま</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Rice Paddy, Thread</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">How would you water this <font color=""#f0a""><b>thin</b></font> rice paddy? Well, you’d have to use a <font><b>hose</b></font> (ほそ), but the hose would be so harsh it would spray the rice into a <font><b>coma</b></font> (こま). It’s as thin as a thread! It can’t handle the full brunt of a hose!</span></span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Picture yourself as the thin rice paddy getting sprayed with the hose. It’d be like getting shot with a fireman’s hose. You’d get knocked out and put in a coma for sure.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>梅<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>ume</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">ばい</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>うめ</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Tree, Window, Gun</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You’ve probably heard of <font color=""#f0a""><b>ume</b></font> before, depending on your exposure to Japan, but an <font><b>ume</b></font> (うめ) is a <font color=""#f0a""><b>Japanese plum</b></font>.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine eating your harvest of ume. Taste the ripe fruity flesh of these Japanese plums as you stuff your gluttonous face.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>虚<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>void</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>きょ</b>, こ</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">むな</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Tiger, Spikes</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The aforementioned <font color=""#f0a""><b>void</b></font> has opened up in Little <font><b>Kyo</b></font>to (きょ). The spiked void tigers chose to come here in order to face off against the Hanshin Tigers baseball team in battle. It will be a vicious match here in Little Kyoto. Since this is taking place in Little Kyoto and not Japan itself, the Hanshin Tigers won't have the home field advantage. Who will win?</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Picture this grand match taking place in Little Kyoto. Actual tigers versus the Hanshin Tigers. It’s truly a sight to behold. The void tigers are armed with their spikes and the Hanshin Tigers are armed with their bats. Hear the crack of wood and the roar of tigers in the air as the battle commences.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>警<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>warn</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>けい</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Winter, Say, Poem</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">This poem master also <font color=""#f0a""><b>admonish</b></font>es and <font color=""#f0a""><b>warn</b></font>s the <font><b>K</b></font>KK (けい) not to go out in winter, especially by streets when it’s snowing. The KKK outfits are all white and therefore pretty hard to see in a snowstorm. If they cross the street like that, they might all die. It’s not smart for a KKK member to go wandering about in a snowstorm.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Picture yourself driving along a snowy road and running down a KKK member. You didn’t see him because he blended in with the snow. He should have heeded the warnings.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>告<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>announce</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>こく</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">つ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Mouth, Slide, Grave</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You realize it’s pointless to <font color=""#f0a""><b>announce</b></font> things with dirt and a slide in your mouth. As such, you remove the slide, but the dirt from the grave is harder to get out. You crack open a <font><b>Coke</b></font> (こく), and wash out that grave dirt. Coke sure hits the spot.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: You’re super thirsty and the Coke tastes so good. Hear the crack and fizz as you open the can of Coke and taste its sweet liquidy bubbles as you drink it down, washing out that pesky grave dirt.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>達<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>attain, plural</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>たつ</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">たち</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Happiness, Water Slide</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">If there’s not a water slide around you, getting a <font><b>tattoo</b></font> (たつ) of one is the next best thing. Might as well get two tattooed on because <font color=""#f0a""><b>plural</b></font> is always better. This is a surefire way to <font color=""#f0a""><b>attain</b></font> happiness. Get a tattoo.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Feel the pain of the tattoo needle as you get water slides tattooed on your body. It might hurt now, but you’ll be rewarded with great happiness later in life.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>焼<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>bake, cook</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">しょう</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>や</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Fire, Gambler</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">This gambler used to play for the New York <font><b>Ya</b></font>nkees (や). He had a pitching injury, developed a gambling problem, and also took up some hobbies to <font color=""#f0a""><b>bake</b></font> and <font color=""#f0a""><b>cook</b></font>. Certainly a departure from his time with the Yankees.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine this guy running around cooking in the fire of his home, only this time with a Yankees hat and jersey on. He doesn’t play for them anymore, but he still loves the team.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>借<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>borrow</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>しゃく</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">か</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Leader, Long Ago</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">In your rage, you decide to find this leader, take back what’s yours, and in return, <font color=""#f0a""><b>borrow</b></font> the leader’s life. So you found him, grabbed him, and then threw him into a dirt <font><b>shack</b></font> (しゃく) where you shock him and do other terrible things to him.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Come up with all the terrible things you do to this great leader in his shack. He deserves to pay.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>弓<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>bow</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>きゅう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">ゆみ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Spring</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">But what are you aiming your <font color=""#f0a""><b>bow</b></font> and arrow at? You are aiming it at a <font><b>cu</b></font>te (きゅう) rabbit. A cute rabbit you are going to eat for dinner.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: You’re shooting a cute rabbit. Hear the whirr of the arrow through the air as it leaves your bow, striking the rabbit and killing it dead as it squeals in one last gasp of life.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>脳<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>brain</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>のう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Moon, Treasure Chest, Grass</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text""><font><b>No</b></font>stradamus (のう) actually predicted that you would find this grass moon treasure chest thing for your <font color=""#f0a""><b>brain</b></font>. It’s in one of his books. Nostradamus actually found a similar treasure that allowed his brain to make such startling predictions.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Think of all the great predictions you’ll be able to make with your super brain. You’ll be even more powerful than Nostradamus! What sort of predictions do you think you’ll see in the future?</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>胸<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>chest</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">きょう</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>むね</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Enclosure, Moon, Treasure Chest</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Where is this <font color=""#f0a""><b>chest</b></font> armor from? It’s from the moon. Now how would you say that if you were Canadian? It’s from the <font><b>moon, eh</b></font> (むね). Right, this here chest armor is from the moon, eh.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Try and remember this kanji and its reading and meaning with a Canadian accent and you’ll have no problem remembering how to read this kanji, eh.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>喫<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>consume</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>きつ</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">の</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Big, Mouth, Sword, Master</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The way this sword master got his mouth was by using mouth enlarging <font><b>kits</b></font> (きつ). These kits stretch your mouth out so that you may <font color=""#f0a""><b>consume</b></font> more with each mouthful. The kits were expensive, but worth it.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine someone using one of these kits to stretch their mouth. Hear them mumble and try to speak as drool runs down their face. It looks disgusting, but effective.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>等<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>equal</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>とう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">ひと, など</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Bamboo, Temple</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Each person gets an <font color=""#f0a""><b>equal</b></font> amount of bamboo from this temple located in <font><b>To</b></font>kyo (とう). Of course this temple is in Tokyo, where else would there be a bamboo temple as important as this? Tokyo is the only place!</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine yourself in Tokyo, climbing up to the temple to get your equal share of bamboo. Now walk back home to your house in Tokyo while you carry your bamboo. Really imagine your surroundings and pretend you're actually in Tokyo.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>枚<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>flat objects counter</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>まい</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Tree, Winter</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">While trying to count these slats of wood, a whole bunch of <font><b>mi</b></font>ce (まい) show up and start climbing all over the tree. This will not do, so you take two slats and start smashing and flattening all the mice. Now that the mice are flat too, you can also use them as a <font color=""#f0a""><b>flat objects counter</b></font>. Good job, mice.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Now imagine yourself counting on these mice you just smashed. They’re freshly dead, so there’s not much of a stench yet, but you still feel bad about using dead mice to help you count. Imagine yourself counting on these mice as you try to hold back tears from all the murder you just did.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>忘<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>forget</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ぼう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">わす</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Heart, Death</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The kanji for <font color=""#f0a""><b>forget</b></font> shares the same reading as 亡, meaning deceased (and read as <font><b>bow</b></font> (ぼう) like bow and arrow), which is what someone becomes when their heart dies (because they got shot with a bow) – so you can kind of link these two together. Don’t forget!</span></span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Just remember to forget. Well, don’t forget this kanji – remember that it means forget. You can’t forget it just like you can’t forget the loss of a loved one. Use this to help you remember (to forget).</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>訓<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>instruction</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>くん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">よ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">River, Say</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">While giving <font color=""#f0a""><b>instruction</b></font> to the river, you see a small boat coming down it. Inside the miniature boat is a rac<font><b>coon</b></font> (くん) captain and his raccoon crew. The raccoon captain is instructing them, “Stroke! Stroke!”</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Picture this raccoon captain and his raccoon crew coming down the river. The raccoons are all chittering about as they paddle the boat down the river.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>種<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>kind, type</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>しゅ</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">たね, ぐさ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Pine, Heavy</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">One of the worst things about this <font color=""#f0a""><b>kind</b></font> of tree is that they’re the <font color=""#f0a""><b>type</b></font> to drop needles. Especially in the house, it’s easy to get a needle in your <font><b>shoe</b></font> (しゅ). It’s especially painful to have one in your shoe, because the pine needle will poke you.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Having a pine needle in your shoe is very uncomfortable. Imagine this type of situation and being stabbed in the foot every time you take a step.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>報<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>news</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ほう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">むく</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Stool, Stamp, Happiness</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Because all happiness has been stamped out of you by this miserable <font color=""#f0a""><b>news</b></font> <font color=""#f0a""><b>report</b></font>, you decided to bury yourself in the backyard so you don’t have to ever hear such a sad story ever again. Unfortunately you are Harry <font><b>Hou</b></font>-dini (ほう) so you inevitably escape from your underground confinement regardless of whether or not you want to.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Visualize yourself digging a hole and then throwing yourself in, burying yourself, and then magically appearing above ground again. Darn these Hou-dini genes of yours!</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>句<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>paragraph</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>く</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Paragraph</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You write a <font color=""#f0a""><b>paragraph</b></font> of text on the greatest leader, <font><b>Ku</b></font>blai Khan.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: If you don't know who he is you should probably read up and write a paragraph on him to help you to remember this reading.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>許<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>permit</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>きょ</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">ゆる</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Say, Noon</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Where do these archaic horrible rules exist? The smaller version of Kyoto, Little <font><b>Kyo</b></font>to (きょ). Normal Kyoto is just fine. This smaller one is where a group of people went to create their own little town with their own dumb rules.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine going to big Kyoto where everything is fine. Then, go to little Kyoto where it's not. Little Kyoto has the short きょ (instead of the long one), and this is how you can remember the difference.</span></i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>可<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>possible</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>か</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Lip Ring</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Since anything and everything is <font color=""#f0a""><b>possible</b></font> with your new lip ring, you use it to get a new <font><b>ca</b></font>r (か). You go to the car dealership and ask for a free car. The manager is impressed with your lip ring and gladly hands over the keys to the latest model of your favorite car. Not bad.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: What car is your favorite car? Would you go through the process of having your lip pierced in order to get this car for free? Probably. Imagine driving around and joyriding in this new car. Feel the wind on your face, stinging the not quite healed pierce wound from the lip ring.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>祈<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>pray</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>き</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">いの</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Pelican, Axe</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">For safety, you lock yourself in your bedroom and eat the <font><b>key</b></font> (き). The only way the pelican is going to get in without that key is by breaking down the door. Oh, wait- he has an axe, doesn’t he? Better <font color=""#f0a""><b>pray</b></font> harder.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Visualize yourself praying that the pelican isn’t smart enough to use the axe to chop down the door. Imagine yourself continuing to pray as you hear the thunk thunk of the axe against the door.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>僧<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>priest, monk</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>そう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Leader, Mask</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">This <font color=""#f0a""><b>priest</b></font> or <font color=""#f0a""><b>monk</b></font> did not make the mask themselves. They had somebody else <font><b>sew</b></font> (そう) it for them. It’s a cloth mask, but they can’t sew at all, so they got someone else to take care of it for them.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: You were this person hired to sew the mask. Imagine yourself sewing it, with a thimble on your thumb. You prick your finger every once in a while but you’re doing a fine job. What does the mask you made look like?</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>禁<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>prohibition</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>きん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Tree, Jackhammer</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">If you hadn’t already guessed, these two trees aren’t too <font><b>keen</b></font> (きん) on fun. They want <font color=""#f0a""><b>prohibition</b></font> to extend to all fun activities which they see as unnecessary and wasteful. These two trees aren’t keen on fun, and they aren’t keen on wasting time either. These trees are keen on serious efficiency.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Since these trees are keen on serious efficiency, they both wear suits as a uniform. Imagine these trees looking keen in their suits. They don’t look like they’re keen on fun, they mean business.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>静<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>quiet</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>せい</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">しず</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Blue, Conflict</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">It’s <font color=""#f0a""><b>quiet</b></font>. To break the silence, Hard Gay jumps onto the poop deck and shouts, “<font><b>Sei</b></font> (せい), sei, sei~!” and starts hip thrusting violently. Now you don’t know whether to watch him, or concentrate on the conflict under the blue waters.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Picture yourself trying to concentrate on the quiet battle under the sea as Hard Gay parades around the ship, gyrating and shouting, “Sei, sei, sei~!” It’s quite distracting.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>座<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>sit</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ざ</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">すわ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Person, Grave, Mullet</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">But unexpectedly, this person with a mullet is also a wi<font><b>za</b></font>rd (ざ). The reason the wizard is resting his <font color=""#f0a""><b>seat</b></font> on the grave and taking the time to <font color=""#f0a""><b>sit</b></font> down is because he is using a spell to raise the dead. This wizard is truly nefarious.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine seeing this wizard in a graveyard. He’s casting magic and raising the dead. Hear the incantations he chants as the bodies rise from the ground.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>煙<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>smoke</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>えん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">けむ, けむり</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Fire, Grave, Helicopter</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The&nbsp;<b style=""color: rgb(226, 0, 150);"">smoke</b>&nbsp;is too much and you realize this is the&nbsp;<b>en</b>d (えん) for you. You're gonna die here!</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine choking on the smoke and accepting that this is the end.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>汽<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>steam</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>き</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Energy, Tsunami</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">In order to contain this <font color=""#f0a""><b>steam</b></font> energy and store it for later, you lock it up in a box with a <font><b>key</b></font> (き). That way the energy can be used at a later time. Provided you don’t lose the key, that is.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Steam is very light, so carrying this box of steam energy will be no problem. Picture yourself wandering about with a box of steam in one hand and a key in the other.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>験<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>test</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>けん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">ため, ためし</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Horse, Squid</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The final <font color=""#f0a""><b>test</b></font> is racing in the <font><b>Ken</b></font>tucky (けん) Derby. This may seem unfair, but the squid totally dominated the swim challenge, so it’s only fair that the horse gets a chance in the Kentucky Derby.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: When you think of horses, you think of the Kentucky Derby. Just imagine that, only this time with a squid in there too.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>試<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>try</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>し</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">こころ, ため</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Construction, Ceremony, Say</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Probably the only guy who could <font color=""#f0a""><b>try</b></font> and succeed at having an <font color=""#f0a""><b>attempt</b></font> with construction in the middle of a ceremony would be Charlie <font><b>She</b></font>en (し). All Charlie Sheen does is win, and since he’s winning all the time, he’d probably win at construction like this if he gave it a try.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Charlie Sheen. Imagine him doing construction – would you hire him for a construction job? Picture him doing construction in the middle of a ceremony with everyone yelling at him and trying to get him to stop doing what he's doing.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>類<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>type</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>るい</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">たぐ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Big, Rice, Geoduck</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">While eating every <font color=""#f0a""><b>type</b></font> and <font color=""#f0a""><b>kind</b></font> of rice from every <font color=""#f0a""><b>category</b></font>, the big geoduck has become even bigger. Its body is <font><b>rui</b></font>ned (るい). It’s painfully obese. This geoduck has eaten itself into ruin.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Picture this big, fat geoduck, too big to move. It’s now in a wheel chair and on a rice IV. Imagine its wheelchair squeaking by as it wheezes and groans.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>洗<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>wash</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>せん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">あら</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Previous, Tsunami</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">All the Laundromats in town are owned by <font><b>cen</b></font>taurs (せん), and they got a good <font color=""#f0a""><b>wash</b></font> as well. Being half horse, centaurs have a lot of hair that needs washing. Luckily, the soap tsunami gave them a good wash too.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine these centaurs frolicking around in the aftermath of the previous tsunami. It’s just like a big bathtub for them. Hear them splashing and neighing in the water.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>禅<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>zen</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ぜん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Pelican, Witch Doctor</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The reading for this kanji is <font><b>zen</b></font> (ぜん), just like the <font color=""#f0a""><b>Zen</b></font> in <font color=""#f0a""><b>Zen Buddhism</b></font>. Pretty easy to remember, no? Just remember that the reading is the same as the meaning. It’s easy!</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Picture the pelican again but this time really listen to what he is chanting. He’s saying, “Zennn… zennnn… zennnn.” Imagine this in your head to help remember this kanji.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>得<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>acquire</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>とく</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">え, う</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Sun, Loiter, Temple</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Next, you <font color=""#f0a""><b>acquire</b></font> some tobacco that grows around the Sun Temple area, roll it into a cigarette, and start to <font><b>toke</b></font> (とく) up. If you’re going to loiter around, might as well look like a cool kid and toke up a cig, right? All the cool kids are doing it.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Picture yourself taking a toke from your Sun Temple cig as you try to look cool while you loiter. Feel the smoke enter your lungs as you toke up.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>加<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>add</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>か</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">くわ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Mouth, Power</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Your parents are so proud of you for using your powerful mouth to <font color=""#f0a""><b>add</b></font> words together that they decide to surprise you with a gift. It’s a new <font><b>ca</b></font>r (か). It’s that shiny brand new car that you’d always wanted. You’re speechless. However, your speechlessness frustrates your parents so they decide to take away the car they just gave you. Boo hoo.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine how awful it would be to have a new car given to you only to have it taken away immediately after. Feel this rollercoaster of emotion as you are joyful and excited, then sad and sorrowful.&nbsp;</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>冊<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>books counter</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>さつ</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Books</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">While you were counting books using the <font color=""#f0a""><b>books counter</b></font>, you started to get a bit tired so you <font><b>sat</b></font> (さつ) down. After you sat down, you felt much better about counting books because you weren’t so fatigued anymore.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: You sat down and everything was better. Imagine yourself sitting down, continuing to count books.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>履<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>boots</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>り</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">は</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Flag, Loiter, Black Hole</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">As you’re loitering there in your rocket <font color=""#f0a""><b>boots</b></font> holding your flag, someone walks by with a bag of <font><b>Ree</b></font>se’s (り) Pieces candy. "<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>忙<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>busy</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">ぼう</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>いそが</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Death, Fish Stick</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">This man used to keep a lot of pets before he became so <font color=""#f0a""><b>busy</b></font>. One of his most exotic pets was an <font><b>ice ogre</b></font> (いそが). The ice ogre was almost just as busy as his owner. "<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>閥<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>clique</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ばつ</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Leader, Gate, Drunkard</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Eventually you get sick and tired of this washed up <font color=""#f0a""><b>clan</b></font> leader and you gather your own <font color=""#f0a""><b>clique</b></font> to chase this guy away from your gate and your property. You and your friends grab some <font><b>bats</b></font> (ばつ) and use these bats to beat the drunkard leader. Being beaten with bats frightens him, and he scurries away.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Hear the crushing blows of bats against flesh as you imagine this scene in your mind. "<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>布<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>cloth</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ふ</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">ぬの</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Narwhal, Two Face</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">With Two Face wearing this <font color=""#f0a""><b>cloth</b></font> mask, it’s easy for him to <font><b>foo</b></font>l (ふ) people, since they don’t recognize him. Take away Two Face’s face, and he doesn’t really have any other distinguishing features. He could easily fool you into thinking he was someone else.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: How would you feel if Two Face fooled you in such a way, making a fool out of you. You’d probably feel bad. Feel like a foolish fool for letting yourself be fooled in such a foolish way.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>比<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>compare</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ひ</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">くら</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Compare</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text""><font color=""#f0a""><b>Compare</b></font> a <font><b>he</b></font>ro (ひ) to a normal person. The hero is obviously more exciting and influential on society. If you compare a hero with a normal person, the hero will always be superior.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Try to compare yourself with a hero. What sets them apart from you when you compare them to you? Muscles? Superpowers? Spandex?</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>歴<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>continuation</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>れき</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">へ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Tree, Stop, Cliff</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text""><font color=""#f0a""><b>Continuation</b></font> is impossible unless you chop this tree down to use as a bridge to cross to the other side of the cliff. You decide to use a <font><b>wrecki</b></font>ng (れき) ball. Luckily, there’s one right by you. So you take the wrecking ball and knock the tree over, making a bridge with it.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Picture yourself using the wrecking ball to knock down the tree on the cliff. Hear the chug of the wrecking ball engine as the tree cracks and splinters from the force of the wrecking ball.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>続<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>continue</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ぞく</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">つづ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Thread, Sell</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You have to&nbsp;<b style=""color: rgb(226, 0, 150);"">continue</b>&nbsp;to sell that thread because a Boso<b>zoku</b>&nbsp;(ぞく) bike gang is forcing you to do it. You see? If you want to continue to live, you have to appease this Bosozoku gang. You better keep selling!</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Continue selling thread and paying off the Bosozoku. It’s the only way you can continue to survive!</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>減<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>decrease</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>げん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">へ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Tsunami, Feeling</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">This&nbsp;<b style=""color: rgb(226, 0, 150);"">decrease</b>&nbsp;in tsunami size seems to be something unique to this&nbsp;<b>gen</b>eration (げん). Your generation, that is. When you were young your parents would tell you about how tsunamis always increase in size, but since you can remember, they've already decreased. And you could always feel it in your guts.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Your generation is lucky because tsunamis decrease instead of increase now. Take that boomers!</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>昆<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>descendants</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>こん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Sun, Compare</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">While you’re looking up at the sun and its <font color=""#f0a""><b>descendants</b></font>, trying to compare them to one another, a flock of <font><b>con</b></font>dors (こん) flies by, blocking out the sun. There’s a great many condors, and they manage to totally block out the light from the suns.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: While you’re looking up at the condors, one of them poops in your eye. Imagine the shame and frustration you feel with condor poo in your eye as you hear the condors screech and flap their wings as they pass by.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>困<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>distressed, troubled</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">こん</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>こま</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Mouth, Tree</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Being the <font color=""#f0a""><b>distressed</b></font> and <font color=""#f0a""><b>troubled</b></font> individual that you are, you continue to chomp away at the tree despite the warnings of your peers. Unfortunately for you, the sap and bark of this tree is poisonous and you’ve nom nommed yourself into a <font><b>coma</b></font> (こま). Who knows how long the coma will last, but things aren’t looking good.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Picture eating so much tree bark and sap that you slip into a coma. Have you ever eaten so much that you felt incredibly drowsy? Imagine that feeling, only with a tree.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>易<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>easy</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>い</b>, えき</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">やさ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Gravity</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Some things can seem to defy gravity, such as an <font><b>ea</b></font>gle (い). An eagle goes up, stays up, and then comes down when it wants to. Eagles are dirty cheats who use things like wings and feathers to circumvent the influence of gravity. Crafty eagles, making flight look so <font color=""#f0a""><b>easy</b></font> and junk.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Picture this eagle flying in the sky above you. Hear its piercing screech reverberate across the land as you marvel at its amazing ability to defy gravity.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>絡<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>entangle</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>らく</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">から</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Thread, Kiss</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">This is your first kiss ever so getting a thread to <font color=""#f0a""><b>entangle</b></font> between your lips was really bad <font><b>luck</b></font> (らく). The person you were trying to kiss got really grossed out by the thread and tried to push you away but was so entangled with the thread that they were unable. Bad luck indeed.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Picture yourself being tied to someone by the tongue with thread. You can’t escape, and you can’t believe your bad luck. Feel the thread tugging on your tongue as you try to get yourself untangled.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>笛<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>flute</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>てき</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">ふえ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Bamboo, Reason</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You cut down the bamboo and whittle a <font color=""#f0a""><b>flute</b></font>. You start playing a song. You know the reason why. An alien spacecraft comes flying down and drops a box full of alien <font><b>tech</b></font> (てき) in front of you.&nbsp;</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: You've done what you came to do. "<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>容<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>form, appearance</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>よう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Helmet, Valley</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Even though putting on the helmet gives you the <font color=""#f0a""><b>appearance</b></font> of a football player, you still don’t quite look like one. Your <font color=""#f0a""><b>form</b></font> is a bit small, so you eat lots and lots of Greek <font><b>yo</b></font>gurt (よう) every day to try and bulk up and increase your form.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine yourself eating Greek yogurt by the gallon. "<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>団<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>group</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>だん, とん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Mouth, Measurement</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">This guy named <font><b>Dan</b></font> (だん) joined the <font color=""#f0a""><b>group</b></font> for people who weigh a <font><b>ton</b></font> (とん) or more, and tried to use this method for measuring the people in the group. Since Dan weighs a ton, his mouth is pretty big, but so are the fingers of the people sticking them in his mouth.</span></span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine yourself as Dan. You weigh a ton and now you’ve other large people jamming their sweaty mitts in your face and sticking their fingers in your mouth. "<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>史<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>history</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>し</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">History</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Look back on <font color=""#f0a""><b>history</b></font>. Think of your favorite moments in this history. Now, replace each moment with Charlie <font><b>Shee</b></font>n (し). He is Napoleon. He is Tokugawa. He is George Washington. Ohhhgggghaaddd. He is ruining history and creating an alternate future full of tiger blood!</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Now imagine yourself living out these alternate histories. Charlie Sheen is never too far away.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>徒<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>junior</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>と</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Loiter, Run</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Deciding not to loiter any longer, Indiana Jones <font color=""#f0a""><b>Junior</b></font> takes his dad’s advice and starts to run. Unfortunately he wasn’t paying attention to where his feet were and he stubbed his <font><b>to</b></font>e (と) on a jagged rock. His toe is in so much pain that he can’t bear to run any longer and gets taken over by the Nazis that were chasing them.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine yourself as Indiana Jones Junior and this happened to you. Feel the terrible pain of your stubbed toe as Nazis surround you. Hear them jabbering about in German as you clutch your throbbing toe.</i></span><br> "

"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>混<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>mix</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>こん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">ま</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Sun, Compare, Tsunami</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Just before the tsunami crashes over you, a <font><b>con</b></font>dor (こん) swoops out of the sky and grabs you up. Like a pterodactyl.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine yourself getting mixed up in this situation and the pterodactyl sized condor picking you up. "<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>善<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>morally good</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ぜん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">ぜん</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Ground, Mouth, Sheep, Horns</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Since you are a <font color=""#f0a""><b>morally good</b></font> doctor, you decide not to murder the sheep and harvest its organs. Instead, as a practitioner of the <font color=""#f0a""><b>good</b></font> teachings of <font><b>Zen</b></font> (ぜん) Buddhism, you decided to help the sheep out. Your Zen teachings have only increased the power of your healing abilities, so you fix the sheep up in no time.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine yourself using your Zen magic to heal this sheep. "<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>順<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>order</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>じゅん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">River, Geoduck</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">After extensive study of the <font color=""#f0a""><b>sequence</b></font> and <font color=""#f0a""><b>order</b></font> of water, the geoduck has determined that <font><b>June</b></font> (じゅん) is the best time to travel to the river. June is the best time for the temperature and atmospheric pressure are just right for such a journey. In June, the geoduck will set out.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: June has arrived. Imagine the geoduck making its way from the ocean to the river. "<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>宇<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>outer space</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>う</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Antenna, Helmet</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Looking into <font color=""#f0a""><b>outer space</b></font>, you see something pass through your field of vision. Then another. And another. Focusing on these objects, you realize it’s a storm of <font><b>u</b></font>ni (う) (sea urchins), only these are space uni. They travel around in packs, hurtling throughout space. They’re often mistaken for meteor showers, actually.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Picture yourself again in the space suit, floating about as you see these sea uni shooting past you. "<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>改<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>renew</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>かい</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">あらた</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Winter, Cobra</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">But, as he's <font color=""#f0a""><b>renew</b></font>ing himself by flying out into the warmish spring weather, a <font><b>coy</b></font>ote (かい) chomps him out of the air, shakes him, and walks the cobra back to her baby coyote pups. But, I guess the coyotes can be happy now too. I hope you feel sad for the cobra, it will help you to remember this reading.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>乱<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>riot</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>らん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">みだ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Tongue, Umbrella</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Just now you realize that the man you stabbed in the tongue with your umbrella was none other than Macho Man <font><b>Ran</b></font>dy Savage (らん). Being a professional wrestler, Macho Man Randy Savage is ready to throw down at a moment’s notice. A <font color=""#f0a""><b>riot</b></font> immediately erupts. It’s a battle royal with you and Randy at the epicenter.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Picture yourself squaring off with Macho Man Randy Savage in the middle of this riot. You have the advantage of having an umbrella, but Randy has the advantage of being himself. Picture yourself getting into a fight with him.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>節<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>season</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>せつ</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">ふし</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Bamboo, Stamp, Good</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Since you have to stamp so many of these bamboo pieces come bamboo <font color=""#f0a""><b>season</b></font>, you mark them out in <font><b>sets</b></font> (せつ). Sets of ten bamboo. Having them marked out in sets helps the job seem a bit more manageable as finishing each of the sets feels like a small victory.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Picture yourself stamping all these sets of bamboo each season. It seems like there’s an endless supply of sets. Your hand is starting to cramp up from all the stamping. Feel the pain in your hand and wrist as you continue to stamp the sets along.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>連<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>take along</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>れん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">つ, つら</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Car, Water Slide</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">So you <font color=""#f0a""><b>take along</b></font> your car to the water slide and then it gets demolished and now it’s lying in a smoldering pile of metal. Good thing it was a <font><b>ren</b></font>tal (れん). You rented it earlier that day for the sole purpose of driving it on the water slide. Good call renting it - renter’s insurance will cover the damages, I’m sure.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Picture yourself renting the car knowing you’re just going to total it. You're always here for me when I need you most. Even when I'm giving birth to your child.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>罪<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>guilt</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ざい</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">つみ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Injustice, Sauron</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Eventually, Sauron decides to erase his <font color=""#f0a""><b>guilt</b></font> by bringing joy to the world through music. As such, Sauron takes up the <font><b>xy</b></font>lophone (ざい) and goes on a world-wide “Right the Injustice” tour. It’s a solo xylophone tour, but Sauron is actually a pretty mean xylophone player, so it works.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Now imagine Sauron on stage and playing a xylophone. He’s surprisingly lithe for a guy in full armor and he’s playing that xylophone beautifully. Hear the notes in your ears as he plays away.</i></span><br> "

Laugh at Ana and her unfortunate misfortune of having fallen into a hole like a ninny. You’d help Ana out of the hole, but you’re too busy laughing at her.</i></span><br> "

The pelican was shot with a <font><b>he</b></font>at (ひ) ray. The shooter just expected the pelican to <font color=""#f0a""><b>incur</b></font> minor burns, but instead the heat melted off all of the pelican’s skin.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Now smell the smell of the cooking pelican. "<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>機<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>machine</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>き</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">はた</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Person, Tree, Poop, Drunkard</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Oh, I see – the door to the outhouse with the machine toilet is locked, and the drunkard doesn’t have the <font><b>key</b></font> (き). If he had a <font color=""#f0a""><b>machine</b></font> like a jackhammer, or a circular saw, or some other heavy duty machine, he might be able to get in without a key, but since he has none of those or a key, he’s reduced to pooping under the tree instead.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Listen to the drunkard grumbling about the lack of a key as he poops under the tree. He was a member of the <font><b>K</b></font>KK (けい). Through the <font color=""#f0a""><b>passage of time</b></font>, you got more and more accustomed to him being stuck in the racist ways of the KKK.
