"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>委<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>committee</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>い</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Woman, Pine</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Speaking of birds, part of the reason she started this <font color=""#f0a""><b>committee</b></font> was to save the pines, but another was to save the <font><b>ea</b></font>gles (い) that live in the pines. Eagles call this forest their home so it is important that the trees don’t get cut down.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Hear the sound of eagles screeching overhead as they fly about the pine forest. They have no idea that a committee is being formed for them. Look up at them as they fly. Oops, one just pooped in your eye.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>省<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>conserve</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>しょう, せい</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">はぶ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Eye, Few</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You lost your eye when it was stabbed out by the <font><b>sho</b></font>gun (しょう) himself. You foolishly challenged the shogun to a duel, and he beat you handily. In order to <font color=""#f0a""><b>conserve</b></font> some of your dignity, he stabbed out one of your eyes instead of killing you, so that one day you might redeem yourself.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine walking around with your one eye. Curse the shogun for what he has done to you. You almost wish he had just killed you right then and there. The humiliation is almost too much to bear.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>制<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>control</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>せい</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Life, Two Face, Ribs</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You decide to control Two Face and put his ribs back in. Instead of having him kill the Batman, though, you ask him to kill Hard Gay. Just before you can put the ribs back, Hard Gay jumps into the room you're in (as if he knew!) and thrusts his hips into your hands, knocking the ribs away. <font><b>SEI</b></font> (せい) SEI SEI!</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Oh no! Thwarted again by that blasted Hard Gay! What a superhero.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>批<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>criticism</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ひ</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Compare, Nailbat</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The blood from the nailbat wound sprays onto your body. It’s very warm and you can feel the <font><b>he</b></font>at (ひ) from the fresh blood. Feel this heat as the blood trickles down the length of your body. You’re insane, and you’re going to face a lot of <font color=""#f0a""><b>criticism</b></font> for doing what you done did.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Again, feel this blood moving down your body and feel the heat coming off of it.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>断<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>cut off</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>だん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">ことわ, た</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Lion, Rice, Axe</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">This lion’s name is <font><b>Dan</b></font> (だん). He’s Dan the harvesting lion man. He swings his might axe to <font color=""#f0a""><b>cut off</b></font> the rice for harvest. Dan is the best lion farmer in the history of ever.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: See Dan in his farmer’s uniform. He even has the name Dan embroidered on his jacket. See Dan frolick through the rice fields as he swings his axe about merrily.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>任<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>duty</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>にん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">まか</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">King, Leader</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You’re the village <font><b>nin</b></font>compoop (にん), but the king and the leader still have a <font color=""#f0a""><b>duty</b></font> to protect you. Even a nincompoop is important to the kings and leaders of the world.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: You’re a nincompoop. Even though you’re so nincompoopy, your king and leader still have a duty to protect you. Feel happy and content, despite your nincompoopery.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>素<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>element</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>す, そ</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Life, Thread</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">But how do you feel about this thread? You think it's just <font><b>so</b></font>-so (そ). The <font color=""#f0a""><b>element</b></font> known as life isn't all that big of a deal. But what can you make out of this thread? You can create a <font><b>su</b></font>it (す) made exclusively from this thread. It’s the most impressive suit of all time. Far more impressive than that thread that was just so-so.</span></span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine yourself wearing this exquisite suit. Feel the so-so thread in your hands. How could such a so-so thing like this thread turn into such an awesome suit? Skill.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>敵<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>enemy</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>てき</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">かな, かたき</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Winter, Mohawk</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You’re kind of a <font><b>techie</b></font> (てき), so you have an advantage over your <font color=""#f0a""><b>enemy</b></font>. You’re armed with night vision goggles and other cool tech gear as well. Being a techie certainly has its advantages.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine yourself all teched out like the techie you are. Hear the beeps and boops of all the technology you have at your disposal as you search for more mohawk enemies.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>設<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>establish</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>せつ</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">もう</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Say, Ikea</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You go into the IKEA you've&nbsp;<b style=""color: rgb(226, 0, 150);"">establish</b>ed. It's great, everything comes in&nbsp;<b>sets</b>&nbsp;(せつ). Chairs, tables, everything! Sets sets sets sets sets.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: You say the word ""IKEA"" again, and it creates another IKEA. Now IKEA can come in&nbsp;<b>sets</b>.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>評<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>evaluate</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ひょう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Say, Peace</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">While you say your peace, you end up making a really bad pun and you hear somebody say “<font><b>Heyo</b></font>!” (ひょう) You look at the people around you and try to <font color=""#f0a""><b>evaluate</b></font> who said heyo, but you can’t tell. You start talking again when somebody exclaims “That’s what she said” and another person shouts “Heyo!”once again, but you still can’t evaluate who’s saying these things.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine yourself trying to explain a situation you’re about to evaluate and your audience keeps shouting “Heyo!” every other sentence. Imagine how frustrating that would be. Get angry at your rude audience and how much they shout “Heyo.”</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>検<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>examine</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>けん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Tree, Squid</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">However, <font><b>Ken</b></font> (けん) from Street Fighter reaches into the sea and rips the squid out of the water, marches it over to a tree and throws the squid at it shouting “Hadoken!” Ken has brought this squid to a tree and now the squid is free to <font color=""#f0a""><b>examine</b></font> it.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Unfortunately the squid can’t live without water, so it soon dies. See Ken sobbing and crying once he realizes what a foolish thing he has done.</i></span><br> "

Eh. It was <font><b>oka</b></font>y (おか), but that's about it.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Feel indifferent about this hill of horns on top of the mountain. It's all in your head anyways.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>増<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>increase</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ぞう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">ふ, ま</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Grave, Mask</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">To <font color=""#f0a""><b>increase</b></font> his <font><b>zo</b></font>ne (ぞう) of terror, this creepy dude puts on an even bigger mask which makes his zone of influence that much larger. How much can the terror increase?</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Visualize this in your head. The mask he is wearing is increasing in size at an alarming rate, increasing the zone of horror as it grows. Feel fear as this terrifyingly large mask looms over you.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>査<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>inspect, investigate</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>さ</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Tree, Eye</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">In the middle of your&nbsp;<b><font color=""#f0a"">inspection</font></b>&nbsp;you realize you need to&nbsp;<b>saw</b>&nbsp;(さ) the tree open to come to a good conclusion. This seems a bit unnecessary, but no! No! For the sake of this&nbsp;<b><font color=""#f0a"">investigation</font></b>&nbsp;you must saw the tree in half!</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine stopping to inspect the tree after each minute of sawing. You'll find out why it's growing out of a top hat! Eventually!</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>判<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>judge</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>はん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Half, Ribs</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">There’s perhaps only one way for people not to <font color=""#f0a""><b>judge</b></font> you for having half your ribs removed. That would be if you were <font><b>Han</b></font> (はん) Solo. Han Solo is so cool that nobody would ever judge him for doing anything. Also, keep in mind that this kanji contains 半, and also shares its reading. How helpful!</span></span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Picture Han Solo missing half his ribs. You feel the need to start judging him, but he’s just so cool you can’t bring yourself to do it. Imagine Han Solo awkwardly running around without half his ribs, shooting his gun and yelling at Chewbacca to fire up the engines on the Millennium Falcon.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>審<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>judge</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>しん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Helmet, Number</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Apparently this <font color=""#f0a""><b>judge</b></font> is not happy with you. He decides to judge you with violence. He leaps out from behind his stand while clutching his gavel and smashes you in the <font><b>shin</b></font> (しん) with it. “Criminal!” he shouts as he knocks you in the other shin. “You deserve to die!”</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Your shin really hurts. Why would this judge hit you in the shin? Did he go crazy? Feel how badly each of your shins hurt from being struck by this mad judge.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>件<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>matter, affair</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>けん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Cow, Leader</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The latest <font color=""#f0a""><b>affair</b></font> that the cows have had to deal with is <font><b>Ken</b></font> (けん) the farmer. As a cow farmer, he obviously wants to slaughter all the cows to harvest their meat.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine the cows getting together and trying to figure out a solution to this whole mess. Imagine drawings and diagrams of Ken the farmer. Also imagine the Cow leader sitting off to the side, thinking he's too important to help with these matters and affairs.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>際<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>occasion</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>さい</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">きわ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Tent, Jackhammer, Butcher</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">In this particular <font color=""#f0a""><b>occasion</b></font>, the butcher is a mighty <font><b>Cy</b></font>clops (さい). He actually slayed the rock beast himself, and now the Cyclops butcher is carving it up with his mighty jackhammer.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: See this Cyclops butcher as he continues to carve the beast with his one eye. Continue to hear the jackhammer ringing in your ears as you watch the Cyclops butcher do his work.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>企<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>plan</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>き</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">くわだ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Stop, Hat</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The <font color=""#f0a""><b>plan</b></font> that made this hat stop right in its tracks was very simple. First, obtain the <font><b>key</b></font> (き) to the house. Then, use the key to get in the front door. How simple!</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Watch as the hat begins to grin. This plan is so simple it’s sure to work. Now watch as the hat obtains the key and enters the locked door. What sort of mischief will the hat get into once inside?</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>挙<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>raise</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>きょ</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">あ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Fins, Ground, Hand, Grass</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">This ritual only works in one part of the world however. It absolutely must be performed in Little <font><b>Kyo</b></font>to (きょ). The way Little Kyoto lines up with the sun and the sky and all that astrological junk makes it the best place for you to <font color=""#f0a""><b>raise</b></font> fish fins up in the air.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine yourself going through the same process as before, only this time imagine yourself in Little Kyoto. Little Kyoto is really little, so make sure you're in the right spot.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>認<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>recognize</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>にん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">みと</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Drop, Sword, Heart, Say</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You <font><b>nin</b></font>compoop (にん), how did you not <font color=""#f0a""><b>recognize</b></font> that you were about to be stabbed? That guy came at you from like a mile away. And slowly! You had plenty of time to recognize they were going to stab you and you did nothing about it. You silly nincompoop.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: You got stabbed in the heart with a sword for no good reason. It could have easily been avoided. Recognize that you are a huge nincompoop and you should feel bad.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>資<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>resources</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>し</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Clam, Next</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Now, who is the evil man distributing these <font color=""#f0a""><b>resources</b></font>? Imagine him to be Charlie <font><b>Shee</b></font>n (し), the terrible resources distributor. He is taking all the clams and tiger blood for himself!</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Now imagine what happened in the meaning mnemonics again, this time with Charlie Sheen as the resources distributor.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>義<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>righteousness</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ぎ</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Righteousness</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Such <font color=""#f0a""><b>righteousness</b></font>! Well, at least according to the king who thinks he's being righteous. His version of righteousness is to send anyone who disagrees with him to the <font color=""#0af""><b>gui</b></font>llotine.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: THIS IS NOT RIGHTEOUSNESS! you yell, just before the guillotine comes down on your neck.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>権<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>rights</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>けん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Tree, Arrow, Turkey</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Whats your name, turkey?' you ask. You have to include the turkey's name in the <font color=""#f0a""><b>rights</b></font> or it's not official. The turkey responds: <font><b>Ken</b></font> (けん)... I am Ken the turkey.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Now re-read the rights to the turkey, using his name.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>派<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>sect</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>は</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Cliff, Tsunami, Tofu</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Riding up along with the tsunami is a gigantic <font><b>ha</b></font>mmerhead (は) shark. The hammerhead has a taste for tofu and plans to eat all of it once it rides the tsunami up to the cliff. The <font color=""#f0a""><b>sect</b></font> won’t know what hit them.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: It’s very strange for a hammerhead to have a taste for tofu, but this hammerhead does. Imagine the hammerhead thrashing around as it devours every crumbly block of tofu in sight.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>務<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>task</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>む</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">つと</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Power, Winter, Soldier</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Your next <font color=""#f0a""><b>task</b></font> is to kill a cow. Being a soldier, this is no problem for you. You sneak up on a cow and power-stab it to death. "<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>税<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>tax</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ぜい</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Pine, Guard</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You're thinking about this&nbsp;<b style=""color: rgb(226, 0, 150);"">tax</b>&nbsp;when you hear someone shout, ""Vat did you&nbsp;<b>zay</b>&nbsp;(ぜい)?"" German Hard Gay comes sliding down the tree. ""Zer iz no tax! Don't listen to vat he zays!"" He leaps over the guard and runs off. He didn't have to, but the guard made you pay it.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>解<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>untie</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>かい</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">と</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Cow, Sword, Angle</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">When you make it through the door after you <font color=""#f0a""><b>untie</b></font> the rope and <font color=""#f0a""><b>solve</b></font> this room’s puzzle, you see a <font><b>coy</b></font>te (かい) on the other side. It falls over dead.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Good thing you were still carrying that sword, huh? That coyote almost got you. "<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>総<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>whole</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>そう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Heart, Thread, Public</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">What do you do to make this heart <font color=""#f0a""><b>whole</b></font>? That’s right, you <font><b>sew</b></font> (そう) it. You sew this heart to make it whole. It was busted, and now you sew it with thread to make it a whole heart once again.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Now you have to sew the chest back up to close the heart inside since it’s been made whole once again. Imagine the person you saved thanking you profusely as you sew his chest back up again.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>援<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>aid, assist</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>えん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Nailbat, Football</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">This nailbat was made from the wood of an <font><b>en</b></font>t (えん). Ents are composed of very strong wood. A nailbat made out of such a material is very strong. This proves a great <font color=""#f0a""><b>aid</b></font> in your defensive ability on the football field. You manage to <font color=""#f0a""><b>assist</b></font> in many touchdowns because of it.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Remember yourself crafting this nailbat out of an ent. You cut the branch from a live ent so he wasn’t too happy with you. Hear the leafy scream of the ent as you carve your nailbat out of one of his arms.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>態<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>appearance</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>たい</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">わざ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Heart, Ability</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">While you may have the <font color=""#f0a""><b>appearance</b></font> of someone who is super strong, powerful, and awesome, you do have one shortcoming. You don’t know how to <font><b>tie</b></font> (たい) a tie. Actually, you don’t even know how to tie your shoes, let alone your tie. How embarrassing.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Since you don’t know how to tie a tie or tie your shoes, you wear slip ons and clip ons. Hear the noise of Velcro being undone as you kick off your shoes and unclip your tie after a hard day’s work at the office.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>誕<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>birth</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>たん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Say, Big Bird, Correct</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Another thing Big Bird has been doing since <font color=""#f0a""><b>birth</b></font> is <font><b>tan</b></font> (たん). Big Bird loves to tan. He says it is good for his skin. If Big Bird says it, and Big Bird is always correct, then this must be true. Getting a tan is good for Big Bird.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Picture Big Bird lying out in the sun to get a tan. See him with sunglasses and a tanning mirror to reflect the rays. He’s been doing this since birth, so he’s a pretty accomplished tanner.</i></span><br> "

"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>賀<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>congratulations</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>が</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Mouth, Power, Clam</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">After you give the clam a hearty <font color=""#f0a""><b>congratulations</b></font> for his mighty power, you start to break down and cry like the little baby you are. “Goo goo… <font><b>ga</b></font> (が) ga…” It’s really embarrassing. Stop acting like a little baby, you baby. Go and goo goo ga ga somewhere else, you’re embarrassing the rest of us with your presence.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Since your friends have abandoned you, imagine yourself crying like a whiny little baby after your defeat. Actually pretend to wipe away tears as you say goo goo ga ga out loud. Go ahead – do it.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>各<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>each</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>かく</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">おの</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Kiss</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Actually, <font color=""#f0a""><b>each</b></font> of your best pals are of the <font><b>cock</b></font> (かく) variety. "<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>費<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>expense</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ひ</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">つい</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Clam, Slinky</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Since the clam spared no <font color=""#f0a""><b>expense</b></font> and bought the best slinky clam money could buy, he is now the most famous and fastest clam in all the land. The slinky has turned him into a sort of clam super<font><b>he</b></font>ro (ひ). Being a superhero has its downsides though. The clam has to always help people out and like, do good and stuff. He’s the treasure. For your soul. He’s here to show you that Jesus is still a hip and cool guy and he wants to <font color=""#f0a""><b>indicate</b></font> to you that having faith in Jesus and God and stuff is super rad. "<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>寝<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>lie down</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">しん</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ね</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Stool, Forehead, Helmet, Wolverine, Nailbat</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You hear a horse <font><b>neigh</b></font> (ね) in the distance, followed by the sound of galloping approaching you. This can’t be good. All you want to do is <font color=""#f0a""><b>lie down</b></font> and nurse your wounds, but there appears to be a horse charging at you. Wolverine is riding it. "<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>営<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>manage</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>えい</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">いとな</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Bathtub, Viking</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Since you’ll never <font color=""#f0a""><b>manage</b></font> to move this Viking out of the bathtub, you decide to play cards with him instead. You’re playing poker, and you manage to be dealt one <font><b>a</b></font>ce (えい) after another. Then, the rest of the cards are laid out, and there’s another ace, and another ace. You have 4 aces! Surely you will manage to win this hand.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine yourself playing cards against this Viking. You’re pretty sure you’ll manage to win this hand with your aces, but you’re also afraid that if you beat the Viking, he’ll tear you in half. Yikes.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>坊<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>monk</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ぼう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Grave, Direction</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You’re following this <font color=""#f0a""><b>monk</b></font> to the grave when all of a sudden he turns around and shoots you with a <font><b>bow</b></font> (ぼう). You’re not sure where he got that bow from, but now you’re dying from the arrow wound. The monk then proceeds to take your body and put it into the grave.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine yourself getting shot by a monk holding a bow. See his face and hear the twang of the bowstring as the arrow enters your chest and pierces your heart.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>罰<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>penalty</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ばつ</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">ばつ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Say, Ribs, Sauron</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The way Sauron is removing your ribs is a two step process. First, he breaks your ribs with some baseball <font><b>bats</b></font> (ばつ), then he tears the ribs out of you. This is a <font color=""#f0a""><b>penalty</b></font>, so the process is not pleasant. It hurts enough being hit with the bats, but then after getting hit with the bats you get torn open for your broken ribs to be removed.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Feel your ribs being hit with these bats. Imagine the wind being knocked out of you multiple times as you continue to suffer many blows from bats.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>案<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>plan</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>あん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Tree, Cheap</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">This cheap tree is a woman. She is a woman with a <font color=""#f0a""><b>plan</b></font> and her name is <font><b>Ann</b></font> (あん). Ann is the cheap tree with a plan, man.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Look at Ann on the TV screen detailing her plan. Hear Ann’s leaves rustling in the soft breeze as she continues to detail her cheap plan. *Extra Hint: Same reading as 安 which is in the kanji. Convenient!</span></i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>策<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>plan</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>さく</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">さく</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Tree, Head, Bamboo</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">But why is this bamboo tree so heavy? You look to each end of the bamboo and realize that there is a <font><b>sack</b></font> (さく) tied on each end. Each sack seems to be filled with heavy rocks. Looks like someone made a <font color=""#f0a""><b>plan</b></font> to trap you here. Now you have to devise a plan to escape!</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Bamboo is usually kind of light, but this bamboo has a sack of rocks tied to each end making it heavy. Imagine yourself trying to remove this bamboo tree by pushing it up and away from you. It’s like doing a bench-press, bamboo style.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>提<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>present, submit</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>てい</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Sun, Correct, Nailbat</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You really want to <font color=""#f0a""><b>present</b></font> the sun with something awesome. So you decided to <font color=""#f0a""><b>submit</b></font> your favorite nailbat. But in reality, all the sun wants is some <font><b>ta</b></font>ter (てい) tots. The sun really loves tater tots, but no one knows this. Poor sun. Just wants some taters.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Pretend you are the sun. Imagine these tater tots that you just cannot get your hands on. No one will submit them to you. All you do all day is imagine what the tater tots taste like in your mouth. All tatery and tottery. Mmm… tater tots.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>置<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>put</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ち</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">お</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Lion, Sauron, Pope</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Every day, Pope Sauron will <font color=""#f0a""><b>put</b></font> out <font><b>chee</b></font>se (ち) for his lion to eat. Most lions are not so fond of cheese, but this papal lion is quite fond of it.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine this lion eating cheese. See it holding a huge wedge of cheese in its mighty paws as it nibbles on the cheese.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>域<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>region</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>いき</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Ground, Mouth, Grave, Drunkard</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">In an attempt to identify what <font color=""#f0a""><b>region</b></font> of North America the thing in the drunkard’s mouth came from, you touch it and try to remove it with your bare hands. Upon touching whatever it is, you find it to be all <font><b>icky</b></font> (いき) and gooey. Like, super icky. So icky that you barf in the region immediately adjacent to the grave you’re in.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine touching this super icky substance from the drunkard’s mouth. It’s really icky. Feel yourself throwing up as you feel the icky goo between your fingers.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>応<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>respond</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>おう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Heart, Mullet</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Every time you try and talk to someone, they start to <font color=""#f0a""><b>respond</b></font> as they turn around, but then they see you and they’re all like, “<font><b>Oh</b></font> (おう). You have a mullet. Nevermind.” You’re getting really tired of hearing “Oh. You have a mullet.” Like, “Oh. You’re inferior to us so we’re not going to respond. You mullet wearing freak you.” It feels bad to be treated this way.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Oh. Oh. Oh. You have a mullet. Oh. Ok. I have nothing to say to you. Go away.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>宮<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>shinto shrine</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">きゅう</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>みや</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Helmet, Bathtub</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">But wait, who is it that is bathing in this bathtub in the <font color=""#f0a""><b>Shinto Shrine</b></font> whilst wearing a German War helmet? Why, it’s none other than Mario himself! “It’s-a <font><b>me-a</b></font> (みや), Mario!” he shouts, jumping out of the bathtub and bouncing about the Shinto Shrine. “It’s-a me-a… It’s-a me-a, Mario!!”</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: See Mario jumping around the Shinto Shrine and imagine him shouting “It’s-a me-a, Mario!” as he hops around. "<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>吸<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>suck, inhale</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>きゅう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">す</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Mouth, Escalator</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">It looks like something is riding the escalator as you <font color=""#f0a""><b>inhale</b></font> it. It’s a <font><b>cu</b></font>te (きゅう) rabbit, just hopping along the escalator stairs. Unfazed, you suck down the cute rabbit along with the rest of the escalator. Cute or not, food is food.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine the cute rabbit running away from your mouth as you suck and inhale the escalator out from under the cute rabbit’s feet. Hear it squeal and shriek in fear as you get closer and closer and finally inhale the cute rabbit into your mouth.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>過<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>surpass</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>か</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">す, あやま</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Mustache, Water Slide</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The only one challenging you now is a little girl sitting in an amazing <font><b>ca</b></font>r (か). It's on the next water slide over, revving its engines, then blasts down the slide, surpassing you in manliness and speed.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Feel so surpassed by this car, surpassing you in every way.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>領<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>territory</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>りょう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Orders, Geoduck</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Not wanting to end up dead in enemy <font color=""#f0a""><b>territory</b></font>, you decide to escape this geoduck leader by getting on a <font><b>row</b></font> (りょう) boat and rowing your way outta there. The geoduck commander orders you to halt your escape, but you still get in your row boat and row away.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Feel yourself in the row boat as you imagine rowing away to safe territory. "<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>統<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>unite</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>とう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">す</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Thread, Outhouse</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Since you’re still kind of drowsy, you don’t realize how close you are to the outhouse and you <font color=""#f0a""><b>unite</b></font> your face with the outhouse door. It really hurts and you stumble over backwards and fall down a hill leading to downtown <font><b>To</b></font>kyo (とう). You end up in a Tokyo street with your pants down, urinating on the sidewalk. The Tokyo Police will arrest you for sure.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: How embarrassing. It's bad enough that you fell down a hill and wet yourself, and now you're going to be arrested for indecent exposure. Yikes.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>価<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>value</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>か</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">あたい</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Leader, Helicopter</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">To further increase the helicopter's&nbsp;<b style=""color: rgb(226, 0, 150);"">value</b>, the leader bought himself a&nbsp;<b>ca</b>r (か) and then tied them together. "<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>値<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>value</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">ち</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ね</b>, あたい</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Lion, Leader, Pope</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Turning the corner, the pope and his lion come across a horse. While not having as much <font color=""#f0a""><b>value</b></font> as a lion, a horse is still an important animal to the town. However, the horse is afraid of the lion and lets out a shrill <font><b>neigh</b></font> (ね). The neigh in turn startles the lion, and now we have two animals that are scared.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Hear the neigh of the horse in your head. Do you value your life? If so, imagine yourself getting far away from these startled and dangerous animals as you continue to hear the horse neigh in the distance.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>副<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>vice, side</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ふく</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Rice Paddy, Ribs, Creeper</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">To feed the <font color=""#f0a""><b>vice</b></font> president’s need for more ribs, the creeper must acquire them from multiple sources. You really need some extra cash on the <font color=""#f0a""><b>side</b></font> so you go and find a target to obtain some ribs. As you’re pulling ribs out of their body, they shout at you, “<font><b>F***</b></font> (ふく) you, rib thief! F*** you!”</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine you are the one having your ribs torn out. "<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>観<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>view</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>かん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">み</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Arrow, See, Turkey</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">After you <font color=""#f0a""><b>view</b></font> the turkey being prepared, there is some left over. The remains are put into a <font><b>can</b></font> (かん) and each person who came to view the preparation gets to take home a can of turkey for later.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Since you came to view the turkey being prepared, you also get a can. "<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>藤<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>wisteria</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">とう, どう</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ふじ</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Moon, Water, Flowers, Horns, Train</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">So where does the <font color=""#f0a""><b>wisteria</b></font> arrive after its journey from the moon? Well, it arrives at Mt. <font><b>Fuji</b></font> (ふじ). Mt. Fuji is the best spot for a wisteria to arrive on planet earth. Fuji loves wisteria flowers and wisteria flowers love Fuji.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Picture this beam of water connecting the moon to Mt. Fuji and see the train traveling over it, carrying the wisteria. Imagine yourself standing on Mt. Fuji as you watch the wisteria train approaching. "<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>庁<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>agency</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ちょう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Nail, Mullet</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The only person posing a threat to your <font color=""#f0a""><b>agency</b></font> and the whole <font color=""#f0a""><b>government office</b></font> is the notorious Ms. <font><b>Chou</b></font> (ちょう). She totally disrespects your mullet and cares not for your symbolic nail. Ms. Chou is an angry Asian woman and she is not to be trifled with.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Now see Ms. Chou facing off against this guy with a mullet holding a nail. "<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>額<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>amount</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>がく</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">ひたい</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Guest, Geoduck</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Unfortunately, if you mess up any of these things, (the&nbsp;<b><font color=""#f0a"">amount</font></b>, the&nbsp;<b><font color=""#f0a"">framed pictures</font></b>, or the&nbsp;<b><font color=""#f0a"">forehead</font></b>&nbsp;tattoo) every other guest will&nbsp;<b>gawk</b>&nbsp;(がく) at you.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Feel the feel of hundreds of gawks. Feel ashamed as they gawk at you. How could you!?</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>腕<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>arm</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">わん</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>うで</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Evening, Moon, Helmet, Snake</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Your <font color=""#f0a""><b>arm</b></font> is tired from fighting the snake. You feel a chill. Where are your clothes? You’re n<font><b>ude, eh</b></font> (うで)! Also, you’re Canadian, eh. But more importantly, you’re nude, eh!</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Fighting a snake naked would be scary. But other than your helmet, you’re nude, eh. Feel the chill all around you as you massage your sore arm.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>境<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>boundary</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>きょう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">さかい</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Grave, Stand, See</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">This grave is located in <font><b>Kyo</b></font>to (きょう), only the <font color=""#f0a""><b>boundary</b></font> around the grave represents a new country. The area within the boundary is actually a country belonging to the guy buried in the grave. He was tired of Kyoto and decided to start his own country.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Now see yourself hopping in and out of the boundary, switching what country you are in. One moment you’re in Kyoto, Japan, the next you’re somewhere else. What a silly boundary.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>燃<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>burn</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ねん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">も</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Fire, Nature</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">What is the worst thing that could <font color=""#f0a""><b>burn</b></font> in this fire? Your <font><b>nen</b></font>doroid (ねん) collection. You've spent a lot of time and money collecting all these cool and rare and unique nendoroids and now they've all burned in the fire.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Cry your eyes out as you smell the smell of burning plastic from the nendoroids. Worst. Day. Ever.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>担<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>carry, bear</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>たん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">にな, かつ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Sunrise, Nailbat</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">But, it doesn't end there. This nailbat you&nbsp;<b><font color=""#f0a"">bear</font></b>&nbsp;is not something you can give up easily. You have to continue to&nbsp;<b><font color=""#f0a"">carry</font></b>&nbsp;it all day long too. Good thing about the day is that the sun will give you a nice&nbsp;<b>tan</b>&nbsp;(たん).</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Now that you've done this for one night and one day, you can put down the nailbat. It's all over. Feel the relief. Even something that's not so heavy like a nailbat will be heavy if you&nbsp;<b><font color=""#f0a"">carry</font></b>&nbsp;it this whole time.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>祝<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>celebrate</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>しゅく</b>, しゅう</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">いわ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Pelican, Older Brother</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">But, if you&nbsp;<b style=""color: rgb(226, 0, 150);"">celebrate</b>&nbsp;too much you go a little crazy. The pelican grabbed your brother and&nbsp;<b>shook</b>&nbsp;(しゅく) him so hard that his head flew off.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: You'll have to imagine a pelican shaking your older brother so hard with its wings that his head falls off. ""You&nbsp;<b>shook</b>&nbsp;him too hard!"" you yell.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>届<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>deliver</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>とど</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Flag, Reason</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">To <font color=""#f0a""><b>deliver</b></font> this flag is something you just have <font><b>to do</b></font> (とど). Need to do. Want to do. There is no one else to do it. This is something only you are equipped to do.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: The world depends on you to do this delivery. If you fail, the United States will be ruined. You have to do it! Deliver that flag now! Run! Run!</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>違<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>different</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">い</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ちが</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Water Slide, Cow God</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Also <font color=""#f0a""><b>different</b></font> from the water slide and the cow god is <font><b>Tigger</b></font> (ちが), the tiger from Winnie the Pooh. Tigger bounces all about, and is almost just as fun to ride around on as a water slide or a cow god. The ride is just a bit more bouncy when it’s with Tigger.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine yourself riding on Tigger’s back. Feel yourself shoot up into the air as Tigger jumps and feel yourself bounce off the ground as Tigger lands and jumps again. It’s pretty fun, but a different kind of fun than a water slide or cow god.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>差<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>distinction</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>さ</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">さ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Construction, Slide, Sheep</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The way this sheep lost its legs was due to a <font><b>saw</b></font> (さ). A saw cut off the sheep’s legs. With the loss of its legs, the sheep lost its <font color=""#f0a""><b>distinction</b></font> as well. All because of some stupid saw.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Picture this sheep getting its legs sawed off with a saw. It’s brutal. See the saw slicing through the sheep’s flesh and bone as blood spatters everywhere. Hear the sheep screaming as each leg is slowly sawed off.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>象<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>elephant, phenomenon</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>しょう, ぞう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Pig, Excuse</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">This special&nbsp;<b><font color=""#f0a"">elephant</font></b>&nbsp;<b><font color=""#f0a"">phenomenon</font></b>&nbsp;was actually started by the&nbsp;<b>sho</b>gun (しょう). He was sick of people making excuses about why they couldn’t pay their taxes, go to war for him, or come to his birthday party. Now all he has to do is walk around town and find the people with elephants in their yards. Then he can punish them!</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine getting an invitation to the shogun’s birthday party. This is the third one this month! You’re pretty sure it’s not even his birthday. You’re about to make an excuse when… you notice your pig staring at you. Hmm… you don’t want your pig to become an elephant. It wouldn’t fit in your house anymore. I guess you have to go.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>展<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>expand</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>てん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">のぶ, のび</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Flag, Kick, Blackjack</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The blackjack table does have a limit though of how many times it will <font color=""#f0a""><b>expand</b></font>, and that limit is <font><b>ten</b></font> (てん). You can only kick the flag to get the table to expand ten times.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine yourself kicking the flag ten times. Count it off in your head and imagine each instance up to ten. Any more kicks after ten don’t cause the table to do anything, but it does cause your leg to get sore.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>層<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>layer</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>そう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Flag, Mask</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Every <font color=""#f0a""><b>layer</b></font> is a layer of protection to maintain your anonymity. However, an angry protester throws something at the flag, damaging it. This is unacceptable, so you get out a needle and thread and <font><b>sew</b></font> (そう) the flag back up. It’s not too difficult for you to sew things, so you sew the flag back to working order in no time.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: See yourself in your mask, working on this flag. You’ve got the needle in one hand and the thread in the other. Now sew. Sew sew sew until the flag is repaired.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>視<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>look at</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>し</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Pelican, See</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You know who doesn’t like to <font color=""#f0a""><b>look at</b></font> pelicans? Charlie <font><b>She</b></font>en (し ). Pelicans freak him the heck out. But can you really blame Charlie Sheen? Pelicans are creepy, especially under the influence. I see how Charlie Sheen would be wary to look at a pelican.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: See Charlie Sheen staring down a pelican. Since Mr. Sheen doesn’t want to look at the pelican, he’s really freaking out. See him sweating bullets as he slowly starts to lose his mind looking at the pelican.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>環<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>loop</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>かん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Ground, King, Sauron, Zombie</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">In an attempt to knock King sauron out of his zombie raising <font color=""#f0a""><b>loop</b></font>, you toss a <font><b>can</b></font> (かん) at his head. The can smacks into him, knocking him out of the loop. Normally, King Sauron would kill you for throwing a can at him, but in this case, he is overjoyed.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Picture yourself throwing this can at Sauron. Feel the weight of the can as you heft and throw it, and then hear the clink of the can on Sauron’s helmet as it strikes him.</i></span><br> "

Unfortunately, the angel’s ninjutsu training did him no good on this water slide. No amount of ninjutsu training could have prepared him for this day.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Since the angel is a trained ninjutsu practitioner, imagine the angel in a ninja outfit as he slides down the water slide. Hear him screaming out martial art yells as he slides down and then gets stabbed in the gut.</i></span><br> "

"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>型<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>model</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>けい</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">かた</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Grave, Lantern, Ribs</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You were a member of the <font><b>K</b></font>KK (けい). Definitely not a <font color=""#f0a""><b>model</b></font> citizen. KKK members are not the <font color=""#f0a""><b>type</b></font> who are widely liked by the general public. They might actually be glad to hear that a member of the KKK was put in a grave due to a lantern injury.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Picture this KKK member falling into a grave after being hit in the ribs with a lantern.
