"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>狭<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>narrow</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">きょう</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>せま</b>, せば</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Husband, Horns, Animal</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">I’m not even going to get into the <font><b>sema</b></font>ntics (せま) of how this weird relationship of yours works. Nope, this reading explanation is on the straight and <font color=""#f0a""><b>narrow</b></font>. Need to know basis. Classified. All that junk. There will be no discussion of the semantics between you and your goat lover.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: But that doesn’t mean you can’t imagine the semantics. The finer points of the relationship. Go ahead, imagine all the weird stuff that comes with the territory for having a goat as a husband. Use all that weird stuff to remember this kanji and its reading. Want an example? Just imagine the goat doing dishes! Goats don’t have hands! Hahahahaha!!</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>管<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>pipe</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>かん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">くだ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Bamboo, Helmet, Bear</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The bear is almost to the other side of the <font color=""#f0a""><b>pipe</b></font> when he stumbles across a soda <font><b>can</b></font> (かん). Being a bear, he stops to play with the can, batting it around and forgetting his mission.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: See the bear in his bamboo helmet, playing with the can inside of the pipe. It’s very noisy. Hear the can rattling around and the bear making a huge commotion banging into the sides of the pipe and stomping all around.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>載<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>publish</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>さい</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">の</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Cross, Car, Drunkard</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The next day, you examine the news to see if they had the audacity to <font color=""#f0a""><b>publish</b></font> your car accident. Letting out a big <font><b>sigh</b></font> (さい), you discover the article detailing your life as a drunkard and a full write-up of the accident. How embarrassing. Sigh.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Let out a big sigh. Your secret drunkard life has been exposed to the world, and now everyone knows about your problems. Let out another sigh for good measure. Sigh.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>質<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>quality</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>しつ</b>, しち</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Clam, Axe</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You finally open the clam of&nbsp;<b style=""color: rgb(226, 0, 150);"">quality</b>. You can't believe your luck! It opened! When you look inside, expecting to see some high quality clam meat you see...&nbsp;<b>shit</b>&nbsp;(しつ). This clam is filled with poo.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: You even put the clam in your mouth before looking and taste it.&nbsp;<b>Shit</b>&nbsp;(しつ) is all over your mouth. Taste it, and think how disappointed you are in this clam that looked to be of such high quality. You broke two axes to open it, after all!</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>量<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>quantity</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>りょう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">はか</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Sunflower, Sunrise</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Eventually, the <font color=""#f0a""><b>quantity</b></font> of sunflowers becomes too great for you to walk through. As such, you must use a <font><b>row</b></font> (りょう) boat and row your way through this sea of sunflowers. Row, row, row!</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Feel the row boat oars in your hands as you row your boat back to safety. Feel the breeze as you skim along over the sea of sunflowers as the sunrise crests over the horizon.</i></span><br> "

Suddenly,&nbsp;<b>Han</b>&nbsp;(はん) Solo bursts through the door, fills the devil clam full of lasers, and then runs off.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Han Solo saved you from this pushy clam devil! "<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>供<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>servant</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>きょう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">とも, そな</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Leader, Together</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The leader takes the fins from his <font color=""#f0a""><b>servant</b></font> and smells them. "<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>抜<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>extract</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">ばつ, はつ, はい</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ぬ</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Friend, Nailbat</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">To make matters worse, your friend is completely <font><b>nu</b></font>de (ぬ). So not only are you <font color=""#f0a""><b>extract</b></font>ing pain and blood from your friend’s body, but also copious amounts of embarrassment. Why would you hit a nude? That’s just rude, dude.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine your nude friend. Sear this image into your mind. Now beat it with a nailbat.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>鮮<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>fresh</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>せん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">あざ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Sheep, Fish</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">This place also serves <font color=""#f0a""><b>fresh</b></font> <font><b>cen</b></font>taur (せん), but that’s just weird. Centaur is endangered and you don’t believe in eating endangered things. Even if they are incredibly fresh.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Can you imagine eating a fresh centaur? How weird would that be? Half of it is human-like, so you’d be like, a half cannibal. Weird, huh?</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>満<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>full</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>まん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">み</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Both, Flowers, Tsunami</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Soon after you’re <font color=""#f0a""><b>full</b></font> of the water from the tsunami, you see a <font><b>man</b></font>atee (まん) floating over towards you and your flower friends. The tsunami must have carried him over here, and he looks hungry. The manatee starts to munch on you and your flower friends. Oh the humanity!</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Just like you got full on the water, this manatee is now becoming full on you and the other flowers. Imagine being eaten alive by this manatee. Chomp chomp chomp. What a way to go.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>与<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>give</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>よ</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">あた</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Ground, Beggar</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">When you set the money down next to the beggar he shouts, “No! I want a <font><b>yo</b></font>-yo (よ)!” so you go to the corner store and buy him a yo-yo with the money instead. You <font color=""#f0a""><b>give</b></font> the yo-yo to the beggar and he looks very happy.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Now watch as the beggar plays with the yo-yo you just gave him. "<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>隠<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>hide</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>いん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">かく</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Heart, Wolverine, Butcher, Cleat</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The butcher thinks that Wolverine has committed a terrible crime that he must pay dearly for, but actually wolverine is <font><b>in</b></font>nocent (いん). He’s innocent, so he decided to <font color=""#f0a""><b>hide</b></font> instead of fight. "<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>模<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>imitation</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>も, ぼ</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Tree, Greenhouse</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The greenhouse tree realizes that its <font color=""#f0a""><b>imitation</b></font> will never be as good as the real thing. When it realizes this, the tree <font><b>mo</b></font>ans (も) aloud. The tree is still kinda tiny, so the moan isn’t very loud, but it is still pretty strange to witness. Speaking of witnesses, <font><b>Bo</b></font>bo (ぼ) the clown sees this greenhouse tree moaning and decides to take it for his next clown show. Surely this miniature moaning tree can be worked into Bobo's next clown act.</span></span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Hear the little tree moaning at its pitiful imitation of a real tree. The greenhouse tree sounds very sad and you actually start to feel bad for it. Moan along with the tree in sympathy.</i></span><br> "

Gandhi didn’t use our program, but we’re sure if he’d had the opportunity to, he would have used it. So buy now, and get the words of Gandhi in your hands as well as your mouth!</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Since you bought the program, you also got the Gandhi books included with your order. Imagine yourself reading them and learning all about non-violent resistance. Fascinating.</i></span><br> "

You smash its legs with your nailbat and then you <font><b>sew</b></font> (そう) its legs back on so you can bash them off again. "<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>絞<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>strangle</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>こう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">し, しぼ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Thread, Mix</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Who would be so cruel as to use a piece of thread to <font color=""#f0a""><b>strangle</b></font> you? Well, <font><b>こう</b></font>いち, that’s who. As we all know, こういち is a diabolical mastermind who also loves thread. Therefore you are getting strangled by こういち with a piece of thread. Lucky you.</span></span></span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine looking at こういち as you get strangled with the thread. What kind of faces is he making? What is he saying to you? "<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>補<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>supplement</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ほ</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">おぎな</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Pelican, Wedding</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Along with pelicans to&nbsp;<b style=""color: rgb(226, 0, 150);"">supplement</b>&nbsp;your wedding guests, you also bought a ton of&nbsp;<b>hoe</b>s (ほ). They supplement your lack of guests. You feel sad you don't have more friends, but luckily they don't know that because you have so many pelicans and hoes at your wedding.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>渡<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>transit</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">と</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>わた</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Stool, Tsunami, Hick</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">What kind of <font color=""#f0a""><b>transit</b></font> is he riding on? <b>Water</b>&nbsp;(わた) transit.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Maybe when the tsunami stops at the next station you'll take the water transit for a ride yourself.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>接<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>adjoin</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>せつ</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">つ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Woman, Stand, Nailbat</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Unfortunately, it seems like this clinic will only <font color=""#f0a""><b>adjoin</b></font> things in <font><b>sets</b></font> (せつ). So, the woman has to get two nailbats, or none at all. The woman has never been a big fan of sets, and would like to keep both her arms, but she decides to go through with the procedure anyway.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine having a set of nailbats instead of a set of arms. How terrible would that be? Not only would you not be able to pick anything up, but you’d probably also accidently hurt yourself and others with the nailbats like all the time. Not a good choice.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>再<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>again</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>さ, さい</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">ふたた</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Elephant, Leaf</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Oh, dear – looks like the elephant has done it <font color=""#f0a""><b>again</b></font>. He’s just cut his other leg off. Wait, this time he did it himself. He used a <font><b>saw</b></font> (さ) to saw it off! Man, we need to watch this elephant more carefully. <font><b>Sigh</b></font> (さい). There goes my zookeeper bonus this year.</span></span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine this elephant sawing off his own leg. What is wrong with this elephant? Now sigh out loud. This elephant is really difficult to take care of. Sigh, sigh, sigh.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>独<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>alone</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>どく</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">ひと</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Insect, Animal</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">One activity that the animal can never do <font color=""#f0a""><b>alone</b></font> is solve Su<font><b>doku</b></font> (どく) puzzles. The insect always has to help him out with them, and together they are an unstoppable Sudoku solving team.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Picture this animal with the insect on his head doing a Sudoku. "<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>獣<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>beast, animal</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>じゅう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">けもの</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Dog, Rice Paddy, Creeper, Grass</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Probably the strangest thing about this <font color=""#f0a""><b>animal</b></font> <font color=""#f0a""><b>beast</b></font> creeper is that he only creeps on you if you’re a <font><b>Jew</b></font> (じゅう). The dog really likes to creep on Jews. If you’re not a Jew, he’ll probably leave you alone. If you are a Jew, be prepared to get creeped on by this dog beast.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Why does this animal have a Jewish person fetish? "<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>菓<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>cake</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>か</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Fruit, Flowers</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You’re standing back, admiring your <font color=""#f0a""><b>cake</b></font> when you hear a <font><b>ca</b></font>r (か) engine revving and before you know it your cake has been run over. "<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>故<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>circumstance, reason</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>こ</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">ゆえ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Old, Winter</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">This particular <font color=""#f0a""><b>circumstance</b></font> takes you back to when you were a <font><b>子</span></b></font> (こ). When you were a little 子, you never thought you’d get old, even in the circumstance of winter. Your joints were young and limber and the cold of winter had little effect on you. <br>A circumstance is also a <font color=""#f0a""><b>reason</b></font> we're in this situation.</span></span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: But as you get older, the effects of winter make you feel older and older, very far removed from feeling like a 子 again. Imagine yourself as a rickety old dude out in the cold, reminiscing about the days when you were a 子.</span></span></i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>較<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>contrast</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>かく</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Car, Mix</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">What did I say this car looks like? Oh that’s right, a pea<font><b>cock</b></font> (かく). This car looks like a peacock. It’s the color of a peacock and you’ll look like you’re peacocking when you’re out on the town driving it. "<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>励<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>encourage</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>れい</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">はげ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Power, Cliff, Ten Thousand</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">However, one of the ten thousand people actually wants you to die so he whips out a death <font><b>ray</b></font> (れい) and shoots at you with it. "<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>占<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>fortune, occupy</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>せん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">うらな, し</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Fortune</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">To <font color=""#f0a""><b>occupy</b></font> some free time you have, you go and get your <font color=""#f0a""><b>fortune</b></font> told at a fortune teller. "<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>障<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>hinder</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>しょう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">さわ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Stand, Early, Butcher</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Being a butcher is just this guy’s side job though. "<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>我<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>i, me</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>が</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">われ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Ego</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text""><font color=""#f0a""><b>I</b></font> am the greatest in the world! "<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>徴<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>indication, sign</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ちょう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Mountain, King, Winter, Loiter</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Truly this is a <font color=""#f0a""><b>sign</b></font>, an <font color=""#f0a""><b>indication</b></font> sent from above that you have finally made it in life, that you are cool enough to get in good with the king, you’re so happy you could die! "<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>授<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>instruct</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>じゅ</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">さず</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Accept, Nailbat</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">While you're smashing your student with the nailbat, you hear a strange sipping sound. You look away from the crumpled mass of student you were beating, and see a student sipping on a small&nbsp;<b>ju</b>ice (じゅ) box. The nerve. You are meant to&nbsp;<b style=""color: rgb(226, 0, 150);"">instruct</b>&nbsp;these students, not let them sip juice loudly. You turn towards him, nailbat raised, ""Do you have enough for everyone?"" Still sipping, the student opens his bag to reveal it's full of little juice boxes.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Picture yourself beating the snot out of your student and being interrupted by the sound of another student sipping on a tiny juice box. But he had plenty of juice for the rest of your class. You decided to forgo the nailbat, accepted a juice box from the student, and you're sipping it while instructing the rest of the class on proper straw usage.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>鉛<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>lead</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>えん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">なまり</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Fins, Mouth, Gold</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The <font color=""#f0a""><b>lead</b></font> you’re buying isn’t for you, actually. It’s probably all tree-like and earthy, like being inside a forest indoors. Imagine what this would be like as you continue to shop for the lead.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>郵<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>mail</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ゆう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Car, Butcher</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Who is the butcher? <font><b>You</b></font> (ゆう) are. You are the butcher. And you need to <font color=""#f0a""><b>mail</b></font> this car to your friend in Japan. You are a good friend.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: You are very kind to send your friend the car, even if it is butchered a bit. Continue butchering the car, but concentrate on thinking about you and how great you are.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>針<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>needle</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">しん</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>はり</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Cross, Gold</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Just when you’re about to give up on trying to remove the <font color=""#f0a""><b>needle</b></font>, <font><b>Harry</b></font> (はり) Potter shows up and works some magic to remove the needle from the cross. Thanks, Harry! You’re like, super helpful.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: That was really nice of Harry to help us out with removing that needle. Picture Harry Potter in your head and imagine him yelling a spell incantation to remove the needle from the cross. Harry takes the gold as a reward.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>従<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>obey</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>じゅう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">したが</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Loiter, Correct, Horns</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Unfortunately for the devil, you are actually a <font><b>Jew</b></font> (じゅう) with super demon fighting powers. Using your Jew superpowers, you turn the tables and force the devil to <font color=""#f0a""><b>obey</b></font> you! You force the devil to sing and dance for your entertainment.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Even if you're not actually a Jew, imagine that you are, and feel the yarmulka atop your head as you command the devil to obey you. "<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>豚<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>pork</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">とん</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ぶた</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Moon, Pig</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">At this particular pig restaurant, they have a secret ingredient that goes onto their <font color=""#f0a""><b>pork</b></font>. Lots and lots of <font><b>butte</b></font>r (ぶた). Okay, so it’s not that big of a secret. But boy is it delicious. Mmm, butter.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Butter and pork. "<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>復<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>restore</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ふく</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Loiter, Black Hole</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">When the black hole is done sucking everything in it's time. You hit the <font color=""#f0a""><b>restore</b></font> button but nothing happens. You were lied to. "<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>河<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>river</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>か</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">かわ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Lip Ring, Tsunami</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">But why were you trying to cross this <font color=""#f0a""><b>river</b></font> anyway? "<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>貯<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>savings</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ちょ</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">たくわ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Nail, Clam, Helmet</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">After he’s secured his <font color=""#f0a""><b>savings</b></font>, the clam realizes he accidently left the keys to his car under the helmet as well. Oh no! "<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>端<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>edge</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>たん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">はし</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Mountain, Stand, Rake</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You set up this stand at the top of the mountain so you could give a speech to the world. But you need to look your best, so you decide to get a <font><b>tan</b></font> (たん). You lay next to the <font color=""#f0a""><b>edge</b></font> of the mountain, and prepare to tan. Everyone likes a person with a healthy tan.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine yourself at the edge of this mountain getting your tan on. Feel the sun beating down on you and feel the fresh mountain breeze blowing over your body. It’s very relaxing.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>極<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>extreme</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>きょく, ごく</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">きわ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Ground, Mouth, Tree, Stool, Beggar</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Unfortunately we still haven’t come up with a good reading for きょく, but just try and remember this reading as <font><b>Goku</b></font> (ごく) from Dragon Ball Z and his strange step brother <font><b>Kyoku</b></font> (きょく). Goku and Kyoku are the beggars in this story, the ones performing all the <font color=""#f0a""><b>extremes</b></font>. First Goku gets eaten by the tree with the mouth, and then Kyoku gets eaten as well.</span></span></span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: You know Goku from Dragon Ball, right? Imagine him doing all sorts of extreme things. Then imagine his less impressive brother, Kyoku, also doing extremes. And then they get eaten by the tree.</i></span><br> "

"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>迫<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>urge</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>はく</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">せま</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">White, Water Slide</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Actually, this water doesn’t look nearly white and foamy enough. You feel the <font color=""#f0a""><b>urge</b></font> to make the water flow more violently. Therefore, you <font><b>hack</b></font> (はく) the control panel to up the power on the water jets. The hack is easy, and soon the water is flowing stronger than ever.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine yourself hacking the control panel that controls the water. Look at the electronics and imagine yourself crossing wires and typing in computer code as you hack your way to victory. Keep in mind that this kanji also shares its reading with 白 which is a part of this kanji. How useful.</span></i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>訪<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>visit</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ほう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">たず, おとず</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Direction, Say</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The person you are traveling with is none other than Harry <font><b>Hou</b></font>-dini (ほう) himself. You trust Hou-dini’s judgement, so you <font color=""#f0a""><b>visit</b></font> the same direction that he does, only when you get there, Hou-dini disappears and you are visiting there alone.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine getting there and Hou-dini vanishing. It’s what he’s known for. Now call out for Hou-dini trying to get him to come back because he promised you’d visit this place together. Hou-didni! Hou-diiiiiniiiiii!!!</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>織<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>weave</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>しき</b>, しょく</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">お</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Thread, Drunkard, Sound</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">This drunkard is actually a <font><b>Sheikh</b></font> (しき) (an Arabic leader), but he’s just fallen on hard times and has been hitting the bottle pretty hard lately. The piece of clothing he is using the thread to <font color=""#f0a""><b>weave</b></font> back together is one of his fancy formal robes.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine this drunken Sheikh again, only this time he is moving to the sound of some Arabic music. You know what that sounds like, right?</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>悩<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>worry</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">のう</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>なや</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Treasure Chest, Fish Stick, Grass</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Do you need to <font color=""#f0a""><b>worry</b></font> about remembering how to read this kanji? <font><b>Nah, yah</b></font> (なや) don’t need to worry about it doncha know. You’ll be fine. Nah, yah don’t need to worry about it one bit.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Don’t worry about it! You’ll remember this one for sure. Just repeat the reading mnemonic a few times out loud and just remember the “nah yah” bit and you’ll be fine.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>屈<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>yield</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>くつ</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">かが</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Flag, Exit</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Even though the flag told you to <font color=""#f0a""><b>yield</b></font>, you’re starting to lose your patience. The people walking outside the exit are all a bunch of crazy old <font><b>coots</b></font> (くつ)! These crazy coots keep walking right in front of the door, getting in the way. The old coots aren’t even going anywhere, they just keep looping around to obstruct the way!</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Darn coots! Forget the yield flag, it’s time to exit. "<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>稚<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>immature</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ち</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Pine, Turkey</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">To make it worse, the turkey falls into a pile of fetid <font><b>chee</b></font>se (ち). The <font color=""#f0a""><b>immature</b></font> pine tree placed the cheese there for the turkey to fall in. It was bad enough that the turkey fell down, but now he has a face full of old, rotten cheese.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Picture the turkey falling down again, only this time his face splats into a pile of yucky cheese. Hear the squishing sound and smell the fragrant smell wafting off the cheese.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>幼<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>infancy</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>よう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">おさな</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Power, Poop</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">In <font color=""#f0a""><b>infancy</b></font>, one eats a lot of soft foods, such as <font><b>yo</b></font>gurt (よう). "<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>並<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>line up</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>へい</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">なら, なみ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Ground, Horns, Spikes</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">As you&nbsp;<b style=""color: rgb(226, 0, 150);"">line up</b>&nbsp;these horns and stick them into the ground, you notice a bull munching on&nbsp;<b>hay</b>&nbsp;(へい) nearby. It's staring at the horns you're lining up. Somehow it feels like it's munching that hay angrily. You gulp, looking at its horn as it grabs another mouthful of hay, and you feel pretty guilty.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine the hay in that bull's mouth as it chomps angrily, watching you line up horns in the ground. It probably wishes you were the hay.</i></span><br> "

"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>宴<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>banquet</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>えん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">うたげ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Sun, Woman, Helmet</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">This <font color=""#f0a""><b>banquet</b></font> is being put on by the <font><b>en</b></font>t (えん) lord. That’s why it’s outside. An ent always prefers to be outdoors rather than in.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: While at the banquet observing the woman in the helmet, also see the ents wandering about and mingling with all the other ent guests.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>板<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>board</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>はん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">いた</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Tree, Devil</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">By making <font color=""#f0a""><b>board</b></font>s from these trees, the devil has to cut the tree in <font><b>半</span></b></font> (はん) over and over again until they're board sized.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Half and half and half again. These poor trees have to be cut in half for a long time, until they're at a molecular level, unable to be cut in half again (or are they? Only the devil can try to cut molecules in 半).</span></i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>壊<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>break</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>かい</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">こわ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Cross, Grave, Clothes, Sauron</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Before Sauron can get a hold of you and <font color=""#f0a""><b>break</b></font> all your bones for breaking his precious cross he was making for the grave, a <font><b>coy</b></font>ote (かい) comes out of nowhere and attacks Sauron, knocking him down. You have no idea where the coyote came from, but you don’t pause to think. You get right up and hightail it outta there.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Hear the coyote snarl as it attacks Sauron. Hear Sauron scream in agony as the coyote clamps down on his arm. Where did that coyote come from anyway?</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>督<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>coach</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>とく</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Eye, Small, Stool, Above</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">That was a really hard lesson and by the end of it your <font color=""#f0a""><b>coach</b></font> wasn’t too happy with your progress. To relieve some stress, you go out behind the classroom and <font><b>toke</b></font> (とく) up. You hardly ever toke up, but this sort of situation really calls for it.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine yourself toking up behind the school. Feel the smoke enter your lungs as you toke up. What would your coach think if he saw you now?</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>僚<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>colleague</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>りょう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Leader, Ox</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">As your <font color=""#f0a""><b>colleague</b></font>, the ox likes to suggest things to do with the rest of your colleagues to build teamwork. He suggests you rent a <font><b>row</b></font> (りょう) boat and row around some on your lunch break.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine an ox in a row boat. That row boat won’t hold him! Silly ox, what were you thinking?</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>杯<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>cup of liquid, counter for cups</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>はい</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Tree, Not</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Another way to remember the <font color=""#f0a""><b>counter for cups</b></font> using a <font color=""#f0a""><b>cup of liquid</b></font> would be by creating and memorizing a <font><b>hai</b></font>ku (はい) about them. Aren’t haikus useful?</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Think of a haiku about a cup of liquid and a counter for cups. Use that haiku to help remember this kanji.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>娘<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>daughter</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>むすめ</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Woman, Good</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Your <font color=""#f0a""><b>daughter</b></font> is not a good woman. Your daughter looks like a <font><b>moose who may</b></font> (むすめ) not be able to find its way out of a wet paper bag. Your daughter looks like a moose who may lose its way without a map. Your daughter looks like a moose who may do lots of stupid things.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Think about how your daughter is basically a moose who may do dumb things. How ashamed you feel. How very very ashamed.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>診<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>diagnose</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>しん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">み</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Hair, Say, Hat</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You just had the doctor <font color=""#f0a""><b>diagnose</b></font> you with cancer. How terrible. You stumble out of the room, dumbfounded. Not paying attention you bang your <font><b>shin</b></font> (しん) on the table. Your shin really hurts. What an awful day.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Hold your shin as you feel the throbbing pain in it. Even though the pain is so extreme, you can’t help but still think about the diagnosis you got from the doctor.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>乾<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>dry</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>かん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">かわ, ほ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Nose, Gun, Morning</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Immediately you throw the gun in the trash <font><b>can</b></font> (かん) and start crying. After you collect yourself and your nose, you vow never to use your gun to dry your nose again. It will stay in that trash can.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Hear the gun clunk into the trash can as you throw it. The can is made out of metal, so it makes a loud clinking noise.</i></span><br> "

"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>恐<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>fear</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>きょう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">おそ, こわ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Heart, Saw</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Even more so than your <font color=""#f0a""><b>fear</b></font> of dying, you are filled with the fear that you’ll never get to vacation in <font><b>Kyo</b></font>to (きょう). You always wanted to take a trip to Kyoto, but if you die from this saw wound to the heart, you’ll never get the chance to go.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: How sad. I fear you’ll never make it to Kyoto. Think of Kyoto and how you long for it as you slowly die from that saw wound to the heart.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>猛<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>fierce</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>もう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Child, Plate, Animal</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The reason this <font color=""#f0a""><b>fierce</b></font> animal is eating the child from the plate is because the child forgot to <font><b>mow</b></font> (もう) the animal’s lawn. The fierce animal had hired the child to mow his lawn today, and when the child forgot to do it, the fierce animal hunted the child down and ate him.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: That child really shouldn’t have forgotten to mow the lawn. Imagine you are the child, being eaten by the fierce animal and wishing that you would have just mowed the lawn like you said you would.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>江<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>inlet</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">こう</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>え</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Construction, Tsunami</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Imagine the Japanese people standing on the <font color=""#f0a""><b>bay</b></font> and the <font color=""#f0a""><b>inlet</b></font> as the tsunami approaches. “<font><b>Eh</b></font> (え)? What is that, Akiko?” “Eh? Where? Oh gawd, it’s a tsunami!!”</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: EH? A tsunami you say? Those construction areas are screwed, man. Again, imagine the tsunami demolishing the area. Then be all like, “Eh? A tsunami? Aw, man.”</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>韓<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>korea</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>かん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Cow God, Morning</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Once Cow God destroys <font color=""#f0a""><b>Korea</b></font>, he puts what’s left of Korea into a large <font><b>can</b></font> (かん) for storage. This way Cow God can remember this day fondly whenever he wants to. The can full of Korea is like a memento for Cow God.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine Korea doesn’t exist anymore and what’s left of it is in a can owned by Cow God. What a strange world. Try and picture Cow God scraping the remains of Korea into the can.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>雄<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>male, brave</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ゆう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">おす</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Narwhal, Pile, Turkey</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The <font color=""#f0a""><b>brave</b></font> <font color=""#f0a""><b>male</b></font> turkey has a reason for wanting all the narwhal’s junk though. “<font><b>You</b></font> (ゆう)!” the turkey yells, “You killed my family and left me for dead! You and your horn are to blame for my terrible life, so now I’m going to take your pile of things, you filthy animal!”</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Listen to the turkey as he talks, he really emphasizes “you” each time he says it. Read it aloud if you have to – get a feel for how angry the turkey is.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>航<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>navigation</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>こう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Lid, Sail, Table</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">But who are you? Who is this master navigator? You are <font><b>こう</b></font>いち, Master of <font color=""#f0a""><b>Navigation</b></font>. "<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>監<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>oversee</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>かん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Ground, Plate, Servant, Gun</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You continue to <font color=""#f0a""><b>oversee</b></font> the procedure and soon the deed is done. You take the gun from the servant and slide all the parts from the plate into a <font><b>can</b></font> (かん). You seal the can and then put it into storage. You’re demilitarizing, so all the guns need to be put into cans.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Picture yourself putting a gun into a can. "<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>宗<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>religion</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>しゅう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Helmet, Jackhammer</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Eventually, someone notices that you are forcing <font color=""#f0a""><b>religion</b></font> on people, even those who don’t want any religion. This person is a <font><b>shoo</b></font>ter (しゅう), so he takes out his gun and shoots you, stopping your religious oppression.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: See this shooter just before he shoots you. The sound of the jackhammer drones in your ears as you hear the crack from his gun. You’re dead.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>請<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>request</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>せい</b>, しん, しょう</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">う, こ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Blue, Say</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You know what else they say? “<font><b>Sei</b></font> (せい), sei, sei!” Oh wait, that’s not what everyone says, just Hard Gay. Hard Gay loves the color blue and he makes <font color=""#f0a""><b>request</b></font> after request that they let him wear a blue outfit, but they say it’s not allowed.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine Hard Gay in his current black outfit. Now imagine it in blue. Hard Gay wants to wear blue, so he makes a request to wear blue, but he is shot down. Too bad.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>怖<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>scary</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ふ</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">こわ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Narwhal, Two Face, Fish Stick</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">But wait! What a <font><b>foo</b></font>l (ふ) you’ve been. While the narwhal fights Two Face, you can just escape. They’re distracted and won’t even notice. And you thought this was a <font color=""#f0a""><b>scary</b></font> situation. Pshaw!</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: How foolish you feel as you walk away from the battle. "<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>索<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>search</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>さく</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Cross, Forehead, Thread</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Your <font color=""#f0a""><b>search</b></font> is over. You found the end of the thread. The thread leads you to a <font><b>sack</b></font> (さく). A sack filled with more crosses with more threads attached to them. What does it all mean!?!</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Why are there more crosses and threads in the sack? Are you supposed to take them from the sack and throw them at other people’s foreheads? Maybe. Imagine yourself reaching into the sack and throwing the crosses at other people.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>臣<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>servant</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>しん, じん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Servant</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Your&nbsp;<b style=""color: rgb(226, 0, 150);"">servant</b>, also known as your&nbsp;<b style=""color: rgb(226, 0, 150);"">retainer</b>, bangs his&nbsp;<b>shins</b>&nbsp;(しん) all the time so you make him wear&nbsp;<b>jean</b>s (じん) to work now. He bangs his shins on all the furniture in the house, knocking over all your valuables. But at least when he’s wearing jeans it doesn’t leave bruises like it did when he wasn’t wearing pants.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine your servant banging his shins on everything in your house. Hand him a pair of jeans and tell him to put them on to soften the blows.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>催<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>sponsor</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>さい</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">もよお</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Mountain, Leader, Turkey</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Since the logo is so gaudy and ridiculous, you let out a large <font><b>sigh</b></font> (さい). Siiiigh. These logos are really embarrassing, but you needed a <font color=""#f0a""><b>sponsor</b></font>, and there’s no one around making fun of you, so you can deal with it.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Sigh out loud as you imagine looking at this turkey logo. Two cats is really the limit. How would you feel if most of your ancestors had been KKK members?</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>覧<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>look at</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>らん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Ground, See, Servant, Gun</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You start backing away, but then you realize that you are Macho Man <font><b>Ran</b></font>dy (らん) Savage. Randy Savage backs away from no fight! I mean, <font color=""#f0a""><b>look at</b></font> this guy – this servant guy. Take away the gun and he’s not much to look at. You can take him.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Pretend you are Macho Man Randy Savage. Run at this servant guy, take his gun away, and beat him up. Ohhh yeaaahhh!</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>婚<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>marriage</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>こん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Sun, Woman, Duck</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Once they get to the part in the <font color=""#f0a""><b>marriage</b></font> ceremony where they ask if anyone objects, a <font><b>con</b></font>dor (こん) swoops down from the sky and gets into a fight with the duck. Apparently the condor thinks that he should be with the woman and that the duck stole his love away. Yikes.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine the condor fighting the duck as the woman looks on from the sidelines, weeping into her dress. What a sight.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>懐<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>nostalgia</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">かい</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>なつ</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Cross, Clothes, Sauron, Fish Stick</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Another thing you used to love doing as a child was to tie <font><b>knots</b></font> (なつ). To further increase the feeling of <font color=""#f0a""><b>nostalgia</b></font> you’re experiencing, you grab some rope and start trying knots in it. It’s almost like you’re a kid again!</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Feel nostalgia as you continue tying knots in this rope. Feel the weight of the rope in your hand as you continue to tie it in knots.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>撮<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>photograph</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>さつ</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">と</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Sun, Stool, Ear, Nailbat</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">When the sun monster took the <font color=""#f0a""><b>photograph</b></font> and handed you the <font color=""#f0a""><b>photo</b></font>, you couldn’t even see the photo because you’d been blinded by the flash. Not being able to see, you <font><b>sat</b></font> (さつ) down on the stool and tried to regain your sight. The sun monster sat down too, waiting to give you the photograph.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: You sat down on the stool. Feel the wood under your butt as you sit. It’s not a comfortable stool. Rub your eyes until you regain your sight.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>枕<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>pillow</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">しん</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>まくら</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Big, Tree</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">While the big tree is sleeping on the <font color=""#f0a""><b>pillow</b></font>, you sneak past him and steal his <font><b>Mac Cooler</b></font> (まくら) (the cooler where he stores all his Big Macs). This Mac Cooler will feed you and all your friends for years!</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine lugging this Mac Cooler away from the tree as he snores into the pillow. Nobody. This guy’s a real <font><b>a**hole</b></font> (あそ). He deserves to be punished. "<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>快<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>pleasant</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>かい</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">こころよ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Person, Hook, Fish Stick</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Unfortunately, <font><b>coy</b></font>otes (かい) also find fish sticks to be <font color=""#f0a""><b>pleasant</b></font>, and soon you attract some of them. The coyotes surround you and the other person, eying up your fish sticks. You’d better give up the fish stick, these coyotes don’t look very pleasant.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: You toss the fish stick at the coyote. Hear the coyote scarfing up the fish stick, smacking its lips, as you back slowly away and make your escape.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>貧<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>poor</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>びん</b>, ひん</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">まず</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Clam, Part</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Since you’re <font color=""#f0a""><b>poor</b></font>, you always need to forage for new food. After finishing every part of the clam, you forage around in a nearby trash <font><b>bin</b></font> (びん) for discarded clam shells to munch on. Rummaging through the bin, you find some more clam shells.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Picture yourself digging through the bin. Feel the trash between your fingers as you search for more clams. Smell the terrible odor of trash as you search.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>延<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>prolong</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>えん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">のば, の</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Big Bird, Correct</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Actually, you are an <font><b>En</b></font>t (えん), and as everyone knows, Ents take a long time to say things. Being an Ent, you <font color=""#f0a""><b>prolong</b></font> pretty much everything that requires words, so this argument with Big Bird here is going to take forever.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Silly Ent, why prolong this argument any longer than it needs to be? Imagine yourself as a tree, arguing over things with Big Bird for an eternity. Prolonged forever. Neverending.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>押<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>push</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">おう</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>お</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Turtle Shell, Nailbat</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text""><font color=""#f0a""><b>Push</b></font> down harder… A little harder… Push… CRACK! <font><b>Oh</b></font> (お) no, the turtle shell split into a million pieces. "<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>乏<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>scarce</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ぼう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">とぼ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Leaf, Hills</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Still looking for a leaf, you determine that they are far too <font color=""#f0a""><b>scarce</b></font> to find here. Just before you give up, you discover a <font><b>bow</b></font> (ぼう). You were looking for a leaf, but instead you found a bow. Pluck the bowstring with your fingers making it hum as you think of that scarce leaf you never did find.</i></span><br> "

"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>翌<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>the following</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>よく</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Stand, Feathers</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">While you and <font color=""#f0a""><b>the following</b></font> are <font color=""#f0a""><b>following</b></font> the feathers from their departure from the stand, one of the members of the following drops an egg and <font><b>yolk</b></font> (よく) spills everywhere.
