"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>離<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>detach</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>り</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">はな</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Turkey</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The reason you want to <font color=""#f0a""><b>detach</b></font> the limbs from this turkey is that the turkey is actually a piñata and inside him are a ton of <font><b>Ree</b></font>se’s (り) Pieces. "<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>径<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>diameter</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>けい</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Loiter, Tombstone</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You’re measuring the <font color=""#f0a""><b>diameter</b></font> of the last tombstone when you realize it belongs to a <font><b>K</b></font>KK (けい) member. You grimace as you finish measuring the diameter.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Run your fingers around the diameter of this last tombstone. Feel the etchings where it says “KKK” as you imagine what this person’s life must have been like.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>融<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>dissolve</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ゆう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Insect, Chester</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Just when the last bit of the insect begins to <font color=""#f0a""><b>dissolve</b></font>, you finally work up the courage to confront Chester. “<font><b>YOU</b></font> (ゆう)! You… you… JERK!”</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Okay so maybe you’re not the best with words, but the important part is that you called Chester out. Good job, you.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>均<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>equal</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>きん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">ひと</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Grave, Pool</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Now you’re dead. You <font color=""#f0a""><b>equal</b></font> death. Someone is going to have to notify your next of <font><b>kin</b></font> (きん). You’re already in a grave, so your kin won’t have to bury you, but it’s still sad regardless.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine your kin finding you in this grave. "<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>富<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>rich</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ふ</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">と, とみ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Rice Paddy, Helmet, Creeper</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Once the owner of the rice paddy discovers that all his rice has been taken, he realizes what a <font><b>foo</b></font>l (ふ) he’s been to not implement some sort of security measure against thieving creepers. Now the rice paddy owner will never get <font color=""#f0a""><b>rich</b></font>. He has no rice to sell! Oh, what a fool he is.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine the rich creeper and imagine the fool rice paddy owner. There’s quite a big difference between their attitudes and moods. Juxtapose these in your mind and think of what a lousy situation it is for the rice paddy owner. Pool fool.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>散<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>scatter</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>さん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">ち</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Moon, Winter, Blackjack</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You are playing blackjack with <font><b>San</b></font>ta-san (さん). Santa-san is doing his best to use his Christmas magic to prevent the <font color=""#f0a""><b>scatter</b></font> of cards, but it’s not working out so well. Good effort, Santa-san.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine yourself next to Santa-san as he tries to prevent the cards from scattering. Look at the expression of concentration on Santa-san’s face as he tries to prevent the scatter.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>華<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>showy</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>か</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">はな</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Flowers, Potato</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The flowers are too <font color=""#f0a""><b>showy</b></font> so you get in a <font><b>car</b></font> (か) and drive the flowers over to your friend’s house to give them the flowers. They don’t need to know where the flowers came from, it’s the thought that counts. So get in your car and drive on over!</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: See the showy flowers on the seat next to you as you drive over to your friend’s house. Visualize which friend you’re going to see as you hear the car engine roar.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>嘆<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>sigh</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>たん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">なげ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Mouth, Chinese</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Your favorite Chinese thing to do is <font><b>tan</b></font> (たん). You can wander around without your shirt on and tan all day. No one will <font color=""#f0a""><b>sigh</b></font> or scoff at you, it’s perfectly acceptable. The Chinese just love to get their tan on.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Sigh again as you remember how nice it was to tan everywhere. Picture yourself wandering around some Chinese streets with your shirt off as you soak in the rays and get a tan.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>偵<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>spy</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>てい</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Toe, Clam, Leader</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">While you and your leader <font color=""#f0a""><b>spy</b></font> on the clam, you realize that the clam is smuggling <font><b>ta</b></font>ter (てい) tots. Use the camera to watch the clam smuggle these tater tots. The clam eats a few tater tots in the process.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Boy you wish you had some tater tots. Tater tots are good. Imagine how good a tater tot would taste in your mouth as you continue to spy on this devious clam.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>驚<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>surprised</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>きょう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">おどろ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Winter, Horse, Poem</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You might also be <font color=""#f0a""><b>surprised</b></font> to learn that you are to ride this horse all across <font><b>Kyo</b></font>to (きょう). That gives you a time limit. You have until you traverse Kyoto to write this poem about winter.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine riding through Kyoto on a horse. As if that wasn’t difficult enough for poem writing, now you have all the sights and sounds of Kyoto to distract you as well.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>掃<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>sweep</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>そう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">は</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Forehead, Two Face, Wolverine</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Wolverine finishes his <font color=""#f0a""><b>sweep</b></font>, then notices he’s missing an ear. He must have accidentally knocked it off during his rage. Wolverine then finds his ear, and begins to <font><b>sew</b></font> (そう) it back onto his head. Wolverine has done this before so he knows how to sew body parts back on.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Look at Wolverine as he sews his ear back on. He really does know how to sew, so the job is done pretty quickly. Imagine what it would feel like to sew your own ear back on as you watch.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>菜<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>vegetable</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>さい</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">な</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Tree, Flowers, Cleat</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Once you realize that the tree doesn’t have even a single <font color=""#f0a""><b>vegetable</b></font>, you let out a deep long <font><b>sigh</b></font> (さい). You’re depressed. No vegetable for you or your sweetie. Sigh.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Sigh out loud a few times while you think about your lack of vegetable. It’s really depressing you. Sigh sigh sigh.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>脈<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>vein</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>みゃく</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Moon, Cliff, Tofu</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Eventually, your friends and family find you at the cliff, tripping on tofu. Each and every <font color=""#f0a""><b>vein</b></font> on your body is engorged, pulsating with the effects of tofu. Your friends try and take you home. “You cyan’t <font><b>myake</b></font> (みゃく) me!” You slur, suffering from the effects of the tofu. “None of you cyan myake me go home! You cyan’t myake me! Nyah!”</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Say this out loud, it’ll help you remember. Really focus on the “myake” be sure to say it like you’re all bugged out from tofu overdose.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>徳<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>virtue</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>とく</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Cross, Heart, Loiter, Sauron</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Sauron tries to tempt your <font color=""#f0a""><b>virtue</b></font> by encouraging you to light a cigar and <font><b>toke</b></font> (とく) up. Smoking is not viewed as virtuous in this land, so Sauron is trying to play a trick on you by getting you to drop your guard and toke up. It will taint your virtue a bit, but not enough to deter Sauron from taking your heart anyway.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine Sauron trying to coax you into taking a toke of his cigar. “C’mon, guy – all the cool kids are doing it. You want to be cool, don’t you?” Continue to imagine Sauron trying to peer pressure you into taking a toke as you loiter about some more, still carrying your cross.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>倉<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>warehouse</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>そう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">くら</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Mouth, Flag, Roof</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">As you get closer to the <font color=""#f0a""><b>warehouse</b></font>, one of the flags falls off. This is unacceptable, so you climb up there and <font><b>sew</b></font> (そう) the flag back on. This double flag needs to stay intact, so you sew it back together right away.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Picture yourself atop the roof of this warehouse as you sew the flags back together. Feel the needle and thread in your hands as you work.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>酸<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>acid</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>さん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">す</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Alcohol, Spider</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You're trying to find a container for this&nbsp;<b style=""color: rgb(226, 0, 150);"">acid</b>&nbsp;when&nbsp;<b>San</b>ta-san (さん) bursts through your wall. He frowns down at you. You're on the naughty list now. You killed spiders AND made dangerous acid? Ooooh you're in trouble.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: It’s Christmas morning. Instead of gifts, Santa-san just throws a piece of charcoal at your face. Feel the charcoal smash into your face and explode into acid, burning you. Santa-san runs away laughing. Ho ho ho!</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>賛<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>agree</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>さん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Clam, Husband</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Since the husbands were able to <font color=""#f0a""><b>agree</b></font>, <font><b>San</b></font>ta-san (さん) believes they’re both good husbands and belong on the good list. "<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>祖<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>ancestor</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>そ</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Pelican, Top Hat</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You ask your&nbsp;<b style=""color: rgb(226, 0, 150);"">ancestor</b>&nbsp;pelican how life is now that he's, well you know, a pelican.The pelican shrugs and says, ""Eh, it's&nbsp;<b>so</b>-so (そ)."" Now that you think about it, he must have had a so-so life to be reborn as a so-so pelican.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Your ancestor had a so-so life when he was a human and now he's having a so-so life as a pelican. At least he looks dapper in that hat!</i></span><br> "

"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>衛<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>defense</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>えい</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Go, Cow God</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">When the cow god comes to help you with your&nbsp;defense&nbsp;(for a good reason), you notice a symbol on its back. It's a large&nbsp;<b>a</b>ce (えい), like a playing card. It's the ace of spades. I wonder why.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Maybe the cow god is going to ace your enemies in your defense! "<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>机<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>desk</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">き</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>つくえ</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Tree, Table</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">When you finish the <font color=""#f0a""><b>desk</b></font> you turn to your friend and say, “<font><b>It’s cool, eh</b></font> (つくえ)?” Your friend looks at you and says, “S’coo’ eh? What?” “This desk, it’s cool. It’s cool, eh?” “Aw, yeah man. S’coo’ eh.”</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Okay, so this is a pretty tricky one to make a reading mnemonic out of, if you can think of a better one, please email us. Until then, just imagine someone slurring “It’s cool, eh?” While you think about how cool this desk really is. Run your hands over the finished project as you say it.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>汚<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>dirty</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>お</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">よご, きたな, けが</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Ground, Beggar, Tsunami</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Once the beggar realizes how <font color=""#f0a""><b>dirty</b></font> he is, he becomes sad. “<font><b>Oh</b></font> (お), no.” he says. “Oh no! "<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>飼<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>domesticate</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">し</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>か</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Eat, Director</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">While you did succeed in your attempt to&nbsp;<b style=""color: rgb(226, 0, 150);"">domesticate</b>&nbsp;the director, he is now bleeding profusely from the bite wound. "<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>複<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>duplicate</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ふく</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Pelican, Black Hole</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Suddenly, the <font color=""#f0a""><b>duplicate</b></font> pelican starts yelling, “Why did you throw me into that black hole?? <font><b>F@#$ you</b></font> (ふく) man, f@#$ you.”</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: You feel pretty bad after this duplicate says this. "<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>染<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>dye</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>せん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">しみ, そ, し</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Nine, Tree, Tsunami</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The <font color=""#f0a""><b>dye</b></font> continues to pass through the forest and hits a group of <font><b>cen</b></font>taurs (せん). Now each centaur is dyed with the forest green dye. They don’t look happy.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Hear each centaur shouting about how he hates that dye for changing his color. They look kind of funny, so you laugh at them a bit, but not too loud – they might hear you and get even more angry.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>卵<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>egg</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">らん</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>たまご</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Pool</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You remember <font><b>Tamago</b></font>tchi (たまご), right? Well, Tamagotchi is an <font color=""#f0a""><b>egg</b></font>, and the toy looks like an egg, so it’s pretty easy to remember that tamago means egg.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Just think Tamagotchi whenever you see this kanji. Tamagotchi = tamago = egg. Easy!</i></span><br> "

They will let the water drop for <font color=""#f0a""><b>eternity</b></font> or until you give up the information you have. Being an ace fighter pilot isn’t always fame and glory.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: As the water crop continues to sound for eternity, imagine the good old days of being an ace fighter pilot, flying about in the sky. It’s hard to concentrate for long though with that incessant drip dripping though. Ugh.</i></span><br> "

Gandhi had at least one good eyeball. I mean, each eye of his was probably good, but at least one eyeball was. "<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>興<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>interest</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">きょう, こう</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Fins, Ground, Same, Comb</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Since the combs <font color=""#f0a""><b>interest</b></font> you more than the fins, you examine the combs more closely. They run up to you and smack you with a <font><b>jo</b></font> (じょ). They dare you to say it again as they hit you over and over with the jo.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: What could you have said that was so offensive to this guy? "<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>秘<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>secret</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ひ</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">ひ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Pine, Certain</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">To try and get the <font color=""#f0a""><b>secret</b></font> out of the pine, you <font><b>he</b></font>at (ひ) it up with a lighter. "<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>迎<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>welcome</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>げい</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">むか</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Water Slide, Cat Pirate</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The cat pirate then launches into a speech about how they <font color=""#f0a""><b>welcome</b></font> all kinds of people. Even <font><b>gay</b></font> (げい) ones. He puts a certain emphasis on gay, so you figure that the cat pirate thinks you are gay.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Are you gay? Did the cat pirate guess correctly? How does this make you feel?</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>傷<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>wound</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>しょう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">きず, いた</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Leader, Gravity, Gun</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The <font color=""#f0a""><b>wound</b></font> really hurts and you’re really angry, but you can’t do anything because the leader is the <font><b>sho</b></font>gun (しょう) and you’re just a lowly peon. You can’t get angry or talk back to the shogun, so you just have to suffer your wound in silence.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: That rotten shogun, thinking he can just wound people without consequence. Feel your blood boil with anger at the shogun as the wound on your head continues to throb.</i></span><br> "

"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>著<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>author</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ちょ</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">いちじる, あらわ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Someone, Flowers</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Unfortunately, the <font color=""#f0a""><b>author</b></font> is allergic to flowers. He’s only allergic to touching them though, so the author receives and manipulates the flowers with a pair of <font><b>cho</b></font>psticks (ちょ). Using the chopsticks, he can still enjoy the flowers without touching them.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine trying to move and manipulate flowers with a pair of chopsticks. "<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>垂<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>dangle</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>すい</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">た</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Car</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You see the parts as they <font color=""#f0a""><b>dangle</b></font> off the car and you get an idea. Up, back down, back up, back down. You stand here for days watching because you're so depressed. Stop being so <font color=""#f0a""><b>vague</b></font> in your approach, sun! "<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>異<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>differ</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>い</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">こと</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Fins, Rice Paddy, Blackjack</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Okay, so we both know how the two things <font color=""#f0a""><b>differ</b></font>. That was the easy part. Now let’s think of a way they are similar. Well, they can both be ruined by an <font><b>ea</b></font>gle (い). An eagle can easily ruin a game of blackjack by shredding and stealing the cards and scattering chips all over. The eagle can also ruin a rice paddy by stomping and eating all the rice.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Just imagine the eagle ruining both of these things. "<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>盛<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>pile</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>せい, じょう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">も, さか</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Plate, Become</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The evil wizard responsible for turning you into nothing more than <font color=""#f0a""><b>heaps</b></font> of plates is Hard Gay! “<font><b>Sei</b></font> (せい), sei, sei!” he shouts. Every time he says “sei” another part of your body becomes a <font color=""#f0a""><b>pile</b></font> of plates. When your head is the only part not transformed, <font><b>Jo</b></font>seph (じょう) Stalin busts into the room and knocks out Hard Gay. Wow, thanks Joseph Stalin!</span></span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine Joseph Stalin beating up Hard Gay and then coming over to you. Every time Joseph Stalin says “comrade” to you, another pile of plates turns back into its normal body part. Just imagine this all taking place.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>宣<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>proclaim</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>せん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">のたま</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Ground, Helmet, Sunrise</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Out of the nearby forest appears a <font><b>cen</b></font>taur (せん). "<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>賃<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>rent</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ちん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">King, Clam, Leader</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">With all the <font color=""#f0a""><b>rent</b></font> money the clam king makes from all the other clams who rent from him, he has quite a big pile of rent money. One day the Clam King falls off his rent money pile and lands right on his <font><b>chin</b></font> (ちん). BAM! The clam king just broke his chin. How embarrassing.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine the Clam King with his broken chin. See him crying and sniffling at the pain he has suffered. That’s what you get for being so greedy!</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>敬<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>respect</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>けい</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">うやま</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Winter, Poem</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Soon the cold makes you a bit delirious. With all the white around with it being winter and all, you end up writing a poem about the <font><b>K</b></font>KK (<span lang='ja'>けい</b></font>). A poem about the KKK is definitely not the way to gain the <font color='#f0a'><b>respect</b></font> of other poets.<br></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine what this poem of yours must be like. What kind of things do you think it says about the KKK? Think about what you could have written.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>尊<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>revered</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>そん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">とうと</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Measurement, Alcohol, Horns</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The reason you are interested in these <font color=""#f0a""><b>revered</b></font> horns so much is that your <font><b>son</b></font> (そん) is sick and you need one of these revered horns to make a medicine for your son. Only with the revered power of the horns will you be able to save your son’s life.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Good thing you already have one of these revered horns. Now imagine yourself grinding it up into a powder to mix into a potion for your son to drink. Hear the horn grinding away as you physically break the horn up into millions of tiny pieces.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>熟<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>ripen</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>じゅく</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">う</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Circle, Fish Tail, Sock</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Since the fish tail filled sock began to <font color=""#f0a""><b>ripen</b></font>, you decide to play a joke and throw it at someone. You toss it at your worst enemy, and they <font><b>juke</b></font> (じゅく), getting out of the way just in time. Ah, the juke! Their expertly timed juke totally ruined your plans.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: How did this guy get so good at juking? That was like, the best juke you’ve ever seen. Replay that juke over and over in your head, seeing the guy expertly dodge that circular sock filled with fish tails.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>砂<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>sand</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>さ</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">すな</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Stone, Few</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">What’s in your hand? A few grains of <font><b>sa</b></font>nd (さ)! <font color=""#f0a""><b>Sand</b></font>, sand, sand!</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Just remember that stones become sand and if you remember that this kanji means sand you’ll remember how to pronounce it as well.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>簡<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>simplicity</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>かん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Bamboo, Interval</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Furthering the <font color=""#f0a""><b>simplicity</b></font> is how the bamboo was spaced. The designer just took a soda <font><b>can</b></font> (かん) and used the length of the can to measure the interval of space between each piece of bamboo. Simplicity at its finest.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine yourself as the one laying the bamboo down. Feel the can in your hand as you space out the bamboo. Feel the aluminum can with your fingers. Squeeze it a little so the can flexes and pops. This really is simple.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>蒸<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>steam</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>じょう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">む</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Flowers, Shark</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The reason <font color=""#f0a""><b>steam</b></font> is shooting out of the shark is because of a bad memory it has with <font><b>Jo</b></font>seph (じょう) Stalin. Joseph Stalin used to give the shark flowers all the time, but then Joseph Stalin betrayed the shark so flowers remind him of the betrayal. So now whenever the shark sees flowers, he steams with anger.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine what Joseph Stalin could have done to get this shark so steaming angry. Probably something pretty lousy.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>蔵<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>storehouse</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ぞう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">くら</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Storehouse</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">A <font color=""#f0a""><b>storehouse</b></font> is a storage <font><b>zo</b></font>ne (ぞう). It’s the zone where you store things. That’s why it is called a storehouse.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Get in the zone, the storehouse zone. Imagine yourself inside the storehouse. You feel safe here. The storehouse is a safe zone.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>糖<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>sugar</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>とう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Mouth, Mullet, Rice, Brush</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You remember traveling to <font><b>To</b></font>kyo (とう) by train, and meeting a strange gentleman in downtown Tokyo. He must have drugged you or something. You’re pretty sure you’re still in Tokyo now, you just don’t know where. Even though you took the brush out of your mouth, the taste of <font color=""#f0a""><b>sugar</b></font> still lingers on your tongue.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine yourself bumbling around the streets of Tokyo looking for a landmark or something that will help guide your way back home. Your mouth still tastes of sugar, so imagine that sugary taste in your mouth as you continue to try and find your way home.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>納<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>supply</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>のう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">おさ, なっ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Thread, Inside</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You steal the last <font color=""#f0a""><b>supply</b></font> of thread from inside. Now you are the sole supply of thread. When the others check the supply and discover it’s been stolen they all shout out in unison, “<font><b>NOOOoooOOOOoooOOOoo</b></font>!!” (のう)</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Hear their shouts ringing in your ears as you run your fingers through your newfound thread. Muahaha.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>宝<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>treasure</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ほう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">たから</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Drop, King, Helmet</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">When he tries to remove the gem, he realizes that he can’t penetrate the drop of water. It’s stuck inside the drop which is stuck to the ground. Just then <font><b>Hou</b></font>-dini (ほう) shows up and snatches the <font color=""#f0a""><b>treasure</b></font> away. “Ta~da!” Hou-dini shouts.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Dang it Hou-dini! He always ruins this king’s treasure conquests. This is the fourth time this week! Hou-diiiiniiiii!!</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>諸<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>various</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>しょ</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">もろ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Say, Someone</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You’re so good at speaking <font color=""#f0a""><b>various</b></font> languages that you decide to put on a <font><b>sho</b></font>w (しょ). At the show, you say a lot of things in various languages and everyone is impressed.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine yourself at this show. The spotlight is on and all eyes are watching. You feel kind of nervous, but you speak the various languages with ease.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>窓<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>window</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">そう</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>まど</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Pile, Heart, Hole</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">As I stare out the <font color=""#f0a""><b>window</b></font>, you don't just get sad, you also get really <font><b>mad</b></font> (まど). So, so, mad.&nbsp;</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Maybe you're <font><b>mad</b></font> that the window was made in China, and it's broken. Or maybe you're <font><b>mad</b></font> about the hole in your body. Whatever it is, get mad.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>豆<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>beans</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>とう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">まめ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Beans</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">These <font color=""#f0a""><b>beans</b></font> are from <font><b>To</b></font>kyo (とう). Everybody knows Tokyo has the best beans. What?! You didn’t know that? Tokyo’s beans are the best beans!</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine eating these beans from Tokyo. They’re the best beans you’ve ever had. Even if you don’t like beans, you love Tokyo beans. Mmm… beans beans beans.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>枝<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>branch</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>し</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">えだ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Tree, Frog</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">What’s this? Something else is on the <font color=""#f0a""><b>branch</b></font>. Hey, look! It’s Charlie <font><b>Shee</b></font>n (し). Charlie Sheen is licking the tree frog on the branch to get high. Oh Charlie Sheen, you crazy guy.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Watch Charlie Sheen on the branch as he licks the tree frog. See his eyes glaze over as he gets all messed up from licking it.</i></span><br> "

It’s much nicer that your car, so you’re trying to intimidate the owner into giving you the key.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Yell at the car owner as you continue to brandish the nailbat from your forehead. “The key! Gimme the KEY!”</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>刻<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>carve</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>こく</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">きざ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Ribs, Slice</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">After you <font color=""#f0a""><b>carve</b></font> the rib meat, you’re really thirsty. Nice.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine washing down your ribs with the ice cold Coke you just got. Taste the tasty ribs first, then feel the sweet bubbly goodness of the Coke afterwards.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>爪<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>claw</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">そう</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>つま, つめ</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Claw</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You’ve got not one <font><b>tumor</b></font> (つま), but <font><b>too ma</b></font>ny (つめ) tumors and you need to claw them out with your sharp <font color=""#f0a""><b>claw</b></font>. One tumor is one tumor too many. Cut them out with your claw!</span></span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine you have too many tumors. Feel the claw digging into your flesh and removing the tumors. It really hurts, but it is necessary.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>承<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>consent</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>しょう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">うけたまわ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Child, Water</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You’re in trouble. Even if this kid gave you his <font color=""#f0a""><b>consent</b></font>, he’s been impaled on sticks and now he might drown. The <font><b>sho</b></font>gun (しょう) is not going to be happy with you. This child is the shogun’s child. Dang. You’re in trouble.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Hear the shogun’s child screaming and splashing in the water. Feel your heart sink and your stomach turn. What should you do? Should you run away or try and help the child?</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>幕<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>curtain</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">まく, ばく</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">とばり</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Two Face, Greenhouse</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You finally do manage to find a crack in the <font color=""#f0a""><b>curtain</b></font>, though, and look in. Uh oh... yep... it's poisoned.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>紅<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>deep red</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>こう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">べに, くれない</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Construction, Thread</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">This <font color=""#f0a""><b>deep red</b></font> quilt is actually a present for your best friend <font><b>こう</b></font>いち. こういち’s favorite color is also deep red, so you’re sure that こういち will just love this gift you got him.</span></span></span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Now imagine こういち all wrapped up in this deep red quilt. Look at his happy face and hear him cooing with pleasure as he wraps himself up all tight and cozy.</span></i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>歓<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>delight</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>かん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Arrow, Lack, Turkey</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You need to wipe that look of <font color=""#f0a""><b>delight</b></font> off the turkey’s face. It’s embarrassing. So you pick up a <font><b>can</b></font> (かん) and toss it at the turkey. Bam! The can connects. You knocked out the turkey with the can.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine hurling this can as hard as you can at the turkey. Hear the loud smack as the can connects, knocking out the turkey. Now you are the one who feels delight.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>降<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>descend</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>こう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">お, ふ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Cow, Winter, Butcher</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The killing room’s elevator begins to <font color=""#f0a""><b>descend</b></font> again. It’s <font><b>こう</b></font>いち! He’s here to help the butcher. The cow shudders in fear as the butcher and こういち approach.</span></span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: See こういち and the butcher wielding knives as they approach the cow. Their knives are ready to descend into the cow’s tender flesh. See their blades glinting in the fluorescent lights as こういち and the butcher cackle maniacally.</span></span></i></span><br> "

HAHAHAHAHA!!!”</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Spit on the ground and keep laughing. Throw up some more. Just spew everything out of your mouth while you laugh. You’ve gone insane.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>貴<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>valuable</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>き</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">とうと</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Ground, Middle, Clam</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">To get to the <font color=""#f0a""><b>valuable</b></font> object inside, you need to open the clam. The valuable clam is locked, so you need to find a <font><b>key</b></font> (き). Search for the key.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Finally, you found the key with which to open the valuable clam. Take the key and stick it into the clam, hearing the click as its shell opens. What do you see inside?</i></span><br> "

"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>己<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>oneself</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>こ</b>, き</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">おのれ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Cobra</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Only problem is, this cobra is just a <font><b>子</span></b></font>. To protect <font color=""#f0a""><b>oneself</b></font>, you really need an adult cobra. 子 cobras just aren’t as effective.</span></span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Aww, look at the little 子 cobra. "<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>鹿<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>deer</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">ろく</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>か</b>, しか</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Mullet, Compare, Helicopter</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">As you're admiring and comparing the&nbsp;<b style=""color: rgb(226, 0, 150);"">deer</b>'s mullet to all the mullets you've ever seen, it gets hit by a&nbsp;<b>ca</b>r (か).</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Deer get hit by cars all the time, but it was still really shocking . I mean it was right in front of you. The car could have hit you too.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>換<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>exchange</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>かん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">か</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Big, Enclosure, Head, Legs, Nailbat</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">One of the big guys finds a <font><b>can</b></font> (かん) on the ground and uses that as a weapon. He and the guy with the nailbat <font color=""#f0a""><b>exchange</b></font> blows, but the can is no match for the nailbat. The guy with the can is struck down.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine trying to wield a can as a weapon against a nailbat. It’s not a fair exchange. Feel the nailbat strike you down violently.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>牙<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>fang, tusk</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>げ</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">きば</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Fang</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Lots of animals have&nbsp;<b style=""color: rgb(226, 0, 150);"">fang</b>s, even ones that don't look like they do. The coolest fang-having animal is the&nbsp;<b>ge</b>cko (げ)! They have pretty sharp little fangs in their mouths and they'll bite you if you keep tapping their glass cages like that. Cut it out.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Picture a gecko with cute little fangs. You can keep thinking they're cute as long as one never bites you. They may be little, but gecko fangs are no joke!</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>旧<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>former</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>きゅう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Sun, Stick</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Just when you feel like you’re about to start becoming like your <font color=""#f0a""><b>former</b></font> self, a <font><b>cu</b></font>te (きゅう) rabbit dashes out of the woods and snatches you up in its mouth before running off with you. Dang it! This cute rabbit needs to let you down right now!</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine yourself being carried off by this cute rabbit as you struggle and try to get away. Shout at the cute rabbit to let you go.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>般<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>generally</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>はん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Sail, Ikea</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Generally you wouldn’t have any problems getting to IKEA. However, <font><b>Han</b></font> (はん) Solo flies in from the sky and purchases everything in the store before you can get to shopping. Han! How rude of him to so such a thing.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine Han Solo running about picking up and purchasing everything in IKEA. Now imagine him trying to put all that furniture together. It’s not easy.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>津<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>haven</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">しん</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>つ</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Brush, Tsunami</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The only downside about this <font color=""#f0a""><b>haven</b></font> is that there’s only room for <font><b>two</b></font> (つ) people in the brush. The brush isn’t big enough for more than two people, so unless you have a lot of brushes, you won’t be saving many people from the tsunami.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Since there is room for two people in the brush, imagine yourself in the haven with one other person. They and you make two. The other person is a real whiner though - imagine them crying the whole time.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>療<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>heal</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>りょう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Sick, Ox</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">To fully <font color=""#f0a""><b>heal</b></font> this sick ox you need to cleanse him in water. Therefore you <font><b>row</b></font> (りょう) the ox out in the middle of a lake, dunk him in the water, and then row back to shore.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine being in a row boat with the ox you need to heal. He doesn’t like the water and he’s not helping you row either. Lousy ox.</i></span><br> "

Oh no! Blood everywhere. The KKK is a murdering bunch of ravenous ravels! Well, now the lion can <font color=""#f0a""><b>inherit</b></font> his piece of rice I guess.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine the lion’s face as he sees his parents being brutally slaughtered by the KKK. Once the KKK leaves and the lion realizes he now owns the piece of rice, the lion becomes happy again.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>遺<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>leave behind</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>い</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">のこ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Valuable, Water Slide</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You <font color=""#f0a""><b>leave behind</b></font> the water slide and return to it many years later. You’re surprised to find that <font><b>ea</b></font>gles (い) have made a nest at the top of the slide. Yes, eagles. Now you feel good about your decision to leave behind the slide. A family of eagles now has a home thanks to you.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: See the eagles as they circle over the water slide. Hear the flap of their wings as they screech their eagle screeches.</i></span><br> "

You try to maintain order but it’s not possible. What a kerfuffle.</i></span><br> "

And by cock I mean a male chicken – a rooster. Why does the <font color=""#f0a""><b>nucleus</b></font> of a tree look like a cock? "<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>廃<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>obsolete</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>はい</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">すな</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Mullet, Departure</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Let’s come up with a <font><b>hai</b></font>ku (はい) in memory of this <font color=""#f0a""><b>obsolete</b></font> hairstyle. A haiku is the best way to remember something that is obsolete, especially if it’s something hilarious like a mullet.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Are you ready for the obsolete mullet haiku? Here goes. What’s that on your head? / The mullet is obsolete. / Make your departure.</i></span><br> "

The dog decides to <font color=""#f0a""><b>offer</b></font> to help you in your search. Ken is lonely without Ryu, so it makes sense that Ken is looking for him.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine going around with this dog looking for Ryu. "<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>沖<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>open sea</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">ちゅう</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>おき</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Middle, Tsunami</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Someone dares you to go out to the <font color=""#f0a""><b>open sea</b></font> and surf on the middle of the tsunami. “<font><b>Oki</b></font> (おき) doki,” you reply. You can’t refuse a dare. Every time someone dares you to do something, you always respond with “oki doki”.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: You really regret saying oki doki this time. You don’t want to surf on a tsunami in the middle of the open sea. Imagine doing so. It’s terrifying and wet and you don’t even know how to surf. You’re going to die.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>摘<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>pluck</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>てき</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">つ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Nailbat, Mohawk</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The guy with the mohawk is a self-proclaimed <font><b>techie</b></font> (てき) but he managed to screw up your computer beyond repair. You decide to <font color=""#f0a""><b>pluck</b></font> out his mohawk with a nailbat as punishment. Some techie this guy is.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Now you have motivation for torturing this techie with a mohawk. Continue to pluck each hair, thinking about how this lousy “techie” screwed up your computer. Also note that this kanji has the same reading as the similar 敵.</span></i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>及<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>reach</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>きゅう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">およ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Escalator</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The thing you’re trying to <font color=""#f0a""><b>reach</b></font> is a <font><b>cu</b></font>te (きゅう) rabbit! The escalator is taking you up to the pet store. Once you reach the pet store you can obtain a cute rabbit.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine getting off the escalator and seeing a big cute fuzzy rabbit there waiting for you. How cute!</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>依<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>reliant</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>い</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">よ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Leader, Clothes</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The leader has become so <font color=""#f0a""><b>reliant</b></font> on his clothes that his judgment has been clouded. His kingdom has become infested with <font><b>ea</b></font>gles (い) but the leader does nothing, trusting that his clothes will rout out the eagles if it is something that needs to be done. He’s become so reliant on his clothes that he’s started to become not so good a leader anymore.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Look at the leader as he shouts at his clothes he’s become so reliant on to do something. Hear the countless eagles screeching around as they terrorize the neighborhood. People scream and weep in the streets.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>縄<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>rope</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>じょう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">なわ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Thread, Turtle</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">This turtle has been hired by <font><b>Jo</b></font>seph (じょう) Stalin to make a <font color=""#f0a""><b>rope</b></font> for every soldier in his army. Joseph Stalin is running short on workers so he’s recruited this turtle to help with the war effort.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine Joseph Stalin barking orders at the turtle, telling him to make the rope faster, faster, FASTER!</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>踏<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>step</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>とう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">ふ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Sun, Water, Foot</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The reason you took a <font color=""#f0a""><b>step</b></font> on the sun was to win a trip to <font><b>To</b></font>kyo (とう). There was a contest going on that said if you were brave enough to step on the sun they would give you a paid vacation to Tokyo. You won!</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Too bad your foot got burned off. And too bad they’re only paying for a vacation to Tokyo and not your medical bills. Think about it – was that step really worth it?</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>伸<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>stretch</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">しん</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>の</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Leader, Say Humbly</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">While in the middle of his explanation, the leader realizes he is thirsty so he begins to <font color=""#f0a""><b>stretch</b></font> towards a glass of egg <font><b>no</b></font>g (の). Apparently this guy really likes the nog.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Watch him stretch towards the nog in desperation. You could help him, but you’re kind of enjoying watching him stretch, you weirdo.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>姓<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>surname</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>せい</b>, しょう</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Woman, Life</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">There is a special woman in the life of Hard Gay. She’s changing her <font color=""#f0a""><b>surname</b></font> to Gay. Yes, Hard Gay’s <font color=""#f0a""><b>family name</b></font> is Gay. “<font><b>Sei</b></font> (せい), sei, sei! Another Gay is on the way!”</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine Hard Gay chanting this at his wedding as Mrs. Gay officially takes on Hard Gay’s family name. I’m sure they’ll live a long and happy life together.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>甘<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>sweet</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">かん</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>あま</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Sweet</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The <font color=""#f0a""><b>sweet</b></font>, sweet sensation is almost overwhelming. You gotta put on some sweet resistant <font><b>armor</b></font> (あま) to protect you from all that sweetness. The armor will prevent you from having a sweet, sweet sweetness overload.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Put on the armor! Feel its weight on your body. Now taste the sweet flavor on your tongue. It’s sweet, but not too sweet.</i></span><br> "

The evil Mrs. Chou is the reason your foot can’t help but <font color=""#f0a""><b>hop</b></font>.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Feel your foot continue to hop as Mrs. Chou cackles in the background, laughing her evil little head off. “Hop! "<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>抱<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>hug</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">ほう</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>だ</b>, かか, いだ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Enclosure, Cobra, Nailbat</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The person you want a <font color=""#f0a""><b>hug</b></font> from the most is your <font><b>da</b></font>ddy (だ), your dada.
