"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>旬<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>in season, time of month</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>しゅん, じゅん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Enclosure, Sun</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Looks like it’s that <font color=""#f0a""><b>time of month</b></font> again. Wait, what month? The one that’s coming <font><b>soon</b></font> (しゅん), of course. Soon, yes… Shorts are <font color=""#f0a""><b>in season</b></font> in this month. Shorts! Coming soon. Ah, I get it now. It’s that time of month, that month that’s soon arriving, and shorts are in season. Yes, it all comes together.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine being out and about soon as you wear your in season shorts. Ah, what a great time of month this is. But soon it will be over. Too soon.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>聴<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>listen</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ちょう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">き</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Cross, Heart, Ear, Sauron</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">As you continue to <font color=""#f0a""><b>listen</b></font>, you feel like there’s something wrong. That doesn’t sound like a regular heartbeat at all. All at once you realize that he’s been cursed by the evil Mrs. <font><b>Chou</b></font> (ちょう)! You can hear her cackling in the background. "<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>執<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>tenacious</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>しゅう</b>, しつ</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">と</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Circle, Happiness</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">This circular blob of happiness is so&nbsp;<b style=""color: rgb(226, 0, 150);"">tenacious</b>&nbsp;that it’s starting to get on your nerves. You were happy before but this particular bundle of literal happiness is more annoying than anything so you hire a&nbsp;<b>shoo</b>ter (しゅう) to snipe the happiness out of your life. Unfortunately the shooter misinterprets your instructions and just shoots you dead instead. Oh, and what was that little happiness ball of tenacious love? Your&nbsp;shitzu&nbsp;(しつ). Wait, you hired a shooter to shoot your&nbsp;<b>shitzu</b>? Wow. Cold.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Hear the crack of the sniper rifle as the shooter shoots you with his gun. BAM! Feel the shooter’s bullet hit you. The happiness is fading from your life. Your shitzu is licking that face. Good bye cruel, tenacious world.</i></span><br> "

"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>削<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>whittle down</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>さく</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">けず</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Moon, Triceratops, Ribs</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The triceratops continues to <font color=""#f0a""><b>whittle</b></font> down the moon with his ribs until there is almost no moon left. A <font><b>sack</b></font> (さく) of coins falls out from the moon. Did you know that if you whittle down the moon enough you’ll receive a sack of coins? Apparently this triceratops knew.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Hear the clink of the sack as it falls out of the moon. "<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>宜<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>best regards</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">ぎ</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>よろ</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Helmet, Top Hat</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Do you know the saying&nbsp;<b>YOLO</b>&nbsp;(よろ)? It means You Only Live Once. This is why you're giving your&nbsp;<b style=""color: rgb(226, 0, 150);"">best regards</b>&nbsp;now. Best regards!""</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine thinking about the phrase YOLO and how it totally fits into why you're giving your best regards before going off to the war.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>賂<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>bribe</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ろ</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Clam, Kiss</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">After you kiss the clam, you take your <font color=""#f0a""><b>bribe</b></font> money and run off down the <font><b>ro</b></font>ad (ろ) to the nearest shopping center. Fortunately there is one just down the road, so you’ll get there in no time.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine yourself running down the road, feet slapping on the pavement. Hold your bribe money tightly in your fists as you dash down the road.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>賄<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>bribe</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>わい</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">まかな</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Clam, Have</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Do you know what happens when somebody doesn’t pay the clam his <font color=""#f0a""><b>bribe</b></font> money? The clam shoots off their kneecaps. They always scream, “<font><b>Why</b></font>?? (わい) WHYYYYYY!?! WHY WHY WHY!!?!?” But it matters not. This clam has no room in his heart for pity.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Listen to these clams screaming “WHY?!” as they get their kneecaps blown off. Wait, do clams even have kneecaps?</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>房<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>cluster</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ぼう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">ふさ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Direction, Door</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">After you make it through the door, you come across another <font color=""#f0a""><b>cluster</b></font> of doors. Which one to choose? You see a <font><b>bow</b></font> (ぼう) and arrow etched over one of the doors. You enter that door. Another cluster appears. You see another door with a bow and arrow over it. You repeat the process until you finally escape the cluster of doors maze.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Good thing you noticed that bow and arrow clue. Imagine going through each cluster of doors looking for that bow and arrow symbol to guide you outside.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>慮<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>consider</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>りょ</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">おもんぱく, おもんぱか</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Tiger, Think</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">It's&nbsp;<b style=""color: rgb(226, 0, 150);"">consider</b>ing you for so long that it takes out a&nbsp;<b>ro</b>be (りょ), a pipe, and an armchair and starts puffing away, staring intently at you. You didn't even know tigers could wear robes, but this one seems to use it to help itself think.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Consider this! Tigers look great in robes.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>託<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>consign</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>たく</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">かこ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Seven, Slide, Say</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">One of the seven things you <font color=""#f0a""><b>consign</b></font> over to this guy is a <font><b>tack</b></font> (たく). It’s the sharpest tack you’ve ever seen. You slide the tack down the slide. Good thing no one is on the slide now, sitting on that tack would hurt.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Let’s imagine what it would be like to hit this tack while sliding on the slide. It would hurt. Good thing you are consigning it over to someone. Probably safer for everyone that way.</i></span><br> "

What, did you forget about Kia Cookies? Yes, they’re a real thing.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Munch on your Kia Cookies as you dwell on everything contrary. "<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>需<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>demand</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>じゅ</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Rain, Rake</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Now imagine the rain changing. Wait a second, this isn't rain, it's&nbsp;<b>ju</b>ice (じゅ)! You shake your rake harder, and&nbsp;<b style=""color: rgb(226, 0, 150);"">demand</b>&nbsp;that the juice rain continues. It doesn't listen to your demands and stops as soon as you start bottling it. Well, at least you have enough for one, really small juice box.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Picture yourself demanding more rain from the sky, trying to fill up your tiny juice box with what little juice rain you were able to get.</i></span><br> "

You decide to do some <font><b>chee</b></font>se (ち). Cheese is a good thing to do. You draw for so long that you begin to sweat and get really bad <font><b>B.O. </b></font> (びょう). Did you forget to put on deodorant today? Your B.O. is terrible!</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Try and continue to draw as your B.O. attacks your nose. Your B.O. is really bad. You try not to black out from the stench as you draw some more.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>刊<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>edition</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>かん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Antenna, Ribs</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">To make the most of these latest <font color=""#f0a""><b>edition</b></font> ribs of yours, you hold a <font><b>can</b></font> (かん) up to your ribs. The can amplifies the sound coming from them and makes it easier to hear. It can be any old can too. Soda can, coffee can, you name it.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine holding a can up to your ribs and hearing the sound louder and clearer. Now remove the can. Put it back. Remove it. Keep doing this over and over until you get bored.</i></span><br> "

You’re new here, so you’re not too familiar with the Tokyo streets. Your escape is hindered by your lack of navigational ability. "<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>還<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>send back</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>かん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">かえ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Ground, Water Slide, Sauron, Zombie</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">In an effort to <font color=""#f0a""><b>send back</b></font> the zombie, Sauron continues to stomp on its head. When this doesn’t work, Sauron finds a <font><b>can</b></font> (かん) and throws that at the zombie too. And another can, and another. Can after can rain down on this zombie in an attempt to send back the abomination.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Now imagine Sauron throwing a can at the zombie trying to crawl out the ground. Will he be able to send back the zombie? Maybe. But for now just hear the sound of each can ricocheting off the zombie’s skull. Thunk!</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>繰<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>spin</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">そう</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>く</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Tree, Thread, Products</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">One of the products you attached the thread to was a <font><b>coo</b></font>kie (く). As you see the cookie <font color=""#f0a""><b>spin</b></font> around the tree, you start to want to eat it. In the middle of the spinning, you stop the tree and detach the cookie.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Eat the cookie. Mmm, cookie. It’s so good. Taste its crumbly goodness in your mouth. You don’t regret stopping the thread spinning process at all. So worth it.</i></span><br> "

You’re making breakfast with every egg yolk in the house and the cat pirate is trying to suppress you so it can take the egg yolks for itself.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Defend the egg yolk! The centaur said that he was the rightful leader of these mountain goats so the centaur challenged the hermit to a duel.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Picture this old hermit fighting this centaur in a duel. "<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>邦<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>home country</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ほう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">くに</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Slide, Three, Butcher</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You need to get some tourism traffic in your <font color=""#f0a""><b>home country</b></font> so you hire the great <font><b>Hou</b></font>-dini ほう to put on a show. Hou-dini will surely be famous enough to attract many many tourists here to your home country.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine Hou-dini performing his magic show in your home country and hear the crowd get louder and louder as more and more people flood into your home country to see the great Hou-dini.</i></span><br> "

They’ve got me.&nbsp;<b>Go</b>&nbsp;(ご)! Go and save yourself! Why are you in such a state of <font color=""#f0a""><b>humility</b></font>, watching the rich people from the ditches with your fish sticks? "<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>唱<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>chant</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>しょう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">とな</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Mouth, Sun</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The reason you are doing this <font color=""#f0a""><b>chant</b></font> is because the <font><b>sho</b></font>gun (しょう) wanted to see the sun. The sun just set, but the shogun wanted to see the sun for longer so he made you chant your chant to bring it back. Silly shogun. So greedy.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Now imagine the shogun doing the chant with you. He’s a quick learner. Mouth! Sun sun, mouth! Sun sun!</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>衝<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>collide</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>しょう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">つ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Heavy, Go</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You're going around the town, you&nbsp;<b style=""color: rgb(226, 0, 150);"">collide</b>&nbsp;with a bunch of things, when all of a sudden you collide with the&nbsp;<b>sho</b>gun (しょう)! Oh no! The shogun looks really mad.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine colliding with the shogun. Imagine his angry face. Imagine his fist colliding with your face.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>戒<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>commandment</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>かい</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">いまし</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Twenty, Drunkard</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The drunkard gets disoriented and wanders into the woods, shouting his new <font color=""#f0a""><b>commandment</b></font> at the top of his lungs. His yelling attracts a <font><b>coy</b></font>ote (かい), and the coyote proceeds to attack and maul the drunkard to death. Looks like his commandment isn’t going to catch on.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Hear the drunkard screaming for help and mercy as the coyote disembowels him. Maybe his new commandment should have been “Thou shalt not go into a coyote infested forest and scream at the top of thine lungs.”</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>兼<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>concurrently</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>けん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">か</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Mona Lisa</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">To make matters worse, while you are <font color=""#f0a""><b>concurrently</b></font> studying the Mona Lisa and painting your forgery, <font><b>Ken</b></font> (けん) from Street Fighter is concurrently dancing around the room doing hadokens and shoryukens as loud as he possibly can. Ken has no consideration at all.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: With so many things going on concurrently, you start to go insane. While staring at the Mona Lisa, just listen to Ken continue to scream hadoken and shoryuken at the top of his lungs.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>薄<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>dilute</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>はく</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">うす</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Specialty, Tsunami, Flowers</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">As you watch the flower <font color=""#f0a""><b>dilute</b></font>, you determine that this is obviously a nature <font><b>hack</b></font> (はく). You’ve never seen anything like this before, so you think the tsunami found out how to hack nature and that’s how it got so good at diluting things. By hacking nature.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: As you continue to watch the flower dilute due to the water being poured onto it by the tsunami, imagine what techniques this tsunami is using to hack nature. Is the tsunami a super cyborg from the future? Maybe.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>堀<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>ditch</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">くつ</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ほり</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Flag, Grave, Exit</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">As you climb out of the <font color=""#f0a""><b>ditch</b></font>, the flag bursts into flames! <font><b>Holy</b></font> (ほり) crap! This flag was booby trapped? Somebody really didn’t want it removed from the ditch. Holy moly.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Holy cow, man. That flag just blew up in your hands. Feel the heat and slight burn on your palms as you look back into the ditch you just crawled up out of.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>剤<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>dose</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ざい</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Stilts, Ribs</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">For an extra <font color=""#f0a""><b>dose</b></font> of challenge, you decide to play the <font><b>xy</b></font>lophone (ざい) with your stilts. This is really hard. The xylophone is near the ground, so you have to hop on your stilts and be very quick to hit all the xylophone keys.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Hear the xylophone go plink plink as you tap out the notes with your stilts. This little dose of exercise is good enough for a whole week!</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>雅<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>elegant</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>が</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">みや</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Turkey, Fang</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You’re so scared of this <font color=""#f0a""><b>elegant</b></font> but menacing turkey with a fang that you start going “goo-goo <font><b>ga</b></font>-ga” (が) like a big baby. In between each goo and ga, you slowly back away from the turkey.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Say goo-goo ga-ga out loud a few times as you imagine backing away from the elegant and fearsome turkey. What a baby you are.</i></span><br> "

He's your elder, after all. He might even be your dad, who knows. Make sure you use your new knowledge of filial piety to show your respect to&nbsp;こういち!</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Being taught about filial piety has helped you see your elders, like&nbsp;こういち, in a whole new light!</i></span><br> "

You always see the geoduck here, but also a lot of Hindu people.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Look at all the Hindu people as you walk around and observe the geoduck. Hear them all speaking Hindi as you continue to walk around.</i></span><br> "

The moans are getting louder and more erotic. You’re kind of creeped out. This is the last time you give him flowers from your luxuriant garden, that’s for sure.</i></span><br> "

Yes, milord. Right away, milord! I shall thrust the flag into the building, creating a dent for it to rest in, and claiming IKEA for our kingdom!</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine yourself thrusting the flag into the side of the IKEA building so hard that you make a dent. Feel the flag reverberate in your hands as the noise echoes in your ears.</i></span><br> "

And then you’ve got that bad lion too, and lions always provide a great shock. This whole situation is quite shocking, really.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Watch the pope continue to multiply in front of your eyes as you try to overcome the shock you are feeling. Since you’re in shock, you’re having trouble breathing and standing. You’ve got to get it together!</i></span><br> "

It's time to start protesting again, no time for eating! The butcher leaves her neighbors, the ringing bells still ringing in her ears. She's glad she isn't a protestor.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine the ringing in your ears. You were just being a friendly neighbor. But now your ears are bothering you.</i></span><br> "

Han Solo is used to blasting baddies and kissing princesses. Overgrown thread is not his specialty. Use your blaster to clear a way through this thread instead of using that machete.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine yourself as Han Solo, bravely blasting your way through the overgrown thread with your blaster. "<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>巡<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>patrol</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>じゅん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">めぐ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Water Slide, Arrows</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The only month you get to <font color=""#f0a""><b>patrol</b></font> this area is the month of <font><b>June</b></font> (じゅん). June is the only month that this park is open, so June is the only month you get to patrol around and shoot arrows at the water slide.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: It’s June, so imagine how hot and sticky it is outside as you continue to fire arrows and patrol around the water slide. It’s toasty.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>柱<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>pillar</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ちゅう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">はしら</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Tree, Master</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">While bowing, the <font color=""#f0a""><b>pillar</b></font> accidently smashes <font><b>Chew</b></font>bacca (ちゅう). The pillar is horrified for having murdered Chewbacca, his tree master’s closest friend. The pillar is going to be punished.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Hear the crack and snap of branches as the tree beats the crap out of the pillar for having murdered Chewbacca. Unforgivable.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>携<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>portable</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>けい</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">たずさ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Stairs, Turkey, Nailbat</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The reason you need the turkey in the <font color=""#f0a""><b>portable</b></font> carrier is so that you can deliver him to the <font><b>K</b></font>KK (けい). They’re having a turkey dinner and you were in charge of providing the turkey. The KKK will be very happy you got their turkey.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine delivering the turkey to the KKK in the portable carrier. They’re all wearing those white hoods so you don’t know which person to deliver the turkey to.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>褒<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>praise</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ほう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">ほ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Lid, Clothes, Preserve</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">When you lift up the lid, your clothes have disappeared! This sounds like one of <font><b>Hou</b></font>-dini’s (ほう) tricks. Hou-dini gives <font color=""#f0a""><b>praise</b></font> to demons and devils and they have bestowed Hou-dini with evil and corrupted power.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Hou-dini, you fiend! Give me my clothes back! Imagine chasing after this rascally Hou-dini as he attempts to abscond with your clothes.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>排<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>reject</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>はい</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Injustice, Nailbat</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Only one more person to <font color=""#f0a""><b>reject</b></font> so let us write a <font><b>hai</b></font>ku (はい) to commemorate this occasion. You aren’t wanted here. Take your crap and go now please. This is injustice.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: What a nice haiku we’ve composed. The guy you rejected likes the haiku so much that he doesn’t even mind that he was rejected.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>駐<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>resident</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ちゅう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Master, Horse</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">To prove yourself a worthy <font color=""#f0a""><b>resident</b></font> of the horse master’s house, you must capture <font><b>Chew</b></font>bacca (ちゅう). Your horse master collects rare creatures, and Chewbacca is his latest desire. If you wish to remain a resident of the house, you must capture Chewbacca.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine Chewbacca in a cage in the horse master’s house. You’ve proved yourself a worthy resident. Hear Chewbacca making his Wookie sounds as he bashes against the bars of his new cage.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>顧<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>review</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>こ</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">かえり</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Employ, Geoduck</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You ask the geoduck to <font color=""#f0a""><b>review</b></font> your taxes and the geoduck asks for your first born <font><b>子</b></font> as payment. You don’t really like your 子 so you agree to trade your 子 for the geoduck’s reviewing services.</span></span></span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Hear your 子 as it is dragged away kicking and screaming by the geoduck. "<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>犠<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>sacrifice</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ぎ</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Cow, Righteousness</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">One of the rites that happens while the people sacrifice the cow is someone plays the <font><b>gui</b></font>tar (ぎ). The song the guitarist is playing is very inappropriate, so be sure to take notice of that.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Of course, the reading is also shared with kanji like 義. The righteousness radicals seems to have that effect on kanji.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>獲<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>seize</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>かく</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">え</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Stool, Turkey, Flowers, Animal</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The animal the turkey is trying to <font color=""#f0a""><b>seize</b></font> the flowers from is a <font><b>cock</b></font> (かく). The cock is a lot bigger than the turkey, so that’s why the turkey needs to stand on the stool in its attempt to seize those flowers.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine this scene again only with a big cock holding the flowers as the turkey attempts to seize them. Hear the cock shouting cock-a-doodle-doo as it defends its flowers.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>鋭<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>sharp</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>えい</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">するど</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Gold, Guard</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You want to test how&nbsp;<b style=""color: rgb(226, 0, 150);"">sharp</b>&nbsp;it is, so you walk up and throw an&nbsp;<b>a</b>ce (えい) card at him. In one, quick swipe, the ace is split in half! Woah! That sword is SUPER sharp!</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine how sharp a sword would have to be to cut an ace in half. "<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>敷<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>spread</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">ふ</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>しき</b>, し</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Cross, Rice Paddy, Direction, Winter</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You’re actually a&nbsp;<b>Sheikh</b>&nbsp;(しき) (an Arabic leader) which makes the fact that you’re holding a cross while you&nbsp;<b style=""color: rgb(226, 0, 150);"">spread</b>&nbsp;your arms even more of a big deal. You spread your arms wider than any Sheikh ever has before.<br>Side note: The official kun'yomi reading is just&nbsp;し&nbsp;but since no vocab words ever use&nbsp;し, we're teaching you&nbsp;しき, which includes what used to be okurigana but is never used outside of the kanji anymore.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Feel the strain on your Sheikh arms as you continue to spread them. Since you’re a Sheikh, you have to set a good example for your people, so don’t let them (or your arms) down.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>透<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>transparent</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>とう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">す</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Pine, Stairs, Water Slide</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Having conquered your near crippling vertigo, you make it to the top of the <font color=""#f0a""><b>transparent</b></font> staircase. This water slide is right in the middle of <font><b>To</b></font>kyo (とう), so as you slide down, you get a great view of all the Tokyo sights.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: You slide down the pine water slide and get some pine splinters in your butt. They really hurt, but you’re more focused on the amazing sights you’re seeing around Tokyo. It’s really beautiful.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>棄<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>abandon</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>き</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Tree, Boob, Trident</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You realize that the boob had to <font color=""#f0a""><b>abandon</b></font> the trident for a reason. Now that the boob has abandoned his trident, the boob can take the key and open the mystery chest.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine the boob using the key to open the chest. "<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>拠<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>based on</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>きょ</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">よ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Winter, Table, Nailbat</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The table that the nailbat was <font color=""#f0a""><b>based on</b></font> was built in Little <font><b>Kyo</b></font>to (きょ). Both the nailbat and the table it was based on have designs specific to Little Kyoto. There is Japanese writing and koi fish designs on the both of them.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine the nailbat again, but imagine it imagining the table it’s based on being built in Little Kyoto, hearing the electric saw, hammer, and sander as the creator works on the construction of the table.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>蜂<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>bee</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">ほう</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>はち</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Winter, Insect, Signpost</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Not wanting to see the <font color=""#f0a""><b>bee</b></font> shivering in the winter cold anymore, you open up the <font><b>hatch</b></font> (はち) to your carrying case and shoo the bee inside. You shut the hatch, and transport the bee to a warmer area where you open the hatch and set the bee free.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Hear the bee buzzing furiously until you open the hatch. He doesn’t like to be contained, and the bee buzzes very happily once the hatch is opened again. Buzz buzz buzz!</i></span><br> "

"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>畑<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>field</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>はたけ, はた</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Fire, Rice Paddy</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Your rice paddy farm and <font color=""#f0a""><b>field</b></font> are on a cay. A cay is a small, sandy island, and since your farm in on fire, this cay has turned into a hot cay. Or as Mario would say, that’s one-a <font><b>hot-a cay</b></font>! (はたけ) Mama mia!</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine running around this hot cay as you try to put out the fire in your field. The fire is ravaging the entire hot cay, so it takes you a while to put it out. Man those flames are hot.<br>Also, this kanji can have the reading はた for the kun'yomi as well. If you learn the longer version (はたけ) it will be easier to just shave off a kana to remember the shorter version.</span></span></i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>蛍<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>firefly</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">けい</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ほたる</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Insect, Viking</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The Viking <font color=""#f0a""><b>firefly</b></font> is attacking <font><b>Hotaru</b></font> (ほたる) Tomoe (alter ego of Sailor Saturn) because the Viking firefly hates the show Sailor Moon and everyone on it. "<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>郷<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>hometown</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>きょう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Poop, Good, Butcher</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Your <font color=""#f0a""><b>hometown</b></font> is <font><b>Kyo</b></font>to (きょう). Whenever you go back to your hometown of Kyoto, they pour this runny poop on you.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine being in your hometown of Kyoto and getting this runny poop poured on you. Imagine looking at the sights in Kyoto as you wipe the runny poop out of your eyes.</i></span><br> "

He's all like 'isn't this a cool car?' You reply: '<font><b>Gee, coo</b></font>l' (じく) very sarcastically.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: You're super sarcastic about this, so feel the sarcasm inside of you when you imagine this.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>綱<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>cable</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">こう</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>つな</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Thread, Hill</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You use this <font color=""#f0a""><b>cable</b></font> to swing down from a building but you need to do i<font><b>t soon</b></font> (つな)! You're being chased by some bad guys and they've almost caught you, so if you're gonna swing to safety with this cable, you need to do it soon.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Gotta do it soon. Imagine swinging from this cable and feeling the wind in your hair.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>挑<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>challenge</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ちょう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">いど</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Omen, Nailbat</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The <font color=""#f0a""><b>challenge</b></font> you are facing comes in the form of Evil Mrs. <font><b>Chou</b></font> (ちょう). Mrs. Chou has issued a challenge to you. She wants to fight you in a duel. The nailbat was sent to you by her in order to issue the challenge. It was a bad omen after all.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine fighting Mrs. Chou with this nailbat. She is a tough challenge. Your arms are weak and weary from swinging this nailbat around during the battle with Mrs. Chou.</i></span><br> "

What an embarassment. Now all you have is easymac.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: The Shogun comes over and you have to explain. Feel the embarassment. "<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>掘<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>dig</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>くつ</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">ほ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Flag, Exit, Nailbat</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You <font color=""#f0a""><b>dig</b></font> until you finally reach an exit. Upon your exit, you see a bunch of old <font><b>coots</b></font> (くつ). They’re all moaning and groaning like old coots do, you know the type. Since they just saw you digging, the old coots all decide to dig as well. You exit the area as the old coots just start to dig in the ground to no apparent reason.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine walking out of this situation carrying your nailbat and flag as all the old coots dig around you while they moan and groan. How strange.</i></span><br> "

"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>斎<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>purification</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>さい</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">いつ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Jackhammer, Stilts</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">After you finish the <font color=""#f0a""><b>purification</b></font> ritual, they say you didn't do it well enough so you have to do it again. All you can do is <font><b>sigh</b></font> (さい).</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Go ahead and sigh right where you are while thinking about having to do that purification ritual again. *sigh*</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>袋<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>sack</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">たい</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ふくろ</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Clothes, Substitute</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You need your substitute clothes so you take our your substitute clothes <font color=""#f0a""><b>sack</b></font>. You open it up to grab your substitute clothes, only to find out that there is a ton of salmon roe inside your sack. Oh man, you forgot all about putting that in there. You yell: <font><b>F**K ROE</b></font> (ふくろ) because that roe destroyed all your clothes and made it nasty.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine how nasty it is in there. Also imagine how smelly it is. Feel angry about putting roe in your sack. Why would you even do that? Why would the roe do this to you, as well.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>揺<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>shake</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>よう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">ゆ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Nailbat, Satellite</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You want it to&nbsp;<b style=""color: rgb(226, 0, 150);"">shake</b>&nbsp;because there is a bunch of&nbsp;<b>yo</b>gurt (よう) in there. And you only like yogurt that's been well shook. And who can resist space yogurt? Huh? Anyone?</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine shaking yogurt. Shake it!</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>滑<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>slippery</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>かつ</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">すべ, なめ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Bone, Tsunami</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You not only broke your bone when you fell on the <font color=""#f0a""><b>slippery</b></font> ground, you also got a bunch of <font><b>cuts</b></font> (かつ) from where you landed on some glass, so that's something else to worry about.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Just imagine the whole process. You fall from something slippery. Then you break your bone (feel that pain). Then you notice all the glass cuts in your arm (feel the pain). What a bad day, though to be fair, you did survive getting hit by a tsunami.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>堅<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>solid</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">けん</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>かた</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Grave, Stool, Servant</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">While this stool is <font color=""#f0a""><b>solid</b></font>, you need to keep it away from the dreadful <font><b>Cutter</b></font> (かた). The Cutter likes to find solid things and cut them to pieces. Oh no! The Cutter is already here and he’s cutting the solid stool!</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Hear the Cutter cackling as he cuts the stool into two pieces. Hear the wood crack as it breaks away. Also keep in mind that the 堅い reading is like 固い, which has a similar meaning.</span></span></i></span><br> "

"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>荒<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>wild</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">こう</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>あ, あら</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">River, Death, Flowers</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text""><font><b>Ah</b></font> (あ), the flowers in the <font color=""#f0a""><b>wild</b></font> have been claimed <font><b>à la</b></font> (あら) the great flood. Ah, you don’t think so? Well I do.</span></span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine this scene again, only imagine it like the wild flowers are experiencing their own great flood. Ah, those flowers are drowning to death à la everything that died in the Biblical flood.</i></span><br> "

It’s so pretty! You had no idea the moon could be so bright that the roe in the sea would be bright right back at it!</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Picture the bright moon. "<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>趣<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>gist</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>しゅ</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">おもむき</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Stool, Ear, Run</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Then, after you do that, you have to take off your <font><b>shoe</b></font> (しゅ) and put it on your head while repeating the first step. That's the real <font color=""#f0a""><b>gist</b></font> of the game.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Which one was the gist? Seems like there keeps being new rules added. This isn't Calvinball, man.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>擦<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>grate</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>さつ</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">こす, す</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Helmet, Tent, Jackhammer, Nailbat</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You open the tent and see the jackhammer on top of another jackhammer. EUgHHWW! You can believe what you've just saw. You <font><b>saw two</b></font> (さつ) jackhammers doing it, and it will scar you for life.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: If you can manage, imagine the two jackhammers before you were able to look away. NO WONDER they were making such a grating noise.</i></span><br> "

I don't understand this 事 at all omg what am I going to do?'</span></span></i></span><br> "

"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>牧<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>pasture</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ぼく</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">まき</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Cow, Winter</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">ぼく is one of the common ways to say 'I' in Japanese (tends to be more for boys, you'll learn the kanji soon). In this case, you're a boy... a cowboy, and you say '<font><b></b></font><b>ぼく</b> will take these cows out to pasture!'</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Actually say that phrase out loud while thinking about bringing your cows to pasture.</i></span><br> "

"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>封<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>seal in</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ふう, ほう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Grave, Measurement</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The only way you can <b><font color=""#f0a"">seal in</font></b> that demon is to lure it in with lots of <b>foo</b>d (ふう). The more food you have, the easier sealing it in there will be.  By the way, this has another reading you should probably know. It’s ほう. You need to use a <b>hoe</b> (ほう) to make the graves in the first place. A shovel would be better, but you like hoes more.</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Mmmmmm. Foooood. Seal that demon in and then get some food for yourself. Dealing with demons is hungry business.</i></span><br> "

He's hugging you from behind, using your stilts with you, and he is the Japanese comedian <font><b>Hard Gay</b></font> (せい).</span></span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: He yells out SEI SEI SEI while doing his famous thrust motion, throwing off your balance.</i></span><br> "

But, you are going to use it here, because you always want to remind your nailbat business staff that 'ぼく am the boss, here. "<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>刃<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>blade</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">じん, にん</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>は</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Blade</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You have a <font color=""#f0a""><b>blade</b></font>, your enemy does not. "<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>砲<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>cannon</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ほう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Stone, Wrap</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You want to do a trick with your <font color=""#f0a""><b>cannon</b></font>, though.
