You can imagine them getting their skin added to the pile too if you want.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>軟<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>soft</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>なん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">やわ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Car, Lack</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">This car is probably so&nbsp;<b><font color=""#f0a"">soft</font></b>&nbsp;because it's made entirely of&nbsp;<b>naan</b>&nbsp;(なん). Naan may be delicious, but it makes a really crappy car. No wonder it was so soft (and yummy).</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Picture trying to drive this soft naan car. It probably just sinks into the ground and then gets eaten by wild animals (and me).</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>郊<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>suburbs</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>こう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Butcher, Mix</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Picture this <b><font color=""#f0a"">suburb</font></b> full of butchers. Look closer at their faces and you'll see they're all clones of こういち! This suburb is full of <b>こう</b>いち clone butchers. That's not that weird.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Picture all of these こういち butchers smiling up out of their identical suburban houses at you. Look at their faces. Look. （≼⓪≽⋌⋚⋛⋋≼⓪≽）</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>頂<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>summit, humbly</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ちょう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">いただき, いただ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Nail, Geoduck</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">As you make your way closer to the <b><font color=""#f0a"">summit</font></b> you see the culprit. It's evil Mrs. <b>Chou</b> (ちょう)! She's standing up there cackling. And she isn't acting <b><font color=""#f0a"">humbly</font></b> at all!</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Of course evil Mrs. Chou would do something like this. Maybe you shouldn't keep trying to reach the summit anymore.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>濯<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>wash</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>たく</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">すす, ゆす, そそぐ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Tsunami, Wolverine, Turkey</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Once they're nice and <b><font color=""#f0a"">wash</font></b>ed you need to subdue them my poking each of them with a <b>tack</b> (たく). The tack has special sleeping medicine on it, so once they're nice and clean you can put them back in their cages without them trying to eat each other.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: If you want to wash your animals make sure to have your special tack ready. The tsunami will recede pretty fast so get it out!</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>渦<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>whirlpool</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>か</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">うず</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Mustache, Tsunami</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The <b><font color=""#f0a"">whirlpool</font></b> is huge, and it starts pulling things into itself. Oh no, is that my <b>ca</b>r (か)? Hey, wait! Whirlpool give my car back!</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Picture my car getting sucked into the whirlpool. Picture me crying as my car disappears into it forever.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>聡<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>wise</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>そう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">さと, みみざと</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Heart, Ear, Public</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The <b><font color=""#f0a"">wise</font></b> woman spends all of her spare time <b>sew</b>ing (そう). She sews quietly and listens to the people around her. Saying little, sewing a lot.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Picture a group of wise people, sitting quietly, sewing. Once you become this wise, sewing is really all you have left.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>枯<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>wither</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>こ</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">か</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Tree, Old</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Don't feel sad for trees that <b><font color=""#f0a"">wither</font></b>, they'll come back as little <b>子</b> (こ) trees.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Picture the circle of life. When a tree withers and dies, and new 子 tree takes its place.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>祥<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>auspicious</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>しょう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">きざ, さいわ, つまび, よ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Pelican, Sheep</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The creature is so <b><font color=""#f0a"">auspicious</font></b> that the <b>sho</b>gun (しょう) declares this day to be the most auspicious of all days. The day when the pelican sheep graced the world with its presence.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Picture the shogun telling the world that they must fly pelican sheep flags and that from now on today is known as an auspicious day.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>呂<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>bath</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ろ</b>, りょ</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">せぼね</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Bathtub</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">When do you miss taking a <b><font color=""#f0a"">bath</font></b> the most? When you're on the <b>ro</b>ad (ろ). Traveling is fun and all, but when you're stuck in a car, traveling down a dirt road for days, all you want to do is take a nice long bath.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine being stuck on the road all day for a week. Imagine how good a bath will feel when you finally get home. Nice and hot and relaxing. Mmmm...</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>偏<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>biased</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>へん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">かたよ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Leader, Bookshelf</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You decide to give in to his <b><font color=""#f0a"">biased</font></b> recommendations and look at what he has on his bookshelf. It doesn't take long until you realize that these books are all about <b>hen</b>s (へん) and hen care. This guy is so biased about his favorite books that he only filled his books with what HE wants to read. And apparently that thing is taking care of hens... weird.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: ""This is such biased crap,"" you say, as you finish reading the title of a book called ""Hens are better than all other birds."" Screw this leader guy and his books.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>茨<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>briar, thorn</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">し, じ</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>いばら</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Flowers, Next</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">When you see the <b><font color=""#f0a"">briar</font></b>s you can't help but yell, <b>Eee! Ba ria</b>rs! (いばら)! You pause funny because you prick your finger on one while you're yelling. Ouch!</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine seeing the briars and yelling out ""Ba RI ars!"" as you prick your finger on one.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>陥<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>cave in</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">かん</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">おちい, おとしい</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Enclosure, Stick, Sun, Butcher</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Since the <b><font color=""#f0a"">cave in</font></b>, the butcher has lost everything. Now he lives under what's left of his stick enclosure and eats beans out of a <b>can</b> (かん). That's the moral of this story, kids. Don't cause cave ins or you'll be forced to eat canned food for the rest of your sad life.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Picture the butcher, surrounded by his caved in sticks, eating out of can. Butchers hate eating out of cans. This is so sad.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>鎖<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>chain</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>さ</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">くさり, とざ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Triceratops, Clam, Gold</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The only way to break the <b><font color=""#f0a"">chain</font></b> is to <b>saw</b> (さ) it open. Once the clams start holding on, they never let go. So when you want to take the chain off you have to really hack at it with your saw.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Picture the saw in your hands, sawing back and forth on the gold chain around your neck. Maybe this isn't the best fashion accessory if you have to use a saw to get it off.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>賠<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>compensation</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ばい</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Clam, Clown</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Once the clown has been properly <b><font color=""#f0a"">compensate</font></b>d, he looks you in the eyes, one hand full of clams, the other in the air, and waves, ""<b>Bye</b> (ばい)"" he says. ""Bye, bye.""</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: All you have to do is give him the right amount of compensation and you'll hear his sweet ""Bye, bye."" Then you never have to see him again.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>恒<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>constant, always</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>こう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">つね, つねに</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Ground, Fish Stick, Sunrise</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Another <b><font color=""#f0a"">constant</font></b> in this situation is seeing <b>こう</b>いち crawl out of the mist to come eat that fish stick. You always see him every morning too.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Who is always eating fish sticks at sunrise off the ground? こういち! Who is constantly surprising you? こういち!</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>綾<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>design</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>りん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">あや</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Thread, Frostbite</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">As you watch the snowflake <b><font color=""#f0a"">design</font></b> form you realize they're moving in a <b>rin</b>g (りん) pattern. Rings inside bigger rings, linked with smaller rings.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Try to picture this ring design in your head. It's something no human hands could have made, frostbitten or otherwise.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>没<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>die</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ぼつ</b>, もつ</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">おぼ, しず, ない</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Tsunami, Ikea</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The only way to make sure they don't <b><font color=""#f0a"">die</font></b> is to get them in the <b>boats</b> (ぼつ)! Ikea has boats ready incase of a tsunami, didn't you know? Now get those people in them before they die!</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Picture all those people in ikea trying their best not to die by running for the boats. I hope they all make it!</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>擁<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>embrace</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>よう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Lid, Nailbat, Poop, Turkey</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">As you <b><font color=""#f0a"">embrace</font></b> the sad turkey it starts to make a funny sound and suddenly starts pooping <b>yo</b>gurt (よう) all over you. But you don't want to stop embracing it! It's probably just still scared. But the more you squeeze, the faster the yogurt comes out of it!</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine embracing the turkey as it covers you in yogurt poo. Maybe this is why it was locked in there. Oh well. Embrace it harder and maybe it will stop!</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>遭<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>encounter, meet</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>そう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">あ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Ground, Sun, Water Slide, Music</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You never want to forget all the people you've been able to <b><font color=""#f0a"">encounter</font></b> so you decide to <b>sew</b> (そう) them all a best friend bracelet. Now you'll know if you <b><font color=""#f0a"">meet</font></b> them again because you'll see them wearing what you sewed for them.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine all the people you've encountered wearing the friendship bracelets you sewed for them. Imagine taking the time to sew each one. Handing them to the new friends you've been able to meet.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>噴<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>erupt</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ふん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">ふ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Cross, Mouth, Clam, Flowers</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Finally the clam <b><font color=""#f0a"">erupt</font></b>s and you have more <b>fun</b> (ふん) than you've ever had in your life! Flowers erupt from it's clam mouth and shoot really high up into the sky. You dance in them having way more fun than the clam is having.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine how much fun you'd have when the clam erupts. Imagine how little fun the clam is having erupting with flowers.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>殊<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>especially</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>しゅ</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">こと</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Slide, Bad, Jet</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">If you're in one of these jets it's <b><font color=""#f0a"">especially</font></b> important that you make sure that your <b>shoe</b>s (しゅ) are tied. If you step on it while trying to stop the sliding, you'll fall even faster.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Repeat after me: It's especially important that I tie my shoes. It's especially important that I tie my shoes. Come on, say it back now!</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>倫<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>ethics</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>りん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Leader, Books, Roof</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">One of the <b><font color=""#f0a"">ethics</font></b> books hits you dead in the face and you hear a <b>rin</b>ging (りん) in your ears. The ringing sounds a lot like the word ethics being repeated over and over.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: See the ethics book flying at your face. Hear the word ringing and ringing and ringing through your head over and over. Ethics ethics ethics!</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>陳<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>exhibit</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">ちん</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">ひ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Butcher, East</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Suddenly you realize that everything in the <b><font color=""#f0a"">exhibit</font></b> is the same. They're all animal <b>chin</b>s (ちん). Apparently chin is a delicacy in the east so butchers spend most of their time cutting them off of stuff.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine walking through this chin exhibit. Different kinds of chins in glass cases. Who knew people ate chin? I wonder how it tastes...</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>隼<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>falcon</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">しゅん, じゅん</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>はやぶさ</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Cross, Turkey</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You decide to name this new <b><font color=""#f0a"">falcon</font></b> after your favorite falcon-like ninja. <a href=""https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ryu_Hayabusa""><u>Ryu <b>Hayabusa</b></u></a> (はやぶさ) from Ninja Gaiden! Picture your fat turkey falcon and Ryu Hayabusa teaming up Banjo and Kazooey style. Yeah, that's the dream right there.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Picture your falcon Hayabusa and the real... ok fake.. Hayabusa running around together and kicking butt.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>乃<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>from</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ない</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">すなわ, なんじ, の</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Stairs</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">If you're you're going <b><font color=""#f0a"">from</font></b> place to place, you should really make sure you have a <b>kni</b>fe (ない) on you for protection. If you want to make it far enough from home you should seriously consider it. Knives keep everyone safe when they're going far from home.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine yourself taking those first few steps from home, knife heavy in your pocket. You can go as far from home as you want now. The knife will keep you safe.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>輔<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>help</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">ふ, ほ</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">たす,&nbsp;<b>すけ</b>*</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Car, Wedding</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You can't just ask for <b><font color=""#f0a"">help</font></b> on the day of the wedding, either. You have to <b>sche</b>dule (すけ) getting your friends' help ahead of time. They might have pretty tight schedules too, so makes sure you plan early!</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine calling all your friends and scheduling when you will get their help. Make sure you have your day planner ready!<br>* this is a Nanori Reading not a Kun'yomi</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>猟<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>hunting</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>りょう</b>, れふ</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">かり, か</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Elephant, Animal, Grass</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Everyone knows that when you're <b>hunting</b> you need to do it in a <b><font color=""#f0a"">row</font></b> (りょう) boat. The animal slowly rows its way toward the lumpy elephant, and the elephant doesn't notice at all. That's why row boats are so essential to hunting.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Picture the animal rowing its hunting boat toward the elephant. That animal sure knows a lot about hunting to be able to work a row boat like that.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>唆<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>instigate</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>さ</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">そそのか, そそ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Mouth, Spider</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The spider in your mouth tells you to <b><font color=""#f0a"">instigate</font></b> a fight by <b>saw</b>ing (さ) the other person's leg off. It even whispers where you can find a nice big saw.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Picture the fight you and the spider instigated. The guy pointing at the saw, then pointing at his sawed off leg. Listen as the spider tells you to shake your head.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>惰<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>lazy</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>だ</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Construction, Moon, Narwhal, Fish Stick</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You can't tell the <b><font color=""#f0a"">lazy</font></b> narwhal he's being lazy because he's your <b>da</b>d (だ). If he was anyone else you'd tell him off for being lazy, but you can't tell off your dad. That's just not right.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Picture your lazy dad. Your big lazy narwhal dad.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>怠<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>lazy, neglect</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>たい</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">おこた, なま</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Mouth, Pile, Heart</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You're too <b><font color=""#f0a"">lazy</font></b> to move anymore so you <b>tie</b> (たい) your pile of food to your arm so you don't have to get up anymore. You tie the remote, your laptop, and your cat to you too, because you don't want to have to get up to get those either.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine tying all these things to yourself because you're too lazy to do anything anymore. You even get tired as you're tying and you're too lazy to finish. Especially after your cat gnaws its way out.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>覇<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>leadership</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>は</b>, はく</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">はたがしら</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Moon, Helicopter, Leather</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Under your superior <b><font color=""#f0a"">leadership</font></b> you and your leather helicopter crew are able to make it to the moon. The moon! Your crew is so impressed by your leadership, and their lack of being very dead, and they all start laughing, ""<b>Ha</b> (は) ha ha ha!"" They thought they were going to die but you lead them to the moon safely!</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine laughing along with the crew, in awe at your own leadership skills. Ha ha ha! We didn't die!</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>須<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>necessary</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>す</b>, しゅ</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">すべから, すべし, ひげ, まつ, もち, もと</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Hair, Geoduck</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">It is also <b><font color=""#f0a"">necessary</font></b> that you wear a <b>su</b>it (す) when eating shaved geoduck. It's a super fancy meal so a suit it necessary for you to enjoy it correctly.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: What's necessary? To shave the hair off your geoduck and to wear a suit. That's not too hard. You should do it.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>牲<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>offering</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>せい</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Cow, Life</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">As you're presenting the <b><font color=""#f0a"">offering</font></b>, you hear a noise in the heavens, coming closer. ""<b>Sei</b> (せい) sei sei!"" you hear, as Hard Gay descends from the heavens, to take the cow offering. I guess you were praying to Hard Gay... that's ... okay well, that's you decision to make I guess.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine Hard Gay, floating down to take your offering. ""Sei sei sei!"" He says, saluting you on his way back up, and winking.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>秩<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>order, regularity</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ちつ</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Pine, Fault</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">While you bring <b><font color=""#f0a"">order</font></b> to the rows of pine trees you know there is some other guy who <b>cheats</b> (ちつ). He's been letting faulty trees stand! This is not bringing order, this is chaos! You have to stop him from cheating!</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: You can't carry out order if there is a guy who cheats right under your nose. You have to find the cheater and bring order to HIM!</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>孤<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>orphan</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>こ</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Child, Melon</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text""><b><font color=""#f0a"">Orphan</font></b>s are always <b>子</b> (こ), not adults. No one calls an adult without parents an orphan, because they can take care of themselves and buy their own melons.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine the little 子 orphan eating their new melon. What a great person you are.</i></span><br> "

He laughs and turns the flowers into a bottle of perfume, hands them to you, and disappears.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Picture Houdini turning your flowers into an actual bottle of perfume. Magic!</i></span><br> "

Those eagles are in the zoo because they're endangered! Look what you've done!</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Watch the butcher start chopping up all the zoo eagles. "<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>胡<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>barbarian</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>こ</b>, う, ご</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">なんぞ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Moon, Old</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You’re watching the <b><font color=""#f0a"">barbarian</font></b>s dance when you realize that they all look like little <b>子</b> (こ)! They’re absolutely adorable 子. Waving their little spears in the moonlight.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: 子 barbarians dance under the old moon. Maybe this has something to do with the cycle of life?</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>搭<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>board, embark</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>とう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Nailbat, Flowers, Suit</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Where are you <b><font color=""#f0a"">board</font></b>ing this plane? In <b>To</b>kyo (とう), of course. There are no finer airports than the ones in Tokyo!</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Look at Tokyo out the window as you board your plane. There's Tokyo tower! Wave goodbye!</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>錦<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>brocade</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">きん</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>にしき</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">White, Two Face, Gold</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Two face keeps his <b><font color=""#f0a"">brocade</font></b> fabric locked away and the only way to open the door is with a <b>niche key</b> (にしき). It's niche because brocade is a very niche kind of thing. So you take a garden <b>hoe</b> (ほう) and try to break the moon in two with it. You make it through the bag pretty easily, but the moon is harder to crack than you thought. Are cells really this hard to divide?</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine taking your hoe and trying to use it to hack apart your giant cell. You can't just cut them, because they're really strong, so you just drive your lawnmower over its head. "<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>緯<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>latitude</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>い</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">ぬき, よこいと</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Thread, Cow God</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The cow god is marking <b><font color=""#f0a"">latitude</font></b> lines so fast that it almost looks like an <b>ea</b>gle (い), not a cow. Watch it burst into a million pieces as your car makes contact, hurling melon bits all over your windshield. It's a melon firework!</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>虐<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>oppress</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ぎゃく</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">しいた</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Wolverine, Tiger</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Tiger and wolverine people are so <b><font color=""#f0a"">oppress</font></b>ed that the only thing they're allowed to amuse themselves with is <b>Gak</b> (ぎゃく). You know, that weird goo they made us play with when we were kids? Well that's not so fun when it's all you have.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine being a tiger/wolverine girl and being so oppressed that you can only sit in a cage, playing with goopy Gak all day. This blows...</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>戴<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>receive</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>たい</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">いただ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Cross, Fins, Rice Paddy, Blackjack, Drunkard</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">As you expected, the man hands you something and you reach out to <b><font color=""#f0a"">receive</font></b> it. It's a <b>tie</b> (たい). That's it. A normal necktie. Nothing weird about it at all. Huh.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine receiving an ordinary tie from this drunk, blackjack playing, rice paddy sitting, fin wearing guy. Receiving such a normal item is creepier somehow...</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>艇<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>rowboat</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>てい</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">King, Sail, Big Bird</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">As you row around in the <b><font color=""#f0a"">rowboat</font></b>, king big bird pulls out something to snack on. They're <b>ta</b>ter (てい) tots. You love tater tots but when you ask for some king big bird explains that you have to keep rowing the row boat. He eats the tater tots right in front of you.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Smell the delicious tater tot smell as your arms ache from rowing the rowboat. Tater tots would have really hit the spot if the king wasn't such a jerk.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>丹<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>rust colored</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>たん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">に</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Sail</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The <b><font color=""#f0a"">rust colored</font></b> sail has inspired you and you sit down next to it in the sun and <b>tan</b> (たん). You want to be the exact rust color as the sail and in a few hours you're sure you'll match.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Watch your skin slowly change as you tan to match the rust colored sail. "<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>緋<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>scarlet</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ひ</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">あか, あけ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Thread, Injustice</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The <b>scarlet</b> mark is so effective that when someone wears it their face <b>he</b>ats (ひ) up and turns scarlet too. The heat rises to their face, they blush, and turn a nice scarlet to match the big A you put there.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine looking down at your own shirt and seeing a scarlet letter there. Feel your face heat up and turn the same color. So embarrassing!</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>准<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>semi</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>じゅん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Ice, Turkey</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Finally you realize it will only <b><font color=""#f0a"">semi</font></b> freeze because it's <b>June</b> (じゅん)! It's too hot out for your turkey to freeze all the way. The ice keeps melting off the top and semi thawing it!</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: The lesson is to never try to freeze something in June. If you do it will only semi freeze.</i></span><br> "

Yes. This will make your cottage wedding the absolute best one. "<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>駿<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>speed</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>しゅん</b>, すん</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">すぐ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Horse, Spider</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Once people realize that they can increase the <b><font color=""#f0a"">speed</font></b> of their horses, <b>soon</b> (しゅん) everyone will be taking spiders with them to scare their horses into running faster. I say soon because it hasn't quite caught on yet. But if you help to spread the word it can happen even sooner.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Soon the world will be filled with horses running at full speed all thanks to the spider increase of the 2000s! Soon we will be in the future of top speeds!</i></span><br> "

You go in back to thank the chef and you see <b>Jo</b>seph (じょう) Stalin hauling them all in on the backs of skinny, sick looking people. You don't want to eat anymore.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine realizing that what you thought was a surplus was actually just Joseph Stalin stealing from other people to make you have more. You wouldn't want to keep eating, would you?</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>寛<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>tolerance</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>かん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">くつろ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Flowers, Helmet, See</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Who was looking at the helmet and realizing the importance of <b><font color=""#f0a"">tolerance</font></b>? Genghis <b>Khan</b> (かん). He's decided to stop conquering and start focusing on the people he's ruling. He doesn't care so much about making everyone do everything his way now.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Picture the new Genghis Khan with his new found tolerance of other people. He's giving a flower to a little girl! How nice. He's a new man!</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>庶<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>all</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>しょ</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Fish Tail, Hick</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Here, <b><font color=""#f0a"">all</font></b> the people you've ever known have had them, just let me <b>show</b> (しょ) you. This is me showing you. Through the computer. See them? Yeah, they were always there. All people have them.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: So, now, who's a hick with a fishtail? All people. You're welcome. I don't show everyone this kind of stuff.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>且<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>also</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">しょ, しょう, そ</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>か</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Top Hat</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You have a top hat and all the clothes that go with it but you <b><font color=""#f0a"">also</font></b> need a nice <b>ca</b>r (か) too! "<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>顕<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>appear</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>けん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">あきらか, あらわ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Sun, Spikes, Geoduck</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">If you're having trouble seeing the spikes <b><font color=""#f0a"">appear</font></b> just get <b>Ken</b> (けん)from Street Fighter to help you. "<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>杏<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>apricot</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">あん, きょう, こう</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>あんず</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Mouth, Tree</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">After you put the <b><font color=""#f0a"">apricot</font></b> in your mouth you realize that this tastes really familiar, but not pleasant. "<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>栞<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>bookmark</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">かん</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>しおり</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Tree, Antenna</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">What are you<b><font color=""#f0a""> bookmark</font></b>ing anyway? You keep forgetting that girl owes you some reese's so you needed to bookmark this page so you'd stop forgetting to ask for them back!</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: What does she owe you? Open the page to your bookmark and see she owes reese's pieces!</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>欄<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>column</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>らん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">てすり</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Tree, Gate, East</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Out of the tree <b><font color=""#f0a"">column</font></b>s bursts professional wrestler <b>Ran</b>dy (らん) Savage! "<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>冠<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>crown</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>かん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">かんむり</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Origin, Forehead, Measurement</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You look at the <b><font color=""#f0a"">crown</font></b> on the king's head, the ultimate measurement of status, and see that it's just an old <b>can</b> (かん). Is that even the king?</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>酷<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>cruel, unjust</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>こく</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">ひど</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Alcohol, Announce</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">After this <b><font color=""#f0a"">cruel</font></b> announcement is made everyone will turn to the next best thing after alcohol. <b>Coke</b> (こく)! It's not a replacement, but if this unjust law won't change, then coke sales are going to go through the roof.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine drinking coke while complaining how unjust it is that you can't add rum to it.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>叙<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>describe</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>じょ</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">つい, ついで</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Stool, Surplus</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You <b><font color=""#f0a"">describe</font></b> what happened so many times that you really start to lose your patience. You describe the many stools again and again until you snap, hang up, and take your <b>jo</b> (じょ) out and smash all the extra stools! Your jo is wooden too, but it smashes up the surplus of stools pretty easily. You never want to have to describe another stool again! SO YOU'LL KILL THEM ALL!</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine smashing all the stools with your jo and screaming about how you'll never describe anything to cops again! Hell, you'll never describe any situation to anyone ever again or they will be smashed up with your jo too!</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>逸<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>deviate, elude</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>いつ</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">そ, はぐ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Water Slide, Excuse</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You <b><font color=""#f0a"">deviate</font></b> from the plan a little too well, and as you're running what you've done <b>eats</b> (いつ) away at you. You feel guilty for eluding them? What the hell... that's not fair. You're supposed to get away with it!</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Feel the guilt as it eats away at you because you decided to elude someone who seemed to need something from you.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>紋<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>family crest</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>もん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Doll, Thread</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Why even bother sewing your <b><font color=""#f0a"">family crest</font></b> into everything? Because the town across the river has a different crest and it's a <b>mon</b>ster (もん)! That means they're evil so everyone in your family needs to wear their crest proudly to show that they aren't monsters.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Picture yourself, doll family crest displayed proudly on your chest, flag above your head. And look across the river at the monster family crest on their chests and flags. Wave yours harder! Let them know you're better than the monsters!</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>阿<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>flatter</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>あ</b>, お</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">おもね, くま</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Lip Ring, Butcher</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The butcher is so <b><font color=""#f0a"">flatter</font></b>ed he can't even come up with anything to say in response. ""<b>Ahhhh</b> (あ),"" is all he can manage. ""Ah ahha ahhh."" Well, at least it seems like he appreciated your compliment.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Hear the flattered butcher ""Ahhh""ing at you. You should probably leave now. I don't think he's going to stop.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>愚<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>foolish</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ぐ</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">おろ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Heart, Splinter</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Splinter tells you to your face how <b><font color=""#f0a"">foolish</font></b> you are and you feel your heart turn to <b>goo</b> (ぐ). Now you can't even give it to someone else. No one wants goo.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: What will you do with your foolish goo heart now?</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>尚<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>furthermore, esteem</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>しょう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">なお</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Triceratops, Mustache</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Why don't you just interrupt this mustache triceratops while he's saying <b><font color=""#f0a"">furthermore</font></b>? Because he's the <b>sho</b>gun (しょう)! If you interrupt him you'll probably be put to death or something. Just let him keep going and hope he runs out of furthermores to talk about.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: ""Furthermore!"" the mustachioed triceratops shogun proclaims, ""I am the best shogun we'll ever have. Look how long my mustache is! Furthermore, look at my horns, they're so sharp, I can impale all other shoguns. FURTHERMORE, look at my awesome throne..."" He'll never stop, will he?</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>拐<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>kidnap</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>かい</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Mouth, Sword, Nailbat</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Your <b><font color=""#f0a"">kidnap</font></b>ped self wakes up and sees a <b>coy</b>ote (かい) holding the nailbat and the sword. Wait, a coyote kidnapped you? Why? And how is it even holding those weapons?!</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: You have so many questions for this coyote, but you guess that's all a part of what kidnapping is about.</i></span><br> "

"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>勲<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>merit</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>くん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">いさお</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Power, Fish Tail, Heavy</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The problem with all your <b><font color=""#f0a"">merit</font></b> being in your tail is that it makes you slow. You may seem cool to all the fish, but you can easily be caught by a rac<b>coon</b> (くん). It will catch your slow fishy self and eat your tail off. Then you'll be thrown back in the water with all your merit as a fish gone.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Remember kids, if all your merit is in one place, a raccoon will eat you.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>疎<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>neglect</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>そ</b>, しょ</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">うと, まば</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Coat Rack, Ent</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The sad part isn't even that you <b><font color=""#f0a"">neglect</font></b>ed your friend the ent so much that it became a coat rack. It's that it's not even a good looking coat rack. It's just a <b>so</b>-so (そ) coat rack. Do you see how your neglect did this? You should have paid it more attention, or at least showed it what a coat rack should have looked like so when it gave up on life it would have looked better than so-so.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Your neglect caused this so-so coatrack to be rooted outside your house. This is your own fault, you know.</i></span><br> "

"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>哺<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>nurse</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ほ</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">ほぐく, ふく</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Mouth, Wedding</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The baby wants to <b><font color=""#f0a"">nurse</font></b> all day and the only thing you can seem to do at the same time is <b>hoe</b> (ほ) your garden. "<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>栽<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>planting</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>さい</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Drunkard, Redwood</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">While the drunkard is busy <b><font color=""#f0a"">planting</font></b> (or at least trying to) you go up and offer to help him. He turns around and you're shocked to see he only has one eye. He's a drunk <b>cy</b>clops (さい)! No wonder he's having such a hard time! Planting drunk is hard, but planting drunk with only one eye is almost impossible.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Picture the drunk cyclops trying with all his might not to crush the little lopsided redwood as he tries to plant it. His one big eye fills with tears as the tree he's planted flops over out of the dirt.</i></span><br> "

You only have hooves for feet, and balancing on a bar is going to be a huge hurdle. But your teacher promised if you practiced enough you could make it, and here you are! With your hoofed foot on the bar!</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Picture your centaur foot on the bar as you practice to become a gymnast. It's going to take years and years of this kind of practice, but you're sure you'll make it all the way up there some day! Never give up!</i></span><br> "

"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>茎<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>stem</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">きょう, けい</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>くき</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Flowers, Tombstone</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You have an idea that can make these tombstones look better than just having leftover <b><font color=""#f0a"">stem</font></b>s all over them. "<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>痴<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>stupid</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ち</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">おろか, し</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Mouth, Arrow, Sick</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">The only way to cure this serious a case of <b><font color=""#f0a"">stupid</font></b> is to make you eat <b>chee</b>se (ち). Not only will it fix your sick stomach by cushioning all the arrows that you shoved in your stupid mouth, but it should send smart cheese waves to your brain and cure you of that stupid all together.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine if everyone knew that cheese cures the stupid out of people. Then maybe we would have more cheese and less stupid in the world!</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>荘<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>villa</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>そう</b>, しょう, ちゃん</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">あごそ, ほうき</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Nailbat, Flowers, Samurai</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">This <b><font color=""#f0a"">villa</font></b> is also the only place the samurai will be caught <b>sew</b>ing (そう). He actually sews all of the clothes he wears under his armor. But if he was sewing somewhere public, people might make fun of him because he's not being tough and cutting off heads. So he only sews in the privacy of his villa.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Picture this samurai, his nailbat cast to the side, and instead a sewing needle in his hands, sitting in his peaceful, flower covered villa.</i></span><br> "

"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>悼<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>grieve, mourn</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>とう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">いた</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Toe, Early, Fish Stick</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You need to <b><font color=""#f0a"">grieve</font></b> for this fish stick in particular because it was the last one you had from <b>To</b>kyo (とう). You bought a bunch when you were there last, but this was your very last one. Tokyo fish sticks are very famous, and the fact that you smooshed it with your toe and now you'll probably never get one again, makes you feel like you need to have time to <b><font color=""#f0a"">mourn</font></b> for your loss.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: As you grieve, remember how hard it was to go to Tokyo to get these fish sticks. Remember how they tasted. Boohoohoo.</i></span><br> "

That's pretty cool!</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>栃<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>horse chestnut</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>とち</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Tree, Cliff, Ten Thousand</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You decide to take a bite of a <b><font color=""#f0a"">horse chestnut</font></b> because it looks yummy, and there are ten thousand, so it's not like anyone will notice. So that's why they named this wood after them or... or vice versa?</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Shiba inu's come from setting brushwood on fire! Then slowly, the shape of a human woman pushes it's way out of the butterflies. It's evil Mrs. <b>Chou</b> (ちょう)! No! She looks even more terrifying than usual, with her butterfly suit on. And now she's coming right at you!</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Picture butterfly-covered Mrs. Chou running toward you. You just wanted to look at the pretty insects. They're the easiest thing on the site, and if someone asks you if radicals make you feel peaceful say YES again!</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Yes! Peaceful blue radicals standing in a row. What's that? YES you do want more radicals added to the site. Well okay then, if it will keep you at peace, sure!</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>恭<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>respect</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">きょう</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>うやうや</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Drop, Small, Together</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">If you <b><font color=""#f0a"">respect</font></b> someone enough you'll even take up their hobbies. The person you respect most loves the Yankees. You don't really feel the same, but you respect that about them so you chant, ""<b>Ooh Ya</b>nkees, <b>Ooh Ya</b>nkees うやうや with them during each game.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine respecting someone so much that you'll cheer ooh yankees over and over even though they're kind of a crappy team.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>縫<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>sew</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ほう</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">ぬ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Winter, Thread, Water Slide, Signpost</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">If you don't know how to <b><font color=""#f0a"">sew</font></b>, don't worry, just yell, ""Harry <b>Hou</b>dini (ほう)!"" into the sky and he'll magic himself in and teach you how. He might even sew the signpost for you with magic if you're really bad at sewing. But you won't know until you shout his name!</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: HOUDINI! TEACH ME TO SEW!</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>舶<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>ship</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>はく</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">White, Sail</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">As the <b><font color=""#f0a"">ship</font></b> comes closer you realize that it's been <b>hack</b>ed (はく) to pieces! The sail is just propped up on the hacked up remains of what you assume was the ship. What a shame.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: I guess I was wrong. Ships can have sails and not be much of a ship anymore if they've been hacked to pieces at sea.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>搾<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>squeeze</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>さく</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">しぼ</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Nailbat, Key, Hole</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">Once you've <b><font color=""#f0a"">squeeze</font></b>d your nailbat to unlock the door squeeze all the money and treasure you came there for into your <b>sack</b> (さく)! You can't steal this bank's stuff without a sack to squeeze it all into!</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: How much gold do you think you can squeeze into one sack?</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>猶<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>still</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ゆう</b>, ゆ</font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">なお</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Horns, Animal, Alcohol</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">While you're <b><font color=""#f0a"">still</font></b> staring at the very still sheep, a zookeeper comes marching up. ""<b>YOU</b> (ゆう)!"" He shouts. ""YOU are the one making all my horned animals stand still!"" Uh oh. Time to get out of here.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: Imagine running from the very still sheep, hearing ""YOU! YOU! Get back here you!!"" Luckily, you don't have horns so the alcohol doesn't make you stand still and you can get the heck outta there.</i></span><br> "
"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>窒<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>suffocate</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ちつ</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Hole, Boob Grave</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">As you <b><font color=""#f0a"">suffocate</font></b> to death your life flashes before your eyes and all you see are all the <b>cheats</b> (ちつ) you pulled off. I guess you did cheat a lot of people out of things. Maybe you are destined to die in this boob grave because of all the cheats you got away with.</span><p> <span class=""text""><i>Hint: The moral of the story is not to be the kind of person who cheats other people out of stuff, or you'll slip and fall into a boob grave and suffocate to death.</i></span><br> "

"<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>智<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>wisdom</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>ち</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Mouth, Sun, Arrow</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">You're standing around waiting for the <b><font color=""#f0a"">wisdom</font></b> to hit you when something else does. "<div class=""kanji""><br><br><br>款<br><br><br><br></div>  Reading:  "	"<span class=""title""><font color=""#f0a""><b>article</b></font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>On'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000""><b>かん</b></font></span><br> <span class=""text""><b>Kun'yomi: </b></span> <span class=""hiragana""><font color=""#000000"">-</font></span><p> <span class=""text""><b>Radicals: </b></span> <span class=""text"">Samurai, Lack, Jackhammer</span><p>  <span class=""text""><b><u>Reading Mnemonic</u></b></span><br> <span class=""text"">In the <b><font color=""#f0a"">article</font></b> it says ""If a samurai lacks jackhammer skills, then what <b>CAN</b> (かん) he do?"" It's so catchy!</i></span><br> "

Whenever you hear someone call someone else concave everyone in the room yells, ""<b>OHHHHHHHHH</b> (おう).
